news!</p><p>People are just realizing that &#8220;<strong><a href=\\\"https://x.com/shl/status/1997492199328485400\\\">Harness is the new app</a></strong>&#8221; but this was very clear early this year when we saw Claude and Gemini play pokemon. <a href=\\\"https://www.bensbites.com/p/thoughts-on-a-week-in-sf?open=false#%C2%A7what-im-consuming\\\">We&#8217;ve been talking about</a> it since May but it&#8217;s gaining even more momentum now. Cursor is talking about improving their <a href=\\\"https://cursor.com/blog/codex-model-harness\\\">harness for Codex models</a> and Poetic used a custom harness Gemini 3 Pro to get the <a href=\\\"https://poetiq.ai/posts/arcagi_verified/\\\">best score on ARC-AGI 2</a>.</p><p>Google upgraded <strong><a href=\\\"https://x.com/GoogleAI/status/1996657213390155927\\\">Deep Think with Gemini 3</a></strong> for Ultra plan users ($250/mo). Shopify&#8217;s CTO and prev. Head of AI at Microsoft, <a href=\\\"https://x.com/MParakhin/status/1997392115777638545\\\">Mikhail Parakhin</a>, thinks the new version is better for coding something from scratch and notices more corner cases (and it&#8217;s faster), but still has some rough edges. </p><p>You can now <strong><a href=\\\"https://x.com/claudeai/status/1998109170449719647\\\">delegate tasks to Claude Code</a></strong> directly from Slack. I played around with Claude Code on the desktop app and it&#8217;s a nice interface for Claude as an Agent. I won&#8217;t be surprised if Claude app starts to look like that by default in 2026.</p><p>Folks at HuggingFace got Claude Code and other CLIs to <a href=\\\"https://huggingface.co/blog/hf-skills-training\\\">fine-tune an open model</a>. It&#8217;s available as a skill. Here&#8217;s an idea for you to steal: make a local email processing app with a 3-7B model.</p><p><strong>Eliminate AI anxiety. Build with confidence.</strong> AI agents are the future&#8212;but centralized systems create costly risks. With Airia, prototype and orchestrate AI agents securely while creating a resilient, decentralized AI ecosystem for your organization. Get started today at <strong><a href=\\\"https://airia.com/\\\">airia.com</a></strong>*</p><p>ps: <a href=\\\"https://www.theverge.com/report/838857/openai-gpt-5-2-release-date-code-red-google-response\\\">GPT-5.2</a> is likely coming this week, and Google will launch its first <a href=\\\"https://www.cnbc.com/2025/12/08/google-ai-glasses-launch-2026.html\\\">AI glasses in 2026</a>.</p><div><hr></div><h3><strong> </strong>&#127760;<strong> </strong>What I&#8217;m consuming</h3><ul><li><p><a href=\\\"https://www.99ravens.agency/resources/blogs/your-experts-wont-train-your-ai-you-have-to-interview-them/\\\">Your experts won&#8217;t train your AI</a>. history explorer</a> - Python CLI tool to explore, search and visualise your Claude Code conversation history.</p></li><li><p><a href=\\\"https://github.com/tobi/qmd\\\">QMD by Tobi Lutke</a> - On-device search engine for everything. A combination of BM25 full-text search, vector semantic search, and LLM re-ranking.</p></li></ul><div><hr></div><h3>&#128203; State of AI reports</h3><ul><li><p><a href=\\\"https://openrouter.ai/state-of-ai\\\">OpenRouter released a &#8220;state of AI&#8221; report</a> based on 100 trillion tokens used on their platform. Mostly focuses on how OSS models are used.</p></li><li><p><a href=\\\"https://www.anthropic.com/research/anthropic-interviewer\\\">Anthropic Interviewer</a> - Anthropic interviewed 1,250 professionals about working with AI to map their emptions and expectaations. They are now opening it Claude users too (you should see a popup if you visit Claude on Web).</p></li><li><p><a href=\\\"https://openai.com/index/the-state-of-enterprise-ai-2025-report/\\\">The State of Enterprise AI by OpenAI</a> - Haven&#8217;t got the chance to dig into this one but saw this chart. Top AI users use it much more than median users.</p></li></ul><div class=\\\"captioned-image-container\\\"><figure><a class=\\\"image-link image2 is-viewable-img\\\" target=\\\"_blank\\\" Another Google Labs product, Mixboard, also got some upgrades.\\n\\nYou can now connect Replit Agent to remote MCP servers.\\n\\nNormal - Your team‚Äôs branding partner.\\n\\n\\n\\n\\n\\n\\n\\n\\n\\n\\n\\n\\n\\n\\nü•£ Dev Dish\\n\\nClaude history explorer - Python CLI tool to explore, search and visualise your Claude Code conversation history.\\n\\nQMD by Tobi Lutke - On-device search engine for everything. Updates, tool reviews, and lay of the land from an exited founder turned investor and forever tinkerer.</em></p><p class=\\\"button-wrapper\\\" data-attrs=\\\"{&quot;url&quot;:&quot;https://www.bensbites.com/subscribe?&quot;,&quot;text&quot;:&quot;Subscribe now&quot;,&quot;action&quot;:null,&quot;class&quot;:null}\\\" data-component-name=\\\"ButtonCreateButton\\\"><a class=\\\"button primary\\\" href=\\\"https://www.bensbites.com/subscribe?\\\"><span>Subscribe now</span></a></p><div><hr></div><p>Hey folks, </p><p>I&#8217;m launching a fun little thing: <strong><a href=\\\"https://droidmas.com/\\\">droidmas.com</a></strong> - jokes and games around concepts in ai dev. Day 1 is about benchmarks, live now.</p><p><strong><a href=\\\"https://www.anthropic.com/news/anthropic-acquires-bun-as-claude-code-reaches-usd1b-milestone\\\">Anthropic has acquired Bun</a></strong>. Bun makes JS code run faster, and the company is filled with the best JS devs. The story of <a href=\\\"https://bun.com/blog/bun-joins-anthropic\\\">how this came to be</a> is crazy. <a href=\\\"https://openai.com/index/openai-to-acquire-neptune/\\\">OpenAI also bought a company, Neptune AI</a> (tools for AI researchers).</p><p>Opus 4.5 is finally available on Claude Code with Pro plans ($20/mo). The limits are not as generous, but at least you can use it :) Claude Code has crossed $1B in run-rate revenue just 6 months after launch, and the rumours are that Anthropic is planning an IPO.</p><p><strong><a href=\\\"https://workspace.google.com/studio\\\">Google Workspace Studio</a></strong> is now GA. It&#8217;s an automation builder, but it looks like it can handle much more complex use cases (connect multiple apps beyond Google&#8217;s ecosystem, add different AI steps in between), all with just prompts.</p><p>Mistral released a few models: <strong><a href=\\\"https://mistral.ai/news/mistral-3\\\">Mistral Large 3 and Ministral 3</a></strong>. Mistral Large 3 is in the same leagues as DeepSeek 3.2 and Kimi K2. I&#8217;m more excited by Ministral models. They come in three sizes: 14B, 8B, and 3B with base, instruct and reasoning variants for all three.</p><p><strong>Eliminate AI anxiety. Build with confidence.</strong> AI agents are the future&#8212;but centralized systems create costly risks. With Airia, prototype and orchestrate AI agents securely while creating a resilient, decentralized AI ecosystem for your organization. <strong>Get started today at <a href=\\\"https://airia.com/\\\">airia.com</a></strong>*</p><div><hr></div><h3><strong> </strong>&#127760;<strong> </strong>What I&#8217;m consuming</h3><ul><li><p><a href=\\\"https://www.anthropic.com/research/how-ai-is-transforming-work-at-anthropic\\\">How is AI changing work inside Anthropic?</a> Basically, engineers feel ~50% more productive, 27% of Claude-assisted tasks were projects that &#8220;would not have been done otherwise.</p></li><li><p>Lessons from building AI agents for <a href=\\\"https://x.com/jxnlco/status/1995965653048852788\\\">messy government PDFs</a>.</p></li><li><p>What I learned building an opinionated and <a href=\\\"https://mariozechner.at/posts/2025-11-30-pi-coding-agent/\\\">minimal coding agent</a>.</p></li><li><p>One year of using <a href=\\\"https://www.soundformovement.com/chatgpt-pro-as-first-hire\\\">ChatGPT Pro as my first hire</a>.</p></li><li><p>Cursor&#8217;s <a href=\\\"https://cursorai.notion.site/Building-with-Cursor-public-273da74ef0458051bf22e86a1a0a5c7d\\\">guide for non-technical hires</a> to build with Cursor.</p></li></ul><div Last few slots left for the rest of the year.\",\"enclosure\":{\"url\":\"https://substack-post-media.s3.amazonaws.com/public/images/cae24c17-24b1-41cc-ae89-36fae16e2e0d_2326x1212.png\",\"length\":\"0\",\"type\":\"image/jpeg\"},\"content\":\"Make your own benchmarks\",\"contentSnippet\":\"Make your own benchmarks\",\"guid\":\"https://www.bensbites.com/p/anthropic-makes-its-first-acquisition\",\"isoDate\":\"2025-12-04T14:30:42.000Z\",\"itunes\":{}},\"pairedItem\":[{\"item\":0}]},{\"json\":{\"title\":\"Is OpenAI really in trouble?\",\"link\":\"https://www.bensbites.com/p/is-openai-really-in-trouble\",\"pubDate\":\"Tue, 02 Dec 2025 14:20:37 GMT\",\"content:encoded\":\"<p><em>The newsletter for the technically curious. Updates, tool reviews, and lay of the land from an exited founder turned investor and forever tinkerer.</em></p><p class=\\\"button-wrapper\\\" data-attrs=\\\"{&quot;url&quot;:&quot;https://www.bensbites.com/subscribe?&quot;,&quot;text&quot;:&quot;Subscribe now&quot;,&quot;action&quot;:null,&quot;class&quot;:null}\\\" data-component-name=\\\"ButtonCreateButton\\\"><a class=\\\"button primary\\\" href=\\\"https://www.bensbites.com/subscribe?\\\"><span>Subscribe now</span></a></p><div><hr></div><p>Hey folks, </p><p>The Information reports <strong><a href=\\\"https://www.theinformation.com/articles/openai-ceo-declares-code-red-combat-threats-chatgpt-delays-ads-effort\\\">Sam Altman declared &#8220;Code Red&#8221;</a></strong> inside OpenAI after Gemini 3&#8217;s success. Ads in ChatGPT will be delayed, with the same fate for products like Agents and Pulse. Personalisation, image generation and model behaviour will be the main focus. The report also claims that OpenAI will release a new reasoning model better than Gemini 3 next week.</p><p>DeepSeek&#8217;s new models, <strong><a href=\\\"https://x.com/deepseek_ai/status/1995452641430651132\\\">DeepSeek V3.2 base and Speciale</a>,</strong> are impressive (and open) BUT not better than any of the other top models (GPT-5.1/Codex, Opus/Sonnet 4.5, Gemini 3). The Speciale version can get a gold medal in math olympiads, but it&#8217;s only good for proving theorems, it seems, and you can think of the base version as almost the same level as GPT-5 though you&#8217;ll see subpar results in both use cases: chat and coding.</p><p>FLUX models by Black Forest Labs were the original stable diffusion killer. With <strong><a href=\\\"https://bfl.ai/blog/flux-2\\\">FLUX.2 family of image generation models</a></strong>, their next goal is Nano Banana and dozens of open models from China. FLUX.2 [dev] is the 32B open weights variant, better and 3x cheaper than the original Nano Banana (10x cheaper than Nano Banana Pro). BFL also raised a <a href=\\\"https://bfl.ai/blog/our-300m-series-b\\\">$300M Series B.</a></p><p>The leading video generation model swapped hands by a significant margin. Runway is the new leader with its latest <strong><a href=\\\"https://runwayml.com/research/introducing-runway-gen-4.5\\\">Runway Gen 4.5 model</a></strong>, beating Google&#8217;s Veo 3. Kling, a close competitor, also released a new model, <strong><a href=\\\"https://x.com/fal/status/1995508595954225232\\\">Kling O1</a>,</strong> exclusively on Fal, so it&#8217;s not on the leaderboards yet.</p><p><strong><a href=\\\"https://attio.com/?utm_source=bens_bites&amp;utm_medium=newsletter_sponsorship&amp;utm_campaign=bens_bites-Q3Y25\\\">Attio</a></strong> is the AI-native CRM for the next generation of teams. Sync your email and calendar, and Attio instantly builds your CRM&#8212;enriching every company, contact, and interaction with actionable insights in seconds. Join fast growing teams like Granola, Flatfile, Modal, and more. <strong><a href=\\\"https://attio.com/?utm_source=bens_bites&amp;utm_medium=newsletter_sponsorship&amp;utm_campaign=bens_bites-Q3Y25\\\">Start for free today.</a></strong>*</p><div><hr></div><h3><strong> </strong>&#127760;<strong> </strong>What I&#8217;m consuming</h3><ul><li><p>The new <a href=\\\"https://alignment.openai.com/\\\">alignment research blog</a> from OpenAI, live with its <a href=\\\"https://alignment.openai.com/sae-latent-attribution/\\\">first</a> <a href=\\\"https://alignment.openai.com/scaling-code-verification/\\\">two</a> posts.</p></li><li><p>On the <a href=\\\"https://www.sh-reya.com/blog/consumption-ai-scale/\\\">consumption of AI-generated content</a> at scale.</p></li><li><p>Thoughts from building and shutting down a <a href=\\\"https://hypersoren.xyz/posts/dark-matter/\\\">portable context layer</a> company.</p></li><li><p><a href=\\\"https://www.ft.com/content/8881062d-ff4f-4454-8e9d-d992e8e2c4e3\\\">OpenAI&#8217;s lead under pressure</a> as rivals start to close the gap - FT</p></li><li><p><a href=\\\"https://supermemory.ai/research\\\">Supermemory is state-of-the-art on LongMemEval</a> - a measure for reasoning, recollection and more across 100K+ tokens. (I&#8217;m an investor)</p></li></ul><div class=\\\"captioned-image-container\\\"><figure><a class=\\\"image-link image2 is-viewable-img\\\" target=\\\"_blank\\\" href=\\\"http://concierge.ai/\\\">Concierge.ai</a></strong> - Engage &amp; convert inbound website visitors into qualified leads with a custom AI answer engine trained on your brand &amp; content.*</p></li><li><p><strong>Gemini Dynamic View</strong> - Paid users on Gemini can select this tool to get a visual one-pager website-like output on a certain topic. Here&#8217;s a <a href=\\\"https://x.com/Keshavatearth/status/1995548166591250773\\\">sample</a> of using it to catch up for Stranger Things S5.</p></li><li><p><strong><a href=\\\"https://duet.so/\\\">Duet</a></strong> - Group ChatGPT for work (with MCP and a shared knowledge base).</p></li><li><p><strong><a href=\\\"https://www.rephrase.space/\\\">Rephrase</a></strong> - Fix grammar and format text instantly on Mac.</p></li><li><p><strong><a href=\\\"https://www.komposo.ai/\\\">Komposo</a></strong> - Generate and edit designs, and export directly to code.</p></li><li><p><strong><a href=\\\"https://www.plok.sh/\\\">Plok.sh</a></strong> -  Turn a GitHub repo into a blog. Not an AI tool, but this looks useful.</p></li><li><p><strong><a href=\\\"https://tldw.us/\\\">TLDW</a></strong> - Paste the link of an hour-long video and get the gist in 5-minute highlight reels.</p></li></ul><div class=\\\"captioned-image-container\\\"><figure><a class=\\\"image-link image2 is-viewable-img\\\" target=\\\"_blank\\\" href=\\\"https://tldw.us/\\\" source, local semantic code search for Claude Code that works.</p></li><li><p><a href=\\\"https://x.com/morphllm/status/1994484969050444103\\\">WarpGrep by Morph</a> runs parallel tool calls as a context subagent to improve coding agent performance.</p></li><li><p><a href=\\\"https://agiopen.org/blog\\\">Lux by OpenAGI</a> - Fast, cheap and better computer-use model in an SDK.</p></li><li><p><a href=\\\"https://github.com/automazeio/vibeproxy\\\">vibeproxy</a> - Native macOS menu bar app to use your Claude/ChatGPT/Gemini subscriptions with AI coding tools.</p></li></ul><div><hr></div><h3>&#127846; Afters</h3><ul><li><p><strong><a href=\\\"https://fandf.co/3M4yodI\\\">Valon is hiring Forward Deployed Engineers</a>.</strong> $130K&#8211;$230K &amp; equity, turning enterprise clients needs into code onsite. NYC/SF/Seattle + travel*</p></li><li><p><a href=\\\"https://www.raindrop.ai/blog/seed-round\\\">Raindrop AI</a> (monitoring and A/B testing for AI apps) raised $15M seed.</p></li><li><p>Telegram is operating a <a href=\\\"https://x.com/durov/status/1995208789600182391\\\">decentralised compute network</a> for its AI features and making it open for others, too.</p></li><li><p>OpenAI takes an <a href=\\\"https://openai.com/index/thrive-holdings/\\\">ownership stake</a> in Thrive Holdings.</p></li></ul><blockquote><p>Thrive Holdings (initial round of $1B) acquires and holds legacy businesses like accounting &amp; IT services and transforms them with AI/tech. OpenAI now has equity and will train models for tasks with company-specific data.</p><p><em>- from Sheel Mohnot&#8217;s tweet (<a href=\\\"https://x.com/pitdesi/status/1995489623389433951\\\">@pitdesi</a>)</em></p></blockquote><div><hr></div><div class=\\\"captioned-button-wrap\\\" data-attrs=\\\"{&quot;url&quot;:&quot;https://www.bensbites.com/p/is-openai-really-in-trouble?utm_source=substack&utm_medium=email&utm_content=share&action=share&quot;,&quot;text&quot;:&quot;Share&quot;}\\\" data-component-name=\\\"CaptionedButtonToDOM\\\"><div class=\\\"preamble\\\"><p class=\\\"cta-caption\\\">Enjoy this newsletter? Forward it to a friend.</p></div><p class=\\\"button-wrapper\\\" data-attrs=\\\"{&quot;url&quot;:&quot;https://www.bensbites.com/p/is-openai-really-in-trouble?utm_source=substack&utm_medium=email&utm_content=share&action=share&quot;,&quot;text&quot;:&quot;Share&quot;}\\\" data-component-name=\\\"ButtonCreateButton\\\"><a class=\\\"button primary\\\" href=\\\"https://www.bensbites.com/p/is-openai-really-in-trouble?utm_source=substack&utm_medium=email&utm_content=share&action=share\\\"><span>Share</span></a></p></div><p>That&#8217;s it for today. Last few slots left for the rest of the year.</em></h6></blockquote><div><hr></div>\",\"content:encodedSnippet\":\"The newsletter for the technically curious. Updates, tool reviews, and lay of the land from an exited founder turned investor and forever tinkerer.\\nSubscribe now\\n\\n\\nHey folks, \\nThe Information reports Sam Altman declared ‚ÄúCode Red‚Äù inside OpenAI after Gemini 3‚Äôs success. Ads in ChatGPT will be delayed, with the same fate for products like Agents and Pulse. Personalisation, image generation and model behaviour will be the main focus. The report also claims that OpenAI will release a new reasoning model better than Gemini 3 next week.\\nDeepSeek‚Äôs new models, DeepSeek V3.2 base and Speciale, are impressive (and open) BUT not better than any of the other top models (GPT-5.1/Codex, Opus/Sonnet 4.5, Gemini 3). The Speciale version can get a gold medal in math olympiads, but it‚Äôs only good for proving theorems, it seems, and you can think of the base version as almost the same level as GPT-5 though you‚Äôll see subpar results in both use cases: chat and coding.\\nFLUX models by Black Forest Labs were the original stable diffusion killer. With FLUX.2 family of image generation models, their next goal is Nano Banana and dozens of open models from China. FLUX.2 [dev] is the 32B open weights variant, better and 3x cheaper than the original Nano Banana (10x cheaper than Nano Banana Pro). BFL also raised a $300M Series B.\\nThe leading video generation model swapped hands by a significant margin. Runway is the new leader with its latest Runway Gen 4.5 model, beating Google‚Äôs Veo 3. Kling, a close competitor, also released a new model, Kling O1, exclusively on Fal, so it‚Äôs not on the leaderboards yet.\\nAttio is the AI-native CRM for the next generation of teams. Sync your email and calendar, and Attio instantly builds your CRM‚Äîenriching every company, contact, and interaction with actionable insights in seconds. Join fast growing teams like Granola, Flatfile, Modal, and more. Start for free today.*\\n\\n\\n üåê What I‚Äôm consuming\\n\\nThe new alignment research blog from OpenAI, live with its first two posts.\\n\\nOn the consumption of AI-generated content at scale.\\n\\nThoughts from building and shutting down a portable context layer company.\\n\\nOpenAI‚Äôs lead under pressure as rivals start to close the gap - FT\\n\\nSupermemory is state-of-the-art on LongMemEval - a measure for reasoning, recollection and more across 100K+ tokens. (I‚Äôm an investor)\\n\\n\\n\\n\\n\\n\\n\\n\\n\\n\\n\\n\\n\\n\\n‚öôÔ∏è Tools and demos\\n\\nConcierge.ai - Engage & convert inbound website visitors into qualified leads with a custom AI answer engine trained on your brand & content.*\\n\\nGemini Dynamic View - Paid users on Gemini can select this tool to get a visual one-pager website-like output on a certain topic. Here‚Äôs a sample of using it to catch up for Stranger Things S5.\\n\\nDuet - Group ChatGPT for work (with MCP and a shared knowledge base).\\n\\nRephrase - Fix grammar and format text instantly on Mac.\\n\\nKomposo - Generate and edit designs, and export directly to code.\\n\\nPlok.sh -  Turn a GitHub repo into a blog. Not an AI tool, but this looks useful.\\n\\nTLDW - Paste the link of an hour-long video and get the gist in 5-minute highlight reels.\\n\\n\\n\\n\\n\\n\\n\\n\\n\\n\\n\\n\\n\\n\\nü•£ Dev dish\\n\\nosgrep - open source, local semantic code search for Claude Code that works.\\n\\nWarpGrep by Morph runs parallel tool calls as a context subagent to improve coding agent performance.\\n\\nLux by OpenAGI - Fast, cheap and better computer-use model in an SDK.\\n\\nvibeproxy - Native macOS menu bar app to use your Claude/ChatGPT/Gemini subscriptions with AI coding tools.\\n\\n\\n\\nüç¶ Afters\\n\\nValon is hiring Forward Deployed Engineers. $130K‚Äì$230K & equity, turning enterprise clients needs into code onsite. NYC/SF/Seattle + travel*\\n\\nRaindrop AI (monitoring and A/B testing for AI apps) raised $15M seed.\\n\\nTelegram is operating a decentralised compute network for its AI features and making it open for others, too.\\n\\nOpenAI takes an ownership stake in Thrive Holdings.\\n\\n\\nThrive Holdings (initial round of $1B) acquires and holds legacy businesses like accounting & IT services and transforms them with AI/tech. OpenAI now has equity and will train models for tasks with company-specific data.\\n- from Sheel Mohnot‚Äôs tweet (@pitdesi)\\n\\n\\n\\nEnjoy this newsletter? Forward it to a friend.\\n\\nShare\\n\\nThat‚Äôs it for today. Feel free to comment and share your thoughts. üëã\\n\\nFind me on X, Linkedin, or Instagram\\n\\nRead about me and Ben‚Äôs Bites\\n\\nüì∑ thumbnail creds: @keshavatearth,\\n\\n\\nThanks to today‚Äôs sponsors who made this newsletter possible :)\\nWanna partner with us? Last few slots left for the rest of the year.\",\"enclosure\":{\"url\":\"https://substack-post-media.s3.amazonaws.com/public/images/f13b5f28-285c-4817-bdb1-696b7c760247_2784x1536.png\",\"length\":\"0\",\"type\":\"image/jpeg\"},\"content\":\"Don't listen to DeepSeek hypebros\",\"contentSnippet\":\"Don't listen to DeepSeek hypebros\",\"guid\":\"https://www.bensbites.com/p/is-openai-really-in-trouble\",\"isoDate\":\"2025-12-02T14:20:37.000Z\",\"itunes\":{}},\"pairedItem\":[{\"item\":0}]},{\"json\":{\"title\":\"Always post bad news on a holiday\",\"link\":\"https://www.bensbites.com/p/always-post-bad-news-on-a-holiday\",\"pubDate\":\"Thu, 27 Nov 2025 14:37:28 GMT\",\"content:encoded\":\"<p><em>The newsletter for the technically curious. Updates, tool reviews, and lay of the land from an exited founder turned investor and forever tinkerer.</em></p><p class=\\\"button-wrapper\\\" data-attrs=\\\"{&quot;url&quot;:&quot;https://www.bensbites.com/subscribe?&quot;,&quot;text&quot;:&quot;Subscribe now&quot;,&quot;action&quot;:null,&quot;class&quot;:null}\\\" data-component-name=\\\"ButtonCreateButton\\\"><a class=\\\"button primary\\\" href=\\\"https://www.bensbites.com/subscribe?\\\"><span>Subscribe now</span></a></p><div><hr></div><p>Hey folks, Happy Thanksgiving to those celebrating! Light edition today&#8230;</p><p>Classic move from OpenAI - dropping a data breach disclosure at 10pm the night before Turkey day. Brilliant PR timing.</p><p><strong>OpenAI disclosed a <a href=\\\"https://openai.com/index/mixpanel-incident\\\">Mixpanel security incident</a> that exposed API user data</strong> - names, emails, user IDs, and location info. No ChatGPT data or API keys were compromised. OpenAI has terminated its Mixpanel use entirely (no shit!).</p><p>Meanwhile, <a href=\\\"https://www.ft.com/content/23e54a28-6f63-4533-ab96-3756d9c88bad\\\">OpenAI needs to raise at least $207 billion by 2030</a> [paywalled] to keep the lights on, according to HSBC. This is <em>after</em> their commitments to Oracle ($300B), Microsoft ($250B), and AWS ($38B) for cloud services. The FT called OpenAI &#8220;a money pit with a website on top.&#8221; &#129760;</p><p><strong>Anthropic dropped two bangers this week</strong>. First, <a href=\\\"https://www.anthropic.com/engineering/effective-harnesses-for-long-running-agents\\\">Effective harnesses for long-running agents</a> - a deep dive into how they get Claude to work across multiple context windows without losing the plot. The key insight: use an initializer agent to set up the environment, then a coding agent that makes incremental progress and leaves clean artifacts for the next session. They built a Claude.ai clone this way. </p><p>[But <a href=\\\"https://www.factory.ai/\\\">Factory&#8217;s</a> harness is better]</p><p>Second, <a href=\\\"https://www.anthropic.com/research/estimating-productivity-gains\\\">Estimating AI productivity gains</a> - they analyzed 100K real Claude conversations and found AI reduces task completion time by ~80%. Extrapolating this, they estimate current AI could increase US labor productivity by 1.8% annually over the next decade - roughly doubling recent growth rates. The caveat: this doesn&#8217;t account for time humans spend validating outputs outside the chat window.</p><p>A little update from my portfolio:</p><p><a href=\\\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/sf-compute-40m)\\\">San Francisco Compute</a> - raised $40M at a $300M valuation - marketplace for AI computing capacity. (I&#8217;m an early investor) + <a href=\\\"https://x.com/evanjconrad/status/1993796642299105717?s=12\\\">they&#8217;re hiring</a></p><p>Plus some other investments have been on a tear recently;</p><ul><li><p>Gamma @ $2.5bn valuation - I invested as an a16z scout, they led the latest round. </p></li><li><p>Supabase @ $5bn </p></li><li><p>Scribe @ $1.3bn </p></li></ul><p>My 2020/2021 fund is now over 4x / 36% IRR</p><p>Ben&#8217;s Bites Fund I is 2x / 39% IRR (2023-2025)</p><p>Ben&#8217;s Bites Fund II did its first close, and is still open to new LPs. Get in touch if you&#8217;re interested. </p><p>Here&#8217;s a few YC companies I&#8217;m looking at:</p><ul><li><p><a href=\\\"https://www.sourcebot.dev/\\\">Sourcebot</a> - Self-hosted code search and AI Q&amp;A for your entire codebase. </p></li><li><p><a href=\\\"https://metorial.com/\\\">Metorial</a> - Serverless MCP hosting with 600+ integrations. Deploy MCP servers in 3 clicks, instant observability.</p></li><li><p><a href=\\\"https://sf-tensor.com/\\\">SF-Tensor</a> - Cross-cloud GPU orchestration that finds the cheapest hardware and auto-optimizes your training kernels.</p></li><li><p><a href=\\\"https://s2.dev/\\\">S2.dev</a> - Serverless durable streams API. Like if Kafka and S3 had a baby - unlimited, real-time, bottomless storage.</p></li><li><p><a href=\\\"https://www.hyperspell.com/\\\">Hyperspell</a> - Context and memory layer for AI agents. </p></li><li><p><a href=\\\"https://www.usecrunched.com/\\\">Crunched</a> - AI analyst that works natively inside Excel. </p></li></ul><div><hr></div><h3><strong> </strong>&#127760;<strong> </strong>What I&#8217;m consuming</h3><ul><li><p>Ilya Sutskever &#8211; We&#8217;re moving from <a href=\\\"https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=aR20FWCCjAs\\\">the age of scaling to the age of research</a></p></li><li><p><a href=\\\"https://x.com/elder_plinius/status/1993089311995314564?s=20\\\">Jailbreaking Opus 4.5</a> </p></li><li><p><a href=\\\"https://fokus.cool/2025/11/25/i-dont-care-how-well-your-ai-works.html\\\">I don&#8217;t care how well your &#8220;AI&#8221; works</a> - a rant about AI product fatigue.</p></li><li><p><a href=\\\"https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=vq5WhoPCWQ8\\\">High School Dropout to OpenAI Researcher</a></p></li></ul><div><hr></div><h3>&#9881;&#65039; Tools and demos</h3><ul><li><p><strong><a href=\\\"https://askcodi.com/\\\">AskCodi</a></strong> - Custom LLMs without training, accessible via OpenAI-compatible API</p></li><li><p><strong><a href=\\\"https://bfl.ai/blog/flux-2\\\">Flux 2</a></strong> - image generation &amp; editing model. Multi-reference. 4MP. Production-ready. Open weights.</p></li><li><p><strong><a href=\\\"https://github.com/addyosmani/gemini-cli-tips\\\">Gemini CLI Tips &amp; Tricks </a></strong></p></li><li><p><strong><a href=\\\"https://penpot.app/\\\">Penpot</a></strong> - The open-source design tool for design and code collaboration (open-source Figma)</p></li></ul><div><hr></div><h3>&#129379; Dev dish</h3><ul><li><p><a href=\\\"https://github.com/BinSquare/ERA\\\">Era</a> - Open-source local sandbox for AI agents. Run agents safely without cloud dependencies.</p></li><li><p><a href=\\\"https://tryrubberduck.com/\\\">Rubberduck</a> - Catch App Store rejection issues before Apple does </p></li><li><p>Prime Intellect <a href=\\\"https://x.com/PrimeIntellect/status/1993895068290388134\\\">launched INTELLECT-3</a>: Scaling RL to a 100B+ MoE model on our end-to-end stack</p></li></ul><div><hr></div><h3>&#127846; Afters</h3><ul><li><p><a href=\\\"https://www.wired.com/story/jeff-bezos-new-ai-company-acquired-agentic-computing-startup/\\\">Jeff Bezos&#8217; Project Prometheus quietly acquired General Agents</a>, an agentic AI startup founded by ex-DeepMind and OpenAI researchers. Their agent &#8220;Ace&#8221; can autonomously control computers and perform complex tasks. Project Prometheus has raised $6.2B and now has 100+ employees, all focused on AI for manufacturing - computers, cars, spacecraft. Bezos is back in operator mode.</p></li></ul><div><hr></div><div class=\\\"captioned-button-wrap\\\" data-attrs=\\\"{&quot;url&quot;:&quot;https://www.bensbites.com/p/always-post-bad-news-on-a-holiday?utm_source=substack&utm_medium=email&utm_content=share&action=share&quot;,&quot;text&quot;:&quot;Share&quot;}\\\" data-component-name=\\\"CaptionedButtonToDOM\\\"><div class=\\\"preamble\\\"><p class=\\\"cta-caption\\\">Enjoy this newsletter? Feel free to comment and share your thoughts. &#128075;</p><ul><li><p>Find me on <a href=\\\"https://x.com/bentossell/\\\">X</a>, <a href=\\\"https://www.linkedin.com/in/ben-tossell-70453537/\\\">Linkedin</a>, or <a href=\\\"https://instagram.com/bentossell\\\">Instagram</a></p></li><li><p>Read <a href=\\\"https://bensbites.substack.com/about\\\">about me</a> and Ben&#8217;s Bites</p></li><li><p>&#128247; thumbnail creds: <a href=\\\"https://x.com/Keshavatearth\\\">@keshavatearth</a>,</p></li></ul><blockquote><h6><em>Wanna <a href=\\\"mailto:shanice@bensbites.com\\\">partner with us</a>? Updates, tool reviews, and lay of the land from an exited founder turned investor and forever tinkerer.</em></p><p class=\\\"button-wrapper\\\" data-attrs=\\\"{&quot;url&quot;:&quot;https://www.bensbites.com/subscribe?&quot;,&quot;text&quot;:&quot;Subscribe now&quot;,&quot;action&quot;:null,&quot;class&quot;:null}\\\" data-component-name=\\\"ButtonCreateButton\\\"><a class=\\\"button primary\\\" href=\\\"https://www.bensbites.com/subscribe?\\\"><span>Subscribe now</span></a></p><div><hr></div><p>Hey folks, today&#8217;s post is packed. </p><p>Everyone&#8217;s rushing to launch their thing before American Turkey day.</p><p>I built a social tracker over the weekend, design inspired by Linear so i can rip through all social mentions from X/Github/Reddits/any other feed you like. It&#8217;s open-source so you can copy it and use it for yourself. <a href=\\\"https://x.com/bentossell/status/1992910274823905533/video/1\\\">Here&#8217;s a lil video </a>I recorded of it in action. Built with Factory&#8217;s Droid, Gemini did the initial design pass (which was ok-ish), but trusty Sonnet polished the F out of it. (My first time open-sourcing something I&#8217;m proud of!)</p><div class=\\\"captioned-image-container\\\"><figure><a class=\\\"image-link image2 is-viewable-img\\\" target=\\\"_blank\\\" https://substackcdn.com/image/fetch/$s_!YSRL!,w_1456,c_limit,f_auto,q_auto:good,fl_progressive:steep/https%3A%2F%2Fsubstack-post-media.s3.amazonaws.com%2Fpublic%2Fimages%2F59032412-aa04-4246-a49a-b49f37d8c844_2908x1520.png 1456w\\\" sizes=\\\"100vw\\\" fetchpriority=\\\"high\\\"></picture><div class=\\\"image-link-expand\\\"><div class=\\\"pencraft pc-display-flex pc-gap-8 pc-reset\\\"><button tabindex=\\\"0\\\" type=\\\"button\\\" class=\\\"pencraft pc-reset pencraft icon-container restack-image\\\"><svg xmlns=\\\"http://www.w3.org/2000/svg\\\" width=\\\"20\\\" height=\\\"20\\\" viewBox=\\\"0 0 24 24\\\" fill=\\\"none\\\" stroke=\\\"currentColor\\\" stroke-width=\\\"2\\\" stroke-linecap=\\\"round\\\" stroke-linejoin=\\\"round\\\" class=\\\"lucide lucide-refresh-cw\\\"><path d=\\\"M3 12a9 9 0 0 1 9-9 9.75 9.75 0 0 1 6.74 2.74L21 8\\\"></path><path d=\\\"M21 3v5h-5\\\"></path><path d=\\\"M21 12a9 9 0 0 1-9 9 9.75 9.75 0 0 1-6.74-2.74L3 16\\\"></path><path d=\\\"M8 16H3v5\\\"></path></svg></button><button tabindex=\\\"0\\\" type=\\\"button\\\" class=\\\"pencraft pc-reset pencraft icon-container view-image\\\"><svg xmlns=\\\"http://www.w3.org/2000/svg\\\" width=\\\"20\\\" height=\\\"20\\\" viewBox=\\\"0 0 24 24\\\" fill=\\\"none\\\" stroke=\\\"currentColor\\\" stroke-width=\\\"2\\\" stroke-linecap=\\\"round\\\" stroke-linejoin=\\\"round\\\" class=\\\"lucide lucide-maximize2 lucide-maximize-2\\\"><polyline points=\\\"15 3 21 3 21 9\\\"></polyline><polyline points=\\\"9 21 3 21 3 15\\\"></polyline><line x1=\\\"21\\\" x2=\\\"14\\\" y1=\\\"3\\\" y2=\\\"10\\\"></line><line x1=\\\"3\\\" x2=\\\"10\\\" y1=\\\"21\\\" y2=\\\"14\\\"></line></svg></button></div></div></div></a></figure></div><p><strong>Google released <a href=\\\"https://blog.google/technology/ai/nano-banana-pro/\\\">Nano Banana Pro</a>,</strong> i.e. image generation powered by Gemini 3 Pro. Massive upgrade over already amazing Nano Banana (on top of Gemini 2.5 Flash). It&#8217;s great at text rendering, uses reasoning to think about styles, visual layout and content inside an image.</p><p>Gemini 3 Pro had its charm for a week, but <strong><a href=\\\"https://www.anthropic.com/news/claude-opus-4-5\\\">Claude took it back with Opus 4.5</a></strong>. It&#8217;s the best coding model in the world (crossing 80% on SWE-Bench Verified) and 3x cheaper than previous Opus models. Opus 4.5&#8217;s medium reasoning performs the same as Sonnet 4.5&#8217;s best results while using 76% fewer tokens. So, in real use, sometimes using Opus 4.5 might end up being cheaper. </p><blockquote><p>I&#8217;m working on a web app for a board game. I tested both Gemini 3 Pro and Opus 4.5 on adding multiplayer room creation to it. First, both of these models gave an almost working solution, whereas older models just didn&#8217;t work. Opus was definitely better (and faster) than Gemini, but it still has a few familiar issues. It creates too much duplicate code and very easily falls into the &#8220;you&#8217;re absolutely right&#8221; trap when fixing bugs.</p><p>&#8211; Keshav</p></blockquote><p>Anthropic also released many product updates with this: &#8220;no cutoff&#8221; in long conversations on the Claude app, Claude Code on Desktop, Claude in Chrome and Excel, new tools for <a href=\\\"https://www.anthropic.com/engineering/advanced-tool-use\\\">avoiding the pitfalls of MCP</a> and more.</p><p>OpenAI also released <strong>two major features in ChatGPT: <a href=\\\"https://x.com/nickaturley/status/1991560210326974649\\\">Group Chats</a> and <a href=\\\"https://x.com/OpenAI/status/1993018357432586391\\\">Shopping Research</a>.</strong> Group Chats have a limit of 20 people and still have that beta feel. They were earlier launched in a few countries but are now available globally. Shopping Research is a new mode like Deep Research, powered by a special version of GPT-5 Mini. It promises to find the product on the web for your query, but since it&#8217;s a small model, be wary of inaccuracies in details like pricing, sizes, etc. Both these features are available to free and paid users (except teams/enterprises).</p><p><strong>Hardcoded permissions slowing you down?</strong> As systems grow, hardcoded authorization creates security gaps and dev bottlenecks. This 80-page ebook walks through the <strong>move to externalized authorization</strong> - with frameworks, code samples, and lessons from teams who&#8217;ve made the transition. <a href=\\\"https://solutions.cerbos.dev/how-to-adopt-externalized-authorization?utm_campaign=bens_bites_nov_2025&amp;utm_source=newsletter&amp;utm_medium=email&amp;utm_content=&amp;utm_term=\\\">Download free ebook.</a>*</p><p><a href=\\\"https://x.com/bentossell/status/1991960096864338000?s=20\\\">Factory skills</a> are now live (links to my video)! Skills are essentially instructions + tools to run workflows super easily. I built this browser tool that opens sites, takes actions (clicks, fills in forms etc) and pulls all that back into my chat. I also recently added a DOM picker so i can select elements on a webpage and that code gets sent to the chat so i can identify specific elements to change (instead of saying no not that button, the other blue button)</p><div><hr></div><h3><strong> </strong>&#127760;<strong> </strong>What I&#8217;m consuming</h3><ul><li><p>Why your Voice AI <a href=\\\"https://www.speechmatics.com/company/articles-and-news/voice-ai-doesnt-need-to-be-faster-it-needs-to-read-the-room?utm_source=bens-bites&amp;utm_medium=paid-social&amp;utm_campaign=voice-ai-agents-speaker&amp;utm_content=newsletter\\\">keeps interrupting users</a> (hint: it&#8217;s too fast).*</p></li><li><p>I tested <a href=\\\"https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=t2n1QRjdPMM\\\">Gemini 3.0 Pro inside Droid</a> and Google Antigravity.</p></li><li><p>How a global company lets its employees <a href=\\\"https://www.bensbites.com/p/global-company-lets-employees-build-with-30-llms\\\">build with 30+ LLMs.</a></p></li><li><p>Benedict Evans&#8217; Nov 2025 edition of <a href=\\\"https://www.ben-evans.com/presentations\\\">AI eats the world.</a></p></li><li><p>Why we <a href=\\\"https://www.browserbase.com/blog/chromium-fork-for-ai-automation\\\">forked Chromium</a> for AI automation.</p></li><li><p>How to prompt with Gemini 3 to <a href=\\\"https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=b-kTkak2FKs&amp;t=1s\\\">get the best UIs</a></p></li><li><p>Building an <a href=\\\"https://cdn.openai.com/business-guides-and-resources/building-an-ai-native-engineering-team.pdf\\\">AI native engineering team</a>.</p></li><li><p>A first principles deep dive into <a href=\\\"https://leehanchung.github.io/blogs/2025/10/26/claude-skills-deep-dive/\\\">Claude Agent Skills.</a></p></li><li><p>My read for the weekend is this 35k+ words monster from <span class=\\\"mention-wrap\\\" data-attrs=\\\"{&quot;name&quot;:&quot;Contrary&quot;,&quot;id&quot;:151170839,&quot;type&quot;:&quot;user&quot;,&quot;url&quot;:null,&quot;photo_url&quot;:&quot;https://substack-post-media.s3.amazonaws.com/public/images/1133cb61-6139-4fa2-9990-bdc6f4497319_96x96.jpeg&quot;,&quot;uuid&quot;:&quot;349bc1fa-fff5-484b-991d-dacd7b84a5ab&quot;}\\\" data-component-name=\\\"MentionToDOM\\\"></span> Research covering <a href=\\\"https://research.contrary.com/company/openai\\\">all things OpenAI</a>.</p></li></ul><div><hr></div><h3>&#9881;&#65039; Tools and demos</h3><ul><li><p><strong><a href=\\\"https://yutori.com/blog/introducing-navigator\\\">Navigator</a></strong> by Yutori - SOTA web-navigating agent with its own cloud browser.</p></li><li><p><strong><a href=\\\"https://tubedummies.com/\\\">TubeDummies</a></strong> - Turn any YouTube tutorial into step-by-step interactive learning.</p></li><li><p><strong><a href=\\\"https://paperreview.ai/\\\">paperreview</a></strong> - Get detailed AI feedback on your research paper.</p></li><li><p><strong><a href=\\\"https://parallel.ai/blog/introducing-parallel-extract\\\">Parallel Extract</a></strong> - Get all content from a URL in markdown, either in full detail or in a compressed form for better token efficiency.</p></li><li><p><strong><a href=\\\"https://x.com/Replit/status/1991951303757709664\\\">Replit</a></strong> Agent now integrates with Stripe to help you add payments easily.</p></li><li><p><strong><a href=\\\"https://www.cfosilvia.com/?utm_source=bensbites&amp;utm_medium=newsletter&amp;utm_campaign=sponsorship_oct2025_v1\\\">Silvia</a></strong> &#8211; Your personal AI CFO that tracks every account, models &#8220;what if&#8221; scenarios, and surfaces insights automatically. One place to see and grow your entire net worth.*</p></li></ul><div class=\\\"captioned-image-container\\\"><figure><a class=\\\"image-link image2\\\" target=\\\"_blank\\\" 1456w\\\" sizes=\\\"100vw\\\" loading=\\\"lazy\\\"></picture><div></div></div></a></figure></div><div><hr></div><h3>&#129379; Dev dish</h3><ul><li><p><a href=\\\"https://github.com/dzhng/claude-agent-server\\\">claude-agent-server</a> - Run Claude Agent (the harness behind Claude Code) in a cloud sandbox and control it via WebSocket.</p></li><li><p><a href=\\\"https://github.com/Kylejeong2/synapse\\\">synapse</a> - Fork chats and go down rabbitholes on things without clogging context (<a href=\\\"https://x.com/kylejeong/status/1992373423310602271\\\">demo</a>).</p></li><li><p><a href=\\\"https://github.com/karpathy/llm-council\\\">llm-council</a> - Send your response to multiple models and let the council choose the best for you.</p></li><li><p>MCP servers might soon power interactive user interfaces for hosts with the new proposal of <a href=\\\"https://blog.modelcontextprotocol.io/posts/2025-11-21-mcp-apps/\\\">MCP Apps</a>.</p></li></ul><div><hr></div><h3>&#127846; Afters</h3><ul><li><p><strong><a href=\\\"https://fandf.co/48hlBfG\\\">Valon is hiring Forward Deployed Engineers</a>.</strong> $130K&#8211;$230K &amp; equity, turning enterprise clients needs into code onsite. NYC/SF/Seattle + travel*</p></li><li><p><a href=\\\"https://openai.com/index/accelerating-science-gpt-5/\\\">OpenAI for Science</a> released their first paper - 13 examples of GPT-5 accelerating scientific research.</p></li><li><p><a href=\\\"https://www.anthropic.com/research/emergent-misalignment-reward-hacking\\\">New Anthropic research</a>: if you teach a model to cheat on coding tasks, it learns other bad behaviours too. But if you frame reward hacking as finding loopholes to patch (vs cheating), this generalisation does not happen.</p></li><li><p>Cline is building <a href=\\\"https://cline.bot/blog/cline-bench-initiative\\\">cline-bench</a> - A real-world open source benchmark for agentic coding. Plus, there&#8217;s a new hard physics benchmark in the market - <a href=\\\"https://critpt.com/\\\">CritPt</a>.</p></li><li><p><a href=\\\"https://grokipedia.com/\\\">Grokipedia</a> accepts proposed edits now, Elon&#8217;s replacing <a href=\\\"https://www.theinformation.com/articles/twins-pushing-elon-musks-plans-replace-x-staff-grok\\\">X&#8217;s content moderation with Grok</a>, Replit and Campus Edu have a new <a href=\\\"https://campus.edu/vibe-coding\\\">8-week vibe-coding course</a>, and a <a href=\\\"https://www.browserbase.com/blog/training-computer-use-models-in-the-real-world-with-microsoft\\\">small model from Microsoft</a> tops computer use charts.</p></li></ul><div><hr></div><div class=\\\"captioned-button-wrap\\\" data-attrs=\\\"{&quot;url&quot;:&quot;https://www.bensbites.com/p/new-opus-is-bananas?utm_source=substack&utm_medium=email&utm_content=share&action=share&quot;,&quot;text&quot;:&quot;Share&quot;}\\\" data-component-name=\\\"CaptionedButtonToDOM\\\"><div class=\\\"preamble\\\"><p class=\\\"cta-caption\\\">Enjoy this newsletter? Feel free to comment and share your thoughts. &#128075;</p><ul><li><p>Find me on <a href=\\\"https://x.com/bentossell/\\\">X</a>, <a href=\\\"https://www.linkedin.com/in/ben-tossell-70453537/\\\">Linkedin</a>, or <a href=\\\"https://instagram.com/bentossell\\\">Instagram</a></p></li><li><p>Read <a href=\\\"https://bensbites.substack.com/about\\\">about me</a> and Ben&#8217;s Bites</p></li><li><p>&#128247; thumbnail creds: <a href=\\\"https://x.com/Keshavatearth\\\">@keshavatearth</a>,</p></li></ul><blockquote><h6><em>Thanks to today&#8217;s sponsors who made this newsletter possible :)</em></h6><h6><em>Cerbos, Speechmatics, Silvia and Valon.</em></h6><h6><em>Wanna <a href=\\\"mailto:shanice@bensbites.com\\\">partner with us</a>? Updates, tool reviews, and lay of the land from an exited founder turned investor and forever tinkerer.\\nSubscribe now\\n\\n\\nHey folks, today‚Äôs post is packed. \\nEveryone‚Äôs rushing to launch their thing before American Turkey day.\\nI built a social tracker over the weekend, design inspired by Linear so i can rip through all social mentions from X/Github/Reddits/any other feed you like. It‚Äôs open-source so you can copy it and use it for yourself. Here‚Äôs a lil video I recorded of it in action. Built with Factory‚Äôs Droid, Gemini did the initial design pass (which was ok-ish), but trusty Sonnet polished the F out of it. (My first time open-sourcing something I‚Äôm proud of!)\\n\\n\\n\\n\\n\\n\\n\\n\\n\\n\\n\\n\\n\\n\\nGoogle released Nano Banana Pro, i.e. image generation powered by Gemini 3 Pro. Massive upgrade over already amazing Nano Banana (on top of Gemini 2.5 Flash). It‚Äôs great at text rendering, uses reasoning to think about styles, visual layout and content inside an image.\\nGemini 3 Pro had its charm for a week, but Claude took it back with Opus 4.5. It‚Äôs the best coding model in the world (crossing 80% on SWE-Bench Verified) and 3x cheaper than previous Opus models. Opus 4.5‚Äôs medium reasoning performs the same as Sonnet 4.5‚Äôs best results while using 76% fewer tokens. So, in real use, sometimes using Opus 4.5 might end up being cheaper. \\n\\nI‚Äôm working on a web app for a board game. I tested both Gemini 3 Pro and Opus 4.5 on adding multiplayer room creation to it. First, both of these models gave an almost working solution, whereas older models just didn‚Äôt work. Opus was definitely better (and faster) than Gemini, but it still has a few familiar issues. It creates too much duplicate code and very easily falls into the ‚Äúyou‚Äôre absolutely right‚Äù trap when fixing bugs.\\n‚Äì Keshav\\n\\nAnthropic also released many product updates with this: ‚Äúno cutoff‚Äù in long conversations on the Claude app, Claude Code on Desktop, Claude in Chrome and Excel, new tools for avoiding the pitfalls of MCP and more.\\nOpenAI also released two major features in ChatGPT: Group Chats and Shopping Research. Group Chats have a limit of 20 people and still have that beta feel. They were earlier launched in a few countries but are now available globally. Shopping Research is a new mode like Deep Research, powered by a special version of GPT-5 Mini. It promises to find the product on the web for your query, but since it‚Äôs a small model, be wary of inaccuracies in details like pricing, sizes, etc. Both these features are available to free and paid users (except teams/enterprises).\\nHardcoded permissions slowing you down? As systems grow, hardcoded authorization creates security gaps and dev bottlenecks. This 80-page ebook walks through the move to externalized authorization - with frameworks, code samples, and lessons from teams who‚Äôve made the transition. Download free ebook.*\\nFactory skills are now live (links to my video)! Skills are essentially instructions + tools to run workflows super easily. I built this browser tool that opens sites, takes actions (clicks, fills in forms etc) and pulls all that back into my chat. I also recently added a DOM picker so i can select elements on a webpage and that code gets sent to the chat so i can identify specific elements to change (instead of saying no not that button, the other blue button)\\n\\n\\n üåê What I‚Äôm consuming\\n\\nWhy your Voice AI keeps interrupting users (hint: it‚Äôs too fast).*\\n\\nI tested Gemini 3.0 Pro inside Droid and Google Antigravity.\\n\\nHow a global company lets its employees build with 30+ LLMs.\\n\\nBenedict Evans‚Äô Nov 2025 edition of AI eats the world.\\n\\nWhy we forked Chromium for AI automation.\\n\\nHow to prompt with Gemini 3 to get the best UIs\\n\\nBuilding an AI native engineering team.\\n\\nA first principles deep dive into Claude Agent Skills.\\n\\nMy read for the weekend is this 35k+ words monster from  Research covering all things OpenAI.\\n\\n\\n\\n‚öôÔ∏è Tools and demos\\n\\nNavigator by Yutori - SOTA web-navigating agent with its own cloud browser.\\n\\nTubeDummies - Turn any YouTube tutorial into step-by-step interactive learning.\\n\\npaperreview - Get detailed AI feedback on your research paper.\\n\\nParallel Extract - Get all content from a URL in markdown, either in full detail or in a compressed form for better token efficiency.\\n\\nReplit Agent now integrates with Stripe to help you add payments easily.\\n\\nSilvia ‚Äì Your personal AI CFO that tracks every account, models ‚Äúwhat if‚Äù scenarios, and surfaces insights automatically. One place to see and grow your entire net worth.*\\n\\n\\n\\n\\n\\n\\n\\nü•£ Dev dish\\n\\nclaude-agent-server - Run Claude Agent (the harness behind Claude Code) in a cloud sandbox and control it via WebSocket.\\n\\nsynapse - Fork chats and go down rabbitholes on things without clogging context (demo).\\n\\nllm-council - Send your response to multiple models and let the council choose the best for you.\\n\\nMCP servers might soon power interactive user interfaces for hosts with the new proposal of MCP Apps.\\n\\n\\n\\nüç¶ Afters\\n\\nValon is hiring Forward Deployed Engineers. $130K‚Äì$230K & equity, turning enterprise clients needs into code onsite. Last few slots left for the rest of the year.\",\"enclosure\":{\"url\":\"https://substack-post-media.s3.amazonaws.com/public/images/77770a93-ddd3-401d-9895-2392a426f866_2816x1536.png\",\"length\":\"0\",\"type\":\"image/jpeg\"},\"content\":\"ChatGPT will go shopping for you\",\"contentSnippet\":\"ChatGPT will go shopping for you\",\"guid\":\"https://www.bensbites.com/p/new-opus-is-bananas\",\"isoDate\":\"2025-11-25T14:10:39.000Z\",\"itunes\":{}},\"pairedItem\":[{\"item\":0}]},{\"json\":{\"title\":\"Gemini 3 is worth the hype\",\"link\":\"https://www.bensbites.com/p/gemini-3-is-worth-the-hype\",\"pubDate\":\"Thu, 20 Nov 2025 14:02:20 GMT\",\"content:encoded\":\"<p><em>The newsletter for the technically curious. Updates, tool reviews, and lay of the land from an exited founder turned investor and forever tinkerer.</em></p><p class=\\\"button-wrapper\\\" data-attrs=\\\"{&quot;url&quot;:&quot;https://www.bensbites.com/subscribe?&quot;,&quot;text&quot;:&quot;Subscribe now&quot;,&quot;action&quot;:null,&quot;class&quot;:null}\\\" data-component-name=\\\"ButtonCreateButton\\\"><a class=\\\"button primary\\\" href=\\\"https://www.bensbites.com/subscribe?\\\"><span>Subscribe now</span></a></p><div><hr></div><p>Hey folks,</p><p><strong><a href=\\\"https://blog.google/products/gemini/gemini-3/\\\">Gemini 3 Pro is out</a></strong> beating GPT-5.1, Sonnet 4.5 on all benchmarks but one (SWE-Bench Verified). It&#8217;s only slightly smarter than other models, but it is much better at vision. It scores 72.7% on a benchmark for screenshot understanding; the second best is 36.2%. Faster and <a href=\\\"https://blog.google/technology/developers/gemini-3-developers/\\\">slightly expensive</a> than 2.5 Pro.</p><p>My vibe check: it&#8217;s a good model, it&#8217;s eager to commit changes (!!), isn&#8217;t as good as following instructions as Codex (maybe some new prompting quirks needed?) and <a href=\\\"https://x.com/joshwoodward/status/1991363571188658557\\\">definitely</a> good at frontend.</p><p>This launch comes with a <strong>new IDE from Google: <a href=\\\"https://antigravity.google/blog/introducing-google-antigravity\\\">Antigravity</a></strong> (courtesy of acquiring the Windsurf founders). It also has an Agent Manager and a browser for the agent to see/test what it has built. I tried it for a few hours: Tab complete feels very slow, and the agent is over-eager to implement a plan (while in planning mode). The Agent Manager treats extra documents like plans, task lists as separate &#8220;artifacts&#8221; and doesn&#8217;t clutter your codebase. I liked that. It took me a while to get the browser integration working, but once it was set up, it was really nice and fast too vs Atlas.</p><p>In <a href=\\\"https://blog.google/products/gemini/gemini-3-gemini-app/\\\">other stuff</a>, they released Gemini Agent (for ultra subs only), introduced Dynamic UI in chat, teased <a href=\\\"https://blog.google/products/gemini/gemini-3/#gemini-3-deep-think\\\">Gemini 3 Deep Think</a> and rolled it out in Search (<a href=\\\"https://x.com/arkitus/status/1990815142716518654\\\">via AI mode</a>) on day 1.</p><p>They are not done (potentially nano banana 2 today), but neither are OpenAI and xAI. OpenAI released two models: <strong><a href=\\\"https://x.com/_simonsmith/status/1991263744228237604\\\">GPT-5.1 Pro</a></strong> and <strong><a href=\\\"https://openai.com/index/gpt-5-1-codex-max/\\\">GPT-5.1-Codex-Max</a></strong> to follow up on Gemini 3, and xAI has released <strong><a href=\\\"https://x.ai/news/grok-4-1-fast\\\">Grok 4.1 Fast</a></strong>. These three models all look like they&#8217;d do better than Gemini 3 Pro, but only on specific tasks (hard academic problems, code generation and tool calls).</p><p><strong><a href=\\\"https://ai.meta.com/blog/segment-anything-model-3\\\">An underrated release from Meta: SAM 3</a>.</strong> SAM (Segment Anything Model) family of models can take an image/video and create an overlay of any individual or group of objects in it. Meta is <a href=\\\"https://blog.roboflow.com/sam3/\\\">partnering with Roboflow</a> to let people fine-tune SAM on their use cases, and it&#8217;ll use SAM in Instagram&#8217;s video editing app called &#8220;Edits&#8221;.</p><p><strong>One API for All Your Voice AI Workflows.</strong> Stop wasting time juggling voice AI vendors. AssemblyAI combines multilingual Speech-to-Text, speaker diarization, speech understanding &amp; LLMs in one developer-friendly API. Trusted by Granola, Dovetail &amp; Ashby. Free to try, pay-as-you-go. <a href=\\\"https://www.assemblyai.com/build-voice-ai?utm_source=bensbites&amp;utm_medium=newsletter_sponsor&amp;utm_campaign=main&amp;utm_content=voice_ai\\\">Start building voice AI today</a>.*</p><p>I&#8217;ve been talking with TELUS (one of Canada&#8217;s largest telecom companies) this year. They built a platform that allows 70k+ employees pick from over 30 LLMs to build copilots. I chatted with them and <strong><a href=\\\"https://www.bensbites.com/p/global-company-lets-employees-build-with-30-llms\\\">wrote about their story here</a></strong>.</p><div><hr></div><h3><strong> </strong>&#127760;<strong> </strong>What I&#8217;m consuming</h3><ul><li><p>Gemini 3 reviews: <a href=\\\"https://shumer.dev/gemini3review\\\">Matt Shumer</a> &#8212; <a href=\\\"https://simonwillison.net/2025/Nov/18/gemini-3/\\\">Simon Willison</a></p></li><li><p>GPT-5.1-Pro reviews: <a href=\\\"https://shumer.dev/gpt51proreview\\\">Matt Shumer</a> &#8212; <a href=\\\"https://x.com/_simonsmith/status/1991263744228237604\\\">Simon Smith</a></p></li><li><p>How evals drive the next chapter in <a href=\\\"https://openai.com/index/evals-drive-next-chapter-of-ai/\\\">AI for businesses</a>.</p></li><li><p>The impact of <a href=\\\"https://simonlermen.substack.com/p/can-ai-models-be-jailbroken-to-phish\\\">AI scams on elderly people.</a></p></li><li><p><a href=\\\"https://secondthoughts.ai/p/hyperproductivity\\\">Hyperproductivity</a> - An astonishing, exhilarating, exhausting new style of work.</p></li><li><p>LLMs have distinct coding personalities. <strong><a href=\\\"https://fandf.co/4r5PckL\\\">This research</a></strong> (free report, no form fill needed) from Sonar lays out each LLM&#8217;s unique habits, blind spots and risks &#8211; like hidden security flaws, messy code and severe bugs. Useful read for making smarter, safer decisions when coding with AI.*</p></li></ul><div class=\\\"captioned-image-container\\\"><figure><a class=\\\"image-link image2 is-viewable-img\\\" applications with NLX. No coding required, only great ideas. <a href=\\\"http://nlx.ai/platform?utm_source=newsletter&amp;utm_medium=bens_bites&amp;utm_campaign=october_send\\\">Try it for free today.</a>*</p></li><li><p><strong><a href=\\\"https://smithery.ai/chat\\\">Smithery Chat</a></strong> - Chat with artifacts, code mode and 2000+ integrations. (<a href=\\\"https://x.com/kamathematic/status/1991191038216614299\\\">more</a>) </p></li><li><p><strong><a href=\\\"https://www.warp.dev/blog/agents-3-full-terminal-use-plan-code-review-integration\\\">Warp Agents 3.0</a></strong> - Full terminal use, /plan, code review and more integrations.</p></li><li><p><strong><a href=\\\"https://www.emdash.sh/\\\">emdash</a></strong> - Open-source tool to run multiple coding agents in parallel. (<a href=\\\"https://x.com/rabanspiegel/status/1991220598538924097\\\">demo</a>)</p></li><li><p><strong><a href=\\\"https://www.zo.computer/\\\">Zo</a></strong> - Your intelligent cloud computer with all the context.</p></li><li><p><strong><a href=\\\"https://x.com/Replit/status/1990861193733681408\\\">Design mode in Replit</a></strong> - Prototype beautiful UIs fast with Gemini 3 Pro.</p></li></ul><div class=\\\"captioned-image-container\\\"><figure><a class=\\\"image-link image2 is-viewable-img\\\" target=\\\"_blank\\\" Dunlop</a></figcaption></figure></div><div><hr></div><h3>&#127846; Afters</h3><ul><li><p><a href=\\\"https://www.ft.com/content/b13c6f36-7810-42cd-af8e-526828b04682\\\">xAI is raising $15B for a $230B valuation</a>, and so are many others: <a href=\\\"https://x.com/gneubig/status/1990847700674490719?s=20\\\">Openhands</a> - 18.8M series A, <a href=\\\"https://lumalabs.ai/blog/news/series-c\\\">Luma Labs</a> - 900M series C, <a href=\\\"https://x.com/askalphaxiv/status/1991147020703195375\\\">AlphaXiv</a> - $7M seed round and <a href=\\\"https://x.com/suno/status/1991177878122148271\\\">Suno</a> - $250M Series C.</p></li><li><p><a href=\\\"https://www.anthropic.com/news/microsoft-nvidia-anthropic-announce-strategic-partnerships\\\">Nvidia and Microsoft</a> are investing up to $10B and $5B in Anthropic.</p></li><li><p><a href=\\\"https://www.theinformation.com/articles/yann-lecun-leave-meta-form-new-ai-startup\\\">Meta confirms Yann LeCun will leave</a> to form a new AI startup at the end of the year.</p></li><li><p>ChatGPT will be <a href=\\\"https://openai.com/index/chatgpt-for-teachers/\\\">free for teachers</a> till June 2027.</p></li></ul><div><hr></div><div Last few slots left for the rest of the year.</em></h6></blockquote><div><hr></div>\",\"content:encodedSnippet\":\"The newsletter for the technically curious. Updates, tool reviews, and lay of the land from an exited founder turned investor and forever tinkerer.\\nSubscribe now\\n\\n\\nHey folks,\\nGemini 3 Pro is out beating GPT-5.1, Sonnet 4.5 on all benchmarks but one (SWE-Bench Verified). It‚Äôs only slightly smarter than other models, but it is much better at vision. It scores 72.7% on a benchmark for screenshot understanding; the second best is 36.2%. Faster and slightly expensive than 2.5 Pro.\\nMy vibe check: it‚Äôs a good model, it‚Äôs eager to commit changes (!!), isn‚Äôt as good as following instructions as Codex (maybe some new prompting quirks needed?) and definitely good at frontend.\\nThis launch comes with a new IDE from Google: Antigravity (courtesy of acquiring the Windsurf founders). It also has an Agent Manager and a browser for the agent to see/test what it has built. I tried it for a few hours: Tab complete feels very slow, and the agent is over-eager to implement a plan (while in planning mode). The Agent Manager treats extra documents like plans, task lists as separate ‚Äúartifacts‚Äù and doesn‚Äôt clutter your codebase. I liked that. It took me a while to get the browser integration working, but once it was set up, it was really nice and fast too vs Atlas.\\nIn other stuff, they released Gemini Agent (for ultra subs only), introduced Dynamic UI in chat, teased Gemini 3 Deep Think and rolled it out in Search (via AI mode) on day 1.\\nThey are not done (potentially nano banana 2 today), but neither are OpenAI and xAI. OpenAI released two models: GPT-5.1 Pro and GPT-5.1-Codex-Max to follow up on Gemini 3, and xAI has released Grok 4.1 Fast. These three models all look like they‚Äôd do better than Gemini 3 Pro, but only on specific tasks (hard academic problems, code generation and tool calls).\\nAn underrated release from Meta: SAM 3. SAM (Segment Anything Model) family of models can take an image/video and create an overlay of any individual or group of objects in it. Meta is partnering with Roboflow to let people fine-tune SAM on their use cases, and it‚Äôll use SAM in Instagram‚Äôs video editing app called ‚ÄúEdits‚Äù.\\nOne API for All Your Voice AI Workflows. Stop wasting time juggling voice AI vendors. AssemblyAI combines multilingual Speech-to-Text, speaker diarization, speech understanding & LLMs in one developer-friendly API. Trusted by Granola, Dovetail & Ashby. Free to try, pay-as-you-go. Start building voice AI today.*\\nI‚Äôve been talking with TELUS (one of Canada‚Äôs largest telecom companies) this year. They built a platform that allows 70k+ employees pick from over 30 LLMs to build copilots. I chatted with them and wrote about their story here.\\n\\n\\n üåê What I‚Äôm consuming\\n\\nGemini 3 reviews: Matt Shumer ‚Äî Simon Willison\\n\\nGPT-5.1-Pro reviews: Matt Shumer ‚Äî Simon Smith\\n\\nHow evals drive the next chapter in AI for businesses.\\n\\nThe impact of AI scams on elderly people.\\n\\nHyperproductivity - An astonishing, exhilarating, exhausting new style of work.\\n\\nLLMs have distinct coding personalities. This research (free report, no form fill needed) from Sonar lays out each LLM‚Äôs unique habits, blind spots and risks ‚Äì like hidden security flaws, messy code and severe bugs. Useful read for making smarter, safer decisions when coding with AI.*\\n\\n\\n\\n\\n\\n\\n\\n\\n\\n\\n\\n\\n\\n\\n‚öôÔ∏è Tools and demos\\n\\nBuild chat, voice and multimodal conversational AI applications with NLX. No coding required, only great ideas. Try it for free today.*\\n\\nSmithery Chat - Chat with artifacts, code mode and 2000+ integrations. (more) \\n\\nWarp Agents 3.0 - Full terminal use, /plan, code review and more integrations.\\n\\nemdash - Open-source tool to run multiple coding agents in parallel. (demo)\\n\\nZo - Your intelligent cloud computer with all the context.\\n\\nDesign mode in Replit - Prototype beautiful UIs fast with Gemini 3 Pro.\\n\\n\\n\\n\\n\\n\\n\\n\\n\\n\\n\\nbuilt with Replit Design by Chris Dunlop\\n\\n\\nüç¶ Afters\\n\\nxAI is raising $15B for a $230B valuation, and so are many others: Openhands - 18.8M series A, Luma Labs - 900M series C, AlphaXiv - $7M seed round and Suno - $250M Series C.\\n\\nNvidia and Microsoft are investing up to $10B and $5B in Anthropic.\\n\\nMeta confirms Yann LeCun will leave to form a new AI startup at the end of the year.\\n\\nChatGPT will be free for teachers till June 2027.\\n\\n\\n\\n\\nEnjoy this newsletter? Last few slots left for the rest of the year.\",\"enclosure\":{\"url\":\"https://substack-post-media.s3.amazonaws.com/public/images/2ef9ebe0-e17f-440a-8207-a2b5d2fb86fd_1452x926.png\",\"length\":\"0\",\"type\":\"image/jpeg\"},\"content\":\"but it's not a clear winner\",\"contentSnippet\":\"but it's not a clear winner\",\"guid\":\"https://www.bensbites.com/p/gemini-3-is-worth-the-hype\",\"isoDate\":\"2025-11-20T14:02:20.000Z\",\"itunes\":{}},\"pairedItem\":[{\"item\":0}]},{\"json\":{\"creator\":\"Shanice Stewart-Jones\",\"title\":\"How a global company lets its employees build with 30+ LLMs\",\"link\":\"https://www.bensbites.com/p/global-company-lets-employees-build-with-30-llms\",\"pubDate\":\"Wed, 19 Nov 2025 09:56:50 GMT\",\"content:encoded\":\"<p>TELUS is one of Canada&#8217;s largest telecom companies. With more than 100,000 employees globally, it&#8217;s the very definition of an enterprise.</p><p>When it comes to AI, many enterprise companies seem to have the same cookie-cutter approach: deploy GPT-5, add some guardrails, and call it a day.</p><p>Not TELUS. Despite their size and all the complexities that come with enterprise-level ops, this global company is thinking about AI in a totally different way. And I want to share what they&#8217;re doing with you &#8211; I think there&#8217;s a lot to take away from their story.</p><h2>What TELUS is doing with AI, in a nutshell</h2><p>To overcome all the hurdles they faced when trying to integrate AI at a company-wide level, TELUS built its own switchboard-style application that runs dozens of LLMs at the same time.</p><div xmlns=\\\"http://www.w3.org/2000/svg\\\"><g><title></title><path d=\\\"M2.53001 7.81595C3.49179 4.73911 6.43281 2.5 9.91173 2.5C13.1684 2.5 15.9537 4.46214 17.0852 7.23684L17.6179 8.67647M17.6179 8.67647L18.5002 4.26471M17.6179 8.67647L13.6473 6.91176M17.4995 12.1841C16.5378 15.2609 13.5967 17.5 10.1178 17.5C6.86118 17.5 4.07589 15.5379 2.94432 12.7632L2.41165 11.3235M2.41165 11.3235L1.5293 15.7353M2.41165 11.3235L6.38224 13.0882\\\"></path></g></svg></button><button tabindex=\\\"0\\\" type=\\\"button\\\" class=\\\"pencraft pc-reset pencraft icon-container view-image\\\"><svg xmlns=\\\"http://www.w3.org/2000/svg\\\" width=\\\"20\\\" height=\\\"20\\\" viewBox=\\\"0 0 24 24\\\" fill=\\\"none\\\" stroke=\\\"currentColor\\\" stroke-width=\\\"2\\\" stroke-linecap=\\\"round\\\" stroke-linejoin=\\\"round\\\" class=\\\"lucide lucide-maximize2 lucide-maximize-2\\\"><polyline points=\\\"15 3 21 3 21 9\\\"></polyline><polyline points=\\\"9 21 3 21 3 15\\\"></polyline><line x1=\\\"21\\\" x2=\\\"14\\\" y1=\\\"3\\\" y2=\\\"10\\\"></line><line x1=\\\"3\\\" x2=\\\"10\\\" y1=\\\"21\\\" y2=\\\"14\\\"></line></svg></button></div></div></div></a></figure></div><p>It&#8217;s a comprehensive AI application built on these core functions:</p><ul><li><p>Create customisable AI copilots for unlimited problem-solving</p></li><li><p>Base your AI copilots in your organisation&#8217;s distinctive knowledge</p></li><li><p>Manage and monitor it all from a centralised control plane</p></li><li><p>Integrate with external tools to extend knowledge base capabilities and enable agentic AI workflows</p></li></ul><p>And it&#8217;s not limited to basic productivity tasks &#8211; users can tackle virtually any business challenge by selecting models, defining custom instructions, connecting to knowledge bases, and sharing specialised copilots across the organisation.</p><p>They&#8217;ve given it a name &#8211; Fuel iX Copilots &#8211; and it&#8217;s been such a success that they&#8217;ve <a href=\\\"https://www.fuelix.ai/products/copilots?utm_campaign=2025-Q4_fuelix_cross_us_pros_en&amp;utm_medium=third_tofu_awar_article_&amp;utm_source=d_bens&amp;utm_content=telus-customer-story_lm\\\">turned it into a product</a> for other companies.</p><h2>How it works</h2><p>Users can pick from the newest models from Anthropic, OpenAI, and Google. The picker is pre-grouped by provider, so TELUS always points to the newest model release without touching pipelines.</p><p>On the front-end, Fuel iX Copilots is a chat assistant that can be deployed anywhere throughout an org.</p><p>Its primary features include:</p><ul><li><p><strong>Drag-and-drop RAG builder</strong> &#8211; This lets teams upload docs and databases to create an instant private knowledge base.</p></li><li><p><strong>Model marketplace</strong> &#8211; Users can switch between 30+ LLMs with a single toggle.</p></li><li><p><strong>Unified security layer</strong> &#8211; SSO, audit logs, DLP. Prompts are stateless; a session layer keeps conversation &amp; document data continuity inside TELUS while the model forgets everything after it replies. That single session token works across Claude, GPT-54, and Gemini, so compliance is reviewed once &#8211; not for every new model.</p></li><li><p><strong>Central analytics &amp; billing</strong> &#8211; For tracking usage, cost, and ROI per copilot, per model, or per department.</p></li></ul><div class=\\\"captioned-image-container\\\"><figure><a class=\\\"image-link image2 is-viewable-img\\\" target=\\\"_blank\\\" type=\\\"button\\\" class=\\\"pencraft pc-reset pencraft icon-container restack-image\\\"><svg role=\\\"img\\\" style=\\\"height:20px;width:20px\\\" width=\\\"20\\\" height=\\\"20\\\" viewBox=\\\"0 0
