xmlns=\\\"http://www.w3.org/2000/svg\\\"><g><title></title><path d=\\\"M2.53001 7.81595C3.49179 4.73911 6.43281 2.5 9.91173 2.5C13.1684 2.5 15.9537 4.46214 17.0852 7.23684L17.6179 8.67647M17.6179 8.67647L18.5002 4.26471M17.6179 8.67647L13.6473 6.91176M17.4995 12.1841C16.5378 15.2609 13.5967 17.5 10.1178 17.5C6.86118 17.5 4.07589 15.5379 2.94432 12.7632L2.41165 11.3235M2.41165 11.3235L1.5293 15.7353M2.41165 11.3235L6.38224 13.0882\\\"></path></g></svg></button><button tabindex=\\\"0\\\" type=\\\"button\\\" class=\\\"pencraft pc-reset pencraft icon-container view-image\\\"><svg xmlns=\\\"http://www.w3.org/2000/svg\\\" width=\\\"20\\\" height=\\\"20\\\" viewBox=\\\"0 0 24 24\\\" fill=\\\"none\\\" stroke=\\\"currentColor\\\" stroke-width=\\\"2\\\" stroke-linecap=\\\"round\\\" stroke-linejoin=\\\"round\\\" class=\\\"lucide lucide-maximize2 lucide-maximize-2\\\"><polyline points=\\\"15 3 21 3 21 9\\\"></polyline><polyline points=\\\"9 21 3 21 3 15\\\"></polyline><line x1=\\\"21\\\" x2=\\\"14\\\" y1=\\\"3\\\" y2=\\\"10\\\"></line><line x1=\\\"3\\\" x2=\\\"10\\\" y1=\\\"21\\\" y2=\\\"14\\\"></line></svg></button></div></div></div></a></figure></div><h2>Why they built their own thing</h2><p>Enterprise AI implementation is rarely straightforward. Between data governance and the sprawl of operations, many companies end up with fragmented deployments, lacklustre adoption, or clunky tools that solve for legal teams but frustrate everyone else.</p><p>TELUS faced all of that, but instead of pushing ahead with off-the-shelf copilots or waiting for the dust to settle in the LLM space, they created their own solution.</p><p>The Copilots application now gives users access to over thirty LLMs in parallel, so they can:</p><ul><li><p>Upload internal docs and spin up custom copilots quickly</p></li><li><p>Share those copilots with their teams, or keep them private</p></li><li><p>Choose which models to use and apply specific instructions</p></li><li><p>Monitor usage, permissions and compliance in one place</p></li></ul><p>Everyone in the team can build and share AI tools amongst themselves that fit their specific use cases, without waiting for central IT or budget approvals. Translation, research, IT queries, policy lookups, and onboarding help are just some examples.</p><p>It&#8217;s also fully governed by a central control plane, meaning TELUS gets visibility into how teams are using AI, while still enabling decentralised innovation.</p><p>Today, 50,000 TELUS employees use Fuel iX to pick the right model for the job without needing IT to rewrite pipelines or renegotiate pricing. As a company they&#8217;ve saved more than 500k work hours (more than 62,000 working days) so far, and the numbers are improving all the time.</p><h2>Results that prove the platform works</h2><p>Some real examples of how Fuel iX Copilots is saving time and money for companies:</p><ul><li><p><strong>An internal project planning copilot:</strong></p><ul><li><p>Brought timeline estimates down from 3 hours to 90 seconds, saving TELUS $2 million+ in efficiency gains.</p></li></ul></li><li><p><strong>A retail-facing AI tool:</strong></p><ul><li><p>Integrates live product info across 300+ stores and has saved ~$1.4M annually by cutting down interaction time.</p></li></ul></li><li><p><strong>A network engineering assistant, built into Google Chat:</strong></p><ul><li><p>Helped generate 6,000+ ad hoc jobs and has driven $7M+ in OPEX savings.</p></li></ul></li><li><p><strong>A contact centre copilot:</strong></p><ul><li><p>Saves 80,000+ training hours, $1M in OPEX savings, and handles 30,000 customer queries a day.</p></li></ul></li></ul><h2>Bottom-up, not top-down</h2><p>One of the smartest moves TELUS made was letting people play in a safe playground.</p><p>Early on, they launched a <a href=\\\"https://www.linkedin.com/feed/update/urn:li:activity:7320761526028484608/\\\">sandbox environment</a> with open access to generative AI tools for 30,000 employees. Teams could experiment, test ideas, and build their own copilots without needing to be technical.</p><p>That flipped the usual enterprise AI script on its head. Instead of pushing rigid tools onto teams, TELUS watched departments build what they needed from scratch, and only scaled the things that stuck.</p><p>Adoption grew organically with encouragement from leadership. Resistance gave way to curiosity. And that curiosity turned into capability.</p><h2>Lessons to take away</h2><p>If you&#8217;re building AI workflows inside a large org, TELUS has some advice:</p><ul><li><p>Instead of getting locked into one model, use a flexible, multi-LLM platform that can adapt to new tools.</p></li><li><p>Think like a product team &#8211; design a system that people will want to use.</p></li><li><p>Use only straightforward interfaces. A good copilot builder should be as plug and play as a Canva template.</p></li><li><p>Pair flexibility with strong governance. TELUS&#8217;s control plane ensures security and compliance without slowing innovation down.</p></li></ul><p>In a space dominated by proof-of-concepts, piecemeal deployments, and tools not fit for the enterprise, TELUS built a product that actually delivers control and confidence to business level decision makers. Meanwhile, the people doing the work get to do it better and faster.</p><p>And now, they&#8217;re packaging it up and offering it to other enterprises. If it can work at TELUS scale and in highly-regulated environments, it can surely work anywhere.</p>\",\"content:encodedSnippet\":\"TELUS is one of Canada‚Äôs largest telecom companies. With more than 100,000 employees globally, it‚Äôs the very definition of an enterprise.\\nWhen it comes to AI, many enterprise companies seem to have the same cookie-cutter approach: deploy GPT-5, add some guardrails, and call it a day.\\nNot TELUS. Despite their size and all the complexities that come with enterprise-level ops, this global company is thinking about AI in a totally different way. And I want to share what they‚Äôre doing with you ‚Äì I think there‚Äôs a lot to take away from their story.\\nWhat TELUS is doing with AI, in a nutshell\\nTo overcome all the hurdles they faced when trying to integrate AI at a company-wide level, TELUS built its own switchboard-style application that runs dozens of LLMs at the same time.\\n\\n\\n\\n\\n\\n\\n\\n\\n\\n\\n\\nIt‚Äôs a comprehensive AI application built on these core functions:\\n\\nCreate customisable AI copilots for unlimited problem-solving\\n\\nBase your AI copilots in your organisation‚Äôs distinctive knowledge\\n\\nManage and monitor it all from a centralised control plane\\n\\nIntegrate with external tools to extend knowledge base capabilities and enable agentic AI workflows\\n\\nAnd it‚Äôs not limited to basic productivity tasks ‚Äì users can tackle virtually any business challenge by selecting models, defining custom instructions, connecting to knowledge bases, and sharing specialised copilots across the organisation.\\nThey‚Äôve given it a name ‚Äì Fuel iX Copilots ‚Äì and it‚Äôs been such a success that they‚Äôve turned it into a product for other companies.\\nHow it works\\nUsers can pick from the newest models from Anthropic, OpenAI, and Google. The picker is pre-grouped by provider, so TELUS always points to the newest model release without touching pipelines.\\nOn the front-end, Fuel iX Copilots is a chat assistant that can be deployed anywhere throughout an org.\\nIts primary features include:\\n\\nDrag-and-drop RAG builder ‚Äì This lets teams upload docs and databases to create an instant private knowledge base.\\n\\nModel marketplace ‚Äì Users can switch between 30+ LLMs with a single toggle.\\n\\nUnified security layer ‚Äì SSO, audit logs, DLP. Prompts are stateless; a session layer keeps conversation & document data continuity inside TELUS while the model forgets everything after it replies. That single session token works across Claude, GPT-54, and Gemini, so compliance is reviewed once ‚Äì not for every new model.\\n\\nCentral analytics & billing ‚Äì For tracking usage, cost, and ROI per copilot, per model, or per department.\\n\\n\\n\\n\\n\\n\\n\\n\\n\\n\\n\\n\\n\\n\\n\\n\\n\\n\\n\\n\\n\\n\\n\\nWhy they built their own thing\\nEnterprise AI implementation is rarely straightforward. Between data governance and the sprawl of operations, many companies end up with fragmented deployments, lacklustre adoption, or clunky tools that solve for legal teams but frustrate everyone else.\\nTELUS faced all of that, but instead of pushing ahead with off-the-shelf copilots or waiting for the dust to settle in the LLM space, they created their own solution.\\nThe Copilots application now gives users access to over thirty LLMs in parallel, so they can:\\n\\nUpload internal docs and spin up custom copilots quickly\\n\\nShare those copilots with their teams, or keep them private\\n\\nChoose which models to use and apply specific instructions\\n\\nMonitor usage, permissions and compliance in one place\\n\\nEveryone in the team can build and share AI tools amongst themselves that fit their specific use cases, without waiting for central IT or budget approvals. Translation, research, IT queries, policy lookups, and onboarding help are just some examples.\\nIt‚Äôs also fully governed by a central control plane, meaning TELUS gets visibility into how teams are using AI, while still enabling decentralised innovation.\\nToday, 50,000 TELUS employees use Fuel iX to pick the right model for the job without needing IT to rewrite pipelines or renegotiate pricing. As a company they‚Äôve saved more than 500k work hours (more than 62,000 working days) so far, and the numbers are improving all the time.\\nResults that prove the platform works\\nSome real examples of how Fuel iX Copilots is saving time and money for companies:\\n\\nAn internal project planning copilot:\\n\\nBrought timeline estimates down from 3 hours to 90 seconds, saving TELUS $2 million+ in efficiency gains.\\n\\n\\nA retail-facing AI tool:\\n\\nIntegrates live product info across 300+ stores and has saved ~$1.4M annually by cutting down interaction time.\\n\\n\\nA network engineering assistant, built into Google Chat:\\n\\nHelped generate 6,000+ ad hoc jobs and has driven $7M+ in OPEX savings.\\n\\n\\nA contact centre copilot:\\n\\nSaves 80,000+ training hours, $1M in OPEX savings, and handles 30,000 customer queries a day.\\n\\n\\nBottom-up, not top-down\\nOne of the smartest moves TELUS made was letting people play in a safe playground.\\nEarly on, they launched a sandbox environment with open access to generative AI tools for 30,000 employees. Teams could experiment, test ideas, and build their own copilots without needing to be technical.\\nThat flipped the usual enterprise AI script on its head. Instead of pushing rigid tools onto teams, TELUS watched departments build what they needed from scratch, and only scaled the things that stuck.\\nAdoption grew organically with encouragement from leadership. Resistance gave way to curiosity. And that curiosity turned into capability.\\nLessons to take away\\nIf you‚Äôre building AI workflows inside a large org, TELUS has some advice:\\n\\nInstead of getting locked into one model, use a flexible, multi-LLM platform that can adapt to new tools.\\n\\nThink like a product team ‚Äì design a system that people will want to use.\\n\\nUse only straightforward interfaces. A good copilot builder should be as plug and play as a Canva template.\\n\\nPair flexibility with strong governance. TELUS‚Äôs control plane ensures security and compliance without slowing innovation down.\\n\\nIn a space dominated by proof-of-concepts, piecemeal deployments, and tools not fit for the enterprise, TELUS built a product that actually delivers control and confidence to business level decision makers. Meanwhile, the people doing the work get to do it better and faster.\\nAnd now, they‚Äôre packaging it up and offering it to other enterprises. If it can work at TELUS scale and in highly-regulated environments, it can surely work anywhere.\",\"enclosure\":{\"url\":\"https://substackcdn.com/image/fetch/$s_!UtPq!,f_auto,q_auto:good,fl_progressive:steep/https%3A%2F%2Fsubstack-post-media.s3.amazonaws.com%2Fpublic%2Fimages%2F495cbabb-d0bd-4da1-b300-b93331c94654_1600x1401.png\",\"length\":\"0\",\"type\":\"image/jpeg\"},\"dc:creator\":\"Shanice Stewart-Jones\",\"content\":\"A telecom giant&#8217;s not-so-secret AI playground that turned 70,000 employees into copilot builders.\",\"contentSnippet\":\"A telecom giant‚Äôs not-so-secret AI playground that turned 70,000 employees into copilot builders.\",\"guid\":\"https://www.bensbites.com/p/global-company-lets-employees-build-with-30-llms\",\"isoDate\":\"2025-11-19T09:56:50.000Z\",\"itunes\":{}},\"pairedItem\":[{\"item\":0}]},{\"json\":{\"title\":\"Group chats with AI\",\"link\":\"https://www.bensbites.com/p/group-chats-with-ai\",\"pubDate\":\"Tue, 18 Nov 2025 14:10:38 GMT\",\"content:encoded\":\"<p><em>The newsletter for the technically curious. Updates, tool reviews, and lay of the land from an exited founder turned investor and forever tinkerer.</em></p><p class=\\\"button-wrapper\\\" data-attrs=\\\"{&quot;url&quot;:&quot;https://www.bensbites.com/subscribe?&quot;,&quot;text&quot;:&quot;Subscribe now&quot;,&quot;action&quot;:null,&quot;class&quot;:null}\\\" data-component-name=\\\"ButtonCreateButton\\\"><a class=\\\"button primary\\\" href=\\\"https://www.bensbites.com/subscribe?\\\"><span>Subscribe now</span></a></p><div><hr></div><p>Hey folks,</p><p>While we&#8217;re all waiting for Gemini 3 (probably out when some of you are reading this &#128064;) , <a href=\\\"https://x.ai/news/grok-4-1\\\">Grok 4.1</a> is out. It&#8217;s on <a href=\\\"https://x.com/arena/status/1990530978943787291\\\">top of LM Arena</a>, has good creative writing and comes in two variants - thinking and non-thinking. There are no other &#8220;performance&#8221; benchmarks, but the model safety card mentions that Grok 4.1 has much higher levels of sycophancy (i.e. agreeing with the user) and deception than Grok 4. I tried some basic prompts, and it looks like a decent model, but I don&#8217;t feel like I&#8217;m getting something special to even consider using it regularly. (Like every Grok model tbh)</p><p>OpenAI made GPT-5.1 <a href=\\\"https://openai.com/index/gpt-5-1-for-developers/\\\">available in the API</a> and shared some evals for it. On vibes, I&#8217;m seeing reports of the model being &#8220;extra eager&#8221;, similar to Claude Sonnet 3.7. </p><p>OpenAI is also <a href=\\\"https://openai.com/index/group-chats-in-chatgpt/\\\">piloting a group chat feature in ChatGPT</a> in 4 countries: Japan, New Zealand, South Korea and Taiwan. <a href=\\\"https://poe.com/blog/introducing-group-chat-for-all-poe-users\\\">Poe</a>, the AI chatbot from Quora, released the same feature with groups up to 200 members, including humans and multiple models.</p><p>Anthropic says it stopped a <a href=\\\"https://www.anthropic.com/news/disrupting-AI-espionage\\\">large-scale AI cyberattack</a> (originating from China), open-sourced their <a href=\\\"https://www.anthropic.com/news/political-even-handedness\\\">eval for political bias</a>, and launched a <a href=\\\"https://www.anthropic.com/news/rwandan-government-partnership-ai-education\\\">learning companion</a> with the Govt. of Rwanda. Oh, and the Claude Code team released a pre-built plugin to make it <a href=\\\"https://x.com/trq212/status/1989061937590837678\\\">better at frontend design.</a></p><p><strong><a href=\\\"https://attio.com/?utm_source=bens_bites&amp;utm_medium=newsletter_sponsorship&amp;utm_campaign=bens_bites-Q3Y25\\\">Attio</a></strong> is the AI-native CRM for the next generation of teams. Sync your email and calendar, and Attio instantly builds your CRM&#8212;enriching every company, contact, and interaction with actionable insights in seconds. Join fast growing teams like Granola, Flatfile, Modal, and more. <strong><a href=\\\"https://attio.com/?utm_source=bens_bites&amp;utm_medium=newsletter_sponsorship&amp;utm_campaign=bens_bites-Q3Y25\\\">Start for free today</a>.</strong>*</p><p>Inside Factory</p><ul><li><p>Our CLI now <a href=\\\"https://docs.factory.ai/changelog/cli-updates\\\">supports all Skills</a> - you can import from claude code, plugin support coming this week &#128522;</p></li><li><p>We <a href=\\\"https://docs.factory.ai/changelog/1-10\\\">support Hooks</a> (which I&#8217;ve been <a href=\\\"https://x.com/bentossell/status/1989317209525538988\\\">experimenting</a> with) too</p></li><li><p>We have 5.1, 5.1 Codex, and some of the newest models (with SOTA scores) coming out VERY soon</p></li><li><p>We&#8217;re building a new web product we&#8217;re excited to share soon for early access</p></li><li><p>We launched a $2k/mo plan, which isn&#8217;t as nuts as you&#8217;d expect - its actually a KILLER deal for small teams, and I can tell you that people have already signed up to it (one guys&#8217;s a solo dev!) </p></li><li><p>Want to be more technical? Come <a href=\\\"https://discord.gg/zuudFXxg69\\\">join the Factory Discord</a></p><p></p></li></ul><div><hr></div><h3><strong> </strong>&#127760;<strong> </strong>What I&#8217;m consuming</h3><ul><li><p><a href=\\\"https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=3H0ngGU5pbM\\\">The rise of Gamma</a> from &#8220;dumbest idea I&#8217;ve heard&#8221; to $100M ARR. (Luckily, I didn&#8217;t think it was a dumb idea and wrote a check in 2022 as a a16z scout - who led their last round)</p></li><li><p><a href=\\\"https://www.interconnects.ai/p/why-ai-writing-is-mid\\\">Why AI writing is mid</a>.</p></li><li><p>How we made sandboxed coding agents <a href=\\\"https://imbue.com/product/containers/\\\">10x faster to start</a>.</p></li><li><p><a href=\\\"https://www.gleech.org/paper\\\">The state of Chinese LLMs</a> - supposedly frontier performance, supposedly huge shadow adoption, all under massive compute constraints.</p></li><li><p>How <a href=\\\"https://claude.com/blog/building-companies-with-claude-code\\\">three YC startups</a> built their companies with Claude Code.</p></li><li><p>Benchmarks should focus on <a href=\\\"https://x.com/emollick/status/1990076061254668403\\\">agentic work</a> and <a href=\\\"https://x.com/emollick/status/1990239544164470793\\\">brittleness</a>, and why this new one isn&#8217;t a good measure for <a href=\\\"https://x.com/emollick/status/1990475648662708538\\\">hallucination</a>.</p></li></ul><div><hr></div><h3>&#9881;&#65039; Tools and demos</h3><ul><li><p><strong>Voice agents fail</strong> in noisy, multi-speaker environments. Speechmatics voice API doesn&#8217;t. <strong><a href=\\\"https://www.speechmatics.com/best-ears-in-ai?utm_source=bens-bites&amp;utm_medium=paid-media&amp;utm_campaign=voice-ai-agents-speaker&amp;utm_content=newsletter\\\">Build with $200 free credits &#128072;</a></strong>*</p></li><li><p><a href=\\\"https://elevenlabs.io/image-video\\\">ElevenLabs Image &amp; Video</a> - Generate visual content with the best models (like Veo, Sora and more, then add voices and sound effects in one place.</p></li><li><p><a href=\\\"https://blog.google/technology/google-labs/notebooklm-deep-research-file-types/\\\">NotebookLM</a> also has a Deep Research mode now, with support to bring your own sources.</p></li><li><p><a href=\\\"https://www.react-grab.com/\\\">React Grab</a> - Select elements and edit with Cursor/Claude Code.</p></li><li><p><a href=\\\"https://researchoor.com/\\\">Researchoor</a> - AI-powered social listicle builder.</p></li><li><p><a href=\\\"https://www.typeless.com/\\\">Typeless</a> - Convert spoken voice into polished writing.</p></li></ul><div><hr></div><h3>&#129379; Dev dish</h3><ul><li><p><a href=\\\"https://github.com/coderabbitai/git-worktree-runner\\\">git-worktree-runner</a> by CodeRabbit - A CLI tool for managing git worktrees with ease.</p></li><li><p><a href=\\\"https://x.com/pontusab/status/1990089988898214133\\\">ai-sdk-tools/ocr</a> - Extract structured data from invoices &amp;amp; receipts with one line of code.</p></li><li><p><a href=\\\"https://github.com/steipete/agent-scripts/blob/35355d0d3bae68b7e047e1f3e77804dba05a104e/scripts/browser-tools.ts\\\">browser-tools</a> - A tiny script that can do most of what chrome-devtools MCP can.</p></li><li><p><a href=\\\"https://github.com/steipete/oracle\\\">Oracle</a> - bundle a prompt plus the right files and hand them to GPT-5 Pro when you&#8217;re stuck.</p></li></ul><div><hr></div><h3>&#129497; AI experts you can hire</h3><p>ICYMI, we built a <a href=\\\"https://experts.bensbites.com/\\\">platform to hire the best AI experts</a> for your projects. Here are a few of them:</p><ul><li><p><a href=\\\"https://experts.bensbites.com/developer/ab577499-055a-4547-8e55-054b615aacce\\\">Chris Hennigfeld</a></p></li><li><p><a href=\\\"https://experts.bensbites.com/developer/6c2a1421-de7c-4e26-aa65-67fe451759e0\\\">Tommy Wu</a></p></li><li><p><a href=\\\"https://experts.bensbites.com/developer/68678bed-b36e-4025-8723-3cd5fa8a145a\\\">Alexandra Zubko</a></p></li><li><p><a href=\\\"https://experts.bensbites.com/developer/05f9a4eb-8dd3-4aa1-96e9-cf9e0c6e03ba\\\">Mar&#237;a Kolodynski</a></p></li><li><p><a href=\\\"https://experts.bensbites.com/developer/0e3e1ce9-1d1e-4bdc-9b7a-aff85bea27ea\\\">Nick Winder</a></p></li><li><p><a href=\\\"https://experts.bensbites.com/developer/4fa02a77-9f6d-4ccb-876a-f206c72b2eda\\\">Jens jk</a></p></li><li><p><a href=\\\"https://experts.bensbites.com/developer/70aeecde-c41c-4f5b-8e11-7c3df1ba6198\\\">Alexander Orlov</a></p></li></ul><p>If you&#8217;re a company needing AI projects built, you can post jobs and connect with the right people. We&#8217;ll be trialling a personalised matching service soon too.</p><div><hr></div><h3>&#127846; Afters</h3><ul><li><p><a href=\\\"https://replicate.com/blog/replicate-cloudflare\\\">Cloudflare has acquired Replicate</a>, which gives developers an easy API to build on top of open-weights models (primarily media generation).</p></li><li><p><a href=\\\"https://deepmind.google/blog/sima-2-an-agent-that-plays-reasons-and-learns-with-you-in-virtual-3d-worlds\\\">SIMA 2 from Google</a> - Agent that plays, reasons, and learns with you in virtual 3D worlds.</p></li><li><p>Jeff Bezos is starting a new &#8220;<a href=\\\"https://www.nytimes.com/2025/11/17/technology/bezos-project-prometheus.html\\\">AI for manufacturing</a>&#8221; company with $6.2B of funding and himself as co-CEO.</p></li><li><p>OpenAI is allowing employees to <a href=\\\"https://www.theverge.com/ai-artificial-intelligence/822496/openai-employee-equity-donation-charity-rounds-share-valuation\\\">donate equity to charity</a>.</p></li></ul><div><hr></div><div class=\\\"captioned-button-wrap\\\" data-attrs=\\\"{&quot;url&quot;:&quot;https://www.bensbites.com/p/group-chats-with-ai?utm_source=substack&utm_medium=email&utm_content=share&action=share&quot;,&quot;text&quot;:&quot;Share&quot;}\\\" data-component-name=\\\"CaptionedButtonToDOM\\\"><div class=\\\"preamble\\\"><p class=\\\"cta-caption\\\">Enjoy this newsletter? Updates, tool reviews, and lay of the land from an exited founder turned investor and forever tinkerer.</em></p><p class=\\\"button-wrapper\\\" data-attrs=\\\"{&quot;url&quot;:&quot;https://www.bensbites.com/subscribe?&quot;,&quot;text&quot;:&quot;Subscribe now&quot;,&quot;action&quot;:null,&quot;class&quot;:null}\\\" data-component-name=\\\"ButtonCreateButton\\\"><a class=\\\"button primary\\\" href=\\\"https://www.bensbites.com/subscribe?\\\"><span>Subscribe now</span></a></p><div><hr></div><p>Hey folks,</p><p><strong><a href=\\\"https://openai.com/index/gpt-5-1/\\\">GPT-5.1 is out</a></strong>&#8212;only in ChatGPT for now, API access is coming soon. We get two new models: GPT-5.1-Thinking and GPT-5.1-Instant (which can also think if needed, but just a little). The focus is on two things: vibes and safety, not smartness. OpenAI claims it has better vibes than 4o when chatting, and it&#8217;s safer than GPT-5. ChatGPT is also getting new default personalities that you can pick from. Here&#8217;s <a href=\\\"https://x.com/emollick/status/1988829651368575282\\\">how they all respond</a> to <a href=\\\"https://x.com/omooretweets/status/1988815530132992392\\\">the same question</a>.</p><p>This year, we have seen a bunch of research previews that generate navigational environments from images/prompts. <strong><a href=\\\"https://www.worldlabs.ai/blog/marble-world-model\\\">Marble by World Labs</a></strong> is another one on the list. It&#8217;s not interactive like some others, but it&#8217;s available to use as a product, and I&#8217;m really impressed by the quality. </p><blockquote><p>Realistic video was one of the key trends in 2025 (a noticable improvement from 2024&#8217;s &#8220;still looks weird/fake&#8221; videos). We&#8217;ll see a lot of these realistic/interactive worlds next year with likely a lot more interest in VR headsets&#8212;Samsung just launched one couple weeks ago, Steam is also launching one for games next year.</p><p>- Keshav</p></blockquote><p>ElevenLabs has a new speech-to-text model - <strong><a href=\\\"https://x.com/elevenlabsio/status/1988282248445976987\\\">Scribe v2</a></strong>. It&#8217;s better than Gemini 2.5 Flash in accuracy and latency. They also released an option to <a href=\\\"https://elevenlabs.io/iconic-marketplace\\\">license Iconic Voices</a> (like Dr Maya Angelou and Sir Michael Caine). ElevenLabs is one of the few companies in the AI x Creatives space that&#8217;s not alienating the existing talent in their business.</p><p>Anthropic is also <a href=\\\"https://www.anthropic.com/news/anthropic-invests-50-billion-in-american-ai-infrastructure\\\">building data centres</a> now with a $50B investement, starting from Texas and New York. In the meantime, they are letting software engineers (who know nothing about robotics) <a href=\\\"https://www.anthropic.com/research/project-fetch-robot-dog\\\">teach robot dogs to play fetch</a>.</p><p><strong>Eliminate AI anxiety. Build with confidence.</strong> AI agents are the future&#8212;but centralized systems create costly risks. With Airia, prototype and orchestrate AI agents securely while creating a resilient, decentralized AI ecosystem for your organization. <strong>Get started today at <a href=\\\"https://airia.com/\\\">airia.com</a></strong>*</p><div><hr></div><h3><strong> </strong>&#127760;<strong> </strong>What I&#8217;m consuming</h3><ul><li><p><a href=\\\"https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=8-boBsWcr5A\\\">Satya Nadella answers hard questions</a> from Dwarkesh and Dylan Patel.</p></li><li><p>AI adopters produced <a href=\\\"https://x.com/emollick/status/1988837620248412406\\\">39% more code merges</a>, with no sign of a decrease in quality.</p></li><li><p><a href=\\\"https://ibelick.com/ai-glossary\\\">AI glossary</a> - Simple definitions for key AI terms with visualisations.</p></li><li><p>How to improve <a href=\\\"https://www.claude.com/blog/improving-frontend-design-through-skills\\\">Claude&#8217;s frontend design</a> outputs using Skills.</p></li><li><p><a href=\\\"https://x.com/tomosman/status/1988572722335469969\\\">Building a Character AI clone</a> with Google AI Studio in 50 minutes.</p></li><li><p><strong>Multi-agent systems</strong> can handle more complex tasks, but are they worth navigating dozens of moving parts and infra costs that add up fast? Yep, if you&#8217;ve got a guide to follow. The team at Galileo has compiled just that, proven tips to simplify the process, and <a href=\\\"https://galileo.ai/mastering-multi-agent-systems?utm_medium=paid&amp;utm_source=bens_bites&amp;utm_campaign=sponsorship\\\">they&#8217;re giving it away for free.</a>*</p></li></ul><div strategy</p></li><li><p><strong><a href=\\\"https://x.com/daraladje/status/1988663003592683843\\\">Delphi</a></strong> - Create a digital version of you, just by being interviewed.</p></li><li><p>LM Arena has a new <strong><a href=\\\"https://news.lmarena.ai/code-arena/\\\">Code Arena</a></strong> to test how models plan, scaffold, debug, and build real web apps step-by-step. <a href=\\\"https://lmarena.ai/?chat-modality=code\\\">Try it here</a> or check out the leaderboard:</p></li></ul><div class=\\\"captioned-image-container\\\"><figure><a class=\\\"image-link image2 href=\\\"https://github.com/anthropics/claude-agent-sdk-demos/tree/main/research-agent\\\">deep research demo</a> using Claude Agents SDK.</p></li><li><p><a href=\\\"https://github.com/badlogic/pi-mono/tree/main/packages/coding-agent\\\">pi</a> - A radically simple and opinionated coding agent with multi-model support. (<a href=\\\"https://x.com/badlogicgames/status/1988780091447693718\\\">disclaimer</a>)</p></li><li><p><a href=\\\"https://captions.events/\\\">captions.events</a> - An open-source template for broadcasting real-time transcripts.</p></li><li><p><a href=\\\"https://swefficiency.com/\\\">SWE-fficiency</a> - A new eval with 498 optimisation tasks to test if AI models can speed up real GitHub repos on real workloads.</p></li></ul><div><hr></div><h3>&#128176; Who got that bag?</h3><ul><li><p><a href=\\\"https://parallel.ai/blog/series-a\\\">Parallel AI</a> (the web search company by ex-Twitter CEO) raised a $100M series A.</p></li><li><p><a href=\\\"https://www.wisdom.ai/blog/announcing-our-series-a-funding\\\">Wisdom AI</a> has raised a $50M Series A funding for its AI data analyst.</p></li><li><p><a href=\\\"https://x.com/hassaanrza/status/1988666194795331996\\\">Tavus has raised $40M</a> Series B for making <a href=\\\"https://www.tavus.io/pals\\\">PALS</a>.</p></li></ul><div><hr></div><h3>&#127846; Afters</h3><ul><li><p>NYT might still get their hands on <a href=\\\"https://openai.com/index/fighting-nyt-user-privacy-invasion/\\\">20M random ChatGPT chats</a>.</p></li><li><p>Meta released an ASR model that <a href=\\\"https://ai.meta.com/blog/omnilingual-asr-advancing-automatic-speech-recognition/\\\">covers 1600 languages</a> and an <a href=\\\"https://x.com/fb_engineering/status/1987929289401176230\\\">Ads recommendation model</a> inspired by LLM-scale techniques.</p></li></ul><div><hr></div><div class=\\\"captioned-button-wrap\\\" data-attrs=\\\"{&quot;url&quot;:&quot;https://www.bensbites.com/p/when-ai-is-smart-enough?utm_source=substack&utm_medium=email&utm_content=share&action=share&quot;,&quot;text&quot;:&quot;Share&quot;}\\\" data-component-name=\\\"CaptionedButtonToDOM\\\"><div class=\\\"preamble\\\"><p class=\\\"cta-caption\\\">Enjoy this newsletter? Updates, tool reviews, and lay of the land from an exited founder turned investor and forever tinkerer.\\nSubscribe now\\n\\n\\nHey folks,\\nGPT-5.1 is out‚Äîonly in ChatGPT for now, API access is coming soon. We get two new models: GPT-5.1-Thinking and GPT-5.1-Instant (which can also think if needed, but just a little). The focus is on two things: vibes and safety, not smartness. OpenAI claims it has better vibes than 4o when chatting, and it‚Äôs safer than GPT-5. ChatGPT is also getting new default personalities that you can pick from. Here‚Äôs how they all respond to the same question.\\nThis year, we have seen a bunch of research previews that generate navigational environments from images/prompts. Marble by World Labs is another one on the list. It‚Äôs not interactive like some others, but it‚Äôs available to use as a product, and I‚Äôm really impressed by the quality. \\n\\nRealistic video was one of the key trends in 2025 (a noticable improvement from 2024‚Äôs ‚Äústill looks weird/fake‚Äù videos). We‚Äôll see a lot of these realistic/interactive worlds next year with likely a lot more interest in VR headsets‚ÄîSamsung just launched one couple weeks ago, Steam is also launching one for games next year.\\n- Keshav\\n\\nElevenLabs has a new speech-to-text model - Scribe v2. It‚Äôs better than Gemini 2.5 Flash in accuracy and latency. They also released an option to license Iconic Voices (like Dr Maya Angelou and Sir Michael Caine). ElevenLabs is one of the few companies in the AI x Creatives space that‚Äôs not alienating the existing talent in their business.\\nAnthropic is also building data centres now with a $50B investement, starting from Texas and New York. In the meantime, they are letting software engineers (who know nothing about robotics) teach robot dogs to play fetch.\\nEliminate AI anxiety. Build with confidence. AI agents are the future‚Äîbut centralized systems create costly risks. With Airia, prototype and orchestrate AI agents securely while creating a resilient, decentralized AI ecosystem for your organization. Yep, if you‚Äôve got a guide to follow. The team at Galileo has compiled just that, proven tips to simplify the process, and they‚Äôre giving it away for free.*\\n\\n\\n\\n\\n\\n\\n\\n\\n\\n\\n\\n\\n\\n\\n‚öôÔ∏è Tools and demos\\n\\nCData Connect AI ‚Äì Connect any of your data sources to AI for real-time enterprise data connectivity with MCP to make AI work for you.*\\n\\nDeep Research in Gemini now connects to your workspace account, letting you give it access to your Gmail, Drive and more. Both Google Ads & Google Analytics are getting an AI advisor. Plus, Gemini Live can now speak faster or use accents.\\n\\nScribe Optimize - See how work happens in your organisation, identify bottlenecks and get real steps to improve each workflow.\\n\\nProduct Intelligence by Pylon - Turn your customer feedback into a product strategy\\n\\nDelphi - Create a digital version of you, just by being interviewed.\\n\\nLM Arena has a new Code Arena to test how models plan, scaffold, debug, and build real web apps step-by-step. Updates, tool reviews, and lay of the land from an exited founder turned investor and forever tinkerer.</em></p><p class=\\\"button-wrapper\\\" data-attrs=\\\"{&quot;url&quot;:&quot;https://www.bensbites.com/subscribe?&quot;,&quot;text&quot;:&quot;Subscribe now&quot;,&quot;action&quot;:null,&quot;class&quot;:null}\\\" data-component-name=\\\"ButtonCreateButton\\\"><a class=\\\"button primary\\\" href=\\\"https://www.bensbites.com/subscribe?\\\"><span>Subscribe now</span></a></p><div><hr></div><p>Hey folks, </p><p><strong><a href=\\\"https://x.com/OpenAIDevs/status/1986861734619947305\\\">GPT-5-Codex has a mini variant now.</a></strong> It&#8217;s not that far from the big brother on SWE-Bench Verified. The model is only available in Codex CLI and IDE extensions. API is coming soon, though. Codex-mini gives you 4x the mileage of Codex. Also, all paid ChatGPT plans now have double the rate limits for Codex.</p><p><strong><a href=\\\"https://moonshotai.github.io/Kimi-K2/thinking.html\\\">Kimi K2 Thinking</a></strong> is an open-weights model that is now #1 on many benchmarks like HLE &amp; BrowseComp across all models (not just open ones). Kimi models seem to have really great writing taste, while being great at coding tasks and being cheaper.</p><p>So the trend of models that go further continues with two options: closed-source RL-ed models (Composer, SWE-1.5) and huge MoE open models (GLM, MimiMax, etc.)</p><p><strong><a href=\\\"https://blog.replit.com/ai-integrations\\\">Replit now lets you add AI features to your apps</a></strong> with zero extra setup. No need to make developer accounts, get API keys, etc. You can use 300+ models, including Gemini, OpenAI, Claude or even open-weights models from OpenRouter. The AI cost is billed against your credits. Smart move tbh.</p><p>There&#8217;s a new stealth model on OpenRouter named <strong>Polaris Alpha</strong>, which <a href=\\\"https://x.com/sam_paech/status/1986739513407004992\\\">looks a lot like GPT-5.1</a>. I also caught a few leaks for <a href=\\\"https://x.com/rpnickson/status/1987353691167264792\\\">Nano Banana 2</a>, mostly creating realistic images of news channels.</p><p><strong>Eliminate AI anxiety. Build with confidence.</strong> AI agents are the future&#8212;but centralized systems create costly risks. With Airia, prototype and orchestrate AI agents securely while creating a resilient, decentralized AI ecosystem for your organization. <strong>Get started today at <a href=\\\"https://airia.com/\\\">airia.com</a></strong>*</p><p>Droid updates - I&#8217;ve been on a pretty steep slope learning to be a bit of a developer &#128556;. I shipped our <a href=\\\"https://docs.factory.ai/\\\">new docs site</a>, run the <a href=\\\"https://docs.factory.ai/changelog/cli-updates\\\">changelog</a> process, started making <a href=\\\"https://docs.factory.ai/guides/building/droid-exec-tutorial\\\">guides</a> (with help from Ian Nuttall) and lots more. We&#8217;ve got a new (super simple) <a href=\\\"https://docs.factory.ai/cli/configuration/mcp\\\">MCP feature</a> to add/remove/enable and disable MCPs, plus some big new things coming out the next couple of weeks. You can <a href=\\\"https://discord.gg/sGZrcxGh\\\">join the discord</a> to hear about early access &#128064;.</p><div><hr></div><h3><strong> </strong>&#127760;<strong> </strong>What I&#8217;m consuming</h3><ul><li><p>Teach your AI to <a href=\\\"https://every.to/source-code/teach-your-ai-to-think-like-a-senior-engineer\\\">think like a senior engineer</a>.</p></li><li><p>AI progress and <a href=\\\"https://openai.com/index/ai-progress-and-recommendations/\\\">recommendations</a> from OpenAI.</p></li><li><p><a href=\\\"https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=md8D8eNj5JM\\\">Building Cursor Composer</a> with Sasha Rush.</p></li><li><p>Highlights from <a href=\\\"https://blog.usv.com/2025-annual-meeting\\\">USV&#8217;s 2025 Annual Meeting</a> (captured with AI).</p></li><li><p><a </strong><em><strong>the</strong></em><strong> best voices for AI-assistants.</strong> BMW found their voice with Voices&#8211;<a href=\\\"https://www.voices.com/landing/voice-ai-launch?utm_source=bensbites&amp;utm_medium=newsletter&amp;utm_campaign=voiceailaunch\\\">join the product launch</a> on Nov 13, 1pm ET to see how.*</p></li><li><p><strong><a href=\\\"https://deepwiki.com/\\\">DeepWiki</a></strong> - Understand any GitHub repo with navigable and comprehensive docs generated on demand.</p></li><li><p><strong><a href=\\\"https://x.com/hume_ai/status/1986487748832678325\\\">Voice Conversion by Hume</a></strong> - Generate the same pacing, pronunciation, and intonation with one recording across any voice you choose.</p></li><li><p><strong><a href=\\\"https://papiers.ai/\\\">Papiers</a></strong> - A new interface for arXiv papers with mindmaps, children/parents of a paper, X discussion surrounding it and  more.</p></li><li><p><strong><a href=\\\"https://www.ycombinator.com/launches/OnX-parse-apis-for-any-website\\\">Parse</a></strong> - Build an API for any website in minutes, 100x faster than browser using automations.</p></li><li><p><strong><a href=\\\"https://www.vectors.fun/swipe\\\">Swipe by vectors.fun</a> </strong>- A new way to steer image models. Start with a prompt, swipe left/right to steer the model towards what you&#8217;re thinking of. (<a href=\\\"https://x.com/BingBongBrent/status/1986202839669248272\\\">read more</a>)</p></li></ul><div class=\\\"captioned-image-container\\\"><figure><a class=\\\"image-link image2 y2=\\\"14\\\"></line></svg></button></div></div></div></a></figure></div><div><hr></div><h3>&#129379; Dev dish</h3><ul><li><p><a href=\\\"https://parallel.ai/blog/introducing-parallel-search\\\">Parallel&#8217;s new Search API</a> claims the highest accuracy with the lowest cost across a range of benchmarks&#8212;built specifically for agents.</p></li><li><p>Gemini API now has a <a href=\\\"https://blog.google/technology/developers/file-search-gemini-api/\\\">fully managed RAG file search</a> with generous free storage, embedding generation and more.</p></li><li><p><a href=\\\"https://x.com/vercel_dev/status/1986810835738771574\\\">Vercel Sandbox CLI</a> - Create, run, and manage secure, ephemeral Sandbox environments right from your terminal.</p></li><li><p><a href=\\\"https://github.com/steipete/mcporter\\\">MCPorter</a> - Generate a self-contained bun CLI out of any MCP server. (an implementation for the <em>code execution for MCP</em> thesis)</p></li><li><p><a href=\\\"https://github.com/Doriandarko/kimi-writer\\\">Kimi Writer</a> - An autonomous agent powered by the kimi-k2-thinking model for creating novels, books, and short story collections.</p></li><li><p><a href=\\\"https://github.com/alexfazio/cc-trace\\\">cc-trace</a> - A claude skill that lets claude code reverse-engineer itself.</p></li><li><p><a href=\\\"https://jsxtool.com/\\\">jsxtool</a> - An in-browser IDE for building React UIs.</p></li><li><p>A <a href=\\\"https://ui.fredrika.dev/docs\\\">unified diff viewer</a> that parses standard unified diffs and renders them as minimally as possible for React.</p></li></ul><div><hr></div><h3>&#127846; Afters</h3><ul><li><p><a href=\\\"https://x.com/adamdangelo/status/1986492909827596556\\\">Quora has a new mission</a> - grow the world&#8217;s collective intelligence.</p></li><li><p><a href=\\\"https://www.cnbc.com/2025/11/11/softbank-sells-its-entire-stake-in-nvidia-for-5point83-billion.html\\\">SoftBank is repeating history</a> - it has sold its entire stake in Nvidia worth ~$5.8B.</p></li><li><p><a href=\\\"https://www.inceptionlabs.ai/\\\">Inception AI</a> is building diffusion-based LLMs for code and text generation. They <a href=\\\"https://x.com/timt/status/1986457357124276427\\\">just raised $50M</a> led by Menlo Ventures.</p></li><li><p><a href=\\\"https://gamma.app/insights/how-we-built-a-usd100m-business-differently\\\">Gamma</a> has raised its Series B at a $2.1B valuation while being profitable. (I&#8217;m an investor)</p></li></ul><div><hr></div><div class=\\\"captioned-button-wrap\\\" data-attrs=\\\"{&quot;url&quot;:&quot;https://www.bensbites.com/p/models-with-more-mileage?utm_source=substack&utm_medium=email&utm_content=share&action=share&quot;,&quot;text&quot;:&quot;Share&quot;}\\\" data-component-name=\\\"CaptionedButtonToDOM\\\"><div class=\\\"preamble\\\"><p class=\\\"cta-caption\\\">Enjoy this newsletter? Updates, tool reviews, and lay of the land from an exited founder turned investor and forever tinkerer.\\nSubscribe now\\n\\n\\nHey folks, \\nGPT-5-Codex has a mini variant now. It‚Äôs not that far from the big brother on SWE-Bench Verified. The model is only available in Codex CLI and IDE extensions. API is coming soon, though. Codex-mini gives you 4x the mileage of Codex. Also, all paid ChatGPT plans now have double the rate limits for Codex.\\nKimi K2 Thinking is an open-weights model that is now #1 on many benchmarks like HLE & BrowseComp across all models (not just open ones). Kimi models seem to have really great writing taste, while being great at coding tasks and being cheaper.\\nSo the trend of models that go further continues with two options: closed-source RL-ed models (Composer, SWE-1.5) and huge MoE open models (GLM, MimiMax, etc.)\\nReplit now lets you add AI features to your apps with zero extra setup. No need to make developer accounts, get API keys, etc. You can use 300+ models, including Gemini, OpenAI, Claude or even open-weights models from OpenRouter. The AI cost is billed against your credits. Smart move tbh.\\nThere‚Äôs a new stealth model on OpenRouter named Polaris Alpha, which looks a lot like GPT-5.1. I also caught a few leaks for Nano Banana 2, mostly creating realistic images of news channels.\\nEliminate AI anxiety. Build with confidence. Updates, tool reviews, and lay of the land from an exited founder turned investor and forever tinkerer.</em></p><p class=\\\"button-wrapper\\\" data-attrs=\\\"{&quot;url&quot;:&quot;https://www.bensbites.com/subscribe?&quot;,&quot;text&quot;:&quot;Subscribe now&quot;,&quot;action&quot;:null,&quot;class&quot;:null}\\\" data-component-name=\\\"ButtonCreateButton\\\"><a class=\\\"button primary\\\" href=\\\"https://www.bensbites.com/subscribe?\\\"><span>Subscribe now</span></a></p><div><hr></div><p>Hey folks,</p><p>The Information reports that <a href=\\\"https://www.theinformation.com/articles/anthropic-projects-70-billion-revenue-17-billion-cash-flow-2028\\\">Anthropic aims to be profitable by 2027</a> (vs OpenAI&#8217;s goal of 2030). It is also aiming at $70B revenue in 2028, not too far from OpenAI&#8217;s $100B projection. Claude Code alone is already at a $1B annualised run rate. Saw a chart the other day for <a href=\\\"https://menlovc.com/perspective/2025-mid-year-llm-market-update/\\\">enterprise API use</a> and more companies now use Anthropic&#8217;s APIs vs OpenAI&#8217;s.</p><div class=\\\"captioned-image-container\\\"><figure><a class=\\\"image-link image2 is-viewable-img\\\" target=\\\"_blank\\\" href=\\\"https://substackcdn.com/image/fetch/$s_!VF5L!,f_auto,q_auto:good,fl_progressive:steep/https%3A%2F%2Fsubstack-post-media.s3.amazonaws.com%2Fpublic%2Fimages%2Fedd7ac5a-fa4d-40ed-b1e3-31869b8724ee_1234x802.jpeg\\\" data-component-name=\\\"Image2ToDOM\\\"><div class=\\\"image2-inset\\\"><picture><source type=\\\"image/webp\\\" xmlns=\\\"http://www.w3.org/2000/svg\\\" width=\\\"20\\\" height=\\\"20\\\" viewBox=\\\"0 0 24 24\\\" fill=\\\"none\\\" stroke=\\\"currentColor\\\" stroke-width=\\\"2\\\" stroke-linecap=\\\"round\\\" stroke-linejoin=\\\"round\\\" class=\\\"lucide lucide-maximize2 lucide-maximize-2\\\"><polyline points=\\\"15 3 21 3 21 9\\\"></polyline><polyline points=\\\"9 21 3 21 3 15\\\"></polyline><line x1=\\\"21\\\" x2=\\\"14\\\" y1=\\\"3\\\" y2=\\\"10\\\"></line><line x1=\\\"3\\\" x2=\\\"10\\\" y1=\\\"21\\\" y2=\\\"14\\\"></line></svg></button></div></div></div></a></figure></div><p>Apple is reportedly planning to use a custom Gemini model for the new new final v6 7 Siri, with plans to make it live in March next year. <a href=\\\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2025-11-05/apple-plans-to-use-1-2-trillion-parameter-google-gemini-model-to-power-new-siri\\\">Bloomberg released more details</a> on this deal - Apple will pay Google $1B/yr for this, and the model size would be 1.2 trillion parameters. I immediately thought of some chatter about Gemini 2.5 Flash also being a similar size, with too many experts.</p><p>You can now <a href=\\\"https://x.com/OpenAI/status/1986194298971590988\\\">interrupt ChatGPT&#8217;s thinking</a> (eg, in Deep Research or with ChatGPT Pro) and add new context without restarting. Though many people on X shared that they don&#8217;t really use Deep Research now because GPT-5 thinking gives good enough responses much faster.</p><p>Users of both <a href=\\\"https://x.com/OpenAIDevs/status/1986240264390709405\\\">Codex web</a> and <a href=\\\"https://x.com/_catwu/status/1985754411675930775\\\">Claude Code</a> web can get free credits from $200 to $1000, valid for the next two weeks. </p><p>Cognition has a new feature in Windsurf - <strong><a href=\\\"https://cognition.ai/blog/codemaps\\\">Codemaps</a></strong>. These are annotated structured maps of your code that let you understand what&#8217;s going on where. Codemaps come with a code view listing snippets of what code in which file relates to your query, and a diagram view if you want a visual overview. </p><blockquote><p>I&#8217;ve been using a version of the prompt &#8220;show this codebase in the filetree format with functions, methods and files as nodes&#8221; to understand AI written code and it helps a lot when fixing bugs.</p><p>- Keshav</p></blockquote><p>The <a href=\\\"https://x.com/ayushswrites/status/1970900425730617377\\\">CEO of Warp</a> ripped out Salesforce internally and moved entirely to Attio. His logic? &#8220;We need something powerful, easy to use, that makes us want to log in every day as opposed to feeling like a chore.&#8221; No surprise, his sales team was down for the switch. <a href=\\\"https://attio.com/?utm_source=bens_bites&amp;utm_medium=newsletter_sponsorship&amp;utm_campaign=bens_bites-Q4Y25\\\">Are you?</a>*</p><div><hr></div><h3><strong> </strong>&#127760;<strong> </strong>What I&#8217;m consuming</h3><blockquote><p>A little disclaimer: this section now often contains technical topics that I don&#8217;t fully understand yet. I look through them to get a sense of what&#8217;s recent (example: code execution for MCP) or how to go beyond basic &#8220;slap an LLM to a problem&#8221; approaches as I&#8217;m trying to be more technical.</p></blockquote><ul><li><p>Loading available <a href=\\\"https://www.anthropic.com/engineering/code-execution-with-mcp\\\">MCP tools with code execution</a> (vs declaring them all at once).</p></li><li><p>Thoughts by <a href=\\\"https://windowsontheory.org/2025/11/04/thoughts-by-a-non-economist-on-ai-and-economics/\\\">a non-economist on AI</a> and economics.</p></li><li><p><a href=\\\"https://cursor.com/blog/semsearch\\\">Semantic search</a> improves satisfactory code generation rates in Cursor.</p></li><li><p>The case against <a href=\\\"https://blog.voyageai.com/2025/10/22/the-case-against-llms-as-rerankers/\\\">LLMs as rerankers</a>.</p></li><li><p>Making a website to <a href=\\\"https://basecase.vc/blog/streaming-halloween\\\">observe trick-or-treaters</a> and identify their costumes with Gemma 3 on edge.</p></li><li><p><a href=\\\"https://x.com/mattyp/status/1986267305831972995\\\">Concepts matter more</a> than raw code when building with AI.</p></li><li><p>Sam Altman on trust, persuasion, and the <a href=\\\"https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=cuSDy0Rmdks\\\">future of intelligence</a>.</p></li><li><p><a href=\\\"https://x.com/AlexReibman/status/1986138131813290371\\\">Hyper-engineering</a> - Pushing agents to their full potential.</p></li></ul><div><hr></div><h3>&#9881;&#65039; Tools and demos</h3><ul><li><p><strong>Real conversations have noise, accents, crosstalk.</strong> Speechmatics voice API handles it all for real-time voice agents. <strong><a href=\\\"https://www.speechmatics.com/best-ears-in-ai?utm_source=bens-bites&amp;utm_medium=paid-media&amp;utm_campaign=voice-ai-agents-speaker&amp;utm_content=newsletter\\\">Build with $200 free</a> &#9889;</strong>*</p></li><li><p><strong><a href=\\\"https://www.tembo.io/blog/nov-2025-release\\\">Tembo</a></strong> - Unified interface for background coding agents.</p></li><li><p><strong><a href=\\\"https://www.mesa.dev/\\\">Mesa</a></strong> - A multi-agent system to understand your codebase for senior-level code reviews. (<a href=\\\"https://x.com/olvrgln/status/1985742938014695795\\\">demo</a>)</p></li><li><p><strong><a href=\\\"https://runable.com/\\\">Runable</a></strong> - A general agent for slides, websites, podcasts, videos&#8212;everything.</p></li><li><p><strong><a href=\\\"https://www.orgo.ai/\\\">Orgo</a></strong> - Virtual computers for AI agents. Let them create files, browse the web, and install or use any desktop app.</p></li><li><p><strong><a href=\\\"https://edisonscientific.com/articles/announcing-kosmos\\\">Kosmos</a></strong>  - AI scientist by <a href=\\\"https://edisonscientific.com/articles/announcing-edison-scientific\\\">Edison Scientific</a>, a new company building and commercialising AI agents for science.</p></li></ul><div><hr></div><h3>&#129379; Dev dish</h3><ul><li><p><a href=\\\"https://x.com/trychroma/status/1986159615617442014\\\">Chroma Web Sync</a> - Automatically crawl, scrape and ingest web pages directly into Chroma Cloud.</p></li><li><p>Planning what goes in <a href=\\\"https://repoprompt.com/blog/context-over-convenience/\\\">your coding model&#8217;s context</a>.</p></li><li><p><a href=\\\"https://blog.google/technology/developers/gemini-api-structured-outputs/\\\">Structured Outputs in Gemini API</a> now has expanded JSON Schema support with union types, recursive schemas and more. It also maintains property ordering in its outputs.</p></li><li><p><a href=\\\"https://generalistai.com/blog/nov-04-2025-GEN-0\\\">Gen 0 by Generalist AI</a> - A 10B+ foundational model that works across different robots.</p></li><li><p>Anthropic will <a href=\\\"https://www.anthropic.com/research/deprecation-commitments\\\">store the weights</a> for all its models until the company exists. It&#8217;ll also interview every model before taking it offline (i.e. deprecating it).</p></li></ul><div><hr></div><h3>&#128202; Charts you should see</h3><ul><li><p><a href=\\\"https://lmarena.ai/leaderboard/text/expert\\\">LM Arena&#8217;s latest leaderboard</a> tries to cover how humans actually use frontier AI for real work. Read more about their research on <a href=\\\"https://news.lmarena.ai/arena-expert/\\\">building the dataset</a> for this.</p></li></ul><div class=\\\"captioned-image-container\\\"><figure><a Updates, tool reviews, and lay of the land from an exited founder turned investor and forever tinkerer.\\nSubscribe now\\n\\n\\nHey folks,\\nThe Information reports that Anthropic aims to be profitable by 2027 (vs OpenAI‚Äôs goal of 2030). It is also aiming at $70B revenue in 2028, not too far from OpenAI‚Äôs $100B projection. Claude Code alone is already at a $1B annualised run rate. Saw a chart the other day for enterprise API use and more companies now use Anthropic‚Äôs APIs vs OpenAI‚Äôs.\\n\\n\\n\\n\\n\\n\\n\\n\\n\\n\\n\\nApple is reportedly planning to use a custom Gemini model for the new new final v6 7 Siri, with plans to make it live in March next year. Bloomberg released more details on this deal - Apple will pay Google $1B/yr for this, and the model size would be 1.2 trillion parameters. I immediately thought of some chatter about Gemini 2.5 Flash also being a similar size, with too many experts.\\nYou can now interrupt ChatGPT‚Äôs thinking (eg, in Deep Research or with ChatGPT Pro) and add new context without restarting. Though many people on X shared that they don‚Äôt really use Deep Research now because GPT-5 thinking gives good enough responses much faster.\\nUsers of both Codex web and Claude Code web can get free credits from $200 to $1000, valid for the next two weeks. \\nCognition has a new feature in Windsurf - Codemaps. These are annotated structured maps of your code that let you understand what‚Äôs going on where. Codemaps come with a code view listing snippets of what code in which file relates to your query, and a diagram view if you want a visual overview. \\n\\nI‚Äôve been using a version of the prompt ‚Äúshow this codebase in the filetree format with functions, methods and files as nodes‚Äù to understand AI written code and it helps a lot when fixing bugs.\\n- Keshav\\n\\nThe CEO of Warp ripped out Salesforce internally and moved entirely to Attio. His logic? ‚ÄúWe need something powerful, easy to use, that makes us want to log in every day as opposed to feeling like a chore.‚Äù No surprise, his sales team was down for the switch. Are you?*\\n\\n\\n üåê What I‚Äôm consuming\\n\\nA little disclaimer: this section now often contains technical topics that I don‚Äôt fully understand yet. I look through them to get a sense of what‚Äôs recent (example: code execution for MCP) or how to go beyond basic ‚Äúslap an LLM to a problem‚Äù approaches as I‚Äôm trying to be more technical.\\n\\n\\nLoading available MCP tools with code execution (vs declaring them all at once).\\n\\nThoughts by a non-economist on AI and economics.\\n\\nSemantic search improves satisfactory code generation rates in Cursor.\\n\\nThe case against LLMs as rerankers.\\n\\nMaking a website to observe trick-or-treaters and identify their costumes with Gemma 3 on edge.\\n\\nConcepts matter more than raw code when building with AI.\\n\\nSam Altman on trust, persuasion, and the future of intelligence.\\n\\nHyper-engineering - Pushing agents to their full potential.\\n\\n\\n\\n‚öôÔ∏è Tools and demos\\n\\nReal conversations have noise, accents, crosstalk. Speechmatics voice API handles it all for real-time voice agents. Build with $200 free ‚ö°*\\n\\nTembo - Unified interface for background coding agents.\\n\\nMesa - A multi-agent system to understand your codebase for senior-level code reviews. (demo)\\n\\nRunable - A general agent for slides, websites, podcasts, videos‚Äîeverything.\\n\\nOrgo - Virtual computers for AI agents. Let them create files, browse the web, and install or use any desktop app.\\n\\nKosmos  - AI scientist by Edison Scientific, a new company building and commercialising AI agents for science.\\n\\n\\n\\nü•£ Dev dish\\n\\nChroma Web Sync - Automatically crawl, scrape and ingest web pages directly into Chroma Cloud.\\n\\nPlanning what goes in your coding model‚Äôs context.\\n\\nStructured Outputs in Gemini API now has expanded JSON Schema support with union types, recursive schemas and more. It also maintains property ordering in its outputs.\\n\\nGen 0 by Generalist AI - A 10B+ foundational model that works across different robots.\\n\\nAnthropic will store the weights for all its models until the company exists. It‚Äôll also interview every model before taking it offline (i.e. deprecating it).\\n\\n\\n\\nüìä Charts you should see\\n\\nLM Arena‚Äôs latest leaderboard tries to cover how humans actually use frontier AI for real work. Last few slots left for the rest of the year.\",\"enclosure\":{\"url\":\"https://substack-post-media.s3.amazonaws.com/public/images/daa9e78b-0a19-4cd2-a0f7-796873986a1c_2042x1230.png\",\"length\":\"0\",\"type\":\"image/jpeg\"},\"content\":\"Free Codex and Claude Code credits\",\"contentSnippet\":\"Free Codex and Claude Code credits\",\"guid\":\"https://www.bensbites.com/p/profits-matter-even-for-ai-labs\",\"isoDate\":\"2025-11-06T14:05:22.000Z\",\"itunes\":{}},\"pairedItem\":[{\"item\":0}]},{\"json\":{\"title\":\"Buy credits in ChatGPT\",\"link\":\"https://www.bensbites.com/p/buy-credits-in-chatgpt\",\"pubDate\":\"Tue, 04 Nov 2025 14:05:26 GMT\",\"content:encoded\":\"<p><em>The newsletter for the technically curious. Updates, tool reviews, and lay of the land from an exited founder turned investor and forever tinkerer.</em></p><p class=\\\"button-wrapper\\\" data-attrs=\\\"{&quot;url&quot;:&quot;https://www.bensbites.com/subscribe?&quot;,&quot;text&quot;:&quot;Subscribe now&quot;,&quot;action&quot;:null,&quot;class&quot;:null}\\\" data-component-name=\\\"ButtonCreateButton\\\"><a class=\\\"button primary\\\" href=\\\"https://www.bensbites.com/subscribe?\\\"><span>Subscribe now</span></a></p><div><hr></div><p>Hey folks,</p><p>You can now <a href=\\\"https://help.openai.com/en/articles/12642688-using-credits-for-flexible-usage-in-chatgpt-freegopluspro-sora\\\">buy credits</a> on top of your ChatGPT plan to keep using Codex or Sora. You get 1000 credits for $40, and they have a shelf life of 12 months. <a href=\\\"https://x.com/OpenAIDevs/status/1983956896852988014\\\">For Codex</a>, you can expect double the oomph from your Plus plan, but usage on Sora is complicated. </p><p>OpenAI has also signed a <a href=\\\"https://www.aboutamazon.com/news/aws/aws-open-ai-workloads-compute-infrastructure\\\">$38 billion agreement with AWS</a>, launched a new feature called <strong><a href=\\\"https://openai.com/index/introducing-company-knowledge/\\\">Company Knowledge</a></strong> and opened a private beta for <strong><a href=\\\"https://openai.com/index/introducing-aardvark/\\\">AardVark</a></strong>, an agent that finds and fixes security bugs.</p><p>Also, <strong>Ilya Sutskever</strong> gave his testimony for the Musk vs Altman case last month, and it was made public recently. Ilya wrote a 52-page memo to the OpenAI board to dismiss Sam, thought of it for a year, and really didn&#8217;t wanna merge with Anthropic. Here&#8217;s the <a href=\\\"https://storage.courtlistener.com/recap/gov.uscourts.cand.433688/gov.uscourts.cand.433688.340.1.pdf\\\">full transcript</a>.</p><p><strong><a href=\\\"https://www.udio.com/blog/a-new-era\\\">Udio</a></strong>, the music generation tool, has disabled downloads for users. It seems like a part of the deal to <a href=\\\"https://www.billboard.com/pro/ai-music-udio-settles-lawsuit-universal-music-group/\\\">settle its lawsuit</a> with Universal Music Group. UMG is also partnering with Stability AI for <a href=\\\"https://stability.ai/news/universal-music-group-and-stability-ai-announce-strategic-alliance\\\">licensing deals</a>. ps: you might&#8217;ve already seen AI music on YouTube, but it&#8217;s also on the <a href=\\\"https://futurism.com/future-society/billboard-ai-generated-artist-charting-every-week\\\">Billboard charts now</a>.</p><p><strong><a href=\\\"https://blog.google/technology/google-labs/notebooklm-custom-personas-engine-upgrade/\\\">NotebookLM</a></strong><a href=\\\"https://blog.google/technology/google-labs/notebooklm-custom-personas-engine-upgrade/\\\"> shipped some quality upgrades last week</a>. It now uses the full 1M context of Gemini models, allowing 8x longer context window for documents and 6x longer chats. Plus, you can now give each notebook a goal like studying or research, or marketing assistant to tailor its responses. Also, Sundar Pichai shared that Gemini has <a href=\\\"https://x.com/sundarpichai/status/1983627221425156144\\\">over 650M monthly users</a> now.</p><p><strong>MCP servers create a security risk traditional controls weren&#8217;t built for. The cost? AI breaches average $4.5M.</strong> Without fine-grained authorization, they&#8217;re a centralized governance failure waiting to happen. Get the Zero Trust architecture blueprint that secures MCP properly. <a href=\\\"https://solutions.cerbos.dev/zero-trust-for-ai-securing-mcp-servers?utm_campaign=bens_bites_oct_2025&amp;utm_source=newsletter&amp;utm_medium=email&amp;utm_content=&amp;utm_term=\\\">Download the free eBook</a>.*</p><div><hr></div><h3><strong> </strong>&#127760;<strong> </strong>What I&#8217;m consuming</h3><ul><li><p>What if <a href=\\\"https://mariozechner.at/posts/2025-11-02-what-if-you-dont-need-mcp/\\\">you don&#8217;t need MCP</a> at all?</p></li><li><p><a href=\\\"https://docs.google.com/document/d/1HllKKBULFOAe8e780ISuaUbqKAR8KjRc7XTzO69MOcs\\\">The end of cloud inference</a> - everyday intelligence will live on the device you already own.</p></li><li><p>The <a href=\\\"https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=IDSAMqip6ms\\\">secrets of Claude Code</a> from the engineers who built it.</p></li><li><p><a href=\\\"https://x.com/thsottiaux/status/1984465716888944712\\\">Did Codex really get worse</a> over the last few weeks?</p></li><li><p>Inside the data centres that train A.I. and <a href=\\\"https://www.newyorker.com/magazine/2025/11/03/inside-the-data-centers-that-train-ai-and-drain-the-electrical-grid\\\">drain the electrical grid.</a></p></li><li><p><a href=\\\"https://openai.com/index/building-chatgpt-atlas/\\\">How we built OWL</a>, the new architecture behind ChatGPT&#8217;s browser Atlas.</p></li><li><p>Quick recap on <a href=\\\"https://x.com/yoheinakajima/thread/1985136539651948619\\\">where we are with agents.</a></p></li><li><p><a href=\\\"https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=qbvY0dQgSJ4\\\">Al Engineering 101 with Chip Huyen</a> - Have fun while building AI products as a company. (<a href=\\\"https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=qbvY0dQgSJ4\\\">TLDR</a>)</p></li></ul><div id=\\\"youtube2-qbvY0dQgSJ4\\\" class=\\\"youtube-wrap\\\" data-attrs=\\\"{&quot;videoId&quot;:&quot;qbvY0dQgSJ4&quot;,&quot;startTime&quot;:null,&quot;endTime&quot;:null}\\\" data-component-name=\\\"Youtube2ToDOM\\\"><div class=\\\"youtube-inner\\\"><iframe src=\\\"https://www.youtube-nocookie.com/embed/qbvY0dQgSJ4?rel=0&amp;autoplay=0&amp;showinfo=0&amp;enablejsapi=0\\\" frameborder=\\\"0\\\" loading=\\\"lazy\\\" gesture=\\\"media\\\" allow=\\\"autoplay; fullscreen\\\" allowautoplay=\\\"true\\\" allowfullscreen=\\\"true\\\" width=\\\"728\\\" height=\\\"409\\\"></iframe></div></div><div><hr></div><h3>&#9881;&#65039; Tools and demos</h3><ul><li><p><strong><a href=\\\"https://l.newsbang.com/kMJs?af_web_dp=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.newsbang.com%2Fvalue-prop-dark&amp;af_xp=custom&amp;pid=paid_media&amp;c=bensbites_newsletter_nov4&amp;af_dp=newsbang%3A%2F%2Fnmore.solab.ai%2FsharePage%3Ffrom%3D%26newsId%3D%26bangId%3D\\\">NewsBang - Your Smart News Partner</a></strong>. AI insights, tailored deep dives, and early indicators that move markets and policy.*</p></li><li><p><strong><a href=\\\"https://www.firecrawl.dev/blog/the-worlds-best-web-data-api-v25\\\">Firecrawl 2.5</a></strong> - Comprehensive web data API for your AI products.</p></li><li><p><strong><a href=\\\"https://www.perplexity.ai/hub/blog/introducing-perplexity-patents\\\">Perplexity Patents</a></strong> - AI-powered patent search for everyone.</p></li><li><p><strong><a href=\\\"https://narrative.video/\\\">Narrative</a></strong> - Cursor for professional video editors.</p></li><li><p><strong><a href=\\\"https://x.com/cognition/status/1983983151157563762\\\">Devin</a></strong> can now control a computer and create screen recordings for review.</p></li><li><p><strong><a href=\\\"https://x.com/charliebholtz/status/1984659964129132754\\\">Conductor</a></strong>, an app to run multiple Claude Code agents, now also supports Codex.</p></li><li><p><strong><a href=\\\"https://x.com/skirano/status/1983949174635929985\\\">Web Capture in MagicPath</a></strong> - Copy any functional web element from any website, import it into a canvas and edit it&#8212;visually or with AI.</p></li></ul><div><hr></div><h3>&#129379; Dev dish</h3><ul><li><p><a href=\\\"https://github.com/Dicklesworthstone/mcp_agent_mail\\\">Agent mail MCP</a> - Gmail for your coding agents.</p></li><li><p><a href=\\\"https://llmtext.com/\\\">LLMTEXT.com</a> - Turn any llms.txt into a dedicated MCP server.</p></li><li><p><a href=\\\"https://github.com/philschmid/gemini-api-docs-mcp\\\">Gemini Docs MCP server</a> - local stdio server for searching and retrieving Google Gemini API docs.</p></li></ul><div><hr></div><h3>&#128176; Who got that bag?</h3><ul><li><p><strong><a href=\\\"https://appliedcompute.com/\\\">Applied Compute</a></strong> has $80M in funding, focusing on making specialised models with company data for enterprises.</p></li><li><p><strong><a href=\\\"https://www.figma.com/blog/welcome-weavy-to-figma/\\\">Figma has acquired Weavy AI</a></strong> and is turning it into a new product, Figma Weave. Weavy is less than a year old and <a href=\\\"https://www.bensbites.com/p/liquid-glass-blurs-apple-intelligence#:~:text=Weavy%20AI%20%2D%20create%20scalable%20workflows%20for%20professional%20creative%20work.\\\">launched just four months ago</a>. Its core product was the ability to make creative workflows by chaining multiple models for image gen, caption writers, animation/video gen, etc.</p></li></ul><div><hr></div><h3>&#127846; Afters</h3><ul><li><p>Learn how real AI applications are impacting education, marketing &amp; startups at <a href=\\\"https://techequity-ai.org/\\\">TechEquity&#8217;s Ai summit</a> on 7-8 Nov. Ilya wrote a 52-page memo to the OpenAI board to dismiss Sam, thought of it for a year, and really didn‚Äôt wanna merge with Anthropic. Here‚Äôs the full transcript.\\nUdio, the music generation tool, has disabled downloads for users. It seems like a part of the deal to settle its lawsuit with Universal Music Group. UMG is also partnering with Stability AI for licensing deals. ps: you might‚Äôve already seen AI music on YouTube, but it‚Äôs also on the Billboard charts now.\\nNotebookLM shipped some quality upgrades last week. It now uses the full 1M context of Gemini models, allowing 8x longer context window for documents and 6x longer chats. Plus, you can now give each notebook a goal like studying or research, or marketing assistant to tailor its responses. Also, Sundar Pichai shared that Gemini has over 650M monthly users now.\\nMCP servers create a security risk traditional controls weren‚Äôt built for. The cost? AI breaches average $4.5M. Without fine-grained authorization, they‚Äôre a centralized governance failure waiting to happen. Get the Zero Trust architecture blueprint that secures MCP properly. Weavy is less than a year old and launched just four months ago. Its core product was the ability to make creative workflows by chaining multiple models for image gen, caption writers, animation/video gen, etc.\\n\\n\\n\\nüç¶ Afters\\n\\nLearn how real AI applications are impacting education, marketing & startups at TechEquity‚Äôs Ai summit on 7-8 Nov. Last few slots left for the rest of the year.\",\"enclosure\":{\"url\":\"https://substack-post-media.s3.amazonaws.com/public/images/278ae2a9-0066-4df6-936c-62592566352f_1536x1024.png\",\"length\":\"0\",\"type\":\"image/jpeg\"},\"content\":\"courtroom drama, ai music and secret Siri\",\"contentSnippet\":\"courtroom drama, ai music and secret Siri\",\"guid\":\"https://www.bensbites.com/p/buy-credits-in-chatgpt\",\"isoDate\":\"2025-11-04T14:05:26.000Z\",\"itunes\":{}},\"pairedItem\":[{\"item\":0}]},{\"json\":{\"title\":\"Not a wrapper anymore\",\"link\":\"https://www.bensbites.com/p/not-a-wrapper-anymore\",\"pubDate\":\"Thu, 30 Oct 2025 14:37:31 GMT\",\"content:encoded\":\"<p><em>The newsletter for the technically curious. Updates, tool reviews, and lay of the land from an exited founder turned investor and forever tinkerer.</em></p><p class=\\\"button-wrapper\\\" data-attrs=\\\"{&quot;url&quot;:&quot;https://www.bensbites.com/subscribe?&quot;,&quot;text&quot;:&quot;Subscribe now&quot;,&quot;action&quot;:null,&quot;class&quot;:null}\\\" data-component-name=\\\"ButtonCreateButton\\\"><a class=\\\"button primary\\\" href=\\\"https://www.bensbites.com/subscribe?\\\"><span>Subscribe now</span></a></p><div><hr></div><p>Hey folks,</p><p>I&#8217;m <a href=\\\"https://every.to/courses/droid-camp/purchase?source=post_button\\\">hosting a workshop tomorrow</a> with Dan Shipper and Every. We&#8217;ll talk about <strong>what CLIs are and dive into the Factory CLI, Droid</strong>. It&#8217;s aptly called, Droid Camp. Come and join us for an hour of informal demos, q&amp;a and building!</p><p><strong>Cursor and Windsurf both shipped their in-house models.</strong> <a href=\\\"https://cursor.com/blog/2-0\\\">Cursor 2.0</a> came with <strong><a href=\\\"https://cursor.com/blog/composer\\\">Composer-1</a></strong> (and a new agent-first UI). Windsurf also released <strong><a href=\\\"https://cognition.ai/blog/swe-1-5\\\">SWE-1.5</a></strong>. Both are better than Sonnet 4 but worse than Sonnet 4.5/GPT-5 Codex, have insane speeds and are built to perform the best inside their own platforms. </p><p>The Information reported that Anthropic and OpenAI are using <a href=\\\"https://www.theinformation.com/articles/anthropic-openai-using-cognitions-coding-test\\\">Cognition&#8217;s coding tests</a>, and Cursor is also using their internal benchmark (which they say they can&#8217;t make public) to show Composer&#8217;s performance. Simon made them both draw a pelican (<a href=\\\"https://simonwillison.net/2025/Oct/29/cursor-composer/\\\">Composer</a> &#8212; <a href=\\\"https://simonwillison.net/2025/Oct/29/swe-15/\\\">SWE-1.5</a>), and <a href=\\\"https://every.to/vibe-check/vibe-check-cursor-2-0-and-composer-1-alpha\\\">Every feels</a> the IDE in Cursor distracts you from Composer. </p><p>I agree generally. IDEs are the old way, CLIs and these new agent UI&#8217;s are the new way for software engineering (although CLIs are technically old). I didn&#8217;t ever understand &#8216;tab&#8217; (autocomplete) as a &#8216;thing&#8217; - it reminded me of early ChatGPT days where people rushed to build autocomplete for text everywhere. It's fine, but it&#8217;s no leap in function or form.</p><p><strong>OpenAI finished its profit/non-profit reorg</strong>, and Sam Altman posted a <a href=\\\"https://x.com/sama/status/1983584366547829073\\\">tldr</a> of a <a href=\\\"https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ngDCxlZcecw\\\">livestream</a> he did with OpenAI&#8217;s chief scientist. It&#8217;s still pretty long, so here&#8217;s tldr of a tldr:</p><ul><li><p>Already secured 30GW of compute commitments costing $1.4T.</p></li><li><p>Non-profit owns 26% of the for-profit PBC (valued at $500B total), <a href=\\\"https://blogs.microsoft.com/blog/2025/10/28/the-next-chapter-of-the-microsoft-openai-partnership/\\\">Microsoft owns 27%</a> (<em>rumour</em> - OpenAI has plans for <a href=\\\"https://www.reuters.com/business/openai-lays-groundwork-juggernaut-ipo-up-1-trillion-valuation-2025-10-29/\\\">a trillion-dollar IPO</a>)</p></li><li><p>Goals to build an automated &#8220;AI researcher intern&#8221; by Sept 2026, drop the intern by 2028.</p></li></ul><p>That&#8217;s not it, they released two new open-weights models under the name <strong><a href=\\\"https://x.com/openai/status/1983507392374641071?s=12\\\">gpt-oss-safeguard</a></strong>: fine-tunes of the gpt-oss models with both 20B and 120B variants. Also, Sora has a new feature, <strong><a href=\\\"https://x.com/OpenAI/status/1983661036533379486\\\">Character Cameos</a></strong> (put your dog in your videos), and it&#8217;s available in <a href=\\\"https://x.com/OpenAI/status/1983730999482872195\\\">three more countries</a>, with open access for <a href=\\\"https://x.com/OpenAI/status/1983662144437748181\\\">these (different) countries</a> (i.e. no invite code needed).</p><p>The <a href=\\\"https://x.com/ayushswrites/status/1970900425730617377\\\">CEO of Warp</a> ripped out Salesforce internally and moved entirely to Attio. His logic? &#8220;We need something powerful, easy to use that makes us want to log in every day as opposed to feeling like a chore.&#8221; No surprise, his sales team was down for the switch. <a href=\\\"https://attio.com/?utm_source=bens_bites&amp;utm_medium=newsletter_sponsorship&amp;utm_campaign=bens_bites-Q4Y25\\\">Are you?</a></p><div><hr></div><h3><strong> </strong>&#127760;<strong> </strong>What I&#8217;m consuming</h3><ul><li><p><a href=\\\"https://www.speechmatics.com/company/articles-and-news/build-ai-agents-that-understand-who-said-what-livekit?utm_source=bens-bites&amp;utm_medium=paid-media&amp;utm_campaign=voice-ai-agents&amp;utm_content=newsletter\\\">Why AI voice agents fail</a> at multi-speaker conversations &#8211; and how to fix it.</p></li><li><p><a href=\\\"https://www.bain.com/insights/new-diligence-challenge-uncovering-ai-risks-and-opportunities/\\\">New diligence challenge with AI</a> - When a prototype performs better than the company you wanted to acquire.</p></li><li><p><a href=\\\"https://www.goodfire.ai/research/rakuten-sae-probes-for-pii-detection\\\">How Rakuten replaced LLM-as-a-Judge</a> with SAE probes for PII detection (while saving money).</p></li><li><p><a href=\\\"https://x.com/AnthropicAI/status/1983584136972677319\\\">Signs of introspection in LLMs</a> - Can Claude actually recognise its thoughts, or does it just make up explanations when asked about them?</p></li><li><p><a href=\\\"https://claude.ai/public/artifacts/2d8fbe10-b3b8-439f-85de-6c87329e55fe\\\">Cursor 2.0&#8217;s system prompt</a> in an easy-to-explore artifact (hunted by <a href=\\\"https://github.com/elder-plinius/CL4R1T4S/blob/main/CURSOR/Cursor_2.0_Sys_Prompt.txt\\\">elder_plinius</a>). </p></li></ul><div Gateway</a></strong> - Combine AssemblyAI&#8217;s fast &amp; accurate speech models with GPT-5, Claude, and more.</p></li><li><p><strong><a href=\\\"https://www.grammarly.com/blog/company/introducing-new-superhuman\\\">Superhuman Go</a></strong> - Grammarly is renaming itself to Superhuman (they acquired the email company a while ago) and launching an assistant that can connect to your email, docs, company data and of course fix your typos. </p></li><li><p><strong><a href=\\\"https://experience.odyssey.ml/\\\">Odyssey-2</a></strong> - Generate an instant AI video that you can interact with.</p></li><li><p><strong><a href=\\\"https://www.kaizenautomation.com/\\\">Kaizen</a></strong> - Build browser automations and never do a data entry task twice.</p></li><li><p><strong><a href=\\\"https://ariana.dev/\\\">Ariana</a></strong>, not Grande, it&#8217;s another parallel coding agents app. If you&#8217;re planning to make a text-to-app tool, pivot to &#8220;UI for Claude Code&#8221; hah.</p></li><li><p><strong><a href=\\\"https://www.animeleak.com/\\\">Anime Leak</a></strong> - Put funky art in your real
