https://substackcdn.com/image/fetch/$s_!YSRL!,w_1456,c_limit,f_auto,q_auto:good,fl_progressive:steep/https%3A%2F%2Fsubstack-post-media.s3.amazonaws.com%2Fpublic%2Fimages%2F59032412-aa04-4246-a49a-b49f37d8c844_2908x1520.png 1456w\\\" sizes=\\\"100vw\\\" fetchpriority=\\\"high\\\"></picture><div class=\\\"image-link-expand\\\"><div class=\\\"pencraft pc-display-flex pc-gap-8 pc-reset\\\"><button tabindex=\\\"0\\\" type=\\\"button\\\" class=\\\"pencraft pc-reset pencraft icon-container restack-image\\\"><svg xmlns=\\\"http://www.w3.org/2000/svg\\\" width=\\\"20\\\" height=\\\"20\\\" viewBox=\\\"0 0 24 24\\\" fill=\\\"none\\\" stroke=\\\"currentColor\\\" stroke-width=\\\"2\\\" stroke-linecap=\\\"round\\\" stroke-linejoin=\\\"round\\\" class=\\\"lucide lucide-refresh-cw\\\"><path d=\\\"M3 12a9 9 0 0 1 9-9 9.75 9.75 0 0 1 6.74 2.74L21 8\\\"></path><path d=\\\"M21 3v5h-5\\\"></path><path d=\\\"M21 12a9 9 0 0 1-9 9 9.75 9.75 0 0 1-6.74-2.74L3 16\\\"></path><path d=\\\"M8 16H3v5\\\"></path></svg></button><button tabindex=\\\"0\\\" type=\\\"button\\\" class=\\\"pencraft pc-reset pencraft icon-container view-image\\\"><svg xmlns=\\\"http://www.w3.org/2000/svg\\\" width=\\\"20\\\" height=\\\"20\\\" viewBox=\\\"0 0 24 24\\\" fill=\\\"none\\\" stroke=\\\"currentColor\\\" stroke-width=\\\"2\\\" stroke-linecap=\\\"round\\\" stroke-linejoin=\\\"round\\\" class=\\\"lucide lucide-maximize2 lucide-maximize-2\\\"><polyline points=\\\"15 3 21 3 21 9\\\"></polyline><polyline points=\\\"9 21 3 21 3 15\\\"></polyline><line x1=\\\"21\\\" x2=\\\"14\\\" y1=\\\"3\\\" y2=\\\"10\\\"></line><line x1=\\\"3\\\" x2=\\\"10\\\" y1=\\\"21\\\" y2=\\\"14\\\"></line></svg></button></div></div></div></a></figure></div><p><strong>Google released <a href=\\\"https://blog.google/technology/ai/nano-banana-pro/\\\">Nano Banana Pro</a>,</strong> i.e. image generation powered by Gemini 3 Pro. Massive upgrade over already amazing Nano Banana (on top of Gemini 2.5 Flash). It&#8217;s great at text rendering, uses reasoning to think about styles, visual layout and content inside an image.</p><p>Gemini 3 Pro had its charm for a week, but <strong><a href=\\\"https://www.anthropic.com/news/claude-opus-4-5\\\">Claude took it back with Opus 4.5</a></strong>. It&#8217;s the best coding model in the world (crossing 80% on SWE-Bench Verified) and 3x cheaper than previous Opus models. Opus 4.5&#8217;s medium reasoning performs the same as Sonnet 4.5&#8217;s best results while using 76% fewer tokens. So, in real use, sometimes using Opus 4.5 might end up being cheaper. </p><blockquote><p>I&#8217;m working on a web app for a board game. I tested both Gemini 3 Pro and Opus 4.5 on adding multiplayer room creation to it. First, both of these models gave an almost working solution, whereas older models just didn&#8217;t work. Opus was definitely better (and faster) than Gemini, but it still has a few familiar issues. It creates too much duplicate code and very easily falls into the &#8220;you&#8217;re absolutely right&#8221; trap when fixing bugs.</p><p>&#8211; Keshav</p></blockquote><p>Anthropic also released many product updates with this: &#8220;no cutoff&#8221; in long conversations on the Claude app, Claude Code on Desktop, Claude in Chrome and Excel, new tools for <a href=\\\"https://www.anthropic.com/engineering/advanced-tool-use\\\">avoiding the pitfalls of MCP</a> and more.</p><p>OpenAI also released <strong>two major features in ChatGPT: <a href=\\\"https://x.com/nickaturley/status/1991560210326974649\\\">Group Chats</a> and <a href=\\\"https://x.com/OpenAI/status/1993018357432586391\\\">Shopping Research</a>.</strong> Group Chats have a limit of 20 people and still have that beta feel. They were earlier launched in a few countries but are now available globally. Shopping Research is a new mode like Deep Research, powered by a special version of GPT-5 Mini. It promises to find the product on the web for your query, but since it&#8217;s a small model, be wary of inaccuracies in details like pricing, sizes, etc. Both these features are available to free and paid users (except teams/enterprises).</p><p><strong>Hardcoded permissions slowing you down?</strong> As systems grow, hardcoded authorization creates security gaps and dev bottlenecks. This 80-page ebook walks through the <strong>move to externalized authorization</strong> - with frameworks, code samples, and lessons from teams who&#8217;ve made the transition. <a href=\\\"https://solutions.cerbos.dev/how-to-adopt-externalized-authorization?utm_campaign=bens_bites_nov_2025&amp;utm_source=newsletter&amp;utm_medium=email&amp;utm_content=&amp;utm_term=\\\">Download free ebook.</a>*</p><p><a href=\\\"https://x.com/bentossell/status/1991960096864338000?s=20\\\">Factory skills</a> are now live (links to my video)! Skills are essentially instructions + tools to run workflows super easily. I built this browser tool that opens sites, takes actions (clicks, fills in forms etc) and pulls all that back into my chat. I also recently added a DOM picker so i can select elements on a webpage and that code gets sent to the chat so i can identify specific elements to change (instead of saying no not that button, the other blue button)</p><div><hr></div><h3><strong> </strong>&#127760;<strong> </strong>What I&#8217;m consuming</h3><ul><li><p>Why your Voice AI <a href=\\\"https://www.speechmatics.com/company/articles-and-news/voice-ai-doesnt-need-to-be-faster-it-needs-to-read-the-room?utm_source=bens-bites&amp;utm_medium=paid-social&amp;utm_campaign=voice-ai-agents-speaker&amp;utm_content=newsletter\\\">keeps interrupting users</a> (hint: it&#8217;s too fast).*</p></li><li><p>I tested <a href=\\\"https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=t2n1QRjdPMM\\\">Gemini 3.0 Pro inside Droid</a> and Google Antigravity.</p></li><li><p>How a global company lets its employees <a href=\\\"https://www.bensbites.com/p/global-company-lets-employees-build-with-30-llms\\\">build with 30+ LLMs.</a></p></li><li><p>Benedict Evans&#8217; Nov 2025 edition of <a href=\\\"https://www.ben-evans.com/presentations\\\">AI eats the world.</a></p></li><li><p>Why we <a href=\\\"https://www.browserbase.com/blog/chromium-fork-for-ai-automation\\\">forked Chromium</a> for AI automation.</p></li><li><p>How to prompt with Gemini 3 to <a href=\\\"https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=b-kTkak2FKs&amp;t=1s\\\">get the best UIs</a></p></li><li><p>Building an <a href=\\\"https://cdn.openai.com/business-guides-and-resources/building-an-ai-native-engineering-team.pdf\\\">AI native engineering team</a>.</p></li><li><p>A first principles deep dive into <a href=\\\"https://leehanchung.github.io/blogs/2025/10/26/claude-skills-deep-dive/\\\">Claude Agent Skills.</a></p></li><li><p>My read for the weekend is this 35k+ words monster from <span class=\\\"mention-wrap\\\" data-attrs=\\\"{&quot;name&quot;:&quot;Contrary&quot;,&quot;id&quot;:151170839,&quot;type&quot;:&quot;user&quot;,&quot;url&quot;:null,&quot;photo_url&quot;:&quot;https://substack-post-media.s3.amazonaws.com/public/images/1133cb61-6139-4fa2-9990-bdc6f4497319_96x96.jpeg&quot;,&quot;uuid&quot;:&quot;349bc1fa-fff5-484b-991d-dacd7b84a5ab&quot;}\\\" data-component-name=\\\"MentionToDOM\\\"></span> Research covering <a href=\\\"https://research.contrary.com/company/openai\\\">all things OpenAI</a>.</p></li></ul><div><hr></div><h3>&#9881;&#65039; Tools and demos</h3><ul><li><p><strong><a href=\\\"https://yutori.com/blog/introducing-navigator\\\">Navigator</a></strong> by Yutori - SOTA web-navigating agent with its own cloud browser.</p></li><li><p><strong><a href=\\\"https://tubedummies.com/\\\">TubeDummies</a></strong> - Turn any YouTube tutorial into step-by-step interactive learning.</p></li><li><p><strong><a href=\\\"https://paperreview.ai/\\\">paperreview</a></strong> - Get detailed AI feedback on your research paper.</p></li><li><p><strong><a href=\\\"https://parallel.ai/blog/introducing-parallel-extract\\\">Parallel Extract</a></strong> - Get all content from a URL in markdown, either in full detail or in a compressed form for better token efficiency.</p></li><li><p><strong><a href=\\\"https://x.com/Replit/status/1991951303757709664\\\">Replit</a></strong> Agent now integrates with Stripe to help you add payments easily.</p></li><li><p><strong><a href=\\\"https://www.cfosilvia.com/?utm_source=bensbites&amp;utm_medium=newsletter&amp;utm_campaign=sponsorship_oct2025_v1\\\">Silvia</a></strong> &#8211; Your personal AI CFO that tracks every account, models &#8220;what if&#8221; scenarios, and surfaces insights automatically. One place to see and grow your entire net worth.*</p></li></ul><div class=\\\"captioned-image-container\\\"><figure><a class=\\\"image-link image2\\\" target=\\\"_blank\\\" href=\\\"https://github.com/dzhng/claude-agent-server\\\">claude-agent-server</a> - Run Claude Agent (the harness behind Claude Code) in a cloud sandbox and control it via WebSocket.</p></li><li><p><a href=\\\"https://github.com/Kylejeong2/synapse\\\">synapse</a> - Fork chats and go down rabbitholes on things without clogging context (<a href=\\\"https://x.com/kylejeong/status/1992373423310602271\\\">demo</a>).</p></li><li><p><a href=\\\"https://github.com/karpathy/llm-council\\\">llm-council</a> - Send your response to multiple models and let the council choose the best for you.</p></li><li><p>MCP servers might soon power interactive user interfaces for hosts with the new proposal of <a href=\\\"https://blog.modelcontextprotocol.io/posts/2025-11-21-mcp-apps/\\\">MCP Apps</a>.</p></li></ul><div><hr></div><h3>&#127846; Afters</h3><ul><li><p><strong><a href=\\\"https://fandf.co/48hlBfG\\\">Valon is hiring Forward Deployed Engineers</a>.</strong> $130K&#8211;$230K &amp; equity, turning enterprise clients needs into code onsite. NYC/SF/Seattle + travel*</p></li><li><p><a href=\\\"https://openai.com/index/accelerating-science-gpt-5/\\\">OpenAI for Science</a> released their first paper - 13 examples of GPT-5 accelerating scientific research.</p></li><li><p><a href=\\\"https://www.anthropic.com/research/emergent-misalignment-reward-hacking\\\">New Anthropic research</a>: if you teach a model to cheat on coding tasks, it learns other bad behaviours too. But if you frame reward hacking as finding loopholes to patch (vs cheating), this generalisation does not happen.</p></li><li><p>Cline is building <a href=\\\"https://cline.bot/blog/cline-bench-initiative\\\">cline-bench</a> - A real-world open source benchmark for agentic coding. Plus, there&#8217;s a new hard physics benchmark in the market - <a href=\\\"https://critpt.com/\\\">CritPt</a>.</p></li><li><p><a href=\\\"https://grokipedia.com/\\\">Grokipedia</a> accepts proposed edits now, Elon&#8217;s replacing <a href=\\\"https://www.theinformation.com/articles/twins-pushing-elon-musks-plans-replace-x-staff-grok\\\">X&#8217;s content moderation with Grok</a>, Replit and Campus Edu have a new <a href=\\\"https://campus.edu/vibe-coding\\\">8-week vibe-coding course</a>, and a <a href=\\\"https://www.browserbase.com/blog/training-computer-use-models-in-the-real-world-with-microsoft\\\">small model from Microsoft</a> tops computer use charts.</p></li></ul><div><hr></div><div class=\\\"captioned-button-wrap\\\" data-attrs=\\\"{&quot;url&quot;:&quot;https://www.bensbites.com/p/new-opus-is-bananas?utm_source=substack&utm_medium=email&utm_content=share&action=share&quot;,&quot;text&quot;:&quot;Share&quot;}\\\" data-component-name=\\\"CaptionedButtonToDOM\\\"><div class=\\\"preamble\\\"><p class=\\\"cta-caption\\\">Enjoy this newsletter? Updates, tool reviews, and lay of the land from an exited founder turned investor and forever tinkerer.\\nSubscribe now\\n\\n\\nHey folks, today‚Äôs post is packed. \\nEveryone‚Äôs rushing to launch their thing before American Turkey day.\\nI built a social tracker over the weekend, design inspired by Linear so i can rip through all social mentions from X/Github/Reddits/any other feed you like. It‚Äôs open-source so you can copy it and use it for yourself. Here‚Äôs a lil video I recorded of it in action. Built with Factory‚Äôs Droid, Gemini did the initial design pass (which was ok-ish), but trusty Sonnet polished the F out of it. (My first time open-sourcing something I‚Äôm proud of!)\\n\\n\\n\\n\\n\\n\\n\\n\\n\\n\\n\\n\\n\\n\\nGoogle released Nano Banana Pro, i.e. image generation powered by Gemini 3 Pro. Massive upgrade over already amazing Nano Banana (on top of Gemini 2.5 Flash). It‚Äôs great at text rendering, uses reasoning to think about styles, visual layout and content inside an image.\\nGemini 3 Pro had its charm for a week, but Claude took it back with Opus 4.5. It‚Äôs the best coding model in the world (crossing 80% on SWE-Bench Verified) and 3x cheaper than previous Opus models. Opus 4.5‚Äôs medium reasoning performs the same as Sonnet 4.5‚Äôs best results while using 76% fewer tokens. So, in real use, sometimes using Opus 4.5 might end up being cheaper. \\n\\nI‚Äôm working on a web app for a board game. I tested both Gemini 3 Pro and Opus 4.5 on adding multiplayer room creation to it. First, both of these models gave an almost working solution, whereas older models just didn‚Äôt work. Opus was definitely better (and faster) than Gemini, but it still has a few familiar issues. It creates too much duplicate code and very easily falls into the ‚Äúyou‚Äôre absolutely right‚Äù trap when fixing bugs.\\n‚Äì Keshav\\n\\nAnthropic also released many product updates with this: ‚Äúno cutoff‚Äù in long conversations on the Claude app, Claude Code on Desktop, Claude in Chrome and Excel, new tools for avoiding the pitfalls of MCP and more.\\nOpenAI also released two major features in ChatGPT: Group Chats and Shopping Research. Group Chats have a limit of 20 people and still have that beta feel. They were earlier launched in a few countries but are now available globally. Shopping Research is a new mode like Deep Research, powered by a special version of GPT-5 Mini. It promises to find the product on the web for your query, but since it‚Äôs a small model, be wary of inaccuracies in details like pricing, sizes, etc. Both these features are available to free and paid users (except teams/enterprises).\\nHardcoded permissions slowing you down? As systems grow, hardcoded authorization creates security gaps and dev bottlenecks. This 80-page ebook walks through the move to externalized authorization - with frameworks, code samples, and lessons from teams who‚Äôve made the transition. I built this browser tool that opens sites, takes actions (clicks, fills in forms etc) and pulls all that back into my chat. Last few slots left for the rest of the year.\",\"enclosure\":{\"url\":\"https://substack-post-media.s3.amazonaws.com/public/images/77770a93-ddd3-401d-9895-2392a426f866_2816x1536.png\",\"length\":\"0\",\"type\":\"image/jpeg\"},\"content\":\"ChatGPT will go shopping for you\",\"contentSnippet\":\"ChatGPT will go shopping for you\",\"guid\":\"https://www.bensbites.com/p/new-opus-is-bananas\",\"isoDate\":\"2025-11-25T14:10:39.000Z\",\"itunes\":{}},\"pairedItem\":{\"item\":4}},{\"json\":{\"title\":\"Gemini 3 is worth the hype\",\"link\":\"https://www.bensbites.com/p/gemini-3-is-worth-the-hype\",\"pubDate\":\"Thu, 20 Nov 2025 14:02:20 GMT\",\"content:encoded\":\"<p><em>The newsletter for the technically curious. Updates, tool reviews, and lay of the land from an exited founder turned investor and forever tinkerer.</em></p><p class=\\\"button-wrapper\\\" data-attrs=\\\"{&quot;url&quot;:&quot;https://www.bensbites.com/subscribe?&quot;,&quot;text&quot;:&quot;Subscribe now&quot;,&quot;action&quot;:null,&quot;class&quot;:null}\\\" data-component-name=\\\"ButtonCreateButton\\\"><a class=\\\"button primary\\\" href=\\\"https://www.bensbites.com/subscribe?\\\"><span>Subscribe now</span></a></p><div><hr></div><p>Hey folks,</p><p><strong><a href=\\\"https://blog.google/products/gemini/gemini-3/\\\">Gemini 3 Pro is out</a></strong> beating GPT-5.1, Sonnet 4.5 on all benchmarks but one (SWE-Bench Verified). It&#8217;s only slightly smarter than other models, but it is much better at vision. It scores 72.7% on a benchmark for screenshot understanding; the second best is 36.2%. Faster and <a href=\\\"https://blog.google/technology/developers/gemini-3-developers/\\\">slightly expensive</a> than 2.5 Pro.</p><p>My vibe check: it&#8217;s a good model, it&#8217;s eager to commit changes (!!), isn&#8217;t as good as following instructions as Codex (maybe some new prompting quirks needed?) and <a href=\\\"https://x.com/joshwoodward/status/1991363571188658557\\\">definitely</a> good at frontend.</p><p>This launch comes with a <strong>new IDE from Google: <a href=\\\"https://antigravity.google/blog/introducing-google-antigravity\\\">Antigravity</a></strong> (courtesy of acquiring the Windsurf founders). It also has an Agent Manager and a browser for the agent to see/test what it has built. I tried it for a few hours: Tab complete feels very slow, and the agent is over-eager to implement a plan (while in planning mode). The Agent Manager treats extra documents like plans, task lists as separate &#8220;artifacts&#8221; and doesn&#8217;t clutter your codebase. I liked that. It took me a while to get the browser integration working, but once it was set up, it was really nice and fast too vs Atlas.</p><p>In <a href=\\\"https://blog.google/products/gemini/gemini-3-gemini-app/\\\">other stuff</a>, they released Gemini Agent (for ultra subs only), introduced Dynamic UI in chat, teased <a href=\\\"https://blog.google/products/gemini/gemini-3/#gemini-3-deep-think\\\">Gemini 3 Deep Think</a> and rolled it out in Search (<a href=\\\"https://x.com/arkitus/status/1990815142716518654\\\">via AI mode</a>) on day 1.</p><p>They are not done (potentially nano banana 2 today), but neither are OpenAI and xAI. OpenAI released two models: <strong><a href=\\\"https://x.com/_simonsmith/status/1991263744228237604\\\">GPT-5.1 Pro</a></strong> and <strong><a href=\\\"https://openai.com/index/gpt-5-1-codex-max/\\\">GPT-5.1-Codex-Max</a></strong> to follow up on Gemini 3, and xAI has released <strong><a href=\\\"https://x.ai/news/grok-4-1-fast\\\">Grok 4.1 Fast</a></strong>. These three models all look like they&#8217;d do better than Gemini 3 Pro, but only on specific tasks (hard academic problems, code generation and tool calls).</p><p><strong><a href=\\\"https://ai.meta.com/blog/segment-anything-model-3\\\">An underrated release from Meta: SAM 3</a>.</strong> SAM (Segment Anything Model) family of models can take an image/video and create an overlay of any individual or group of objects in it. Meta is <a href=\\\"https://blog.roboflow.com/sam3/\\\">partnering with Roboflow</a> to let people fine-tune SAM on their use cases, and it&#8217;ll use SAM in Instagram&#8217;s video editing app called &#8220;Edits&#8221;.</p><p><strong>One API for All Your Voice AI Workflows.</strong> Stop wasting time juggling voice AI vendors. AssemblyAI combines multilingual Speech-to-Text, speaker diarization, speech understanding &amp; LLMs in one developer-friendly API. Trusted by Granola, Dovetail &amp; Ashby. Free to try, pay-as-you-go. <a href=\\\"https://www.assemblyai.com/build-voice-ai?utm_source=bensbites&amp;utm_medium=newsletter_sponsor&amp;utm_campaign=main&amp;utm_content=voice_ai\\\">Start building voice AI today</a>.*</p><p>I&#8217;ve been talking with TELUS (one of Canada&#8217;s largest telecom companies) this year. They built a platform that allows 70k+ employees pick from over 30 LLMs to build copilots. I chatted with them and <strong><a href=\\\"https://www.bensbites.com/p/global-company-lets-employees-build-with-30-llms\\\">wrote about their story here</a></strong>.</p><div><hr></div><h3><strong> </strong>&#127760;<strong> </strong>What I&#8217;m consuming</h3><ul><li><p>Gemini 3 reviews: <a href=\\\"https://shumer.dev/gemini3review\\\">Matt Shumer</a> &#8212; <a href=\\\"https://simonwillison.net/2025/Nov/18/gemini-3/\\\">Simon Willison</a></p></li><li><p>GPT-5.1-Pro reviews: <a href=\\\"https://shumer.dev/gpt51proreview\\\">Matt Shumer</a> &#8212; <a href=\\\"https://x.com/_simonsmith/status/1991263744228237604\\\">Simon Smith</a></p></li><li><p>How evals drive the next chapter in <a href=\\\"https://openai.com/index/evals-drive-next-chapter-of-ai/\\\">AI for businesses</a>.</p></li><li><p>The impact of <a href=\\\"https://simonlermen.substack.com/p/can-ai-models-be-jailbroken-to-phish\\\">AI scams on elderly people.</a></p></li><li><p><a href=\\\"https://secondthoughts.ai/p/hyperproductivity\\\">Hyperproductivity</a> - An astonishing, exhilarating, exhausting new style of work.</p></li><li><p>LLMs have distinct coding personalities. <strong><a href=\\\"https://fandf.co/4r5PckL\\\">This research</a></strong> (free report, no form fill needed) from Sonar lays out each LLM&#8217;s unique habits, blind spots and risks &#8211; like hidden security flaws, messy code and severe bugs. Useful read for making smarter, safer decisions when coding with AI.*</p></li></ul><div class=\\\"captioned-image-container\\\"><figure><a class=\\\"image-link image2 is-viewable-img\\\" applications with NLX. No coding required, only great ideas. <a href=\\\"http://nlx.ai/platform?utm_source=newsletter&amp;utm_medium=bens_bites&amp;utm_campaign=october_send\\\">Try it for free today.</a>*</p></li><li><p><strong><a href=\\\"https://smithery.ai/chat\\\">Smithery Chat</a></strong> - Chat with artifacts, code mode and 2000+ integrations. (<a href=\\\"https://x.com/kamathematic/status/1991191038216614299\\\">more</a>) </p></li><li><p><strong><a href=\\\"https://www.warp.dev/blog/agents-3-full-terminal-use-plan-code-review-integration\\\">Warp Agents 3.0</a></strong> - Full terminal use, /plan, code review and more integrations.</p></li><li><p><strong><a href=\\\"https://www.emdash.sh/\\\">emdash</a></strong> - Open-source tool to run multiple coding agents in parallel. (<a href=\\\"https://x.com/rabanspiegel/status/1991220598538924097\\\">demo</a>)</p></li><li><p><strong><a href=\\\"https://www.zo.computer/\\\">Zo</a></strong> - Your intelligent cloud computer with all the context.</p></li><li><p><strong><a href=\\\"https://x.com/Replit/status/1990861193733681408\\\">Design mode in Replit</a></strong> - Prototype beautiful UIs fast with Gemini 3 Pro.</p></li></ul><div class=\\\"captioned-image-container\\\"><figure><a class=\\\"image-link image2 is-viewable-img\\\" target=\\\"_blank\\\" valuation</a>, and so are many others: <a href=\\\"https://x.com/gneubig/status/1990847700674490719?s=20\\\">Openhands</a> - 18.8M series A, <a href=\\\"https://lumalabs.ai/blog/news/series-c\\\">Luma Labs</a> - 900M series C, <a href=\\\"https://x.com/askalphaxiv/status/1991147020703195375\\\">AlphaXiv</a> - $7M seed round and <a href=\\\"https://x.com/suno/status/1991177878122148271\\\">Suno</a> - $250M Series C.</p></li><li><p><a href=\\\"https://www.anthropic.com/news/microsoft-nvidia-anthropic-announce-strategic-partnerships\\\">Nvidia and Microsoft</a> are investing up to $10B and $5B in Anthropic.</p></li><li><p><a href=\\\"https://www.theinformation.com/articles/yann-lecun-leave-meta-form-new-ai-startup\\\">Meta confirms Yann LeCun will leave</a> to form a new AI startup at the end of the year.</p></li><li><p>ChatGPT will be <a href=\\\"https://openai.com/index/chatgpt-for-teachers/\\\">free for teachers</a> till June 2027.</p></li></ul><div><hr></div><div Feel free to comment and share your thoughts. &#128075;</p><ul><li><p>Find me on <a href=\\\"https://x.com/bentossell/\\\">X</a>, <a href=\\\"https://www.linkedin.com/in/ben-tossell-70453537/\\\">Linkedin</a>, or <a href=\\\"https://instagram.com/bentossell\\\">Instagram</a></p></li><li><p>Read <a href=\\\"https://bensbites.substack.com/about\\\">about me</a> and Ben&#8217;s Bites</p></li><li><p>&#128247; thumbnail creds: <a href=\\\"https://x.com/Keshavatearth\\\">@keshavatearth</a>,</p></li></ul><blockquote><h6><em>Thanks to today&#8217;s sponsors who made this newsletter possible :)</em></h6><h6><em>AssemblyAI, Sonar and NLX.</em></h6><h6><em>Wanna <a href=\\\"mailto:shanice@bensbites.com\\\">partner with us</a>? Last few slots left for the rest of the year.</em></h6></blockquote><div><hr></div>\",\"content:encodedSnippet\":\"The newsletter for the technically curious. Updates, tool reviews, and lay of the land from an exited founder turned investor and forever tinkerer.\\nSubscribe now\\n\\n\\nHey folks,\\nGemini 3 Pro is out beating GPT-5.1, Sonnet 4.5 on all benchmarks but one (SWE-Bench Verified). It‚Äôs only slightly smarter than other models, but it is much better at vision. It scores 72.7% on a benchmark for screenshot understanding; the second best is 36.2%. Faster and slightly expensive than 2.5 Pro.\\nMy vibe check: it‚Äôs a good model, it‚Äôs eager to commit changes (!!), isn‚Äôt as good as following instructions as Codex (maybe some new prompting quirks needed?) and definitely good at frontend.\\nThis launch comes with a new IDE from Google: Antigravity (courtesy of acquiring the Windsurf founders). It also has an Agent Manager and a browser for the agent to see/test what it has built. I tried it for a few hours: Tab complete feels very slow, and the agent is over-eager to implement a plan (while in planning mode). The Agent Manager treats extra documents like plans, task lists as separate ‚Äúartifacts‚Äù and doesn‚Äôt clutter your codebase. I liked that. It took me a while to get the browser integration working, but once it was set up, it was really nice and fast too vs Atlas.\\nIn other stuff, they released Gemini Agent (for ultra subs only), introduced Dynamic UI in chat, teased Gemini 3 Deep Think and rolled it out in Search (via AI mode) on day 1.\\nThey are not done (potentially nano banana 2 today), but neither are OpenAI and xAI. OpenAI released two models: GPT-5.1 Pro and GPT-5.1-Codex-Max to follow up on Gemini 3, and xAI has released Grok 4.1 Fast. These three models all look like they‚Äôd do better than Gemini 3 Pro, but only on specific tasks (hard academic problems, code generation and tool calls).\\nAn underrated release from Meta: SAM 3. SAM (Segment Anything Model) family of models can take an image/video and create an overlay of any individual or group of objects in it. Meta is partnering with Roboflow to let people fine-tune SAM on their use cases, and it‚Äôll use SAM in Instagram‚Äôs video editing app called ‚ÄúEdits‚Äù.\\nOne API for All Your Voice AI Workflows. Stop wasting time juggling voice AI vendors. AssemblyAI combines multilingual Speech-to-Text, speaker diarization, speech understanding & LLMs in one developer-friendly API. Trusted by Granola, Dovetail & Ashby. Free to try, pay-as-you-go. Start building voice AI today.*\\nI‚Äôve been talking with TELUS (one of Canada‚Äôs largest telecom companies) this year. They built a platform that allows 70k+ employees pick from over 30 LLMs to build copilots. I chatted with them and wrote about their story here.\\n\\n\\n üåê What I‚Äôm consuming\\n\\nGemini 3 reviews: Matt Shumer ‚Äî Simon Willison\\n\\nGPT-5.1-Pro reviews: Matt Shumer ‚Äî Simon Smith\\n\\nHow evals drive the next chapter in AI for businesses.\\n\\nThe impact of AI scams on elderly people.\\n\\nHyperproductivity - An astonishing, exhilarating, exhausting new style of work.\\n\\nLLMs have distinct coding personalities. This research (free report, no form fill needed) from Sonar lays out each LLM‚Äôs unique habits, blind spots and risks ‚Äì like hidden security flaws, messy code and severe bugs. Useful read for making smarter, safer decisions when coding with AI.*\\n\\n\\n\\n\\n\\n\\n\\n\\n\\n\\n\\n\\n\\n\\n‚öôÔ∏è Tools and demos\\n\\nBuild chat, voice and multimodal conversational AI applications with NLX. No coding required, only great ideas. Try it for free today.*\\n\\nSmithery Chat - Chat with artifacts, code mode and 2000+ integrations. (more) \\n\\nWarp Agents 3.0 - Full terminal use, /plan, code review and more integrations.\\n\\nemdash - Open-source tool to run multiple coding agents in parallel. (demo)\\n\\nZo - Your intelligent cloud computer with all the context.\\n\\nDesign mode in Replit - Prototype beautiful UIs fast with Gemini 3 Pro.\\n\\n\\n\\n\\n\\n\\n\\n\\n\\n\\n\\nbuilt with Replit Design by Chris Dunlop\\n\\n\\nüç¶ Afters\\n\\nxAI is raising $15B for a $230B valuation, and so are many others: Openhands - 18.8M series A, Luma Labs - 900M series C, AlphaXiv - $7M seed round and Suno - $250M Series C.\\n\\nNvidia and Microsoft are investing up to $10B and $5B in Anthropic.\\n\\nMeta confirms Yann LeCun will leave to form a new AI startup at the end of the year.\\n\\nChatGPT will be free for teachers till June 2027.\\n\\n\\n\\n\\nEnjoy this newsletter? Last few slots left for the rest of the year.\",\"enclosure\":{\"url\":\"https://substack-post-media.s3.amazonaws.com/public/images/2ef9ebe0-e17f-440a-8207-a2b5d2fb86fd_1452x926.png\",\"length\":\"0\",\"type\":\"image/jpeg\"},\"content\":\"but it's not a clear winner\",\"contentSnippet\":\"but it's not a clear winner\",\"guid\":\"https://www.bensbites.com/p/gemini-3-is-worth-the-hype\",\"isoDate\":\"2025-11-20T14:02:20.000Z\",\"itunes\":{}},\"pairedItem\":{\"item\":5}},{\"json\":{\"creator\":\"Shanice Stewart-Jones\",\"title\":\"How a global company lets its employees build with 30+ LLMs\",\"link\":\"https://www.bensbites.com/p/global-company-lets-employees-build-with-30-llms\",\"pubDate\":\"Wed, 19 Nov 2025 09:56:50 GMT\",\"content:encoded\":\"<p>TELUS is one of Canada&#8217;s largest telecom companies. With more than 100,000 employees globally, it&#8217;s the very definition of an enterprise.</p><p>When it comes to AI, many enterprise companies seem to have the same cookie-cutter approach: deploy GPT-5, add some guardrails, and call it a day.</p><p>Not TELUS. Despite their size and all the complexities that come with enterprise-level ops, this global company is thinking about AI in a totally different way. And I want to share what they&#8217;re doing with you &#8211; I think there&#8217;s a lot to take away from their story.</p><h2>What TELUS is doing with AI, in a nutshell</h2><p>To overcome all the hurdles they faced when trying to integrate AI at a company-wide level, TELUS built its own switchboard-style application that runs dozens of LLMs at the same time.</p><div xmlns=\\\"http://www.w3.org/2000/svg\\\" width=\\\"20\\\" height=\\\"20\\\" viewBox=\\\"0 0 24 24\\\" fill=\\\"none\\\" stroke=\\\"currentColor\\\" stroke-width=\\\"2\\\" stroke-linecap=\\\"round\\\" stroke-linejoin=\\\"round\\\" class=\\\"lucide lucide-maximize2 lucide-maximize-2\\\"><polyline points=\\\"15 3 21 3 21 9\\\"></polyline><polyline points=\\\"9 21 3 21 3 15\\\"></polyline><line x1=\\\"21\\\" x2=\\\"14\\\" y1=\\\"3\\\" y2=\\\"10\\\"></line><line x1=\\\"3\\\" x2=\\\"10\\\" y1=\\\"21\\\" y2=\\\"14\\\"></line></svg></button></div></div></div></a></figure></div><p>It&#8217;s a comprehensive AI application built on these core functions:</p><ul><li><p>Create customisable AI copilots for unlimited problem-solving</p></li><li><p>Base your AI copilots in your organisation&#8217;s distinctive knowledge</p></li><li><p>Manage and monitor it all from a centralised control plane</p></li><li><p>Integrate with external tools to extend knowledge base capabilities and enable agentic AI workflows</p></li></ul><p>And it&#8217;s not limited to basic productivity tasks &#8211; users can tackle virtually any business challenge by selecting models, defining custom instructions, connecting to knowledge bases, and sharing specialised copilots across the organisation.</p><p>They&#8217;ve given it a name &#8211; Fuel iX Copilots &#8211; and it&#8217;s been such a success that they&#8217;ve <a href=\\\"https://www.fuelix.ai/products/copilots?utm_campaign=2025-Q4_fuelix_cross_us_pros_en&amp;utm_medium=third_tofu_awar_article_&amp;utm_source=d_bens&amp;utm_content=telus-customer-story_lm\\\">turned it into a product</a> for other companies.</p><h2>How it works</h2><p>Users can pick from the newest models from Anthropic, OpenAI, and Google. The picker is pre-grouped by provider, so TELUS always points to the newest model release without touching pipelines.</p><p>On the front-end, Fuel iX Copilots is a chat assistant that can be deployed anywhere throughout an org.</p><p>Its primary features include:</p><ul><li><p><strong>Drag-and-drop RAG builder</strong> &#8211; This lets teams upload docs and databases to create an instant private knowledge base.</p></li><li><p><strong>Model marketplace</strong> &#8211; Users can switch between 30+ LLMs with a single toggle.</p></li><li><p><strong>Unified security layer</strong> &#8211; SSO, audit logs, DLP. Prompts are stateless; a session layer keeps conversation &amp; document data continuity inside TELUS while the model forgets everything after it replies. That single session token works across Claude, GPT-54, and Gemini, so compliance is reviewed once &#8211; not for every new model.</p></li><li><p><strong>Central analytics &amp; billing</strong> &#8211; For tracking usage, cost, and ROI per copilot, per model, or per department.</p></li></ul><div class=\\\"captioned-image-container\\\"><figure><a class=\\\"image-link image2 is-viewable-img\\\" target=\\\"_blank\\\" type=\\\"button\\\" class=\\\"pencraft pc-reset pencraft icon-container restack-image\\\"><svg role=\\\"img\\\" style=\\\"height:20px;width:20px\\\" width=\\\"20\\\" height=\\\"20\\\" viewBox=\\\"0 0 20 20\\\" fill=\\\"none\\\" stroke-width=\\\"1.5\\\" stroke=\\\"var(--color-fg-primary)\\\" stroke-linecap=\\\"round\\\" stroke-linejoin=\\\"round\\\" xmlns=\\\"http://www.w3.org/2000/svg\\\"><g><title></title><path d=\\\"M2.53001 7.81595C3.49179 4.73911 6.43281 2.5 9.91173 2.5C13.1684 2.5 15.9537 4.46214 17.0852 7.23684L17.6179 8.67647M17.6179 8.67647L18.5002 4.26471M17.6179 8.67647L13.6473 6.91176M17.4995 12.1841C16.5378 15.2609 13.5967 17.5 10.1178 17.5C6.86118 17.5 4.07589 15.5379 2.94432 12.7632L2.41165 11.3235M2.41165 11.3235L1.5293 15.7353M2.41165 11.3235L6.38224 13.0882\\\"></path></g></svg></button><button tabindex=\\\"0\\\" type=\\\"button\\\" class=\\\"pencraft pc-reset pencraft icon-container view-image\\\"><svg xmlns=\\\"http://www.w3.org/2000/svg\\\" width=\\\"20\\\" height=\\\"20\\\" viewBox=\\\"0 0 24 24\\\" fill=\\\"none\\\" stroke=\\\"currentColor\\\" stroke-width=\\\"2\\\" stroke-linecap=\\\"round\\\" stroke-linejoin=\\\"round\\\" class=\\\"lucide lucide-maximize2 lucide-maximize-2\\\"><polyline points=\\\"15 3 21 3 21 9\\\"></polyline><polyline points=\\\"9 21 3 21 3 15\\\"></polyline><line x1=\\\"21\\\" x2=\\\"14\\\" y1=\\\"3\\\" y2=\\\"10\\\"></line><line x1=\\\"3\\\" x2=\\\"10\\\" y1=\\\"21\\\" y2=\\\"14\\\"></line></svg></button></div></div></div></a></figure></div><h2>Why they built their own thing</h2><p>Enterprise AI implementation is rarely straightforward. Between data governance and the sprawl of operations, many companies end up with fragmented deployments, lacklustre adoption, or clunky tools that solve for legal teams but frustrate everyone else.</p><p>TELUS faced all of that, but instead of pushing ahead with off-the-shelf copilots or waiting for the dust to settle in the LLM space, they created their own solution.</p><p>The Copilots application now gives users access to over thirty LLMs in parallel, so they can:</p><ul><li><p>Upload internal docs and spin up custom copilots quickly</p></li><li><p>Share those copilots with their teams, or keep them private</p></li><li><p>Choose which models to use and apply specific instructions</p></li><li><p>Monitor usage, permissions and compliance in one place</p></li></ul><p>Everyone in the team can build and share AI tools amongst themselves that fit their specific use cases, without waiting for central IT or budget approvals. Translation, research, IT queries, policy lookups, and onboarding help are just some examples.</p><p>It&#8217;s also fully governed by a central control plane, meaning TELUS gets visibility into how teams are using AI, while still enabling decentralised innovation.</p><p>Today, 50,000 TELUS employees use Fuel iX to pick the right model for the job without needing IT to rewrite pipelines or renegotiate pricing. As a company they&#8217;ve saved more than 500k work hours (more than 62,000 working days) so far, and the numbers are improving all the time.</p><h2>Results that prove the platform works</h2><p>Some real examples of how Fuel iX Copilots is saving time and money for companies:</p><ul><li><p><strong>An internal project planning copilot:</strong></p><ul><li><p>Brought timeline estimates down from 3 hours to 90 seconds, saving TELUS $2 million+ in efficiency gains.</p></li></ul></li><li><p><strong>A retail-facing AI tool:</strong></p><ul><li><p>Integrates live product info across 300+ stores and has saved ~$1.4M annually by cutting down interaction time.</p></li></ul></li><li><p><strong>A network engineering assistant, built into Google Chat:</strong></p><ul><li><p>Helped generate 6,000+ ad hoc jobs and has driven $7M+ in OPEX savings.</p></li></ul></li><li><p><strong>A contact centre copilot:</strong></p><ul><li><p>Saves 80,000+ training hours, $1M in OPEX savings, and handles 30,000 customer queries a day.</p></li></ul></li></ul><h2>Bottom-up, not top-down</h2><p>One of the smartest moves TELUS made was letting people play in a safe playground.</p><p>Early on, they launched a <a href=\\\"https://www.linkedin.com/feed/update/urn:li:activity:7320761526028484608/\\\">sandbox environment</a> with open access to generative AI tools for 30,000 employees. Teams could experiment, test ideas, and build their own copilots without needing to be technical.</p><p>That flipped the usual enterprise AI script on its head. Instead of pushing rigid tools onto teams, TELUS watched departments build what they needed from scratch, and only scaled the things that stuck.</p><p>Adoption grew organically with encouragement from leadership. Resistance gave way to curiosity. And that curiosity turned into capability.</p><h2>Lessons to take away</h2><p>If you&#8217;re building AI workflows inside a large org, TELUS has some advice:</p><ul><li><p>Instead of getting locked into one model, use a flexible, multi-LLM platform that can adapt to new tools.</p></li><li><p>Think like a product team &#8211; design a system that people will want to use.</p></li><li><p>Use only straightforward interfaces. A good copilot builder should be as plug and play as a Canva template.</p></li><li><p>Pair flexibility with strong governance. TELUS&#8217;s control plane ensures security and compliance without slowing innovation down.</p></li></ul><p>In a space dominated by proof-of-concepts, piecemeal deployments, and tools not fit for the enterprise, TELUS built a product that actually delivers control and confidence to business level decision makers. Meanwhile, the people doing the work get to do it better and faster.</p><p>And now, they&#8217;re packaging it up and offering it to other enterprises. If it can work at TELUS scale and in highly-regulated environments, it can surely work anywhere.</p>\",\"content:encodedSnippet\":\"TELUS is one of Canada‚Äôs largest telecom companies. With more than 100,000 employees globally, it‚Äôs the very definition of an enterprise.\\nWhen it comes to AI, many enterprise companies seem to have the same cookie-cutter approach: deploy GPT-5, add some guardrails, and call it a day.\\nNot TELUS. Despite their size and all the complexities that come with enterprise-level ops, this global company is thinking about AI in a totally different way. And I want to share what they‚Äôre doing with you ‚Äì I think there‚Äôs a lot to take away from their story.\\nWhat TELUS is doing with AI, in a nutshell\\nTo overcome all the hurdles they faced when trying to integrate AI at a company-wide level, TELUS built its own switchboard-style application that runs dozens of LLMs at the same time.\\n\\n\\n\\n\\n\\n\\n\\n\\n\\n\\n\\nIt‚Äôs a comprehensive AI application built on these core functions:\\n\\nCreate customisable AI copilots for unlimited problem-solving\\n\\nBase your AI copilots in your organisation‚Äôs distinctive knowledge\\n\\nManage and monitor it all from a centralised control plane\\n\\nIntegrate with external tools to extend knowledge base capabilities and enable agentic AI workflows\\n\\nAnd it‚Äôs not limited to basic productivity tasks ‚Äì users can tackle virtually any business challenge by selecting models, defining custom instructions, connecting to knowledge bases, and sharing specialised copilots across the organisation.\\nThey‚Äôve given it a name ‚Äì Fuel iX Copilots ‚Äì and it‚Äôs been such a success that they‚Äôve turned it into a product for other companies.\\nHow it works\\nUsers can pick from the newest models from Anthropic, OpenAI, and Google. The picker is pre-grouped by provider, so TELUS always points to the newest model release without touching pipelines.\\nOn the front-end, Fuel iX Copilots is a chat assistant that can be deployed anywhere throughout an org.\\nIts primary features include:\\n\\nDrag-and-drop RAG builder ‚Äì This lets teams upload docs and databases to create an instant private knowledge base.\\n\\nModel marketplace ‚Äì Users can switch between 30+ LLMs with a single toggle.\\n\\nUnified security layer ‚Äì SSO, audit logs, DLP. Prompts are stateless; a session layer keeps conversation & document data continuity inside TELUS while the model forgets everything after it replies. That single session token works across Claude, GPT-54, and Gemini, so compliance is reviewed once ‚Äì not for every new model.\\n\\nCentral analytics & billing ‚Äì For tracking usage, cost, and ROI per copilot, per model, or per department.\\n\\n\\n\\n\\n\\n\\n\\n\\n\\n\\n\\n\\n\\n\\n\\n\\n\\n\\n\\n\\n\\n\\n\\nWhy they built their own thing\\nEnterprise AI implementation is rarely straightforward. Between data governance and the sprawl of operations, many companies end up with fragmented deployments, lacklustre adoption, or clunky tools that solve for legal teams but frustrate everyone else.\\nTELUS faced all of that, but instead of pushing ahead with off-the-shelf copilots or waiting for the dust to settle in the LLM space, they created their own solution.\\nThe Copilots application now gives users access to over thirty LLMs in parallel, so they can:\\n\\nUpload internal docs and spin up custom copilots quickly\\n\\nShare those copilots with their teams, or keep them private\\n\\nChoose which models to use and apply specific instructions\\n\\nMonitor usage, permissions and compliance in one place\\n\\nEveryone in the team can build and share AI tools amongst themselves that fit their specific use cases, without waiting for central IT or budget approvals. Translation, research, IT queries, policy lookups, and onboarding help are just some examples.\\nIt‚Äôs also fully governed by a central control plane, meaning TELUS gets visibility into how teams are using AI, while still enabling decentralised innovation.\\nToday, 50,000 TELUS employees use Fuel iX to pick the right model for the job without needing IT to rewrite pipelines or renegotiate pricing. As a company they‚Äôve saved more than 500k work hours (more than 62,000 working days) so far, and the numbers are improving all the time.\\nResults that prove the platform works\\nSome real examples of how Fuel iX Copilots is saving time and money for companies:\\n\\nAn internal project planning copilot:\\n\\nBrought timeline estimates down from 3 hours to 90 seconds, saving TELUS $2 million+ in efficiency gains.\\n\\n\\nA retail-facing AI tool:\\n\\nIntegrates live product info across 300+ stores and has saved ~$1.4M annually by cutting down interaction time.\\n\\n\\nA network engineering assistant, built into Google Chat:\\n\\nHelped generate 6,000+ ad hoc jobs and has driven $7M+ in OPEX savings.\\n\\n\\nA contact centre copilot:\\n\\nSaves 80,000+ training hours, $1M in OPEX savings, and handles 30,000 customer queries a day.\\n\\n\\nBottom-up, not top-down\\nOne of the smartest moves TELUS made was letting people play in a safe playground.\\nEarly on, they launched a sandbox environment with open access to generative AI tools for 30,000 employees. Teams could experiment, test ideas, and build their own copilots without needing to be technical.\\nThat flipped the usual enterprise AI script on its head. Instead of pushing rigid tools onto teams, TELUS watched departments build what they needed from scratch, and only scaled the things that stuck.\\nAdoption grew organically with encouragement from leadership. Resistance gave way to curiosity. And that curiosity turned into capability.\\nLessons to take away\\nIf you‚Äôre building AI workflows inside a large org, TELUS has some advice:\\n\\nInstead of getting locked into one model, use a flexible, multi-LLM platform that can adapt to new tools.\\n\\nThink like a product team ‚Äì design a system that people will want to use.\\n\\nUse only straightforward interfaces. A good copilot builder should be as plug and play as a Canva template.\\n\\nPair flexibility with strong governance. TELUS‚Äôs control plane ensures security and compliance without slowing innovation down.\\n\\nIn a space dominated by proof-of-concepts, piecemeal deployments, and tools not fit for the enterprise, TELUS built a product that actually delivers control and confidence to business level decision makers. Meanwhile, the people doing the work get to do it better and faster.\\nAnd now, they‚Äôre packaging it up and offering it to other enterprises. If it can work at TELUS scale and in highly-regulated environments, it can surely work anywhere.\",\"enclosure\":{\"url\":\"https://substackcdn.com/image/fetch/$s_!UtPq!,f_auto,q_auto:good,fl_progressive:steep/https%3A%2F%2Fsubstack-post-media.s3.amazonaws.com%2Fpublic%2Fimages%2F495cbabb-d0bd-4da1-b300-b93331c94654_1600x1401.png\",\"length\":\"0\",\"type\":\"image/jpeg\"},\"dc:creator\":\"Shanice Stewart-Jones\",\"content\":\"A telecom giant&#8217;s not-so-secret AI playground that turned 70,000 employees into copilot builders.\",\"contentSnippet\":\"A telecom giant‚Äôs not-so-secret AI playground that turned 70,000 employees into copilot builders.\",\"guid\":\"https://www.bensbites.com/p/global-company-lets-employees-build-with-30-llms\",\"isoDate\":\"2025-11-19T09:56:50.000Z\",\"itunes\":{}},\"pairedItem\":{\"item\":6}},{\"json\":{\"title\":\"Group chats with AI\",\"link\":\"https://www.bensbites.com/p/group-chats-with-ai\",\"pubDate\":\"Tue, 18 Nov 2025 14:10:38 GMT\",\"content:encoded\":\"<p><em>The newsletter for the technically curious. Updates, tool reviews, and lay of the land from an exited founder turned investor and forever tinkerer.</em></p><p class=\\\"button-wrapper\\\" data-attrs=\\\"{&quot;url&quot;:&quot;https://www.bensbites.com/subscribe?&quot;,&quot;text&quot;:&quot;Subscribe now&quot;,&quot;action&quot;:null,&quot;class&quot;:null}\\\" data-component-name=\\\"ButtonCreateButton\\\"><a class=\\\"button primary\\\" href=\\\"https://www.bensbites.com/subscribe?\\\"><span>Subscribe now</span></a></p><div><hr></div><p>Hey folks,</p><p>While we&#8217;re all waiting for Gemini 3 (probably out when some of you are reading this &#128064;) , <a href=\\\"https://x.ai/news/grok-4-1\\\">Grok 4.1</a> is out. It&#8217;s on <a href=\\\"https://x.com/arena/status/1990530978943787291\\\">top of LM Arena</a>, has good creative writing and comes in two variants - thinking and non-thinking. There are no other &#8220;performance&#8221; benchmarks, but the model safety card mentions that Grok 4.1 has much higher levels of sycophancy (i.e. agreeing with the user) and deception than Grok 4. I tried some basic prompts, and it looks like a decent model, but I don&#8217;t feel like I&#8217;m getting something special to even consider using it regularly. (Like every Grok model tbh)</p><p>OpenAI made GPT-5.1 <a href=\\\"https://openai.com/index/gpt-5-1-for-developers/\\\">available in the API</a> and shared some evals for it. On vibes, I&#8217;m seeing reports of the model being &#8220;extra eager&#8221;, similar to Claude Sonnet 3.7. </p><p>OpenAI is also <a href=\\\"https://openai.com/index/group-chats-in-chatgpt/\\\">piloting a group chat feature in ChatGPT</a> in 4 countries: Japan, New Zealand, South Korea and Taiwan. <a href=\\\"https://poe.com/blog/introducing-group-chat-for-all-poe-users\\\">Poe</a>, the AI chatbot from Quora, released the same feature with groups up to 200 members, including humans and multiple models.</p><p>Anthropic says it stopped a <a href=\\\"https://www.anthropic.com/news/disrupting-AI-espionage\\\">large-scale AI cyberattack</a> (originating from China), open-sourced their <a href=\\\"https://www.anthropic.com/news/political-even-handedness\\\">eval for political bias</a>, and launched a <a href=\\\"https://www.anthropic.com/news/rwandan-government-partnership-ai-education\\\">learning companion</a> with the Govt. of Rwanda. Oh, and the Claude Code team released a pre-built plugin to make it <a href=\\\"https://x.com/trq212/status/1989061937590837678\\\">better at frontend design.</a></p><p><strong><a href=\\\"https://attio.com/?utm_source=bens_bites&amp;utm_medium=newsletter_sponsorship&amp;utm_campaign=bens_bites-Q3Y25\\\">Attio</a></strong> is the AI-native CRM for the next generation of teams. Sync your email and calendar, and Attio instantly builds your CRM&#8212;enriching every company, contact, and interaction with actionable insights in seconds. Join fast growing teams like Granola, Flatfile, Modal, and more. <strong><a href=\\\"https://attio.com/?utm_source=bens_bites&amp;utm_medium=newsletter_sponsorship&amp;utm_campaign=bens_bites-Q3Y25\\\">Start for free today</a>.</strong>*</p><p>Inside Factory</p><ul><li><p>Our CLI now <a href=\\\"https://docs.factory.ai/changelog/cli-updates\\\">supports all Skills</a> - you can import from claude code, plugin support coming this week &#128522;</p></li><li><p>We <a href=\\\"https://docs.factory.ai/changelog/1-10\\\">support Hooks</a> (which I&#8217;ve been <a href=\\\"https://x.com/bentossell/status/1989317209525538988\\\">experimenting</a> with) too</p></li><li><p>We have 5.1, 5.1 Codex, and some of the newest models (with SOTA scores) coming out VERY soon</p></li><li><p>We&#8217;re building a new web product we&#8217;re excited to share soon for early access</p></li><li><p>We launched a $2k/mo plan, which isn&#8217;t as nuts as you&#8217;d expect - its actually a KILLER deal for small teams, and I can tell you that people have already signed up to it (one guys&#8217;s a solo dev!) </p></li><li><p>Want to be more technical? Come <a href=\\\"https://discord.gg/zuudFXxg69\\\">join the Factory Discord</a></p><p></p></li></ul><div><hr></div><h3><strong> </strong>&#127760;<strong> </strong>What I&#8217;m consuming</h3><ul><li><p><a href=\\\"https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=3H0ngGU5pbM\\\">The rise of Gamma</a> from &#8220;dumbest idea I&#8217;ve heard&#8221; to $100M ARR. (Luckily, I didn&#8217;t think it was a dumb idea and wrote a check in 2022 as a a16z scout - who led their last round)</p></li><li><p><a href=\\\"https://www.interconnects.ai/p/why-ai-writing-is-mid\\\">Why AI writing is mid</a>.</p></li><li><p>How we made sandboxed coding agents <a href=\\\"https://imbue.com/product/containers/\\\">10x faster to start</a>.</p></li><li><p><a href=\\\"https://www.gleech.org/paper\\\">The state of Chinese LLMs</a> - supposedly frontier performance, supposedly huge shadow adoption, all under massive compute constraints.</p></li><li><p>How <a href=\\\"https://claude.com/blog/building-companies-with-claude-code\\\">three YC startups</a> built their companies with Claude Code.</p></li><li><p>Benchmarks should focus on <a href=\\\"https://x.com/emollick/status/1990076061254668403\\\">agentic work</a> and <a href=\\\"https://x.com/emollick/status/1990239544164470793\\\">brittleness</a>, and why this new one isn&#8217;t a good measure for <a href=\\\"https://x.com/emollick/status/1990475648662708538\\\">hallucination</a>.</p></li></ul><div><hr></div><h3>&#9881;&#65039; Tools and demos</h3><ul><li><p><strong>Voice agents fail</strong> in noisy, multi-speaker environments. Speechmatics voice API doesn&#8217;t. <strong><a href=\\\"https://www.speechmatics.com/best-ears-in-ai?utm_source=bens-bites&amp;utm_medium=paid-media&amp;utm_campaign=voice-ai-agents-speaker&amp;utm_content=newsletter\\\">Build with $200 free credits &#128072;</a></strong>*</p></li><li><p><a href=\\\"https://elevenlabs.io/image-video\\\">ElevenLabs Image &amp; Video</a> - Generate visual content with the best models (like Veo, Sora and more, then add voices and sound effects in one place.</p></li><li><p><a href=\\\"https://blog.google/technology/google-labs/notebooklm-deep-research-file-types/\\\">NotebookLM</a> also has a Deep Research mode now, with support to bring your own sources.</p></li><li><p><a href=\\\"https://www.react-grab.com/\\\">React Grab</a> - Select elements and edit with Cursor/Claude Code.</p></li><li><p><a href=\\\"https://researchoor.com/\\\">Researchoor</a> - AI-powered social listicle builder.</p></li><li><p><a href=\\\"https://www.typeless.com/\\\">Typeless</a> - Convert spoken voice into polished writing.</p></li></ul><div><hr></div><h3>&#129379; Dev dish</h3><ul><li><p><a href=\\\"https://github.com/coderabbitai/git-worktree-runner\\\">git-worktree-runner</a> by CodeRabbit - A CLI tool for managing git worktrees with ease.</p></li><li><p><a href=\\\"https://x.com/pontusab/status/1990089988898214133\\\">ai-sdk-tools/ocr</a> - Extract structured data from invoices &amp;amp; receipts with one line of code.</p></li><li><p><a href=\\\"https://github.com/steipete/agent-scripts/blob/35355d0d3bae68b7e047e1f3e77804dba05a104e/scripts/browser-tools.ts\\\">browser-tools</a> - A tiny script that can do most of what chrome-devtools MCP can.</p></li><li><p><a href=\\\"https://github.com/steipete/oracle\\\">Oracle</a> - bundle a prompt plus the right files and hand them to GPT-5 Pro when you&#8217;re stuck.</p></li></ul><div><hr></div><h3>&#129497; AI experts you can hire</h3><p>ICYMI, we built a <a href=\\\"https://experts.bensbites.com/\\\">platform to hire the best AI experts</a> for your projects. Here are a few of them:</p><ul><li><p><a href=\\\"https://experts.bensbites.com/developer/ab577499-055a-4547-8e55-054b615aacce\\\">Chris Hennigfeld</a></p></li><li><p><a href=\\\"https://experts.bensbites.com/developer/6c2a1421-de7c-4e26-aa65-67fe451759e0\\\">Tommy Wu</a></p></li><li><p><a href=\\\"https://experts.bensbites.com/developer/68678bed-b36e-4025-8723-3cd5fa8a145a\\\">Alexandra Zubko</a></p></li><li><p><a href=\\\"https://experts.bensbites.com/developer/05f9a4eb-8dd3-4aa1-96e9-cf9e0c6e03ba\\\">Mar&#237;a Kolodynski</a></p></li><li><p><a href=\\\"https://experts.bensbites.com/developer/0e3e1ce9-1d1e-4bdc-9b7a-aff85bea27ea\\\">Nick Winder</a></p></li><li><p><a href=\\\"https://experts.bensbites.com/developer/4fa02a77-9f6d-4ccb-876a-f206c72b2eda\\\">Jens jk</a></p></li><li><p><a href=\\\"https://experts.bensbites.com/developer/70aeecde-c41c-4f5b-8e11-7c3df1ba6198\\\">Alexander Orlov</a></p></li></ul><p>If you&#8217;re a company needing AI projects built, you can post jobs and connect with the right people. We&#8217;ll be trialling a personalised matching service soon too.</p><div><hr></div><h3>&#127846; Afters</h3><ul><li><p><a href=\\\"https://replicate.com/blog/replicate-cloudflare\\\">Cloudflare has acquired Replicate</a>, which gives developers an easy API to build on top of open-weights models (primarily media generation).</p></li><li><p><a href=\\\"https://deepmind.google/blog/sima-2-an-agent-that-plays-reasons-and-learns-with-you-in-virtual-3d-worlds\\\">SIMA 2 from Google</a> - Agent that plays, reasons, and learns with you in virtual 3D worlds.</p></li><li><p>Jeff Bezos is starting a new &#8220;<a href=\\\"https://www.nytimes.com/2025/11/17/technology/bezos-project-prometheus.html\\\">AI for manufacturing</a>&#8221; company with $6.2B of funding and himself as co-CEO.</p></li><li><p>OpenAI is allowing employees to <a href=\\\"https://www.theverge.com/ai-artificial-intelligence/822496/openai-employee-equity-donation-charity-rounds-share-valuation\\\">donate equity to charity</a>.</p></li></ul><div><hr></div><div class=\\\"captioned-button-wrap\\\" data-attrs=\\\"{&quot;url&quot;:&quot;https://www.bensbites.com/p/group-chats-with-ai?utm_source=substack&utm_medium=email&utm_content=share&action=share&quot;,&quot;text&quot;:&quot;Share&quot;}\\\" data-component-name=\\\"CaptionedButtonToDOM\\\"><div class=\\\"preamble\\\"><p class=\\\"cta-caption\\\">Enjoy this newsletter? Forward it to a friend.</p></div><p class=\\\"button-wrapper\\\" data-attrs=\\\"{&quot;url&quot;:&quot;https://www.bensbites.com/p/group-chats-with-ai?utm_source=substack&utm_medium=email&utm_content=share&action=share&quot;,&quot;text&quot;:&quot;Share&quot;}\\\" data-component-name=\\\"ButtonCreateButton\\\"><a class=\\\"button primary\\\" href=\\\"https://www.bensbites.com/p/group-chats-with-ai?utm_source=substack&utm_medium=email&utm_content=share&action=share\\\"><span>Share</span></a></p></div><p>That&#8217;s it for today. Feel free to comment and share your thoughts. &#128075;</p><ul><li><p>Find me on <a href=\\\"https://x.com/bentossell/\\\">X</a>, <a href=\\\"https://www.linkedin.com/in/ben-tossell-70453537/\\\">Linkedin</a>, or <a href=\\\"https://instagram.com/bentossell\\\">Instagram</a></p></li><li><p>Read <a href=\\\"https://bensbites.substack.com/about\\\">about me</a> and Ben&#8217;s Bites</p></li><li><p>&#128247; thumbnail creds: <a href=\\\"https://x.com/Keshavatearth\\\">@keshavatearth</a>,</p></li></ul><blockquote><h6><em>Thanks to today&#8217;s sponsors who made this newsletter possible :)</em></h6><h6><em>Attio and Speechmatics.</em></h6><h6><em>Wanna <a href=\\\"mailto:shanice@bensbites.com\\\">partner with us</a>? It‚Äôs on top of LM Arena, has good creative writing and comes in two variants - thinking and non-thinking. There are no other ‚Äúperformance‚Äù benchmarks, but the model safety card mentions that Grok 4.1 has much higher levels of sycophancy (i.e. agreeing with the user) and deception than Grok 4. I tried some basic prompts, and it looks like a decent model, but I don‚Äôt feel like I‚Äôm getting something special to even consider using it regularly. (Like every Grok model tbh)\\nOpenAI made GPT-5.1 available in the API and shared some evals for it. On vibes, I‚Äôm seeing reports of the model being ‚Äúextra eager‚Äù, similar to Claude Sonnet 3.7. \\nOpenAI is also piloting a group chat feature in ChatGPT in 4 countries: Japan, New Zealand, South Korea and Taiwan. Poe, the AI chatbot from Quora, released the same feature with groups up to 200 members, including humans and multiple models.\\nAnthropic says it stopped a large-scale AI cyberattack (originating from China), open-sourced their eval for political bias, and launched a learning companion with the Govt. of Rwanda. Updates, tool reviews, and lay of the land from an exited founder turned investor and forever tinkerer.</em></p><p class=\\\"button-wrapper\\\" data-attrs=\\\"{&quot;url&quot;:&quot;https://www.bensbites.com/subscribe?&quot;,&quot;text&quot;:&quot;Subscribe now&quot;,&quot;action&quot;:null,&quot;class&quot;:null}\\\" data-component-name=\\\"ButtonCreateButton\\\"><a class=\\\"button primary\\\" href=\\\"https://www.bensbites.com/subscribe?\\\"><span>Subscribe now</span></a></p><div><hr></div><p>Hey folks,</p><p><strong><a href=\\\"https://openai.com/index/gpt-5-1/\\\">GPT-5.1 is out</a></strong>&#8212;only in ChatGPT for now, API access is coming soon. We get two new models: GPT-5.1-Thinking and GPT-5.1-Instant (which can also think if needed, but just a little). The focus is on two things: vibes and safety, not smartness. OpenAI claims it has better vibes than 4o when chatting, and it&#8217;s safer than GPT-5. ChatGPT is also getting new default personalities that you can pick from. Here&#8217;s <a href=\\\"https://x.com/emollick/status/1988829651368575282\\\">how they all respond</a> to <a href=\\\"https://x.com/omooretweets/status/1988815530132992392\\\">the same question</a>.</p><p>This year, we have seen a bunch of research previews that generate navigational environments from images/prompts. <strong><a href=\\\"https://www.worldlabs.ai/blog/marble-world-model\\\">Marble by World Labs</a></strong> is another one on the list. It&#8217;s not interactive like some others, but it&#8217;s available to use as a product, and I&#8217;m really impressed by the quality. </p><blockquote><p>Realistic video was one of the key trends in 2025 (a noticable improvement from 2024&#8217;s &#8220;still looks weird/fake&#8221; videos). We&#8217;ll see a lot of these realistic/interactive worlds next year with likely a lot more interest in VR headsets&#8212;Samsung just launched one couple weeks ago, Steam is also launching one for games next year.</p><p>- Keshav</p></blockquote><p>ElevenLabs has a new speech-to-text model - <strong><a href=\\\"https://x.com/elevenlabsio/status/1988282248445976987\\\">Scribe v2</a></strong>. It&#8217;s better than Gemini 2.5 Flash in accuracy and latency. They also released an option to <a href=\\\"https://elevenlabs.io/iconic-marketplace\\\">license Iconic Voices</a> (like Dr Maya Angelou and Sir Michael Caine). ElevenLabs is one of the few companies in the AI x Creatives space that&#8217;s not alienating the existing talent in their business.</p><p>Anthropic is also <a href=\\\"https://www.anthropic.com/news/anthropic-invests-50-billion-in-american-ai-infrastructure\\\">building data centres</a> now with a $50B investement, starting from Texas and New York. In the meantime, they are letting software engineers (who know nothing about robotics) <a href=\\\"https://www.anthropic.com/research/project-fetch-robot-dog\\\">teach robot dogs to play fetch</a>.</p><p><strong>Eliminate AI anxiety. Build with confidence.</strong> AI agents are the future&#8212;but centralized systems create costly risks. With Airia, prototype and orchestrate AI agents securely while creating a resilient, decentralized AI ecosystem for your organization. <strong>Get started today at <a href=\\\"https://airia.com/\\\">airia.com</a></strong>*</p><div><hr></div><h3><strong> </strong>&#127760;<strong> </strong>What I&#8217;m consuming</h3><ul><li><p><a href=\\\"https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=8-boBsWcr5A\\\">Satya Nadella answers hard questions</a> from Dwarkesh and Dylan Patel.</p></li><li><p>AI adopters produced <a href=\\\"https://x.com/emollick/status/1988837620248412406\\\">39% more code merges</a>, with no sign of a decrease in quality.</p></li><li><p><a href=\\\"https://ibelick.com/ai-glossary\\\">AI glossary</a> - Simple definitions for key AI terms with visualisations.</p></li><li><p>How to improve <a href=\\\"https://www.claude.com/blog/improving-frontend-design-through-skills\\\">Claude&#8217;s frontend design</a> outputs using Skills.</p></li><li><p><a href=\\\"https://x.com/tomosman/status/1988572722335469969\\\">Building a Character AI clone</a> with Google AI Studio in 50 minutes.</p></li><li><p><strong>Multi-agent systems</strong> can handle more complex tasks, but are they worth navigating dozens of moving parts and infra costs that add up fast? Yep, if you&#8217;ve got a guide to follow. The team at Galileo has compiled just that, proven tips to simplify the process, and <a href=\\\"https://galileo.ai/mastering-multi-agent-systems?utm_medium=paid&amp;utm_source=bens_bites&amp;utm_campaign=sponsorship\\\">they&#8217;re giving it away for free.</a>*</p></li></ul><div href=\\\"https://github.com/anthropics/claude-agent-sdk-demos/tree/main/research-agent\\\">deep research demo</a> using Claude Agents SDK.</p></li><li><p><a href=\\\"https://github.com/badlogic/pi-mono/tree/main/packages/coding-agent\\\">pi</a> - A radically simple and opinionated coding agent with multi-model support. (<a href=\\\"https://x.com/badlogicgames/status/1988780091447693718\\\">disclaimer</a>)</p></li><li><p><a href=\\\"https://captions.events/\\\">captions.events</a> - An open-source template for broadcasting real-time transcripts.</p></li><li><p><a href=\\\"https://swefficiency.com/\\\">SWE-fficiency</a> - A new eval with 498 optimisation tasks to test if AI models can speed up real GitHub repos on real workloads.</p></li></ul><div><hr></div><h3>&#128176; Who got that bag?</h3><ul><li><p><a href=\\\"https://parallel.ai/blog/series-a\\\">Parallel AI</a> (the web search company by ex-Twitter CEO) raised a $100M series A.</p></li><li><p><a href=\\\"https://www.wisdom.ai/blog/announcing-our-series-a-funding\\\">Wisdom AI</a> has raised a $50M Series A funding for its AI data analyst.</p></li><li><p><a href=\\\"https://x.com/hassaanrza/status/1988666194795331996\\\">Tavus has raised $40M</a> Series B for making <a href=\\\"https://www.tavus.io/pals\\\">PALS</a>.</p></li></ul><div><hr></div><h3>&#127846; Afters</h3><ul><li><p>NYT might still get their hands on <a href=\\\"https://openai.com/index/fighting-nyt-user-privacy-invasion/\\\">20M random ChatGPT chats</a>.</p></li><li><p>Meta released an ASR model that <a href=\\\"https://ai.meta.com/blog/omnilingual-asr-advancing-automatic-speech-recognition/\\\">covers 1600 languages</a> and an <a href=\\\"https://x.com/fb_engineering/status/1987929289401176230\\\">Ads recommendation model</a> inspired by LLM-scale techniques.</p></li></ul><div><hr></div><div class=\\\"captioned-button-wrap\\\" data-attrs=\\\"{&quot;url&quot;:&quot;https://www.bensbites.com/p/when-ai-is-smart-enough?utm_source=substack&utm_medium=email&utm_content=share&action=share&quot;,&quot;text&quot;:&quot;Share&quot;}\\\" data-component-name=\\\"CaptionedButtonToDOM\\\"><div class=\\\"preamble\\\"><p class=\\\"cta-caption\\\">Enjoy this newsletter? We get two new models: GPT-5.1-Thinking and GPT-5.1-Instant (which can also think if needed, but just a little). The focus is on two things: vibes and safety, not smartness. OpenAI claims it has better vibes than 4o when chatting, and it‚Äôs safer than GPT-5. ChatGPT is also getting new default personalities that you can pick from. Here‚Äôs how they all respond to the same question.\\nThis year, we have seen a bunch of research previews that generate navigational environments from images/prompts. Marble by World Labs is another one on the list. It‚Äôs not interactive like some others, but it‚Äôs available to use as a product, and I‚Äôm really impressed by the quality. \\n\\nRealistic video was one of the key trends in 2025 (a noticable improvement from 2024‚Äôs ‚Äústill looks weird/fake‚Äù videos). We‚Äôll see a lot of these realistic/interactive worlds next year with likely a lot more interest in VR headsets‚ÄîSamsung just launched one couple weeks ago, Steam is also launching one for games next year.\\n- Keshav\\n\\nElevenLabs has a new speech-to-text model - Scribe v2. It‚Äôs better than Gemini 2.5 Flash in accuracy and latency. They also released an option to license Iconic Voices (like Dr Maya Angelou and Sir Michael Caine). ElevenLabs is one of the few companies in the AI x Creatives space that‚Äôs not alienating the existing talent in their business.\\nAnthropic is also building data centres now with a $50B investement, starting from Texas and New York. In the meantime, they are letting software engineers (who know nothing about robotics) teach robot dogs to play fetch.\\nEliminate AI anxiety. Build with confidence. Yep, if you‚Äôve got a guide to follow. The team at Galileo has compiled just that, proven tips to simplify the process, and they‚Äôre giving it away for free.*\\n\\n\\n\\n\\n\\n\\n\\n\\n\\n\\n\\n\\n\\n\\n‚öôÔ∏è Tools and demos\\n\\nCData Connect AI ‚Äì Connect any of your data sources to AI for real-time enterprise data connectivity with MCP to make AI work for you.*\\n\\nDeep Research in Gemini now connects to your workspace account, letting you give it access to your Gmail, Drive and more. Both Google Ads & Google Analytics are getting an AI advisor. Updates, tool reviews, and lay of the land from an exited founder turned investor and forever tinkerer.</em></p><p class=\\\"button-wrapper\\\" data-attrs=\\\"{&quot;url&quot;:&quot;https://www.bensbites.com/subscribe?&quot;,&quot;text&quot;:&quot;Subscribe now&quot;,&quot;action&quot;:null,&quot;class&quot;:null}\\\" data-component-name=\\\"ButtonCreateButton\\\"><a class=\\\"button primary\\\" href=\\\"https://www.bensbites.com/subscribe?\\\"><span>Subscribe now</span></a></p><div><hr></div><p>Hey folks, </p><p><strong><a href=\\\"https://x.com/OpenAIDevs/status/1986861734619947305\\\">GPT-5-Codex has a mini variant now.</a></strong> It&#8217;s not that far from the big brother on SWE-Bench Verified. The model is only available in Codex CLI and IDE extensions. API is coming soon, though. Codex-mini gives you 4x the mileage of Codex. Also, all paid ChatGPT plans now have double the rate limits for Codex.</p><p><strong><a href=\\\"https://moonshotai.github.io/Kimi-K2/thinking.html\\\">Kimi K2 Thinking</a></strong> is an open-weights model that is now #1 on many benchmarks like HLE &amp; BrowseComp across all models (not just open ones). Kimi models seem to have really great writing taste, while being great at coding tasks and being cheaper.</p><p>So the trend of models that go further continues with two options: closed-source RL-ed models (Composer, SWE-1.5) and huge MoE open models (GLM, MimiMax, etc.)</p><p><strong><a href=\\\"https://blog.replit.com/ai-integrations\\\">Replit now lets you add AI features to your apps</a></strong> with zero extra setup. No need to make developer accounts, get API keys, etc. You can use 300+ models, including Gemini, OpenAI, Claude or even open-weights models from OpenRouter. The AI cost is billed against your credits. Smart move tbh.</p><p>There&#8217;s a new stealth model on OpenRouter named <strong>Polaris Alpha</strong>, which <a href=\\\"https://x.com/sam_paech/status/1986739513407004992\\\">looks a lot like GPT-5.1</a>. I also caught a few leaks for <a href=\\\"https://x.com/rpnickson/status/1987353691167264792\\\">Nano Banana 2</a>, mostly creating realistic images of news channels.</p><p><strong>Eliminate AI anxiety. Build with confidence.</strong> AI agents are the future&#8212;but centralized systems create costly risks. With Airia, prototype and orchestrate AI agents securely while creating a resilient, decentralized AI ecosystem for your organization. <strong>Get started today at <a href=\\\"https://airia.com/\\\">airia.com</a></strong>*</p><p>Droid updates - I&#8217;ve been on a pretty steep slope learning to be a bit of a developer &#128556;. I shipped our <a href=\\\"https://docs.factory.ai/\\\">new docs site</a>, run the <a href=\\\"https://docs.factory.ai/changelog/cli-updates\\\">changelog</a> process, started making <a href=\\\"https://docs.factory.ai/guides/building/droid-exec-tutorial\\\">guides</a> (with help from Ian Nuttall) and lots more. We&#8217;ve got a new (super simple) <a href=\\\"https://docs.factory.ai/cli/configuration/mcp\\\">MCP feature</a> to add/remove/enable and disable MCPs, plus some big new things coming out the next couple of weeks. You can <a href=\\\"https://discord.gg/sGZrcxGh\\\">join the discord</a> to hear about early access &#128064;.</p><div><hr></div><h3><strong> </strong>&#127760;<strong> </strong>What I&#8217;m consuming</h3><ul><li><p>Teach your AI to <a href=\\\"https://every.to/source-code/teach-your-ai-to-think-like-a-senior-engineer\\\">think like a senior engineer</a>.</p></li><li><p>AI progress and <a Composer</a> with Sasha Rush.</p></li><li><p>Highlights from <a href=\\\"https://blog.usv.com/2025-annual-meeting\\\">USV&#8217;s 2025 Annual Meeting</a> (captured with AI).</p></li><li><p><a </strong><em><strong>the</strong></em><strong> best voices for AI-assistants.</strong> BMW found their voice with Voices&#8211;<a href=\\\"https://www.voices.com/landing/voice-ai-launch?utm_source=bensbites&amp;utm_medium=newsletter&amp;utm_campaign=voiceailaunch\\\">join the product launch</a> on Nov 13, 1pm ET to see how.*</p></li><li><p><strong><a href=\\\"https://deepwiki.com/\\\">DeepWiki</a></strong> - Understand any GitHub repo with navigable and comprehensive docs generated on demand.</p></li><li><p><strong><a href=\\\"https://x.com/hume_ai/status/1986487748832678325\\\">Voice Conversion by Hume</a></strong> - Generate the same pacing, pronunciation, and intonation with one recording across any voice you choose.</p></li><li><p><strong><a href=\\\"https://papiers.ai/\\\">Papiers</a></strong> - A new interface for arXiv papers with mindmaps, children/parents of a paper, X discussion surrounding it and  more.</p></li><li><p><strong><a href=\\\"https://www.ycombinator.com/launches/OnX-parse-apis-for-any-website\\\">Parse</a></strong> - Build an API for any website in minutes, 100x faster than browser using automations.</p></li><li><p><strong><a href=\\\"https://www.vectors.fun/swipe\\\">Swipe by vectors.fun</a> </strong>- A new way to steer image models. Start with a prompt, swipe left/right to steer the model towards what you&#8217;re thinking of. (<a href=\\\"https://x.com/BingBongBrent/status/1986202839669248272\\\">read more</a>)</p></li></ul><div class=\\\"captioned-image-container\\\"><figure><a class=\\\"image-link image2 y2=\\\"14\\\"></line></svg></button></div></div></div></a></figure></div><div><hr></div><h3>&#129379; Dev dish</h3><ul><li><p><a href=\\\"https://parallel.ai/blog/introducing-parallel-search\\\">Parallel&#8217;s new Search API</a> claims the highest accuracy with the lowest cost across a range of benchmarks&#8212;built specifically for agents.</p></li><li><p>Gemini API now has a <a href=\\\"https://blog.google/technology/developers/file-search-gemini-api/\\\">fully managed RAG file search</a> with generous free storage, embedding generation and more.</p></li><li><p><a href=\\\"https://x.com/vercel_dev/status/1986810835738771574\\\">Vercel Sandbox CLI</a> - Create, run, and manage secure, ephemeral Sandbox environments right from your terminal.</p></li><li><p><a href=\\\"https://github.com/steipete/mcporter\\\">MCPorter</a> - Generate a self-contained bun CLI out of any MCP server. (an implementation for the <em>code execution for MCP</em> thesis)</p></li><li><p><a href=\\\"https://github.com/Doriandarko/kimi-writer\\\">Kimi Writer</a> - An autonomous agent powered by the kimi-k2-thinking model for creating novels, books, and short story collections.</p></li><li><p><a href=\\\"https://github.com/alexfazio/cc-trace\\\">cc-trace</a> - A claude skill that lets claude code reverse-engineer itself.</p></li><li><p><a href=\\\"https://jsxtool.com/\\\">jsxtool</a> - An in-browser IDE for building React UIs.</p></li><li><p>A <a href=\\\"https://ui.fredrika.dev/docs\\\">unified diff viewer</a> that parses standard unified diffs and renders them as minimally as possible for React.</p></li></ul><div><hr></div><h3>&#127846; Afters</h3><ul><li><p><a href=\\\"https://x.com/adamdangelo/status/1986492909827596556\\\">Quora has a new mission</a> - grow the world&#8217;s collective intelligence.</p></li><li><p><a href=\\\"https://www.cnbc.com/2025/11/11/softbank-sells-its-entire-stake-in-nvidia-for-5point83-billion.html\\\">SoftBank is repeating history</a> - it has sold its entire stake in Nvidia worth ~$5.8B.</p></li><li><p><a href=\\\"https://www.inceptionlabs.ai/\\\">Inception AI</a> is building diffusion-based LLMs for code and text generation. They <a href=\\\"https://x.com/timt/status/1986457357124276427\\\">just raised $50M</a> led by Menlo Ventures.</p></li><li><p><a href=\\\"https://gamma.app/insights/how-we-built-a-usd100m-business-differently\\\">Gamma</a> has raised its Series B at a $2.1B valuation while being profitable. (I&#8217;m an investor)</p></li></ul><div><hr></div><div class=\\\"captioned-button-wrap\\\" data-attrs=\\\"{&quot;url&quot;:&quot;https://www.bensbites.com/p/models-with-more-mileage?utm_source=substack&utm_medium=email&utm_content=share&action=share&quot;,&quot;text&quot;:&quot;Share&quot;}\\\" data-component-name=\\\"CaptionedButtonToDOM\\\"><div class=\\\"preamble\\\"><p class=\\\"cta-caption\\\">Enjoy this newsletter? Updates, tool reviews, and lay of the land from an exited founder turned investor and forever tinkerer.\\nSubscribe now\\n\\n\\nHey folks, \\nGPT-5-Codex has a mini variant now. It‚Äôs not that far from the big brother on SWE-Bench Verified. The model is only available in Codex CLI and IDE extensions. API is coming soon, though. Codex-mini gives you 4x the mileage of Codex. Also, all paid ChatGPT plans now have double the rate limits for Codex.\\nKimi K2 Thinking is an open-weights model that is now #1 on many benchmarks like HLE & BrowseComp across all models (not just open ones). Kimi models seem to have really great writing taste, while being great at coding tasks and being cheaper.\\nSo the trend of models that go further continues with two options: closed-source RL-ed models (Composer, SWE-1.5) and huge MoE open models (GLM, MimiMax, etc.)\\nReplit now lets you add AI features to your apps with zero extra setup. No need to make developer accounts, get API keys, etc. You can use 300+ models, including Gemini, OpenAI, Claude or even open-weights models from OpenRouter. The AI cost is billed against your credits. Smart move tbh.\\nThere‚Äôs a new stealth model on OpenRouter named Polaris Alpha, which looks a lot like GPT-5.1. I also caught a few leaks for Nano Banana 2, mostly creating realistic images of news channels.\\nEliminate AI anxiety. Build with confidence. AI agents are the future‚Äîbut centralized systems create costly risks. With Airia, prototype and orchestrate AI agents securely while creating a resilient, decentralized AI ecosystem for your organization. xmlns=\\\"http://www.w3.org/2000/svg\\\"><g><title></title><path d=\\\"M2.53001 7.81595C3.49179 4.73911 6.43281 2.5 9.91173 2.5C13.1684 2.5 15.9537 4.46214 17.0852 7.23684L17.6179 8.67647M17.6179 8.67647L18.5002 4.26471M17.6179 8.67647L13.6473 6.91176M17.4995 12.1841C16.5378 15.2609 13.5967 17.5 10.1178 17.5C6.86118 17.5 4.07589 15.5379 2.94432 12.7632L2.41165 11.3235M2.41165 11.3235L1.5293
