xmlns=\\\"http://www.w3.org/2000/svg\\\" width=\\\"20\\\" height=\\\"20\\\" viewBox=\\\"0 0 24 24\\\" fill=\\\"none\\\" stroke=\\\"currentColor\\\" stroke-width=\\\"2\\\" stroke-linecap=\\\"round\\\" stroke-linejoin=\\\"round\\\" class=\\\"lucide lucide-maximize2 lucide-maximize-2\\\"><polyline points=\\\"15 3 21 3 21 9\\\"></polyline><polyline points=\\\"9 21 3 21 3 15\\\"></polyline><line x1=\\\"21\\\" x2=\\\"14\\\" y1=\\\"3\\\" y2=\\\"10\\\"></line><line x1=\\\"3\\\" x2=\\\"10\\\" y1=\\\"21\\\" y2=\\\"14\\\"></line></svg></button></div></div></div></a></figure></div><p>Apple is reportedly planning to use a custom Gemini model for the new new final v6 7 Siri, with plans to make it live in March next year. <a href=\\\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2025-11-05/apple-plans-to-use-1-2-trillion-parameter-google-gemini-model-to-power-new-siri\\\">Bloomberg released more details</a> on this deal - Apple will pay Google $1B/yr for this, and the model size would be 1.2 trillion parameters. I immediately thought of some chatter about Gemini 2.5 Flash also being a similar size, with too many experts.</p><p>You can now <a href=\\\"https://x.com/OpenAI/status/1986194298971590988\\\">interrupt ChatGPT&#8217;s thinking</a> (eg, in Deep Research or with ChatGPT Pro) and add new context without restarting. Though many people on X shared that they don&#8217;t really use Deep Research now because GPT-5 thinking gives good enough responses much faster.</p><p>Users of both <a href=\\\"https://x.com/OpenAIDevs/status/1986240264390709405\\\">Codex web</a> and <a href=\\\"https://x.com/_catwu/status/1985754411675930775\\\">Claude Code</a> web can get free credits from $200 to $1000, valid for the next two weeks. </p><p>Cognition has a new feature in Windsurf - <strong><a href=\\\"https://cognition.ai/blog/codemaps\\\">Codemaps</a></strong>. These are annotated structured maps of your code that let you understand what&#8217;s going on where. Codemaps come with a code view listing snippets of what code in which file relates to your query, and a diagram view if you want a visual overview. </p><blockquote><p>I&#8217;ve been using a version of the prompt &#8220;show this codebase in the filetree format with functions, methods and files as nodes&#8221; to understand AI written code and it helps a lot when fixing bugs.</p><p>- Keshav</p></blockquote><p>The <a href=\\\"https://x.com/ayushswrites/status/1970900425730617377\\\">CEO of Warp</a> ripped out Salesforce internally and moved entirely to Attio. His logic? &#8220;We need something powerful, easy to use, that makes us want to log in every day as opposed to feeling like a chore.&#8221; No surprise, his sales team was down for the switch. <a href=\\\"https://attio.com/?utm_source=bens_bites&amp;utm_medium=newsletter_sponsorship&amp;utm_campaign=bens_bites-Q4Y25\\\">Are you?</a>*</p><div><hr></div><h3><strong> </strong>&#127760;<strong> </strong>What I&#8217;m consuming</h3><blockquote><p>A little disclaimer: this section now often contains technical topics that I don&#8217;t fully understand yet. I look through them to get a sense of what&#8217;s recent (example: code execution for MCP) or how to go beyond basic &#8220;slap an LLM to a problem&#8221; approaches as I&#8217;m trying to be more technical.</p></blockquote><ul><li><p>Loading available <a href=\\\"https://www.anthropic.com/engineering/code-execution-with-mcp\\\">MCP tools with code execution</a> (vs declaring them all at once).</p></li><li><p>Thoughts by <a href=\\\"https://windowsontheory.org/2025/11/04/thoughts-by-a-non-economist-on-ai-and-economics/\\\">a non-economist on AI</a> and economics.</p></li><li><p><a href=\\\"https://cursor.com/blog/semsearch\\\">Semantic search</a> improves satisfactory code generation rates in Cursor.</p></li><li><p>The case against <a href=\\\"https://blog.voyageai.com/2025/10/22/the-case-against-llms-as-rerankers/\\\">LLMs as rerankers</a>.</p></li><li><p>Making a website to <a href=\\\"https://basecase.vc/blog/streaming-halloween\\\">observe trick-or-treaters</a> and identify their costumes with Gemma 3 on edge.</p></li><li><p><a href=\\\"https://x.com/mattyp/status/1986267305831972995\\\">Concepts matter more</a> than raw code when building with AI.</p></li><li><p>Sam Altman on trust, persuasion, and the <a href=\\\"https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=cuSDy0Rmdks\\\">future of intelligence</a>.</p></li><li><p><a href=\\\"https://x.com/AlexReibman/status/1986138131813290371\\\">Hyper-engineering</a> - Pushing agents to their full potential.</p></li></ul><div><hr></div><h3>&#9881;&#65039; Tools and demos</h3><ul><li><p><strong>Real conversations have noise, accents, crosstalk.</strong> Speechmatics voice API handles it all for real-time voice agents. <strong><a href=\\\"https://www.speechmatics.com/best-ears-in-ai?utm_source=bens-bites&amp;utm_medium=paid-media&amp;utm_campaign=voice-ai-agents-speaker&amp;utm_content=newsletter\\\">Build with $200 free</a> &#9889;</strong>*</p></li><li><p><strong><a href=\\\"https://www.tembo.io/blog/nov-2025-release\\\">Tembo</a></strong> - Unified interface for background coding agents.</p></li><li><p><strong><a href=\\\"https://www.mesa.dev/\\\">Mesa</a></strong> - A multi-agent system to understand your codebase for senior-level code reviews. (<a href=\\\"https://x.com/olvrgln/status/1985742938014695795\\\">demo</a>)</p></li><li><p><strong><a href=\\\"https://runable.com/\\\">Runable</a></strong> - A general agent for slides, websites, podcasts, videos&#8212;everything.</p></li><li><p><strong><a href=\\\"https://www.orgo.ai/\\\">Orgo</a></strong> - Virtual computers for AI agents. Let them create files, browse the web, and install or use any desktop app.</p></li><li><p><strong><a href=\\\"https://edisonscientific.com/articles/announcing-kosmos\\\">Kosmos</a></strong>  - AI scientist by <a href=\\\"https://edisonscientific.com/articles/announcing-edison-scientific\\\">Edison Scientific</a>, a new company building and commercialising AI agents for science.</p></li></ul><div><hr></div><h3>&#129379; Dev dish</h3><ul><li><p><a href=\\\"https://x.com/trychroma/status/1986159615617442014\\\">Chroma Web Sync</a> - Automatically crawl, scrape and ingest web pages directly into Chroma Cloud.</p></li><li><p>Planning what goes in <a href=\\\"https://repoprompt.com/blog/context-over-convenience/\\\">your coding model&#8217;s context</a>.</p></li><li><p><a href=\\\"https://blog.google/technology/developers/gemini-api-structured-outputs/\\\">Structured Outputs in Gemini API</a> now has expanded JSON Schema support with union types, recursive schemas and more. It also maintains property ordering in its outputs.</p></li><li><p><a href=\\\"https://generalistai.com/blog/nov-04-2025-GEN-0\\\">Gen 0 by Generalist AI</a> - A 10B+ foundational model that works across different robots.</p></li><li><p>Anthropic will <a href=\\\"https://www.anthropic.com/research/deprecation-commitments\\\">store the weights</a> for all its models until the company exists. It&#8217;ll also interview every model before taking it offline (i.e. deprecating it).</p></li></ul><div><hr></div><h3>&#128202; Charts you should see</h3><ul><li><p><a href=\\\"https://lmarena.ai/leaderboard/text/expert\\\">LM Arena&#8217;s latest leaderboard</a> tries to cover how humans actually use frontier AI for real work. Read more about their research on <a href=\\\"https://news.lmarena.ai/arena-expert/\\\">building the dataset</a> for this.</p></li></ul><div class=\\\"captioned-image-container\\\"><figure><a how real AI applications are impacting education, marketing &amp; startups at <a href=\\\"https://techequity-ai.org/\\\">TechEquity&#8217;s Ai summit</a> on 7-8 Nov. Ben&#8217;s Bites readers get 20% off with code <a href=\\\"https://www.eventbrite.com/e/techequity-ai-summit-2025-silicon-valley-tickets-1123010748379?aff=BENSBITES\\\">BENSBITES20</a>.*</p></li><li><p><a href=\\\"https://www.sandbar.com/\\\">Stream by Sandbar</a> (an AI wearable as a ring) is now open for preorders.</p></li><li><p>Wabi is a new &#8220;vibe-coding&#8221; tool. It has extra focus on sharing/remixing the generated mini apps. The team recently <a href=\\\"https://x.com/ekuyda/status/1986135875479380479\\\">raised $20M</a>.</p></li></ul><div><hr></div><div class=\\\"captioned-button-wrap\\\" data-attrs=\\\"{&quot;url&quot;:&quot;https://www.bensbites.com/p/profits-matter-even-for-ai-labs?utm_source=substack&utm_medium=email&utm_content=share&action=share&quot;,&quot;text&quot;:&quot;Share&quot;}\\\" data-component-name=\\\"CaptionedButtonToDOM\\\"><div class=\\\"preamble\\\"><p class=\\\"cta-caption\\\">Enjoy this newsletter? Updates, tool reviews, and lay of the land from an exited founder turned investor and forever tinkerer.\\nSubscribe now\\n\\n\\nHey folks,\\nThe Information reports that Anthropic aims to be profitable by 2027 (vs OpenAI‚Äôs goal of 2030). It is also aiming at $70B revenue in 2028, not too far from OpenAI‚Äôs $100B projection. Claude Code alone is already at a $1B annualised run rate. Saw a chart the other day for enterprise API use and more companies now use Anthropic‚Äôs APIs vs OpenAI‚Äôs.\\n\\n\\n\\n\\n\\n\\n\\n\\n\\n\\n\\nApple is reportedly planning to use a custom Gemini model for the new new final v6 7 Siri, with plans to make it live in March next year. Bloomberg released more details on this deal - Apple will pay Google $1B/yr for this, and the model size would be 1.2 trillion parameters. I immediately thought of some chatter about Gemini 2.5 Flash also being a similar size, with too many experts.\\nYou can now interrupt ChatGPT‚Äôs thinking (eg, in Deep Research or with ChatGPT Pro) and add new context without restarting. Though many people on X shared that they don‚Äôt really use Deep Research now because GPT-5 thinking gives good enough responses much faster.\\nUsers of both Codex web and Claude Code web can get free credits from $200 to $1000, valid for the next two weeks. \\nCognition has a new feature in Windsurf - Codemaps. These are annotated structured maps of your code that let you understand what‚Äôs going on where. Codemaps come with a code view listing snippets of what code in which file relates to your query, and a diagram view if you want a visual overview. \\n\\nI‚Äôve been using a version of the prompt ‚Äúshow this codebase in the filetree format with functions, methods and files as nodes‚Äù to understand AI written code and it helps a lot when fixing bugs.\\n- Keshav\\n\\nThe CEO of Warp ripped out Salesforce internally and moved entirely to Attio. His logic? ‚ÄúWe need something powerful, easy to use, that makes us want to log in every day as opposed to feeling like a chore.‚Äù No surprise, his sales team was down for the switch. Are you?*\\n\\n\\n üåê What I‚Äôm consuming\\n\\nA little disclaimer: this section now often contains technical topics that I don‚Äôt fully understand yet. I look through them to get a sense of what‚Äôs recent (example: code execution for MCP) or how to go beyond basic ‚Äúslap an LLM to a problem‚Äù approaches as I‚Äôm trying to be more technical.\\n\\n\\nLoading available MCP tools with code execution (vs declaring them all at once).\\n\\nThoughts by a non-economist on AI and economics.\\n\\nSemantic search improves satisfactory code generation rates in Cursor.\\n\\nThe case against LLMs as rerankers.\\n\\nMaking a website to observe trick-or-treaters and identify their costumes with Gemma 3 on edge.\\n\\nConcepts matter more than raw code when building with AI.\\n\\nSam Altman on trust, persuasion, and the future of intelligence.\\n\\nHyper-engineering - Pushing agents to their full potential.\\n\\n\\n\\n‚öôÔ∏è Tools and demos\\n\\nReal conversations have noise, accents, crosstalk. Speechmatics voice API handles it all for real-time voice agents. Build with $200 free ‚ö°*\\n\\nTembo - Unified interface for background coding agents.\\n\\nMesa - A multi-agent system to understand your codebase for senior-level code reviews. (demo)\\n\\nRunable - A general agent for slides, websites, podcasts, videos‚Äîeverything.\\n\\nOrgo - Virtual computers for AI agents. Let them create files, browse the web, and install or use any desktop app.\\n\\nKosmos  - AI scientist by Edison Scientific, a new company building and commercialising AI agents for science.\\n\\n\\n\\nü•£ Dev dish\\n\\nChroma Web Sync - Automatically crawl, scrape and ingest web pages directly into Chroma Cloud.\\n\\nPlanning what goes in your coding model‚Äôs context.\\n\\nStructured Outputs in Gemini API now has expanded JSON Schema support with union types, recursive schemas and more. It also maintains property ordering in its outputs.\\n\\nGen 0 by Generalist AI - A 10B+ foundational model that works across different robots.\\n\\nAnthropic will store the weights for all its models until the company exists. It‚Äôll also interview every model before taking it offline (i.e. deprecating it).\\n\\n\\n\\nüìä Charts you should see\\n\\nLM Arena‚Äôs latest leaderboard tries to cover how humans actually use frontier AI for real work. Updates, tool reviews, and lay of the land from an exited founder turned investor and forever tinkerer.</em></p><p class=\\\"button-wrapper\\\" data-attrs=\\\"{&quot;url&quot;:&quot;https://www.bensbites.com/subscribe?&quot;,&quot;text&quot;:&quot;Subscribe now&quot;,&quot;action&quot;:null,&quot;class&quot;:null}\\\" data-component-name=\\\"ButtonCreateButton\\\"><a class=\\\"button primary\\\" href=\\\"https://www.bensbites.com/subscribe?\\\"><span>Subscribe now</span></a></p><div><hr></div><p>Hey folks,</p><p>You can now <a href=\\\"https://help.openai.com/en/articles/12642688-using-credits-for-flexible-usage-in-chatgpt-freegopluspro-sora\\\">buy credits</a> on top of your ChatGPT plan to keep using Codex or Sora. You get 1000 credits for $40, and they have a shelf life of 12 months. <a href=\\\"https://x.com/OpenAIDevs/status/1983956896852988014\\\">For Codex</a>, you can expect double the oomph from your Plus plan, but usage on Sora is complicated. </p><p>OpenAI has also signed a <a href=\\\"https://www.aboutamazon.com/news/aws/aws-open-ai-workloads-compute-infrastructure\\\">$38 billion agreement with AWS</a>, launched a new feature called <strong><a href=\\\"https://openai.com/index/introducing-company-knowledge/\\\">Company Knowledge</a></strong> and opened a private beta for <strong><a href=\\\"https://openai.com/index/introducing-aardvark/\\\">AardVark</a></strong>, an agent that finds and fixes security bugs.</p><p>Also, <strong>Ilya Sutskever</strong> gave his testimony for the Musk vs Altman case last month, and it was made public recently. Ilya wrote a 52-page memo to the OpenAI board to dismiss Sam, thought of it for a year, and really didn&#8217;t wanna merge with Anthropic. Here&#8217;s the <a href=\\\"https://storage.courtlistener.com/recap/gov.uscourts.cand.433688/gov.uscourts.cand.433688.340.1.pdf\\\">full transcript</a>.</p><p><strong><a href=\\\"https://www.udio.com/blog/a-new-era\\\">Udio</a></strong>, the music generation tool, has disabled downloads for users. It seems like a part of the deal to <a href=\\\"https://www.billboard.com/pro/ai-music-udio-settles-lawsuit-universal-music-group/\\\">settle its lawsuit</a> with Universal Music Group. UMG is also partnering with Stability AI for <a href=\\\"https://stability.ai/news/universal-music-group-and-stability-ai-announce-strategic-alliance\\\">licensing deals</a>. ps: you might&#8217;ve already seen AI music on YouTube, but it&#8217;s also on the <a href=\\\"https://futurism.com/future-society/billboard-ai-generated-artist-charting-every-week\\\">Billboard charts now</a>.</p><p><strong><a href=\\\"https://blog.google/technology/google-labs/notebooklm-custom-personas-engine-upgrade/\\\">NotebookLM</a></strong><a href=\\\"https://blog.google/technology/google-labs/notebooklm-custom-personas-engine-upgrade/\\\"> shipped some quality upgrades last week</a>. It now uses the full 1M context of Gemini models, allowing 8x longer context window for documents and 6x longer chats. Plus, you can now give each notebook a goal like studying or research, or marketing assistant to tailor its responses. Also, Sundar Pichai shared that Gemini has <a href=\\\"https://x.com/sundarpichai/status/1983627221425156144\\\">over 650M monthly users</a> now.</p><p><strong>MCP servers create a security risk traditional controls weren&#8217;t built for. The cost? AI breaches average $4.5M.</strong> Without fine-grained authorization, they&#8217;re a centralized governance failure waiting to happen. Get the Zero Trust architecture blueprint that secures MCP properly. <a href=\\\"https://solutions.cerbos.dev/zero-trust-for-ai-securing-mcp-servers?utm_campaign=bens_bites_oct_2025&amp;utm_source=newsletter&amp;utm_medium=email&amp;utm_content=&amp;utm_term=\\\">Download the free eBook</a>.*</p><div><hr></div><h3><strong> </strong>&#127760;<strong> </strong>What I&#8217;m consuming</h3><ul><li><p>What if <a href=\\\"https://mariozechner.at/posts/2025-11-02-what-if-you-dont-need-mcp/\\\">you don&#8217;t need MCP</a> at all?</p></li><li><p><a href=\\\"https://docs.google.com/document/d/1HllKKBULFOAe8e780ISuaUbqKAR8KjRc7XTzO69MOcs\\\">The end of cloud inference</a> - everyday intelligence will live on the device you already own.</p></li><li><p>The <a href=\\\"https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=IDSAMqip6ms\\\">secrets of Claude Code</a> from the engineers who built it.</p></li><li><p><a href=\\\"https://x.com/thsottiaux/status/1984465716888944712\\\">Did Codex really get worse</a> over the last few weeks?</p></li><li><p>Inside the data centres that train A.I. and <a href=\\\"https://www.newyorker.com/magazine/2025/11/03/inside-the-data-centers-that-train-ai-and-drain-the-electrical-grid\\\">drain the electrical grid.</a></p></li><li><p><a href=\\\"https://openai.com/index/building-chatgpt-atlas/\\\">How we built OWL</a>, the new architecture behind ChatGPT&#8217;s browser Atlas.</p></li><li><p>Quick recap on <a href=\\\"https://x.com/yoheinakajima/thread/1985136539651948619\\\">where we are with agents.</a></p></li><li><p><a href=\\\"https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=qbvY0dQgSJ4\\\">Al Engineering 101 with Chip Huyen</a> - Have fun while building AI products as a company. (<a href=\\\"https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=qbvY0dQgSJ4\\\">TLDR</a>)</p></li></ul><div id=\\\"youtube2-qbvY0dQgSJ4\\\" class=\\\"youtube-wrap\\\" data-attrs=\\\"{&quot;videoId&quot;:&quot;qbvY0dQgSJ4&quot;,&quot;startTime&quot;:null,&quot;endTime&quot;:null}\\\" data-component-name=\\\"Youtube2ToDOM\\\"><div class=\\\"youtube-inner\\\"><iframe src=\\\"https://www.youtube-nocookie.com/embed/qbvY0dQgSJ4?rel=0&amp;autoplay=0&amp;showinfo=0&amp;enablejsapi=0\\\" frameborder=\\\"0\\\" loading=\\\"lazy\\\" gesture=\\\"media\\\" allow=\\\"autoplay; fullscreen\\\" allowautoplay=\\\"true\\\" allowfullscreen=\\\"true\\\" width=\\\"728\\\" height=\\\"409\\\"></iframe></div></div><div><hr></div><h3>&#9881;&#65039; Tools and demos</h3><ul><li><p><strong><a href=\\\"https://l.newsbang.com/kMJs?af_web_dp=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.newsbang.com%2Fvalue-prop-dark&amp;af_xp=custom&amp;pid=paid_media&amp;c=bensbites_newsletter_nov4&amp;af_dp=newsbang%3A%2F%2Fnmore.solab.ai%2FsharePage%3Ffrom%3D%26newsId%3D%26bangId%3D\\\">NewsBang - Your Smart News Partner</a></strong>. AI insights, tailored deep dives, and early indicators that move markets and policy.*</p></li><li><p><strong><a href=\\\"https://www.firecrawl.dev/blog/the-worlds-best-web-data-api-v25\\\">Firecrawl 2.5</a></strong> - Comprehensive web data API for your AI products.</p></li><li><p><strong><a href=\\\"https://www.perplexity.ai/hub/blog/introducing-perplexity-patents\\\">Perplexity Patents</a></strong> - AI-powered patent search for everyone.</p></li><li><p><strong><a href=\\\"https://narrative.video/\\\">Narrative</a></strong> - Cursor for professional video editors.</p></li><li><p><strong><a href=\\\"https://x.com/cognition/status/1983983151157563762\\\">Devin</a></strong> can now control a computer and create screen recordings for review.</p></li><li><p><strong><a href=\\\"https://x.com/charliebholtz/status/1984659964129132754\\\">Conductor</a></strong>, an app to run multiple Claude Code agents, now also supports Codex.</p></li><li><p><strong><a href=\\\"https://x.com/skirano/status/1983949174635929985\\\">Web Capture in MagicPath</a></strong> - Copy any functional web element from any website, import it into a canvas and edit it&#8212;visually or with AI.</p></li></ul><div><hr></div><h3>&#129379; Dev dish</h3><ul><li><p><a href=\\\"https://github.com/Dicklesworthstone/mcp_agent_mail\\\">Agent mail MCP</a> - Gmail for your coding agents.</p></li><li><p><a href=\\\"https://llmtext.com/\\\">LLMTEXT.com</a> - Turn any llms.txt into a dedicated MCP server.</p></li><li><p><a href=\\\"https://github.com/philschmid/gemini-api-docs-mcp\\\">Gemini Docs MCP server</a> - local stdio server for searching and retrieving Google Gemini API docs.</p></li></ul><div><hr></div><h3>&#128176; Who got that bag?</h3><ul><li><p><strong><a href=\\\"https://appliedcompute.com/\\\">Applied Compute</a></strong> has $80M in funding, focusing on making specialised models with company data for enterprises.</p></li><li><p><strong><a href=\\\"https://www.figma.com/blog/welcome-weavy-to-figma/\\\">Figma has acquired Weavy AI</a></strong> and is turning it into a new product, Figma Weave. Weavy is less than a year old and <a href=\\\"https://www.bensbites.com/p/liquid-glass-blurs-apple-intelligence#:~:text=Weavy%20AI%20%2D%20create%20scalable%20workflows%20for%20professional%20creative%20work.\\\">launched just four months ago</a>. Its core product was the ability to make creative workflows by chaining multiple models for image gen, caption writers, animation/video gen, etc.</p></li></ul><div><hr></div><h3>&#127846; Afters</h3><ul><li><p>Learn how real AI applications are impacting education, marketing &amp; startups at <a href=\\\"https://techequity-ai.org/\\\">TechEquity&#8217;s Ai summit</a> on 7-8 Nov. Ben&#8217;s Bites readers get 20% off with code <a href=\\\"https://www.eventbrite.com/e/techequity-ai-summit-2025-silicon-valley-tickets-1123010748379?aff=BENSBITES\\\">BENSBITES20</a>.*</p></li><li><p>Gemma models are <a href=\\\"https://x.com/AndrewCurran_/status/1984995011482755085\\\">no longer available</a> in AI Studio (because someone used them to generate factually incorrect content about a US Senator).</p></li><li><p>Apple is reportedly working with Google to build a <a href=\\\"https://www.macrumors.com/2025/11/02/new-version-of-siri-to-lean-on-google-gemini/\\\">special Gemini model to power Siri</a>, with expectations to get it live next March.</p></li><li><p>Design Arena has a new approach to ranking models called <a href=\\\"https://notes.designarena.ai/introducing-micro-evals/\\\">Micro Evals</a>. Here&#8217;s the <a href=\\\"https://www.designarena.ai/evals\\\">leaderboard</a>.</p></li></ul><div><hr></div><div class=\\\"captioned-button-wrap\\\" data-attrs=\\\"{&quot;url&quot;:&quot;https://www.bensbites.com/p/buy-credits-in-chatgpt?utm_source=substack&utm_medium=email&utm_content=share&action=share&quot;,&quot;text&quot;:&quot;Share&quot;}\\\" data-component-name=\\\"CaptionedButtonToDOM\\\"><div class=\\\"preamble\\\"><p class=\\\"cta-caption\\\">Enjoy this newsletter? Last few slots left for the rest of the year.\",\"enclosure\":{\"url\":\"https://substack-post-media.s3.amazonaws.com/public/images/278ae2a9-0066-4df6-936c-62592566352f_1536x1024.png\",\"length\":\"0\",\"type\":\"image/jpeg\"},\"content\":\"courtroom drama, ai music and secret Siri\",\"contentSnippet\":\"courtroom drama, ai music and secret Siri\",\"guid\":\"https://www.bensbites.com/p/buy-credits-in-chatgpt\",\"isoDate\":\"2025-11-04T14:05:26.000Z\",\"itunes\":{}},\"pairedItem\":{\"item\":11}},{\"json\":{\"title\":\"Not a wrapper anymore\",\"link\":\"https://www.bensbites.com/p/not-a-wrapper-anymore\",\"pubDate\":\"Thu, 30 Oct 2025 14:37:31 GMT\",\"content:encoded\":\"<p><em>The newsletter for the technically curious. Updates, tool reviews, and lay of the land from an exited founder turned investor and forever tinkerer.</em></p><p class=\\\"button-wrapper\\\" data-attrs=\\\"{&quot;url&quot;:&quot;https://www.bensbites.com/subscribe?&quot;,&quot;text&quot;:&quot;Subscribe now&quot;,&quot;action&quot;:null,&quot;class&quot;:null}\\\" data-component-name=\\\"ButtonCreateButton\\\"><a class=\\\"button primary\\\" href=\\\"https://www.bensbites.com/subscribe?\\\"><span>Subscribe now</span></a></p><div><hr></div><p>Hey folks,</p><p>I&#8217;m <a href=\\\"https://every.to/courses/droid-camp/purchase?source=post_button\\\">hosting a workshop tomorrow</a> with Dan Shipper and Every. We&#8217;ll talk about <strong>what CLIs are and dive into the Factory CLI, Droid</strong>. It&#8217;s aptly called, Droid Camp. Come and join us for an hour of informal demos, q&amp;a and building!</p><p><strong>Cursor and Windsurf both shipped their in-house models.</strong> <a href=\\\"https://cursor.com/blog/2-0\\\">Cursor 2.0</a> came with <strong><a href=\\\"https://cursor.com/blog/composer\\\">Composer-1</a></strong> (and a new agent-first UI). Windsurf also released <strong><a href=\\\"https://cognition.ai/blog/swe-1-5\\\">SWE-1.5</a></strong>. Both are better than Sonnet 4 but worse than Sonnet 4.5/GPT-5 Codex, have insane speeds and are built to perform the best inside their own platforms. </p><p>The Information reported that Anthropic and OpenAI are using <a href=\\\"https://www.theinformation.com/articles/anthropic-openai-using-cognitions-coding-test\\\">Cognition&#8217;s coding tests</a>, and Cursor is also using their internal benchmark (which they say they can&#8217;t make public) to show Composer&#8217;s performance. Simon made them both draw a pelican (<a href=\\\"https://simonwillison.net/2025/Oct/29/cursor-composer/\\\">Composer</a> &#8212; <a href=\\\"https://simonwillison.net/2025/Oct/29/swe-15/\\\">SWE-1.5</a>), and <a href=\\\"https://every.to/vibe-check/vibe-check-cursor-2-0-and-composer-1-alpha\\\">Every feels</a> the IDE in Cursor distracts you from Composer. </p><p>I agree generally. IDEs are the old way, CLIs and these new agent UI&#8217;s are the new way for software engineering (although CLIs are technically old). I didn&#8217;t ever understand &#8216;tab&#8217; (autocomplete) as a &#8216;thing&#8217; - it reminded me of early ChatGPT days where people rushed to build autocomplete for text everywhere. It's fine, but it&#8217;s no leap in function or form.</p><p><strong>OpenAI finished its profit/non-profit reorg</strong>, and Sam Altman posted a <a href=\\\"https://x.com/sama/status/1983584366547829073\\\">tldr</a> of a <a href=\\\"https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ngDCxlZcecw\\\">livestream</a> he did with OpenAI&#8217;s chief scientist. It&#8217;s still pretty long, so here&#8217;s tldr of a tldr:</p><ul><li><p>Already secured 30GW of compute commitments costing $1.4T.</p></li><li><p>Non-profit owns 26% of the for-profit PBC (valued at $500B total), <a href=\\\"https://blogs.microsoft.com/blog/2025/10/28/the-next-chapter-of-the-microsoft-openai-partnership/\\\">Microsoft owns 27%</a> (<em>rumour</em> - OpenAI has plans for <a href=\\\"https://www.reuters.com/business/openai-lays-groundwork-juggernaut-ipo-up-1-trillion-valuation-2025-10-29/\\\">a trillion-dollar IPO</a>)</p></li><li><p>Goals to build an automated &#8220;AI researcher intern&#8221; by Sept 2026, drop the intern by 2028.</p></li></ul><p>That&#8217;s not it, they released two new open-weights models under the name <strong><a href=\\\"https://x.com/openai/status/1983507392374641071?s=12\\\">gpt-oss-safeguard</a></strong>: fine-tunes of the gpt-oss models with both 20B and 120B variants. Also, Sora has a new feature, <strong><a href=\\\"https://x.com/OpenAI/status/1983661036533379486\\\">Character Cameos</a></strong> (put your dog in your videos), and it&#8217;s available in <a href=\\\"https://x.com/OpenAI/status/1983730999482872195\\\">three more countries</a>, with open access for <a href=\\\"https://x.com/OpenAI/status/1983662144437748181\\\">these (different) countries</a> (i.e. no invite code needed).</p><p>The <a href=\\\"https://x.com/ayushswrites/status/1970900425730617377\\\">CEO of Warp</a> ripped out Salesforce internally and moved entirely to Attio. His logic? &#8220;We need something powerful, easy to use that makes us want to log in every day as opposed to feeling like a chore.&#8221; No surprise, his sales team was down for the switch. <a href=\\\"https://attio.com/?utm_source=bens_bites&amp;utm_medium=newsletter_sponsorship&amp;utm_campaign=bens_bites-Q4Y25\\\">Are you?</a></p><div><hr></div><h3><strong> </strong>&#127760;<strong> </strong>What I&#8217;m consuming</h3><ul><li><p><a href=\\\"https://www.speechmatics.com/company/articles-and-news/build-ai-agents-that-understand-who-said-what-livekit?utm_source=bens-bites&amp;utm_medium=paid-media&amp;utm_campaign=voice-ai-agents&amp;utm_content=newsletter\\\">Why AI voice agents fail</a> at multi-speaker conversations &#8211; and how to fix it.</p></li><li><p><a href=\\\"https://www.bain.com/insights/new-diligence-challenge-uncovering-ai-risks-and-opportunities/\\\">New diligence challenge with AI</a> - When a prototype performs better than the company you wanted to acquire.</p></li><li><p><a href=\\\"https://www.goodfire.ai/research/rakuten-sae-probes-for-pii-detection\\\">How Rakuten replaced LLM-as-a-Judge</a> with SAE probes for PII detection (while saving money).</p></li><li><p><a href=\\\"https://x.com/AnthropicAI/status/1983584136972677319\\\">Signs of introspection in LLMs</a> - Can Claude actually recognise its thoughts, or does it just make up explanations when asked about them?</p></li><li><p><a href=\\\"https://claude.ai/public/artifacts/2d8fbe10-b3b8-439f-85de-6c87329e55fe\\\">Cursor 2.0&#8217;s system prompt</a> in an easy-to-explore artifact (hunted by <a href=\\\"https://github.com/elder-plinius/CL4R1T4S/blob/main/CURSOR/Cursor_2.0_Sys_Prompt.txt\\\">elder_plinius</a>). </p></li></ul><div href=\\\"https://www.assemblyai.com/products/llm-gateway?utm_source=bensbites&amp;utm_medium=newsletter_sponsor&amp;utm_campaign=toptools&amp;utm_content=llm_gateway_103025\\\">LLM Gateway</a></strong> - Combine AssemblyAI&#8217;s fast &amp; accurate speech models with GPT-5, Claude, and more.</p></li><li><p><strong><a href=\\\"https://www.grammarly.com/blog/company/introducing-new-superhuman\\\">Superhuman Go</a></strong> - Grammarly is renaming itself to Superhuman (they acquired the email company a while ago) and launching an assistant that can connect to your email, docs, company data and of course fix your typos. </p></li><li><p><strong><a href=\\\"https://experience.odyssey.ml/\\\">Odyssey-2</a></strong> - Generate an instant AI video that you can interact with.</p></li><li><p><strong><a href=\\\"https://www.kaizenautomation.com/\\\">Kaizen</a></strong> - Build browser automations and never do a data entry task twice.</p></li><li><p><strong><a href=\\\"https://ariana.dev/\\\">Ariana</a></strong>, not Grande, it&#8217;s another parallel coding agents app. If you&#8217;re planning to make a text-to-app tool, pivot to &#8220;UI for Claude Code&#8221; hah.</p></li><li><p><strong><a href=\\\"https://www.animeleak.com/\\\">Anime Leak</a></strong> - Put funky art in your real pictures.</p></li></ul><div class=\\\"captioned-image-container\\\"><figure><a class=\\\"image-link image2 is-viewable-img\\\" target=\\\"_blank\\\" class=\\\"image-caption\\\"><a href=\\\"https://www.animeleak.com/\\\">via AnimeLeak</a></figcaption></figure></div><div><hr></div><h3>&#129379; Dev dish</h3><ul><li><p><a href=\\\"https://nextjs.org/evals\\\">NextJS has its own evals now</a>. It tests AI models on how many failing tests in a NextJS project a model can fix. GPT-5 Codex performs the best by fixing 42% of the tests, but Codex, the agent, solves only 30% (vs Claude Code&#8217;s 42% again). So, I'm not sure how reliable these results are.</p></li><li><p>Might wanna run this command to <a href=\\\"https://x.com/ryancarson/status/1982887330856792237\\\">review your PRs</a> before you submit them.</p></li><li><p><a href=\\\"https://github.com/allenai/olmocr\\\">OlmoOCR</a> - Convert PDFs/image-based documents into clean plain text on your device.</p></li><li><p>New <a href=\\\"https://x.com/trychroma/status/1983625513244750304\\\">Search() API by Chroma</a> - Get the best of both worlds with a hybrid search that combines vector search with metadata filtering and custom ranking.</p></li></ul><div><hr></div><h3>&#128176; Who got that bag?</h3><ul><li><p><strong><a href=\\\"https://cartesia.ai/sonic\\\">Cartesia AI</a></strong> released a new speech generation model, Sonic-3, and raised $100M.</p></li></ul><ul><li><p><strong><a href=\\\"https://fireworks.ai/blog/series-c\\\">Fireworks AI</a></strong> (model hosting platform) has raised $250M Series C at a $4B valuation.</p></li><li><p><strong><a href=\\\"https://mem0.ai/series-a\\\">Mem0</a></strong> (memory for AI) raised $24M in Seed and Series A.</p></li></ul><div><hr></div><h3>&#128587; How do I&#8230;</h3><ul><li><p><strong>ask data questions and get answers, right in my Slack?</strong></p></li></ul><p>Three easy steps, takes less than 5 minutes:</p><ol><li><p>Securely connect your DB to Julius (Postgres, BigQuery, Snowflake, Supabase, MySQL + more supported)</p></li><li><p>Enable Slack Agent (<a href=\\\"https://t.co/tNGIC825FG\\\">http://julius.ai/data-connectors</a>) </p></li><li><p>Create a <em>#ask-data</em> Slack channel and invite `@juliusai` to the channel</p></li></ol><p>More docs here: <a href=\\\"https://julius.ai/docs/slack-agent/overview\\\">Julius&#8217; Slack Agent overview</a>.</p><ul><li><p><strong>create marketing posters just with my website URL?</strong></p></li></ul><p>like <a href=\\\"https://x.com/venturetwins/status/1983556734062043587\\\">this one</a>? You got it. Go to this new tool from Google Labs called <a href=\\\"https://labs.google.com/pomelli/about/\\\">Pomelli</a>. </p><ul><li><p>It picks up business DNA - Your brand colours, fonts and assets from your website. </p></li><li><p>It ideates on campaigns that you can run (and you can guide it via prompts).</p></li><li><p>It generates the ads, and you can edit them to your liking (with some limitations).</p></li></ul><p>See the <a href=\\\"https://x.com/venturetwins/status/1983557283352387637\\\">full tutorial by Justine</a>.</p><ul><li><p><strong>make a &#8220;good&#8221; chat with X feature without complex code?</strong></p></li></ul><p>hmm, this one&#8217;s not easy. You&#8217;ll need to make multiple tools, manage context between them. allow dozens of API calls&#8230; I&#8217;m just kidding,</p><ul><li><p>send your prompt to <em>droid exec</em>.</p></li><li><p>That&#8217;s it.</p></li></ul><p>More here: <a href=\\\"https://docs.factory.ai/guides/building/droid-exec-tutorial\\\">Building interactive apps with Droid Exec</a></p><div><hr></div><h3>&#127846; Afters</h3><ul><li><p>Find out what integrating AI looks like for healthcare, education or urban policy on Nov 7th-8th. Sign up for <a href=\\\"https://www.eventbrite.com/e/techequity-ai-summit-2025-silicon-valley-tickets-1123010748379?aff=BENSBITES\\\">TechEquity&#8217;s Ai Summit</a> (visit the link and use the code BENSBITES20 for a 20% discount.)</p></li><li><p>Two new measures of model capabilities:</p><ul><li><p><a href=\\\"https://epoch.ai/benchmarks\\\">ECI by Epoch AI</a>, meant to normalise multiple benchmarks to track progress across a longer time period. </p></li><li><p><a href=\\\"https://scale.com/leaderboard/rli\\\">RLI - Remote Labor Index</a> from Scale AI and Center for AI Safety. An attempt to measure how much real-world, economically valuable remote work the models/agents can do.</p></li></ul></li><li><p>New AI wearable in the market - <a href=\\\"https://x.com/sandbar/status/1983167124874113451\\\">Stream Ring by Sandbar</a>.</p></li><li><p>YouTube plans to <a href=\\\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2025-10-29/youtube-will-use-ai-to-sharpen-lower-resolution-videos-on-tvs\\\">upscale old videos</a> to HD using AI.</p></li></ul><div><hr></div><div class=\\\"captioned-button-wrap\\\" data-attrs=\\\"{&quot;url&quot;:&quot;https://www.bensbites.com/p/not-a-wrapper-anymore?utm_source=substack&utm_medium=email&utm_content=share&action=share&quot;,&quot;text&quot;:&quot;Share&quot;}\\\" data-component-name=\\\"CaptionedButtonToDOM\\\"><div class=\\\"preamble\\\"><p class=\\\"cta-caption\\\">Enjoy this newsletter? Feel free to comment and share your thoughts. &#128075;</p><ul><li><p>Find me on <a href=\\\"https://x.com/bentossell/\\\">X</a>, <a href=\\\"https://www.linkedin.com/in/ben-tossell-70453537/\\\">Linkedin</a>, or <a href=\\\"https://instagram.com/bentossell\\\">Instagram</a></p></li><li><p>Read <a href=\\\"https://bensbites.substack.com/about\\\">about me</a> and Ben&#8217;s Bites</p></li><li><p>&#128247; thumbnail creds: <a href=\\\"https://x.com/Keshavatearth\\\">@keshavatearth</a>,</p></li></ul><blockquote><h6><em>Thanks to today&#8217;s sponsors who made this newsletter possible :)</em></h6><h6><em>Attio, Speechmatics, AssemblyAI and Ai Summit. </em></h6><h6><em>Wanna <a href=\\\"https://sponsor.bensbites.co/\\\">partner with us</a>? Updates, tool reviews, and lay of the land from an exited founder turned investor and forever tinkerer.\\nSubscribe now\\n\\n\\nHey folks,\\nI‚Äôm hosting a workshop tomorrow with Dan Shipper and Every. We‚Äôll talk about what CLIs are and dive into the Factory CLI, Droid. It‚Äôs aptly called, Droid Camp. Come and join us for an hour of informal demos, q&a and building!\\nCursor and Windsurf both shipped their in-house models. Cursor 2.0 came with Composer-1 (and a new agent-first UI). Windsurf also released SWE-1.5. Both are better than Sonnet 4 but worse than Sonnet 4.5/GPT-5 Codex, have insane speeds and are built to perform the best inside their own platforms. \\nThe Information reported that Anthropic and OpenAI are using Cognition‚Äôs coding tests, and Cursor is also using their internal benchmark (which they say they can‚Äôt make public) to show Composer‚Äôs performance. Simon made them both draw a pelican (Composer ‚Äî SWE-1.5), and Every feels the IDE in Cursor distracts you from Composer. \\nI agree generally. IDEs are the old way, CLIs and these new agent UI‚Äôs are the new way for software engineering (although CLIs are technically old). I didn‚Äôt ever understand ‚Äòtab‚Äô (autocomplete) as a ‚Äòthing‚Äô - it reminded me of early ChatGPT days where people rushed to build autocomplete for text everywhere. It's fine, but it‚Äôs no leap in function or form.\\nOpenAI finished its profit/non-profit reorg, and Sam Altman posted a tldr of a livestream he did with OpenAI‚Äôs chief scientist. It‚Äôs still pretty long, so here‚Äôs tldr of a tldr:\\n\\nAlready secured 30GW of compute commitments costing $1.4T.\\n\\nNon-profit owns 26% of the for-profit PBC (valued at $500B total), Microsoft owns 27% (rumour - OpenAI has plans for a trillion-dollar IPO)\\n\\nGoals to build an automated ‚ÄúAI researcher intern‚Äù by Sept 2026, drop the intern by 2028.\\n\\nThat‚Äôs not it, they released two new open-weights models under the name gpt-oss-safeguard: fine-tunes of the gpt-oss models with both 20B and 120B variants. Also, Sora has a new feature, Character Cameos (put your dog in your videos), and it‚Äôs available in three more countries, with open access for these (different) countries (i.e. no invite code needed).\\nThe CEO of Warp ripped out Salesforce internally and moved entirely to Attio. His logic? ‚ÄúWe need something powerful, easy to use that makes us want to log in every day as opposed to feeling like a chore.‚Äù No surprise, his sales team was down for the switch. Are you?\\n\\n\\n üåê What I‚Äôm consuming\\n\\nWhy AI voice agents fail at multi-speaker conversations ‚Äì and how to fix it.\\n\\nNew diligence challenge with AI - When a prototype performs better than the company you wanted to acquire.\\n\\nHow Rakuten replaced LLM-as-a-Judge with SAE probes for PII detection (while saving money).\\n\\nSigns of introspection in LLMs - Can Claude actually recognise its thoughts, or does it just make up explanations when asked about them?\\n\\nCursor 2.0‚Äôs system prompt in an easy-to-explore artifact (hunted by elder_plinius). \\n\\n\\n\\n\\n\\n\\n\\n\\n\\n\\n\\n\\n\\n\\n‚öôÔ∏è Tools and demos\\n\\nLLM Gateway - Combine AssemblyAI‚Äôs fast & accurate speech models with GPT-5, Claude, and more.\\n\\nSuperhuman Go - Grammarly is renaming itself to Superhuman (they acquired the email company a while ago) and launching an assistant that can connect to your email, docs, company data and of course fix your typos. \\n\\nOdyssey-2 - Generate an instant AI video that you can interact with.\\n\\nKaizen - Build browser automations and never do a data entry task twice.\\n\\nAriana, not Grande, it‚Äôs another parallel coding agents app. If you‚Äôre planning to make a text-to-app tool, pivot to ‚ÄúUI for Claude Code‚Äù hah.\\n\\nAnime Leak - Put funky art in your real pictures.\\n\\n\\n\\n\\n\\n\\n\\n\\n\\n\\n\\nvia AnimeLeak\\n\\n\\nü•£ Dev dish\\n\\nNextJS has its own evals now. Updates, tool reviews, and lay of the land from an exited founder turned investor and forever tinkerer.</em></p><p class=\\\"button-wrapper\\\" data-attrs=\\\"{&quot;url&quot;:&quot;https://www.bensbites.com/subscribe?&quot;,&quot;text&quot;:&quot;Subscribe now&quot;,&quot;action&quot;:null,&quot;class&quot;:null}\\\" data-component-name=\\\"ButtonCreateButton\\\"><a class=\\\"button primary\\\" href=\\\"https://www.bensbites.com/subscribe?\\\"><span>Subscribe now</span></a></p><div><hr></div><p>Hey folks,</p><p>Elon has his own Wikipedia now - <strong><a href=\\\"https://grokipedia.com/\\\">Grokipedia</a></strong>. v0.1 of Grokipedia has almost a million articles generated by Grok (impressive vs Wikipedia 7M English articles). Articles on Grokipedia aggressively cite sources from the web, with most generated pages at 200+ citations. Though it mostly looks like they created a million keywords and ran deep research reports for them.</p><p>Anthropic is turning Claude into an Excel monkey, releasing <strong><a href=\\\"https://claude.com/claude-for-excel\\\">Claude for Excel</a></strong> as a research preview (available to the first 1000 Max, Enterprise, and Teams users). It&#8217;s also expanding <a href=\\\"https://www.anthropic.com/news/advancing-claude-for-financial-services\\\">Claude for Financial Services</a> (an Enterprise plan) with connectors for real-time market data, pre-built Agent Skills, and more.</p><p>Every is hosting a workshop this Friday with ME - <strong><a href=\\\"https://every.to/on-every/for-paid-subscribers-only-every-s-droid-camp\\\">Droid Camp</a></strong>. Danny and Kieran from the Every team will show how they are shipping products using Droid, Factory&#8217;s CLI agent (here&#8217;s a tutorial to <a href=\\\"https://docs.factory.ai/cli/getting-started/video-walkthrough\\\">get you started</a>). ps: We&#8217;re also <a href=\\\"https://factory.ai/careers/business-operations\\\">hiring at Factory AI</a> for our Business Operations team (in-person in SF).</p><p>With automatic enrichment, call intelligence, AI agents, flexible workflows and more, <strong><a href=\\\"https://attio.com/?utm_source=bens_bites&amp;utm_medium=newsletter_sponsorship&amp;utm_campaign=bens_bites-Q4Y25\\\">Attio</a></strong> works for any team and only takes minutes to set up. Industry leaders like Granola, TaskRabbit, and Flatfile are already experiencing what&#8217;s next. <a href=\\\"https://attio.com/?utm_source=bens_bites&amp;utm_medium=newsletter_sponsorship&amp;utm_campaign=bens_bites-Q4Y25\\\">Try Attio Pro for free.</a>*</p><div><hr></div><h3><strong> </strong>&#127760;<strong> </strong>What I&#8217;m consuming</h3><ul><li><p>Fork your data like you fork your code. <a href=\\\"https://www.tigrisdata.com/blog/fork-buckets-like-code/?utm_source=bens_bites\\\">How Tigris brings Git-style workflows</a> to datasets, letting you clone massive buckets instantly for experimentation.*</p></li><li><p>Amjad Masad and Marc Andreessen on <a href=\\\"https://x.com/a16z/status/1981359974661181928\\\">AI agents, AGI, creativity, and reasoning</a>.</p></li><li><p><a href=\\\"https://zarazhang.substack.com/p/why-we-built-tldw\\\">Why we built TLDW</a> -  A tool that helps people learn from long YouTube videos.</p></li><li><p><a href=\\\"https://thinkingmachines.ai/blog/on-policy-distillation/\\\">On policy distillation</a> - The best of both SFT and RL with an order of magnitude lower cost. (by Thinking Machines)</p></li><li><p><a href=\\\"https://academy.langchain.com/collections/quickstart/\\\">LangChain Essentials</a> - Learn the basics of LangChain, the open-source framework.</p></li><li><p>A quick review of <a href=\\\"https://x.com/Keshavatearth/status/1982907507598397878\\\">vibe coding in Google AI Studio</a>. </p></li><li><p>Why Stagehand is <a stroke-linejoin=\\\"round\\\" class=\\\"lucide lucide-maximize2 lucide-maximize-2\\\"><polyline points=\\\"15 3 21 3 21 9\\\"></polyline><polyline points=\\\"9 21 3 21 3 15\\\"></polyline><line x1=\\\"21\\\" x2=\\\"14\\\" y1=\\\"3\\\" y2=\\\"10\\\"></line><line x1=\\\"3\\\" x2=\\\"10\\\" y1=\\\"21\\\" y2=\\\"14\\\"></line></svg></button></div></div></div></a></figure></div><div><hr></div><h3>&#9881;&#65039;  Tools and dev resources</h3><ul><li><p>Voice AI that&#8217;s on brand and human? See how BMW did it with Voices. Join <strong>Voices.com&#8217;s <a href=\\\"https://www.voices.com/landing/voice-ai-launch?utm_source=bensbites&amp;utm_medium=newsletter&amp;utm_campaign=voiceailaunch\\\">product launch</a></strong> Nov 13, 1PM ET to learn how.*</p></li><li><p><strong><a href=\\\"https://v0.app/ios\\\">v0</a></strong> - Vercel&#8217;s vibe coding tool is now available on iOS as well.</p></li><li><p><strong><a href=\\\"https://typeos.com/\\\">TypeOS</a></strong> - Write, edit and format Google Docs with AI. Cursor for Google Docs.</p></li><li><p><strong><a href=\\\"https://openai.com/index/strengthening-chatgpt-responses-in-sensitive-conversations/\\\">Gumloop Agents</a></strong> - Build agents that can decide which tools and workflows to use to complete your tasks.</p></li><li><p><strong><a href=\\\"https://github.com/aidenybai/react-grab\\\">React Grab</a></strong> - Select an element, give it to AI as context and make a change to your page.</p></li><li><p><strong><a href=\\\"https://github.com/MoonshotAI/kimi-cli\\\">Kimi CLI</a></strong> - Open-source hybrid of a shell and a coding agent written in Python.</p></li><li><p><strong><a href=\\\"https://thinkingmachines.ai/tinker/\\\">Tinker by Thinking Machines</a></strong> now also supports gpt-oss models and DeepSeek v3.1</p></li></ul><div><hr></div><h3>&#128202; Charts you should see</h3><ul><li><p><strong><a href=\\\"https://huggingface.co/MiniMaxAI/MiniMax-M2\\\">MiniMax-M2</a></strong>, another model from Last few slots left for the rest of the year.\",\"enclosure\":{\"url\":\"https://substack-post-media.s3.amazonaws.com/public/images/776d343d-1307-4e7e-a43f-7b481c117bcb_1344x768.png\",\"length\":\"0\",\"type\":\"image/jpeg\"},\"content\":\"Claude in Excel, safer GPT-5 and bad LLM traffic.\",\"contentSnippet\":\"Claude in Excel, safer GPT-5 and bad LLM traffic.\",\"guid\":\"https://www.bensbites.com/p/grok-vs-wikipedia\",\"isoDate\":\"2025-10-28T14:21:03.000Z\",\"itunes\":{}},\"pairedItem\":{\"item\":13}},{\"json\":{\"title\":\"OpenAI's new product\",\"link\":\"https://www.bensbites.com/p/openais-new-product\",\"pubDate\":\"Thu, 23 Oct 2025 13:20:25 GMT\",\"content:encoded\":\"<p><em>The newsletter for the technically curious. Updates, tool reviews, and lay of the land from an exited founder turned investor and forever tinkerer.</em></p><p class=\\\"button-wrapper\\\" data-attrs=\\\"{&quot;url&quot;:&quot;https://www.bensbites.com/subscribe?&quot;,&quot;text&quot;:&quot;Subscribe now&quot;,&quot;action&quot;:null,&quot;class&quot;:null}\\\" data-component-name=\\\"ButtonCreateButton\\\"><a class=\\\"button primary\\\" href=\\\"https://www.bensbites.com/subscribe?\\\"><span>Subscribe now</span></a></p><div><hr></div><p>Hey folks,</p><p>We missed our own 3rd birthday! 10th October 2025 marks three years since I started writing this newsletter. So grateful for all of you along for the ride and all the AI tools keeping us busy for so long &#128517;.</p><p>The latest entry in AI browsers is <strong><a href=\\\"https://chatgpt.com/atlas\\\">Atlas - A new browser from OpenAI.</a></strong> Atlas would feel similar to Dia or Comet if you&#8217;ve used them. It has an &#8220;Ask ChatGPT&#8221; sidebar that has the context of your page, and choose &#8220;Agent&#8221; to work on that tab. Right now, Agent is limited to a single tab, and it is way too slow to delegate anything for real to it. Click accuracy for Agent is alright on normal web pages, but it will definitely trip up if you ask it to use something like Google Sheets.</p><p>One ambient feature that I think many people will like is &#8220;select to rewrite&#8221; - You can select any text in Atlas, hover/click on the blue dot in the top right corner to rewrite it using AI.</p><div class=\\\"captioned-image-container\\\"><figure><a class=\\\"image-link image2\\\" target=\\\"_blank\\\" 1272w, https://substackcdn.com/image/fetch/$s_!b1X-!,w_1456,c_limit,f_auto,q_auto:good,fl_progressive:steep/https%3A%2F%2Fsubstack-post-media.s3.amazonaws.com%2Fpublic%2Fimages%2Fdcbd9b81-d4ff-4271-9ff9-b944c0027aba_1586x257.png 1456w\\\" sizes=\\\"100vw\\\" fetchpriority=\\\"high\\\"></picture><div></div></div></a></figure></div><p>You can also share your browsing history and access it in ChatGPT as a form of memory. That seems to be the bet to make Atlas sticky, but I haven&#8217;t been a fan of Memory in general. Searching in Atlas defaults to ChatGPT but has a few panes you can switch to, including one for your 10 blue links, one for images and a couple more. Overall, it feels like a beta version with too many gaps yet to be filled.</p><p><strong><a href=\\\"https://aistudio.google.com/apps\\\">Google AI Studio has had a vibe-coding mode</a></strong> since May, but they have upgraded the experience a lot since then. It is one of the fastest ways to build with Gemini models and have Gemini-based features in your apps. The app files are saved to your drive, can be pushed to GitHub, and you can preview and deploy them as well. This is one of the unique features of the developer console of a major AI lab. Related: <a href=\\\"https://x.com/Similarweb/status/1980980648929325066\\\">Web traffic for AI Studio</a> has also been growing rapidly since last year.</p><p><strong>NEW:</strong> Our <strong>&#8216;Ben&#8217;s Bites AI expert matching service&#8217;</strong> has <a href=\\\"https://experts.bensbites.com/\\\">launched</a>! h/t to my brother, Adam for building it with Shanice. If you&#8217;re an AI dev or no-code/automation expert, list yourself and get hired. If you&#8217;re a company needing AI projects built, post jobs and connect with the right people. We&#8217;ll be trialling a personalised matching service soon too.</p><div class=\\\"captioned-image-container\\\"><figure><a class=\\\"image-link image2 is-viewable-img\\\" target=\\\"_blank\\\" href=\\\"https://x.com/kepano/status/1980332114034979147\\\">Use the saw, fear the saw</a> - Don&#8217;t stop making powerful (and potentially dangerous) tools; rather, we should empower people to use them safely.</p></li><li><p><a href=\\\"https://kyutai.org/next/codec-explainer\\\">Neural audio codecs</a> - how to get audio into LLMs.</p></li><li><p><a href=\\\"https://steve-yegge.medium.com/zero-framework-cognition-a-way-to-build-resilient-ai-applications-56b090ed3e69\\\">Zero Framework Cognition</a>: A way to build resilient AI applications.</p></li><li><p><a href=\\\"https://tawandamunongo.dev/posts/2025/10/ai-work-more\\\">AI is making us work more</a> - How the AI boom revived a 996 work culture.</p></li><li><p>There is no <a href=\\\"https://a16z.substack.com/p/there-is-no-god-tier-video-model\\\">God Tier video model</a>.</p></li><li><p><a href=\\\"https://x.com/ericzakariasson/status/1981004383824589132\\\">How people at Cursor use Cursor</a>.</p></li><li><p>As you know, <strong>I&#8217;m learning to be more technical</strong> so the <a href=\\\"https://solve.it.com/?via_id=6jwqcp22_bensbites\\\">Solve It With Code course</a> by Jeremy Howard (Inventor of the LLM) &amp; Eric Ries (The Lean Startup) is one course I&#8217;m taking - I&#8217;ve learnt a ton from both of them over the years. Their method teaches how to think <em>with</em> AI, not just prompt. Break challenges into small pieces, build iteratively. <strong>Starts Nov 3 with 5 weeks of live problem-solving. Bonus: Access to their Solveit platform. <a href=\\\"https://solve.it.com/?via_id=6jwqcp22_bensbites\\\">Join here</a>.</strong> <br>Also Andrej Karpathy set a challenge: &#8220;Can you take my 2h13m tokenizer video and translate [into] a book chapter&#8221;. and Solve It did - read it <a href=\\\"https://www.fast.ai/posts/2025-10-16-karpathy-tokenizers\\\">here</a>.</p></li></ul><div ears in AI.</strong> Capture who said what in noisy, heavily accented, multi-speaker conversations. <a href=\\\"https://www.speechmatics.com/use-cases/ai-voice-agents?utm_source=taaft&amp;utm_medium=paid-media&amp;utm_campaign=voice-ai-agents-2025&amp;utm_content=newsletter\\\">Get $200 free &#128066;</a>*</p></li><li><p><strong><a href=\\\"http://isualize a multi-agent workflow, with complete support for human-in-the-loop and runtime comparisons.\\\">Workflow Debugger by LlamaIndex</a></strong> - Visualise a multi-agent workflow, with human-in-the-loop support and runtime comparisons.</p></li><li><p><strong><a href=\\\"https://x.com/lovable_dev/status/198065064709683635\\\">Lovable</a></strong><a href=\\\"https://x.com/lovable_dev/status/198065064709683635\\\"> now integrates with Shopify</a>, allowing you to create a storefront and make it live.</p></li><li><p><strong><a href=\\\"https://www.director.ai/\\\">Director</a></strong> - Free app to automate web tasks with a single prompt.</p></li><li><p><strong><a href=\\\"https://writewithspiral.com/\\\">Spiral</a> by Every</strong> - Write content you&#8217;re proud of with AI. (<a href=\\\"https://every.to/podcast/spiral-s-creator-on-why-better-writing-means-better-thinking\\\">blog</a>)</p></li><li><p><strong><a href=\\\"https://x.com/elevenlabsio/status/1980675502055534919\\\">ElevenLabs Voice Isolator</a></strong> now supports video - Clean up the audio in your videos to match studio-grade quality.</p></li><li><p><strong><a href=\\\"https://claude.com/download\\\">Claude Desktop</a></strong> app now supports speech input, quick access and more.</p></li><li><p><strong><a API</a> for developers to build upon. But it&#8217;s still too expensive&#8212;we pull 30-40k tweets per month to look for AI-relevant tweets from our feed, and that&#8217;s easily $200/mo.</p></li><li><p><a href=\\\"https://openrouter.ai/openai/gpt-5-image-mini\\\">GPT-5 Image Mini</a> is now available on OpenRouter.</p></li><li><p><a href=\\\"https://github.com/agentclientprotocol\\\">ACP</a> - A protocol for connecting any editor to any agent.</p></li><li><p><a href=\\\"https://github.com/datalab-to/chandra\\\">Chandra</a> - A highly accurate OCR model that converts images and PDFs into structured HTML/Markdown/JSON while preserving layout information.</p></li><li><p><a href=\\\"https://github.com/Scrapybara/scrapybara-oss\\\">Scrapybara</a> is sunsetting its product for spinning up remote desktop instances for computer use agents. As a result, they have open-sourced a part of their codebase.</p></li></ul><div><hr></div><h3><strong>&#128176; Who got that bag?</strong></h3><ul><li><p><a href=\\\"https://blog.langchain.com/three-years-langchain/\\\">Langchain</a> raised $125M at a $1.25B valuation.</p></li><li><p><a href=\\\"https://www.sequoiacap.com/article/partnering-with-sesame-a-new-era-for-voice/\\\">Sesame</a> (the viral voice demo makers) has raised $250M Series B led by Sequoia and <a href=\\\"https://www.sesame.com/beta\\\">opened an iOS beta</a>.</p></li><li><p><a href=\\\"https://www.tempo.new/blog/5m-seed-design-engineering-movement\\\">Tempo Labs</a> has raised $5M to let design engineers collaborate on production codebases.</p></li></ul><div><hr></div><h3>&#127846; Afters</h3><ul><li><p>The context engineering hackathon - Make agents and compete against pre-defined evals, not demo-ware. Nov 15th in SF, <a href=\\\"https://theoryvc.com/blog-posts/americas-next-top-modeler\\\">sign up here</a>.</p></li><li><p><a href=\\\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2025-10-21/anthropic-google-in-talks-on-cloud-deal-worth-tens-of-billions\\\">Anthropic and Google</a> are in talks for a deal worth tens of billions for compute.</p></li><li><p>Samsung, Google and Qualcomm released an <a href=\\\"https://x.com/izadi_shahram/status/1980820058755805609\\\">Android headset, GalaxyXR</a>, with a bunch of Gemini features (at half the price of Apple Vision Pro).</p></li></ul><div><hr></div><div class=\\\"captioned-button-wrap\\\" data-attrs=\\\"{&quot;url&quot;:&quot;https://www.bensbites.com/p/openais-new-product?utm_source=substack&utm_medium=email&utm_content=share&action=share&quot;,&quot;text&quot;:&quot;Share&quot;}\\\" data-component-name=\\\"CaptionedButtonToDOM\\\"><div class=\\\"preamble\\\"><p class=\\\"cta-caption\\\">Enjoy this newsletter? Updates, tool reviews, and lay of the land from an exited founder turned investor and forever tinkerer.\\nSubscribe now\\n\\n\\nHey folks,\\nWe missed our own 3rd birthday! 10th October 2025 marks three years since I started writing this newsletter. So grateful for all of you along for the ride and all the AI tools keeping us busy for so long üòÖ.\\nThe latest entry in AI browsers is Atlas - A new browser from OpenAI. Atlas would feel similar to Dia or Comet if you‚Äôve used them. It has an ‚ÄúAsk ChatGPT‚Äù sidebar that has the context of your page, and choose ‚ÄúAgent‚Äù to work on that tab. Right now, Agent is limited to a single tab, and it is way too slow to delegate anything for real to it. Click accuracy for Agent is alright on normal web pages, but it will definitely trip up if you ask it to use something like Google Sheets.\\nOne ambient feature that I think many people will like is ‚Äúselect to rewrite‚Äù - You can select any text in Atlas, hover/click on the blue dot in the top right corner to rewrite it using AI.\\n\\n\\n\\n\\nYou can also share your browsing history and access it in ChatGPT as a form of memory. That seems to be the bet to make Atlas sticky, but I haven‚Äôt been a fan of Memory in general. Searching in Atlas defaults to ChatGPT but has a few panes you can switch to, including one for your 10 blue links, one for images and a couple more. Overall, it feels like a beta version with too many gaps yet to be filled.\\nGoogle AI Studio has had a vibe-coding mode since May, but they have upgraded the experience a lot since then. It is one of the fastest ways to build with Gemini models and have Gemini-based features in your apps. The app files are saved to your drive, can be pushed to GitHub, and you can preview and deploy them as well. This is one of the unique features of the developer console of a major AI lab. Related: Web traffic for AI Studio has also been growing rapidly since last year.\\nNEW: Our ‚ÄòBen‚Äôs Bites AI expert matching service‚Äô has launched! h/t to my brother, Adam for building it with Shanice. If you‚Äôre an AI dev or no-code/automation expert, list yourself and get hired. If you‚Äôre a company needing AI projects built, post jobs and connect with the right people. We‚Äôll be trialling a personalised matching service soon too.\\n\\n\\n\\n\\n\\n\\n\\n\\n\\n\\n\\n\\n\\n üåê What I‚Äôm consuming\\n\\nUse the saw, fear the saw - Don‚Äôt stop making powerful (and potentially dangerous) tools; rather, we should empower people to use them safely.\\n\\nNeural audio codecs - how to get audio into LLMs.\\n\\nZero Framework Cognition: A way to build resilient AI applications.\\n\\nAI is making us work more - How the AI boom revived a 996 work culture.\\n\\nThere is no God Tier video model.\\n\\nHow people at Cursor use Cursor.\\n\\nAs you know, I‚Äôm learning to be more technical so the Solve It With Code course by Jeremy Howard (Inventor of the LLM) & Eric Ries (The Lean Startup) is one course I‚Äôm taking - I‚Äôve learnt a ton from both of them over the years. Their method teaches how to think with AI, not just prompt. Break challenges into small pieces, build iteratively. Starts Nov 3 with 5 weeks of live problem-solving. Bonus: Access to their Solveit platform. Join here. \\nAlso Andrej Karpathy set a challenge: ‚ÄúCan you take my 2h13m tokenizer video and translate [into] a book chapter‚Äù. and Solve It did - read it here.\\n\\n\\n\\n\\n\\n\\n\\n\\n\\n\\n\\n\\n\\n\\n‚öôÔ∏è  Tools and demos\\n\\nSpeechmatics gives your Voice AI Agents the best ears in AI. Capture who said what in noisy, heavily accented, multi-speaker conversations. Get $200 free üëÇ*\\n\\nWorkflow Debugger by LlamaIndex - Visualise a multi-agent workflow, with human-in-the-loop support and runtime comparisons.\\n\\nLovable now integrates with Shopify, allowing you to create a storefront and make it live.\\n\\nDirector - Free app to automate web tasks with a single prompt.\\n\\nSpiral by Every - Write content you‚Äôre proud of with AI. (blog)\\n\\nElevenLabs Voice Isolator now supports video - Clean up the audio in your videos to match studio-grade quality.\\n\\nClaude Desktop app now supports speech input, quick access and more.\\n\\nSemantic Art - Instead of generating art, discover what humans have already created.\\n\\n\\n\\n\\n\\n\\n\\n\\n\\n\\n\\n\\n\\n\\n ü•£ Dev dish\\n\\nX finally has a pay-per-use API for developers to build upon. But it‚Äôs still too expensive‚Äîwe pull 30-40k tweets per month to look for AI-relevant tweets from our feed, and that‚Äôs easily $200/mo.\\n\\nGPT-5 Image Mini is now available on OpenRouter.\\n\\nACP - A protocol for connecting any editor to any agent.\\n\\nChandra - A highly accurate OCR model that converts images and PDFs into structured HTML/Markdown/JSON while preserving layout information.\\n\\nScrapybara is sunsetting its product for spinning up remote desktop instances for computer use agents. As a result, they have open-sourced a part of their codebase.\\n\\n\\n\\nüí∞ Who got that bag?\\n\\nLangchain raised $125M at a $1.25B valuation.\\n\\nSesame (the viral voice demo makers) has raised $250M Series B led by Sequoia and opened an iOS beta.\\n\\nTempo Labs has raised $5M to let design engineers collaborate on production codebases.\\n\\n\\n\\nüç¶ Afters\\n\\nThe context engineering hackathon - Make agents and compete against pre-defined evals, not demo-ware. Last few slots left for the rest of the year.\",\"enclosure\":{\"url\":\"https://substack-post-media.s3.amazonaws.com/public/images/bbe99d31-6b1e-4b38-8de6-b5ace0215300_1472x836.png\",\"length\":\"0\",\"type\":\"image/jpeg\"},\"content\":\"Find AI experts for your business\",\"contentSnippet\":\"Find AI experts for your business\",\"guid\":\"https://www.bensbites.com/p/openais-new-product\",\"isoDate\":\"2025-10-23T13:20:25.000Z\",\"itunes\":{}},\"pairedItem\":{\"item\":14}},{\"json\":{\"title\":\"My name is Claudius Maximus Promptus\",\"link\":\"https://www.bensbites.com/p/my-name-is-claudius-maximus-promptus\",\"pubDate\":\"Tue, 21 Oct 2025 13:05:36 GMT\",\"content:encoded\":\"<p><em>The newsletter for the technically curious. Updates, tool reviews, and lay of the land from an exited founder turned investor and forever tinkerer.</em></p><p class=\\\"button-wrapper\\\" data-attrs=\\\"{&quot;url&quot;:&quot;https://www.bensbites.com/subscribe?&quot;,&quot;text&quot;:&quot;Subscribe now&quot;,&quot;action&quot;:null,&quot;class&quot;:null}\\\" data-component-name=\\\"ButtonCreateButton\\\"><a class=\\\"button primary\\\" href=\\\"https://www.bensbites.com/subscribe?\\\"><span>Subscribe now</span></a></p><div><hr></div><p>Hey folks,</p><p>&#8216;Anthropic is on fire&#8217; would be an understatement for last weekend. They released Skills across all Claude products, Claude Code on the web, plus a couple of side quests here and there.</p><p><a href=\\\"https://www.anthropic.com/news/skills\\\">Skills are folders</a> (downloadable as zip files) that contain two things: 1. a Skill.md file and 2. other files relevant to that skill (more .md descriptions, maybe a .py script, and more). First 3-4 lines of Skill.md are reserved for metadata (like name, description). Metadata for all installed skills gets added to Claude&#8217;s context every time, but Claude can choose to expand Skill.md and then the rest of the relevant files. Anthropic has a collection of <a href=\\\"https://github.com/anthropics/skills\\\">pre-built skills hidden away in this repo</a>. </p><ul><li><p><a href=\\\"https://x.com/simonw/status/1978935386496995811\\\">Simon thinks Skills</a> are a bigger deal than MCP.</p></li><li><p>Keshav and I built our version of skills a couple of months earlier, which are strikingly similar to this.</p></li><li><p><a href=\\\"https://github.com/yusufkaraaslan/Skill_Seekers\\\">Skill Seekers</a> - A repo to scrape any documentation page and convert it into a Claude skill. (<a href=\\\"https://doc2skill.com/\\\">an easy-to-use hosted version</a>).</p></li><li><p>But beware! Don&#8217;t install Skills randomly from anywhere; they can be easily <a href=\\\"https://medium.com/@yossifqassim/weaponizing-claude-code-skills-from-5-5-to-remote-shell-a14af2d109c9\\\">weaponised</a>.</p></li></ul><p>Next up, <strong><a href=\\\"https://www.anthropic.com/news/claude-code-on-the-web\\\">Claude Code is now available on the web</a></strong> &#8212; go to <a href=\\\"https://claude.ai/code\\\">claude.ai/code</a>, and you can queue up multiple tasks in parallel across different GitHub repositories. <a href=\\\"https://www.anthropic.com/news/claude-for-life-sciences\\\">Every, as ever, has produced a review</a> which is worth a read. As is <a href=\\\"https://simonwillison.net/2025/Oct/20/claude-code-for-web/\\\">Simon Willison&#8217;s</a>.</p><p>Claude Code also got two new tools (available in the terminal): </p><ol><li><p>First one to display a <a href=\\\"https://x.com/trq212/status/1979215901577875812\\\">new interactive question UI</a> with multiple questions and certain choices to select for each (and blank space to answer subjectively).</p></li><li><p><a href=\\\"https://www.anthropic.com/engineering/claude-code-sandboxing\\\">Sandbox</a> to define what Claude can access (locally and remotely) to make working with it more secure. Run /sandbox to configure it, and the tool is <a href=\\\"https://github.com/anthropic-experimental/sandbox-runtime\\\">open-source.</a></p></li></ol><p>On side quests, Anthopic is launching a program called <a href=\\\"https://www.anthropic.com/news/claude-for-life-sciences\\\">Claude for Life Sciences</a> and adding <a href=\\\"https://x.com/iaincheeseman/status/1980322620055908462\\\">new integrations</a> for it. It&#8217;s also cosying up with Microsoft, <a href=\\\"https://www.anthropic.com/news/productivity-platforms\\\">connecting Claude to all of the Office 365 tools</a> while trying to eat Glean&#8217;s lunch by offering Enterprise Search to the Claude Team and Enterprise plans.</p><p>OpenAI is planning a <strong>&#8220;<a href=\\\"https://www.theinformation.com/articles/openais-growing-ecosystem-play\\\">Sign in with ChatGPT</a></strong>&#8221; option and pitching it to other companies. Companies that agree can let users use their ChatGPT quota to access AI features on their tools.</p><p><strong><a href=\\\"https://getmocha.com/?utm_source=bensbiteoct&amp;utm_medium=newsletter&amp;utm_campaign=primary\\\">Mocha</a> is an all-in-one tool for building real apps</strong>, no duct tape required. It packs in a backend with auth, payments, hosting and database&#8212;no need to juggle Supabase, or even have a Github account. Launch in minutes, scale without glue. &#128073;  <a href=\\\"https://getmocha.com/?utm_source=bensbiteoct&amp;utm_medium=newsletter&amp;utm_campaign=primary\\\">Join 100,000+ founders</a> to start building your ideas today.*</p><div><hr></div><h3><strong> </strong>&#127760;<strong> </strong>What I&#8217;m consuming</h3><ul><li><p><a href=\\\"https://www.thedeepview.com/articles/how-sf-compute-corners-to-offtake-market\\\">It pays to be a middleman</a> - how SF compute corners to offtake market.</p></li><li><p>Using AI to <a href=\\\"https://x.com/maccaw/status/1978873571771568637\\\">generate 100% of my code</a> over the last few months.</p></li><li><p>3 ways <a href=\\\"https://rlancemartin.github.io/2025/10/15/manus/\\\">Manus engineers context</a> for its agent.</p></li><li><p><a href=\\\"https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=RqWIvvv3SnQ\\\">How GPT-5 thinks</a>, with OpenAI&#8217;s VP of Research.</p></li><li><p><a href=\\\"https://florianbrand.de/posts/local-llms\\\">Local models</a> are (not) cope.</p></li><li><p>Evaluating <a href=\\\"https://nrehiew.github.io/blog/long_context/\\\">long context reasoning</a> ability and introducing a new benchmark.</p></li><li><p><a href=\\\"https://ideas.fin.ai/p/a-tale-of-two-agent-builders\\\">A tale of two Agent Builders</a> - Two competing solutions to the same design problem in AI interfaces.</p></li><li><p><a href=\\\"https://x.com/voooooogel/status/1979469389109010871\\\">LLM psychosis</a> isn&#8217;t, generally, psychosis.</p></li><li><p><a href=\\\"https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=lXUZvyajciY\\\">Andrej Karpathy on Dwarkesh&#8217;s podcast</a>&#8212;I&#8217;m 30% into it, and I have just one recommendation: don&#8217;t listen to commentaries on the podcast; instead, listen to it. Everyone has their own take that benefits what they want to sell you.</p></li></ul><div id=\\\"youtube2-lXUZvyajciY\\\" class=\\\"youtube-wrap\\\" data-attrs=\\\"{&quot;videoId&quot;:&quot;lXUZvyajciY&quot;,&quot;startTime&quot;:null,&quot;endTime&quot;:null}\\\" data-component-name=\\\"Youtube2ToDOM\\\"><div class=\\\"youtube-inner\\\"><iframe src=\\\"https://www.youtube-nocookie.com/embed/lXUZvyajciY?rel=0&amp;autoplay=0&amp;showinfo=0&amp;enablejsapi=0\\\" frameborder=\\\"0\\\" loading=\\\"lazy\\\" gesture=\\\"media\\\" allow=\\\"autoplay; fullscreen\\\" allowautoplay=\\\"true\\\" allowfullscreen=\\\"true\\\" width=\\\"728\\\" height=\\\"409\\\"></iframe></div></div><div><hr></div><h3>&#9881;&#65039;  Tools and demos</h3><ul><li><p>Tired of fixing your CRM instead of closing deals? <strong><a href=\\\"https://www.clarify.ai/?utm_source=newsletter&amp;utm_medium=tool_placement&amp;utm_campaign=bens_bites\\\">Clarify</a></strong> is the self-updating CRM that records calls, enriches, and updates in real time.*</p></li><li><p>Everyone wants to be an app builder. Manus, the general web agent, is also focusing heavily on app creation in its upgrade to <strong><a href=\\\"https://manus.im/blog/manus-1.5-release\\\">Manus 1.5</a></strong>.</p></li><li><p>Cline also has a CLI tool now, and Cline in your IDE can orchestrate <strong><a href=\\\"https://cline.bot/blog/cline-cli-return-to-the-primitives\\\">Cline CLI</a></strong> subagents.</p></li><li><p><strong><a href=\\\"https://docsalot.dev/\\\">DocsAlot</a></strong> - Automatically generate and update documentation, tutorials, and blog posts as your code evolves.</p></li><li><p><strong><a href=\\\"https://tldw.us/\\\">TLDW</a></strong> -  Learn from long YouTube videos better &amp; faster. (<a href=\\\"https://github.com/SamuelZ12/tldw\\\">repo</a> and <a href=\\\"https://x.com/zarazhangrui/status/1980371308161482853\\\">examples</a>)</p></li><li><p><strong><a href=\\\"https://apps.apple.com/us/app/epilogue-ambient-reading/id6751764862\\\">Epilogue</a></strong> - Record your natural thoughts, capture quotes, and explore questions while you&#8217;re reading.</p></li><li><p><strong><a href=\\\"https://e2b.dev/blog/introducing-build-system-2-0\\\">E2B Build System 2.0</a></strong> - A faster and simpler way to create custom sandboxes.</p></li><li><p><strong><a href=\\\"https://x.com/charliebholtz/status/1978111678421049407\\\">Code Review in Conductor</a></strong> - Comment on diffs generated by Claude Code, and send them back to get fixed.</p></li><li><p><strong><a href=\\\"https://alloy.app/\\\">Alloy.app</a></strong> - Prototype with your real product (vs. vibe coding from scratch).</p></li><li><p><strong><a href=\\\"https://trydunbar.com/\\\">Dunbar</a></strong> - Replace cold emails with warm intros by searching through your existing network. One of my recent investments</p></li></ul><div class=\\\"captioned-image-container\\\"><figure><a class=\\\"image-link image2 is-viewable-img\\\" target=\\\"_blank\\\" y2=\\\"14\\\"></line></svg></button></div></div></div></a></figure></div><div><hr></div><h3>&#128268; MCP Matters</h3><ul><li><p><strong><a href=\\\"https://x.com/Context7AI/status/1978928358768418900\\\">Default Context by Context7</a></strong> now auto-generates library documentation using Claude models, even if its repo has zero docs.</p></li><li><p><strong><a href=\\\"https://x.com/p0/status/1978876953735188840\\\">Parallel Task MCP Server</a></strong> - The first async MCP server for complex research tasks that can work in the background.</p></li></ul><div><hr></div><h3> &#129379; Dev dish</h3><ul><li><p>I&#8217;m hearing LLMs are better at writing Swift than React &#8212; so if you&#8217;re vibe-coding a desktop app, you might want to try making a native MacOS app  instead of an Electron app. (exhibit - Ivan built a <a href=\\\"https://x.com/andout_/status/1978452991284822194\\\">working clone of Apple Notes</a> in 30 mins)</p></li><li><p><a href=\\\"https://developers.googleblog.com/en/say-hello-to-a-new-level-of-interactivity-in-gemini-cli/\\\">Gemini CLI</a> added a new feature to let you use the same terminal window (where it&#8217;s running) to run other commands, keeping them in Gemini&#8217;s context. Gemini API now offers support for <a href=\\\"https://blog.google/technology/developers/grounding-google-maps-gemini-api/\\\">Grounding with Google Maps</a>. It&#8217;s one of the unique AI features I&#8217;ve seen (<a href=\\\"https://aistudio.google.com/apps/bundled/chat_with_maps_live\\\">demo app</a>).</p></li><li><p><a href=\\\"https://x.com/pvncher/status/1978918200101229013\\\">RepoPrompt 1.5</a> - Build context that fits a certain token budget, connect to your agent of choice and use your existing subscription.</p></li><li><p><a href=\\\"https://moondream.ai/blog/announcing-moondream-cloud\\\">Moondream Cloud</a> - Make cutting-edge vision applications without worrying about hosting a model.</p></li><li><p><a href=\\\"https://groq.com/blog/gpt-oss-improvements-prompt-caching-and-lower-pricing\\\">GPT-OSS is now 20-40% cheaper on Groq</a> with an additional 50% reduction from prompt caching.</p></li><li><p><a href=\\\"https://vercel.com/templates/ai/chatgpt-app-with-next-js\\\">Starter kit</a> to ship a ChatGPT app on Vercel with Next.js and MCP. Or maybe you wanna roll out your own <a href=\\\"https://github.com/vercel-labs/coding-agent-template\\\">web app to run Claude Code</a>, Codex or any CLI tool.</p></li><li><p><a href=\\\"https://github.com/trendy-design/llmchat\\\">llmchat</a> - Feature-rich chat app with local storage for your chats.</p></li><li><p><a href=\\\"https://github.com/firecrawl/open-agent-builder\\\">Open Agent Builder</a> - open source n8n-style workflow builder.</p></li><li><p>How to <a href=\\\"https://docs.together.ai/docs/how-to-build-a-lovable-clone-with-kimi-k2\\\">build a Lovable clone</a> with Kimi K2. </p></li></ul><div><hr></div><h3> &#128202; Charts you should see</h3><ul><li><p>Cognition has trained two new models, <strong><a href=\\\"https://cognition.ai/blog/swe-grep#where-to-try-fast-context\\\">SWE-grep and SWE-grep-mini</a></strong>, to search a codebase for relevant context to answer a question. These models are way faster than LLMs and have better performance. These are available in Windsurf as a &#8220;Fast Context&#8221; subagent that triggers automatically.</p></li></ul><div class=\\\"captioned-image-container\\\"><figure><a class=\\\"image-link image2 in Excel, you know how that goes) on <a href=\\\"https://spreadsheetbench.github.io/\\\">SpreadsheetBench</a>. There&#8217;s still quite a gap between the best score and humans.</p></li></ul><div class=\\\"captioned-image-container\\\"><figure><a class=\\\"image-link image2 is-viewable-img\\\" experiment where 6 models get $10000 to trade cryptocurrencies. It started a little over 90 hours ago, and Deepseek and Claude are up, while Gemini and GPT-5 are in the gutters. They call it a benchmark, but I doubt it&#8217;s a good one.</p></li></ul><div class=\\\"captioned-image-container\\\"><figure><a class=\\\"image-link image2 is-viewable-img\\\" target=\\\"_blank\\\" class=\\\"image-caption\\\">SimilarWeb&#8217;s data on AI web traffic share in the past 12 months</figcaption></figure></div><div><hr></div><h3> &#128176; Who got that bag?</h3><ul><li><p><a href=\\\"https://x.com/_WEEXIAO/status/1978498477580542334\\\">Osmosis raised $7M</a> to fine-tune models for other companies.</p></li><li><p><a href=\\\"https://x.com/christianbowens/status/1977978113138082143\\\">Clove raised $14M</a> (founded by ex-CEO of Paddle) to make AI your financial guide.</p></li><li><p><a href=\\\"https://reducto.ai/blog/reducto-series-b-funding\\\">Reducto raised $75M Series B</a> for production-ready document parsing.</p></li><li><p><a href=\\\"https://x.com/gen_intuition/status/1978823244338659498\\\">General Intuition</a> spins out of Medal with their $133M seed raise to build foundational models.</p></li></ul><div><hr></div><h3>&#127846; Afters</h3><ul><li><p>Leann and Autumn are <a href=\\\"https://x.com/akcushman/status/1978671596215628278\\\">hiring founding engineers</a> + operators.</p></li><li><p><a href=\\\"https://www.worldlabs.ai/blog/rtfm\\\">World Labs</a> has trained another interactive model where you can walk through a generated environment. <a href=\\\"https://rtfm.worldlabs.ai/\\\">Demo here</a>.</p></li><li><p>Uber is now <a href=\\\"https://x.com/bearlyai/status/1979600383908761888\\\">letting drivers label data</a> to get paid while they wait.</p></li></ul><div><hr></div><div class=\\\"captioned-button-wrap\\\"
