href=\"https://www.animeleak.com/\">via AnimeLeak</a></figcaption></figure></div><div><hr></div><h3>&#129379; Dev dish</h3><ul><li><p><a href=\"https://nextjs.org/evals\">NextJS has its own evals now</a>. It tests AI models on how many failing tests in a NextJS project a model can fix. GPT-5 Codex performs the best by fixing 42% of the tests, but Codex, the agent, solves only 30% (vs Claude Code&#8217;s 42% again). So, I'm not sure how reliable these results are.</p></li><li><p>Might wanna run this command to <a href=\"https://x.com/ryancarson/status/1982887330856792237\">review your PRs</a> before you submit them.</p></li><li><p><a href=\"https://github.com/allenai/olmocr\">OlmoOCR</a> - Convert PDFs/image-based documents into clean plain text on your device.</p></li><li><p>New <a href=\"https://x.com/trychroma/status/1983625513244750304\">Search() API by Chroma</a> - Get the best of both worlds with a hybrid search that combines vector search with metadata filtering and custom ranking.</p></li></ul><div><hr></div><h3>&#128176; Who got that bag?</h3><ul><li><p><strong><a href=\"https://cartesia.ai/sonic\">Cartesia AI</a></strong> released a new speech generation model, Sonic-3, and raised $100M.</p></li></ul><ul><li><p><strong><a href=\"https://fireworks.ai/blog/series-c\">Fireworks AI</a></strong> (model hosting platform) has raised $250M Series C at a $4B valuation.</p></li><li><p><strong><a href=\"https://mem0.ai/series-a\">Mem0</a></strong> (memory for AI) raised $24M in Seed and Series A.</p></li></ul><div><hr></div><h3>&#128587; How do I&#8230;</h3><ul><li><p><strong>ask data questions and get answers, right in my Slack?</strong></p></li></ul><p>Three easy steps, takes less than 5 minutes:</p><ol><li><p>Securely connect your DB to Julius (Postgres, BigQuery, Snowflake, Supabase, MySQL + more supported)</p></li><li><p>Enable Slack Agent (<a href=\"https://t.co/tNGIC825FG\">http://julius.ai/data-connectors</a>) </p></li><li><p>Create a <em>#ask-data</em> Slack channel and invite `@juliusai` to the channel</p></li></ol><p>More docs here: <a href=\"https://julius.ai/docs/slack-agent/overview\">Julius&#8217; Slack Agent overview</a>.</p><ul><li><p><strong>create marketing posters just with my website URL?</strong></p></li></ul><p>like <a href=\"https://x.com/venturetwins/status/1983556734062043587\">this one</a>? You got it. Go to this new tool from Google Labs called <a href=\"https://labs.google.com/pomelli/about/\">Pomelli</a>. </p><ul><li><p>It picks up business DNA - Your brand colours, fonts and assets from your website. </p></li><li><p>It ideates on campaigns that you can run (and you can guide it via prompts).</p></li><li><p>It generates the ads, and you can edit them to your liking (with some limitations).</p></li></ul><p>See the <a href=\"https://x.com/venturetwins/status/1983557283352387637\">full tutorial by Justine</a>.</p><ul><li><p><strong>make a &#8220;good&#8221; chat with X feature without complex code?</strong></p></li></ul><p>hmm, this one&#8217;s not easy. You&#8217;ll need to make multiple tools, manage context between them. allow dozens of API calls&#8230; I&#8217;m just kidding,</p><ul><li><p>send your prompt to <em>droid exec</em>.</p></li><li><p>That&#8217;s it.</p></li></ul><p>More here: <a href=\"https://docs.factory.ai/guides/building/droid-exec-tutorial\">Building interactive apps with Droid Exec</a></p><div><hr></div><h3>&#127846; Afters</h3><ul><li><p>Find out what integrating AI looks like for healthcare, education or urban policy on Nov 7th-8th. Sign up for <a href=\"https://www.eventbrite.com/e/techequity-ai-summit-2025-silicon-valley-tickets-1123010748379?aff=BENSBITES\">TechEquity&#8217;s Ai Summit</a> (visit the link and use the code BENSBITES20 for a 20% discount.)</p></li><li><p>Two new measures of model capabilities:</p><ul><li><p><a href=\"https://epoch.ai/benchmarks\">ECI by Epoch AI</a>, meant to normalise multiple benchmarks to track progress across a longer time period. </p></li><li><p><a href=\"https://scale.com/leaderboard/rli\">RLI - Remote Labor Index</a> from Scale AI and Center for AI Safety. An attempt to measure how much real-world, economically valuable remote work the models/agents can do.</p></li></ul></li><li><p>New AI wearable in the market - <a href=\"https://x.com/sandbar/status/1983167124874113451\">Stream Ring by Sandbar</a>.</p></li><li><p>YouTube plans to <a href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2025-10-29/youtube-will-use-ai-to-sharpen-lower-resolution-videos-on-tvs\">upscale old videos</a> to HD using AI.</p></li></ul><div><hr></div><div class=\"captioned-button-wrap\" data-attrs=\"{&quot;url&quot;:&quot;https://www.bensbites.com/p/not-a-wrapper-anymore?utm_source=substack&utm_medium=email&utm_content=share&action=share&quot;,&quot;text&quot;:&quot;Share&quot;}\" data-component-name=\"CaptionedButtonToDOM\"><div class=\"preamble\"><p class=\"cta-caption\">Enjoy this newsletter? Forward it to a friend.</p></div><p class=\"button-wrapper\" data-attrs=\"{&quot;url&quot;:&quot;https://www.bensbites.com/p/not-a-wrapper-anymore?utm_source=substack&utm_medium=email&utm_content=share&action=share&quot;,&quot;text&quot;:&quot;Share&quot;}\" data-component-name=\"ButtonCreateButton\"><a class=\"button primary\" href=\"https://www.bensbites.com/p/not-a-wrapper-anymore?utm_source=substack&utm_medium=email&utm_content=share&action=share\"><span>Share</span></a></p></div><p>That&#8217;s it for today. Feel free to comment and share your thoughts. &#128075;</p><ul><li><p>Find me on <a href=\"https://x.com/bentossell/\">X</a>, <a href=\"https://www.linkedin.com/in/ben-tossell-70453537/\">Linkedin</a>, or <a href=\"https://instagram.com/bentossell\">Instagram</a></p></li><li><p>Read <a href=\"https://bensbites.substack.com/about\">about me</a> and Ben&#8217;s Bites</p></li><li><p>&#128247; thumbnail creds: <a href=\"https://x.com/Keshavatearth\">@keshavatearth</a>,</p></li></ul><blockquote><h6><em>Thanks to today&#8217;s sponsors who made this newsletter possible :)</em></h6><h6><em>Attio, Speechmatics, AssemblyAI and Ai Summit. </em></h6><h6><em>Wanna <a href=\"https://sponsor.bensbites.co/\">partner with us</a>? Last few slots left for the rest of the year.</em></h6></blockquote><div><hr></div>","content:encodedSnippet":"The newsletter for the technically curious. Updates, tool reviews, and lay of the land from an exited founder turned investor and forever tinkerer.\nSubscribe now\n\n\nHey folks,\nI‚Äôm hosting a workshop tomorrow with Dan Shipper and Every. We‚Äôll talk about what CLIs are and dive into the Factory CLI, Droid. It‚Äôs aptly called, Droid Camp. Come and join us for an hour of informal demos, q&a and building!\nCursor and Windsurf both shipped their in-house models. Cursor 2.0 came with Composer-1 (and a new agent-first UI). Windsurf also released SWE-1.5. Both are better than Sonnet 4 but worse than Sonnet 4.5/GPT-5 Codex, have insane speeds and are built to perform the best inside their own platforms. \nThe Information reported that Anthropic and OpenAI are using Cognition‚Äôs coding tests, and Cursor is also using their internal benchmark (which they say they can‚Äôt make public) to show Composer‚Äôs performance. Simon made them both draw a pelican (Composer ‚Äî SWE-1.5), and Every feels the IDE in Cursor distracts you from Composer. \nI agree generally. IDEs are the old way, CLIs and these new agent UI‚Äôs are the new way for software engineering (although CLIs are technically old). I didn‚Äôt ever understand ‚Äòtab‚Äô (autocomplete) as a ‚Äòthing‚Äô - it reminded me of early ChatGPT days where people rushed to build autocomplete for text everywhere. It's fine, but it‚Äôs no leap in function or form.\nOpenAI finished its profit/non-profit reorg, and Sam Altman posted a tldr of a livestream he did with OpenAI‚Äôs chief scientist. It‚Äôs still pretty long, so here‚Äôs tldr of a tldr:\n\nAlready secured 30GW of compute commitments costing $1.4T.\n\nNon-profit owns 26% of the for-profit PBC (valued at $500B total), Microsoft owns 27% (rumour - OpenAI has plans for a trillion-dollar IPO)\n\nGoals to build an automated ‚ÄúAI researcher intern‚Äù by Sept 2026, drop the intern by 2028.\n\nThat‚Äôs not it, they released two new open-weights models under the name gpt-oss-safeguard: fine-tunes of the gpt-oss models with both 20B and 120B variants. Also, Sora has a new feature, Character Cameos (put your dog in your videos), and it‚Äôs available in three more countries, with open access for these (different) countries (i.e. no invite code needed).\nThe CEO of Warp ripped out Salesforce internally and moved entirely to Attio. His logic? ‚ÄúWe need something powerful, easy to use that makes us want to log in every day as opposed to feeling like a chore.‚Äù No surprise, his sales team was down for the switch. Are you?\n\n\n üåê What I‚Äôm consuming\n\nWhy AI voice agents fail at multi-speaker conversations ‚Äì and how to fix it.\n\nNew diligence challenge with AI - When a prototype performs better than the company you wanted to acquire.\n\nHow Rakuten replaced LLM-as-a-Judge with SAE probes for PII detection (while saving money).\n\nSigns of introspection in LLMs - Can Claude actually recognise its thoughts, or does it just make up explanations when asked about them?\n\nCursor 2.0‚Äôs system prompt in an easy-to-explore artifact (hunted by elder_plinius). \n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n‚öôÔ∏è Tools and demos\n\nLLM Gateway - Combine AssemblyAI‚Äôs fast & accurate speech models with GPT-5, Claude, and more.\n\nSuperhuman Go - Grammarly is renaming itself to Superhuman (they acquired the email company a while ago) and launching an assistant that can connect to your email, docs, company data and of course fix your typos. \n\nOdyssey-2 - Generate an instant AI video that you can interact with.\n\nKaizen - Build browser automations and never do a data entry task twice.\n\nAriana, not Grande, it‚Äôs another parallel coding agents app. If you‚Äôre planning to make a text-to-app tool, pivot to ‚ÄúUI for Claude Code‚Äù hah.\n\nAnime Leak - Put funky art in your real pictures.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nvia AnimeLeak\n\n\nü•£ Dev dish\n\nNextJS has its own evals now. It tests AI models on how many failing tests in a NextJS project a model can fix. GPT-5 Codex performs the best by fixing 42% of the tests, but Codex, the agent, solves only 30% (vs Claude Code‚Äôs 42% again). So, I'm not sure how reliable these results are.\n\nMight wanna run this command to review your PRs before you submit them.\n\nOlmoOCR - Convert PDFs/image-based documents into clean plain text on your device.\n\nNew Search() API by Chroma - Get the best of both worlds with a hybrid search that combines vector search with metadata filtering and custom ranking.\n\n\n\nüí∞ Who got that bag?\n\nCartesia AI released a new speech generation model, Sonic-3, and raised $100M.\n\n\nFireworks AI (model hosting platform) has raised $250M Series C at a $4B valuation.\n\nMem0 (memory for AI) raised $24M in Seed and Series A.\n\n\n\nüôã How do I‚Ä¶\n\nask data questions and get answers, right in my Slack?\n\nThree easy steps, takes less than 5 minutes:\n\nSecurely connect your DB to Julius (Postgres, BigQuery, Snowflake, Supabase, MySQL + more supported)\n\nEnable Slack Agent (http://julius.ai/data-connectors) \n\nCreate a #ask-data Slack channel and invite `@juliusai` to the channel\n\nMore docs here: Julius‚Äô Slack Agent overview.\n\ncreate marketing posters just with my website URL?\n\nlike this one? You got it. Go to this new tool from Google Labs called Pomelli. \n\nIt picks up business DNA - Your brand colours, fonts and assets from your website. \n\nIt ideates on campaigns that you can run (and you can guide it via prompts).\n\nIt generates the ads, and you can edit them to your liking (with some limitations).\n\nSee the full tutorial by Justine.\n\nmake a ‚Äúgood‚Äù chat with X feature without complex code?\n\nhmm, this one‚Äôs not easy. You‚Äôll need to make multiple tools, manage context between them. allow dozens of API calls‚Ä¶ I‚Äôm just kidding,\n\nsend your prompt to droid exec.\n\nThat‚Äôs it.\n\nMore here: Building interactive apps with Droid Exec\n\n\nüç¶ Afters\n\nFind out what integrating AI looks like for healthcare, education or urban policy on Nov 7th-8th. Sign up for TechEquity‚Äôs Ai Summit (visit the link and use the code BENSBITES20 for a 20% discount.)\n\nTwo new measures of model capabilities:\n\nECI by Epoch AI, meant to normalise multiple benchmarks to track progress across a longer time period. \n\nRLI - Remote Labor Index from Scale AI and Center for AI Safety. An attempt to measure how much real-world, economically valuable remote work the models/agents can do.\n\n\nNew AI wearable in the market - Stream Ring by Sandbar.\n\nYouTube plans to upscale old videos to HD using AI.\n\n\n\n\nEnjoy this newsletter? Articles on Grokipedia aggressively cite sources from the web, with most generated pages at 200+ citations. href=\"https://openai.com/index/strengthening-chatgpt-responses-in-sensitive-conversations/\">Making GPT-5 safe</a></strong> - OpenAI updated GPT-5 earlier this month with guidance from mental health experts. The new model performs as desired 91% of the time vs the old average of 77%. Cursor for Google Docs.\n\nGumloop Agents - Build agents that can decide which tools and workflows to use to complete your tasks.\n\nReact Grab - Select an element, give it to AI as context and make a change to your page.\n\nKimi CLI - Open-source hybrid of a shell and a coding agent written in Python.\n\nTinker by Thinking Machines now also supports gpt-oss models and DeepSeek v3.1\n\n\n\nüìä Charts you should see\n\nMiniMax-M2, another model from China, scores just a little shy of Sonnet 4.5 and it is also open-source.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nMaking GPT-5 safe - OpenAI updated GPT-5 earlier this month with guidance from mental health experts. Updates, tool reviews, and lay of the land from an exited founder turned investor and forever tinkerer.</em></p><p class=\"button-wrapper\" data-attrs=\"{&quot;url&quot;:&quot;https://www.bensbites.com/subscribe?&quot;,&quot;text&quot;:&quot;Subscribe now&quot;,&quot;action&quot;:null,&quot;class&quot;:null}\" data-component-name=\"ButtonCreateButton\"><a class=\"button primary\" href=\"https://www.bensbites.com/subscribe?\"><span>Subscribe now</span></a></p><div><hr></div><p>Hey folks,</p><p>We missed our own 3rd birthday! 10th October 2025 marks three years since I started writing this newsletter. So grateful for all of you along for the ride and all the AI tools keeping us busy for so long &#128517;.</p><p>The latest entry in AI browsers is <strong><a href=\"https://chatgpt.com/atlas\">Atlas - A new browser from OpenAI.</a></strong> Atlas would feel similar to Dia or Comet if you&#8217;ve used them. It has an &#8220;Ask ChatGPT&#8221; sidebar that has the context of your page, and choose &#8220;Agent&#8221; to work on that tab. Right now, Agent is limited to a single tab, and it is way too slow to delegate anything for real to it. Click accuracy for Agent is alright on normal web pages, but it will definitely trip up if you ask it to use something like Google Sheets.</p><p>One ambient feature that I think many people will like is &#8220;select to rewrite&#8221; - You can select any text in Atlas, hover/click on the blue dot in the top right corner to rewrite it using AI.</p><div 1456w\" sizes=\"100vw\" fetchpriority=\"high\"></picture><div></div></div></a></figure></div><p>You can also share your browsing history and access it in ChatGPT as a form of memory. That seems to be the bet to make Atlas sticky, but I haven&#8217;t been a fan of Memory in general. Searching in Atlas defaults to ChatGPT but has a few panes you can switch to, including one for your 10 blue links, one for images and a couple more. Overall, it feels like a beta version with too many gaps yet to be filled.</p><p><strong><a href=\"https://aistudio.google.com/apps\">Google AI Studio has had a vibe-coding mode</a></strong> since May, but they have upgraded the experience a lot since then. It is one of the fastest ways to build with Gemini models and have Gemini-based features in your apps. The app files are saved to your drive, can be pushed to GitHub, and you can preview and deploy them as well. This is one of the unique features of the developer console of a major AI lab. Related: <a href=\"https://x.com/Similarweb/status/1980980648929325066\">Web traffic for AI Studio</a> has also been growing rapidly since last year.</p><p><strong>NEW:</strong> Our <strong>&#8216;Ben&#8217;s Bites AI expert matching service&#8217;</strong> has <a href=\"https://experts.bensbites.com/\">launched</a>! h/t to my brother, Adam for building it with Shanice. If you&#8217;re an AI dev or no-code/automation expert, list yourself and get hired. If you&#8217;re a company needing AI projects built, post jobs and connect with the right people. We&#8217;ll be trialling a personalised matching service soon too.</p><div class=\"captioned-image-container\"><figure><a class=\"image-link image2 is-viewable-img\" target=\"_blank\" </strong>&#127760;<strong> </strong>What I&#8217;m consuming</h3><ul><li><p><a href=\"https://x.com/kepano/status/1980332114034979147\">Use the saw, fear the saw</a> - Don&#8217;t stop making powerful (and potentially dangerous) tools; rather, we should empower people to use them safely.</p></li><li><p><a href=\"https://kyutai.org/next/codec-explainer\">Neural audio codecs</a> - how to get audio into LLMs.</p></li><li><p><a href=\"https://steve-yegge.medium.com/zero-framework-cognition-a-way-to-build-resilient-ai-applications-56b090ed3e69\">Zero Framework Cognition</a>: A way to build resilient AI applications.</p></li><li><p><a href=\"https://tawandamunongo.dev/posts/2025/10/ai-work-more\">AI is making us work more</a> - How the AI boom revived a 996 work culture.</p></li><li><p>There is no <a href=\"https://a16z.substack.com/p/there-is-no-god-tier-video-model\">God Tier video model</a>.</p></li><li><p><a href=\"https://x.com/ericzakariasson/status/1981004383824589132\">How people at Cursor use Cursor</a>.</p></li><li><p>As you know, <strong>I&#8217;m learning to be more technical</strong> so the <a href=\"https://solve.it.com/?via_id=6jwqcp22_bensbites\">Solve It With Code course</a> by Jeremy Howard (Inventor of the LLM) &amp; Eric Ries (The Lean Startup) is one course I&#8217;m taking - I&#8217;ve learnt a ton from both of them over the years. Their method teaches how to think <em>with</em> AI, not just prompt. Break challenges into small pieces, build iteratively. <strong>Starts Nov 3 with 5 weeks of live problem-solving. Bonus: Access to their Solveit platform. <a href=\"https://solve.it.com/?via_id=6jwqcp22_bensbites\">Join here</a>.</strong> <br>Also Andrej Karpathy set a challenge: &#8220;Can you take my 2h13m tokenizer video and translate [into] a book chapter&#8221;. and Solve It did - read it <a href=\"https://www.fast.ai/posts/2025-10-16-karpathy-tokenizers\">here</a>.</p></li></ul><div AI.</strong> Capture who said what in noisy, heavily accented, multi-speaker conversations. <a href=\"https://www.speechmatics.com/use-cases/ai-voice-agents?utm_source=taaft&amp;utm_medium=paid-media&amp;utm_campaign=voice-ai-agents-2025&amp;utm_content=newsletter\">Get $200 free &#128066;</a>*</p></li><li><p><strong><a href=\"http://isualize a multi-agent workflow, with complete support for human-in-the-loop and runtime comparisons.\">Workflow Debugger by LlamaIndex</a></strong> - Visualise a multi-agent workflow, with human-in-the-loop support and runtime comparisons.</p></li><li><p><strong><a href=\"https://x.com/lovable_dev/status/198065064709683635\">Lovable</a></strong><a href=\"https://x.com/lovable_dev/status/198065064709683635\"> now integrates with Shopify</a>, allowing you to create a storefront and make it live.</p></li><li><p><strong><a href=\"https://www.director.ai/\">Director</a></strong> - Free app to automate web tasks with a single prompt.</p></li><li><p><strong><a href=\"https://writewithspiral.com/\">Spiral</a> by Every</strong> - Write content you&#8217;re proud of with AI. (<a href=\"https://every.to/podcast/spiral-s-creator-on-why-better-writing-means-better-thinking\">blog</a>)</p></li><li><p><strong><a href=\"https://x.com/elevenlabsio/status/1980675502055534919\">ElevenLabs Voice Isolator</a></strong> now supports video - Clean up the audio in your videos to match studio-grade quality.</p></li><li><p><strong><a href=\"https://claude.com/download\">Claude Desktop</a></strong> app now supports speech input, quick access and more.</p></li><li><p><strong><a href=\"http://semantic.art\">Semantic Art</a></strong> - Instead of generating art, discover what humans have already created.</p></li></ul><div class=\"captioned-image-container\"><figure><a &#129379; Dev dish</h3><ul><li><p><a href=\"https://console.x.com/\">X finally has a pay-per-use API</a> for developers to build upon. But it&#8217;s still too expensive&#8212;we pull 30-40k tweets per month to look for AI-relevant tweets from our feed, and that&#8217;s easily $200/mo.</p></li><li><p><a href=\"https://openrouter.ai/openai/gpt-5-image-mini\">GPT-5 Image Mini</a> is now available on OpenRouter.</p></li><li><p><a href=\"https://github.com/agentclientprotocol\">ACP</a> - A protocol for connecting any editor to any agent.</p></li><li><p><a href=\"https://github.com/datalab-to/chandra\">Chandra</a> - A highly accurate OCR model that converts images and PDFs into structured HTML/Markdown/JSON while preserving layout information.</p></li><li><p><a href=\"https://github.com/Scrapybara/scrapybara-oss\">Scrapybara</a> is sunsetting its product for spinning up remote desktop instances for computer use agents. As a result, they have open-sourced a part of their codebase.</p></li></ul><div><hr></div><h3><strong>&#128176; Who got that bag?</strong></h3><ul><li><p><a href=\"https://blog.langchain.com/three-years-langchain/\">Langchain</a> raised $125M at a $1.25B valuation.</p></li><li><p><a href=\"https://www.sequoiacap.com/article/partnering-with-sesame-a-new-era-for-voice/\">Sesame</a> (the viral voice demo makers) has raised $250M Series B led by Sequoia and <a href=\"https://www.sesame.com/beta\">opened an iOS beta</a>.</p></li><li><p><a href=\"https://www.tempo.new/blog/5m-seed-design-engineering-movement\">Tempo Labs</a> has raised $5M to let design engineers collaborate on production codebases.</p></li></ul><div><hr></div><h3>&#127846; Afters</h3><ul><li><p>The context engineering hackathon - Make agents and compete against pre-defined evals, not demo-ware. Nov 15th in SF, <a href=\"https://theoryvc.com/blog-posts/americas-next-top-modeler\">sign up here</a>.</p></li><li><p><a href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2025-10-21/anthropic-google-in-talks-on-cloud-deal-worth-tens-of-billions\">Anthropic and Google</a> are in talks for a deal worth tens of billions for compute.</p></li><li><p>Samsung, Google and Qualcomm released an <a href=\"https://x.com/izadi_shahram/status/1980820058755805609\">Android headset, GalaxyXR</a>, with a bunch of Gemini features (at half the price of Apple Vision Pro).</p></li></ul><div><hr></div><div class=\"captioned-button-wrap\" data-attrs=\"{&quot;url&quot;:&quot;https://www.bensbites.com/p/openais-new-product?utm_source=substack&utm_medium=email&utm_content=share&action=share&quot;,&quot;text&quot;:&quot;Share&quot;}\" data-component-name=\"CaptionedButtonToDOM\"><div class=\"preamble\"><p class=\"cta-caption\">Enjoy this newsletter? Forward it to a friend.</p></div><p class=\"button-wrapper\" data-attrs=\"{&quot;url&quot;:&quot;https://www.bensbites.com/p/openais-new-product?utm_source=substack&utm_medium=email&utm_content=share&action=share&quot;,&quot;text&quot;:&quot;Share&quot;}\" data-component-name=\"ButtonCreateButton\"><a class=\"button primary\" href=\"https://www.bensbites.com/p/openais-new-product?utm_source=substack&utm_medium=email&utm_content=share&action=share\"><span>Share</span></a></p></div><p>That&#8217;s it for today. Updates, tool reviews, and lay of the land from an exited founder turned investor and forever tinkerer.\nSubscribe now\n\n\nHey folks,\nWe missed our own 3rd birthday! 10th October 2025 marks three years since I started writing this newsletter. So grateful for all of you along for the ride and all the AI tools keeping us busy for so long üòÖ.\nThe latest entry in AI browsers is Atlas - A new browser from OpenAI. Atlas would feel similar to Dia or Comet if you‚Äôve used them. It has an ‚ÄúAsk ChatGPT‚Äù sidebar that has the context of your page, and choose ‚ÄúAgent‚Äù to work on that tab. Right now, Agent is limited to a single tab, and it is way too slow to delegate anything for real to it. Click accuracy for Agent is alright on normal web pages, but it will definitely trip up if you ask it to use something like Google Sheets.\nOne ambient feature that I think many people will like is ‚Äúselect to rewrite‚Äù - You can select any text in Atlas, hover/click on the blue dot in the top right corner to rewrite it using AI.\n\n\n\n\nYou can also share your browsing history and access it in ChatGPT as a form of memory. That seems to be the bet to make Atlas sticky, but I haven‚Äôt been a fan of Memory in general. Searching in Atlas defaults to ChatGPT but has a few panes you can switch to, including one for your 10 blue links, one for images and a couple more. Overall, it feels like a beta version with too many gaps yet to be filled.\nGoogle AI Studio has had a vibe-coding mode since May, but they have upgraded the experience a lot since then. It is one of the fastest ways to build with Gemini models and have Gemini-based features in your apps. The app files are saved to your drive, can be pushed to GitHub, and you can preview and deploy them as well. This is one of the unique features of the developer console of a major AI lab. Related: Web traffic for AI Studio has also been growing rapidly since last year.\nNEW: Our ‚ÄòBen‚Äôs Bites AI expert matching service‚Äô has launched! h/t to my brother, Adam for building it with Shanice. If you‚Äôre an AI dev or no-code/automation expert, list yourself and get hired. If you‚Äôre a company needing AI projects built, post jobs and connect with the right people. We‚Äôll be trialling a personalised matching service soon too.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n üåê What I‚Äôm consuming\n\nUse the saw, fear the saw - Don‚Äôt stop making powerful (and potentially dangerous) tools; rather, we should empower people to use them safely.\n\nNeural audio codecs - how to get audio into LLMs.\n\nZero Framework Cognition: A way to build resilient AI applications.\n\nAI is making us work more - How the AI boom revived a 996 work culture.\n\nThere is no God Tier video model.\n\nHow people at Cursor use Cursor.\n\nAs you know, I‚Äôm learning to be more technical so the Solve It With Code course by Jeremy Howard (Inventor of the LLM) & Eric Ries (The Lean Startup) is one course I‚Äôm taking - I‚Äôve learnt a ton from both of them over the years. Their method teaches how to think with AI, not just prompt. Break challenges into small pieces, build iteratively. Starts Nov 3 with 5 weeks of live problem-solving. Bonus: Access to their Solveit platform. Join here. \nAlso Andrej Karpathy set a challenge: ‚ÄúCan you take my 2h13m tokenizer video and translate [into] a book chapter‚Äù. and Solve It did - read it here.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n‚öôÔ∏è  Tools and demos\n\nSpeechmatics gives your Voice AI Agents the best ears in AI. Capture who said what in noisy, heavily accented, multi-speaker conversations. Get $200 free üëÇ*\n\nWorkflow Debugger by LlamaIndex - Visualise a multi-agent workflow, with human-in-the-loop support and runtime comparisons.\n\nLovable now integrates with Shopify, allowing you to create a storefront and make it live.\n\nDirector - Free app to automate web tasks with a single prompt.\n\nSpiral by Every - Write content you‚Äôre proud of with AI. (blog)\n\nElevenLabs Voice Isolator now supports video - Clean up the audio in your videos to match studio-grade quality.\n\nClaude Desktop app now supports speech input, quick access and more.\n\nSemantic Art - Instead of generating art, discover what humans have already created.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n ü•£ Dev dish\n\nX finally has a pay-per-use API for developers to build upon. But it‚Äôs still too expensive‚Äîwe pull 30-40k tweets per month to look for AI-relevant tweets from our feed, and that‚Äôs easily $200/mo.\n\nGPT-5 Image Mini is now available on OpenRouter.\n\nACP - A protocol for connecting any editor to any agent.\n\nChandra - A highly accurate OCR model that converts images and PDFs into structured HTML/Markdown/JSON while preserving layout information.\n\nScrapybara is sunsetting its product for spinning up remote desktop instances for computer use agents. As a result, they have open-sourced a part of their codebase.\n\n\n\nüí∞ Who got that bag?\n\nLangchain raised $125M at a $1.25B valuation.\n\nSesame (the viral voice demo makers) has raised $250M Series B led by Sequoia and opened an iOS beta.\n\nTempo Labs has raised $5M to let design engineers collaborate on production codebases.\n\n\n\nüç¶ Afters\n\nThe context engineering hackathon - Make agents and compete against pre-defined evals, not demo-ware. Nov 15th in SF, sign up here.\n\nAnthropic and Google are in talks for a deal worth tens of billions for compute.\n\nSamsung, Google and Qualcomm released an Android headset, GalaxyXR, with a bunch of Gemini features (at half the price of Apple Vision Pro).\n\n\n\n\nEnjoy this newsletter? Updates, tool reviews, and lay of the land from an exited founder turned investor and forever tinkerer.</em></p><p class=\"button-wrapper\" data-attrs=\"{&quot;url&quot;:&quot;https://www.bensbites.com/subscribe?&quot;,&quot;text&quot;:&quot;Subscribe now&quot;,&quot;action&quot;:null,&quot;class&quot;:null}\" data-component-name=\"ButtonCreateButton\"><a class=\"button primary\" href=\"https://www.bensbites.com/subscribe?\"><span>Subscribe now</span></a></p><div><hr></div><p>Hey folks,</p><p>&#8216;Anthropic is on fire&#8217; would be an understatement for last weekend. They released Skills across all Claude products, Claude Code on the web, plus a couple of side quests here and there.</p><p><a href=\"https://www.anthropic.com/news/skills\">Skills are folders</a> (downloadable as zip files) that contain two things: 1. a Skill.md file and 2. other files relevant to that skill (more .md descriptions, maybe a .py script, and more). First 3-4 lines of Skill.md are reserved for metadata (like name, description). Metadata for all installed skills gets added to Claude&#8217;s context every time, but Claude can choose to expand Skill.md and then the rest of the relevant files. Anthropic has a collection of <a href=\"https://github.com/anthropics/skills\">pre-built skills hidden away in this repo</a>. </p><ul><li><p><a href=\"https://x.com/simonw/status/1978935386496995811\">Simon thinks Skills</a> are a bigger deal than MCP.</p></li><li><p>Keshav and I built our version of skills a couple of months earlier, which are strikingly similar to this.</p></li><li><p><a href=\"https://github.com/yusufkaraaslan/Skill_Seekers\">Skill Seekers</a> - A repo to scrape any documentation page and convert it into a Claude skill. (<a href=\"https://doc2skill.com/\">an easy-to-use hosted version</a>).</p></li><li><p>But beware! Don&#8217;t install Skills randomly from anywhere; they can be easily <a href=\"https://medium.com/@yossifqassim/weaponizing-claude-code-skills-from-5-5-to-remote-shell-a14af2d109c9\">weaponised</a>.</p></li></ul><p>Next up, <strong><a href=\"https://www.anthropic.com/news/claude-code-on-the-web\">Claude Code is now available on the web</a></strong> &#8212; go to <a href=\"https://claude.ai/code\">claude.ai/code</a>, and you can queue up multiple tasks in parallel across different GitHub repositories. <a href=\"https://www.anthropic.com/news/claude-for-life-sciences\">Every, as ever, has produced a review</a> which is worth a read. As is <a href=\"https://simonwillison.net/2025/Oct/20/claude-code-for-web/\">Simon Willison&#8217;s</a>.</p><p>Claude Code also got two new tools (available in the terminal): </p><ol><li><p>First one to display a <a href=\"https://x.com/trq212/status/1979215901577875812\">new interactive question UI</a> with multiple questions and certain choices to select for each (and blank space to answer subjectively).</p></li><li><p><a href=\"https://www.anthropic.com/engineering/claude-code-sandboxing\">Sandbox</a> to define what Claude can access (locally and remotely) to make working with it more secure. Run /sandbox to configure it, and the tool is <a href=\"https://github.com/anthropic-experimental/sandbox-runtime\">open-source.</a></p></li></ol><p>On side quests, Anthopic is launching a program called <a href=\"https://www.anthropic.com/news/claude-for-life-sciences\">Claude for Life Sciences</a> and adding <a href=\"https://x.com/iaincheeseman/status/1980322620055908462\">new integrations</a> for it. It&#8217;s also cosying up with Microsoft, <a href=\"https://www.anthropic.com/news/productivity-platforms\">connecting Claude to all of the Office 365 tools</a> while trying to eat Glean&#8217;s lunch by offering Enterprise Search to the Claude Team and Enterprise plans.</p><p>OpenAI is planning a <strong>&#8220;<a href=\"https://www.theinformation.com/articles/openais-growing-ecosystem-play\">Sign in with ChatGPT</a></strong>&#8221; option and pitching it to other companies. Companies that agree can let users use their ChatGPT quota to access AI features on their tools.</p><p><strong><a href=\"https://getmocha.com/?utm_source=bensbiteoct&amp;utm_medium=newsletter&amp;utm_campaign=primary\">Mocha</a> is an all-in-one tool for building real apps</strong>, no duct tape required. It packs in a backend with auth, payments, hosting and database&#8212;no need to juggle Supabase, or even have a Github account. Launch in minutes, scale without glue. &#128073;  <a href=\"https://getmocha.com/?utm_source=bensbiteoct&amp;utm_medium=newsletter&amp;utm_campaign=primary\">Join 100,000+ founders</a> to start building your ideas today.*</p><div><hr></div><h3><strong> </strong>&#127760;<strong> </strong>What I&#8217;m consuming</h3><ul><li><p><a href=\"https://www.thedeepview.com/articles/how-sf-compute-corners-to-offtake-market\">It pays to be a middleman</a> - how SF compute corners to offtake market.</p></li><li><p>Using AI to <a href=\"https://x.com/maccaw/status/1978873571771568637\">generate 100% of my code</a> over the last few months.</p></li><li><p>3 ways <a href=\"https://rlancemartin.github.io/2025/10/15/manus/\">Manus engineers context</a> for its agent.</p></li><li><p><a href=\"https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=RqWIvvv3SnQ\">How GPT-5 thinks</a>, with OpenAI&#8217;s VP of Research.</p></li><li><p><a href=\"https://florianbrand.de/posts/local-llms\">Local models</a> are (not) cope.</p></li><li><p>Evaluating <a href=\"https://nrehiew.github.io/blog/long_context/\">long context reasoning</a> ability and introducing a new benchmark.</p></li><li><p><a href=\"https://ideas.fin.ai/p/a-tale-of-two-agent-builders\">A tale of two Agent Builders</a> - Two competing solutions to the same design problem in AI interfaces.</p></li><li><p><a href=\"https://x.com/voooooogel/status/1979469389109010871\">LLM psychosis</a> isn&#8217;t, generally, psychosis.</p></li><li><p><a href=\"https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=lXUZvyajciY\">Andrej Karpathy on Dwarkesh&#8217;s podcast</a>&#8212;I&#8217;m 30% into it, and I have just one recommendation: don&#8217;t listen to commentaries on the podcast; instead, listen to it. Everyone has their own take that benefits what they want to sell you.</p></li></ul><div id=\"youtube2-lXUZvyajciY\" class=\"youtube-wrap\" data-attrs=\"{&quot;videoId&quot;:&quot;lXUZvyajciY&quot;,&quot;startTime&quot;:null,&quot;endTime&quot;:null}\" data-component-name=\"Youtube2ToDOM\"><div class=\"youtube-inner\"><iframe src=\"https://www.youtube-nocookie.com/embed/lXUZvyajciY?rel=0&amp;autoplay=0&amp;showinfo=0&amp;enablejsapi=0\" frameborder=\"0\" loading=\"lazy\" gesture=\"media\" allow=\"autoplay; fullscreen\" allowautoplay=\"true\" allowfullscreen=\"true\" width=\"728\" height=\"409\"></iframe></div></div><div><hr></div><h3>&#9881;&#65039;  Tools and demos</h3><ul><li><p>Tired of fixing your CRM instead of closing deals? <strong><a href=\"https://www.clarify.ai/?utm_source=newsletter&amp;utm_medium=tool_placement&amp;utm_campaign=bens_bites\">Clarify</a></strong> is the self-updating CRM that records calls, enriches, and updates in real time.*</p></li><li><p>Everyone wants to be an app builder. Manus, the general web agent, is also focusing heavily on app creation in its upgrade to <strong><a href=\"https://manus.im/blog/manus-1.5-release\">Manus 1.5</a></strong>.</p></li><li><p>Cline also has a CLI tool now, and Cline in your IDE can orchestrate <strong><a href=\"https://cline.bot/blog/cline-cli-return-to-the-primitives\">Cline CLI</a></strong> subagents.</p></li><li><p><strong><a href=\"https://docsalot.dev/\">DocsAlot</a></strong> - Automatically generate and update documentation, tutorials, and blog posts as your code evolves.</p></li><li><p><strong><a href=\"https://tldw.us/\">TLDW</a></strong> -  Learn from long YouTube videos better &amp; faster. (<a href=\"https://github.com/SamuelZ12/tldw\">repo</a> and <a href=\"https://x.com/zarazhangrui/status/1980371308161482853\">examples</a>)</p></li><li><p><strong><a href=\"https://apps.apple.com/us/app/epilogue-ambient-reading/id6751764862\">Epilogue</a></strong> - Record your natural thoughts, capture quotes, and explore questions while you&#8217;re reading.</p></li><li><p><strong><a href=\"https://e2b.dev/blog/introducing-build-system-2-0\">E2B Build System 2.0</a></strong> - A faster and simpler way to create custom sandboxes.</p></li><li><p><strong><a href=\"https://x.com/charliebholtz/status/1978111678421049407\">Code Review in Conductor</a></strong> - Comment on diffs generated by Claude Code, and send them back to get fixed.</p></li><li><p><strong><a href=\"https://alloy.app/\">Alloy.app</a></strong> - Prototype with your real product (vs. vibe coding from scratch).</p></li><li><p><strong><a href=\"https://trydunbar.com/\">Dunbar</a></strong> - Replace cold emails with warm intros by searching through your existing network. One of my recent investments</p></li></ul><div class=\"captioned-image-container\"><figure><a class=\"image-link image2 is-viewable-img\" target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://trydunbar.com/\" MCP Matters</h3><ul><li><p><strong><a href=\"https://x.com/Context7AI/status/1978928358768418900\">Default Context by Context7</a></strong> now auto-generates library documentation using Claude models, even if its repo has zero docs.</p></li><li><p><strong><a href=\"https://x.com/p0/status/1978876953735188840\">Parallel Task MCP Server</a></strong> - The first async MCP server for complex research tasks that can work in the background.</p></li></ul><div><hr></div><h3> &#129379; Dev dish</h3><ul><li><p>I&#8217;m hearing LLMs are better at writing Swift than React &#8212; so if you&#8217;re vibe-coding a desktop app, you might want to try making a native MacOS app  instead of an Electron app. (exhibit - Ivan built a <a href=\"https://x.com/andout_/status/1978452991284822194\">working clone of Apple Notes</a> in 30 mins)</p></li><li><p><a href=\"https://developers.googleblog.com/en/say-hello-to-a-new-level-of-interactivity-in-gemini-cli/\">Gemini CLI</a> added a new feature to let you use the same terminal window (where it&#8217;s running) to run other commands, keeping them in Gemini&#8217;s context. Gemini API now offers support for <a href=\"https://blog.google/technology/developers/grounding-google-maps-gemini-api/\">Grounding with Google Maps</a>. It&#8217;s one of the unique AI features I&#8217;ve seen (<a href=\"https://aistudio.google.com/apps/bundled/chat_with_maps_live\">demo app</a>).</p></li><li><p><a href=\"https://x.com/pvncher/status/1978918200101229013\">RepoPrompt 1.5</a> - Build context that fits a certain token budget, connect to your agent of choice and use your existing subscription.</p></li><li><p><a href=\"https://moondream.ai/blog/announcing-moondream-cloud\">Moondream Cloud</a> - Make cutting-edge vision applications without worrying about hosting a model.</p></li><li><p><a href=\"https://groq.com/blog/gpt-oss-improvements-prompt-caching-and-lower-pricing\">GPT-OSS is now 20-40% cheaper on Groq</a> with an additional 50% reduction from prompt caching.</p></li><li><p><a href=\"https://vercel.com/templates/ai/chatgpt-app-with-next-js\">Starter kit</a> to ship a ChatGPT app on Vercel with Next.js and MCP. Or maybe you wanna roll out your own <a href=\"https://github.com/vercel-labs/coding-agent-template\">web app to run Claude Code</a>, Codex or any CLI tool.</p></li><li><p><a href=\"https://github.com/trendy-design/llmchat\">llmchat</a> - Feature-rich chat app with local storage for your chats.</p></li><li><p><a href=\"https://github.com/firecrawl/open-agent-builder\">Open Agent Builder</a> - open source n8n-style workflow builder.</p></li><li><p>How to <a href=\"https://docs.together.ai/docs/how-to-build-a-lovable-clone-with-kimi-k2\">build a Lovable clone</a> with Kimi K2. </p></li></ul><div><hr></div><h3> &#128202; Charts you should see</h3><ul><li><p>Cognition has trained two new models, <strong><a href=\"https://cognition.ai/blog/swe-grep#where-to-try-fast-context\">SWE-grep and SWE-grep-mini</a></strong>, to search a codebase for relevant context to answer a question. These models are way faster than LLMs and have better performance. These are available in Windsurf as a &#8220;Fast Context&#8221; subagent that triggers automatically.</p></li></ul><div class=\"captioned-image-container\"><figure><a class=\"image-link image2 where 6 models get $10000 to trade cryptocurrencies. It started a little over 90 hours ago, and Deepseek and Claude are up, while Gemini and GPT-5 are in the gutters. Updates, tool reviews, and lay of the land from an exited founder turned investor and forever tinkerer.\nSubscribe now\n\n\nHey folks,\n‚ÄòAnthropic is on fire‚Äô would be an understatement for last weekend. They released Skills across all Claude products, Claude Code on the web, plus a couple of side quests here and there.\nSkills are folders (downloadable as zip files) that contain two things: 1. a Skill.md file and 2. other files relevant to that skill (more .md descriptions, maybe a .py script, and more). First 3-4 lines of Skill.md are reserved for metadata (like name, description). Metadata for all installed skills gets added to Claude‚Äôs context every time, but Claude can choose to expand Skill.md and then the rest of the relevant files. Anthropic has a collection of pre-built skills hidden away in this repo. \n\nSimon thinks Skills are a bigger deal than MCP.\n\nKeshav and I built our version of skills a couple of months earlier, which are strikingly similar to this.\n\nSkill Seekers - A repo to scrape any documentation page and convert it into a Claude skill. (an easy-to-use hosted version).\n\nBut beware! Don‚Äôt install Skills randomly from anywhere; they can be easily weaponised.\n\nNext up, Claude Code is now available on the web ‚Äî go to claude.ai/code, and you can queue up multiple tasks in parallel across different GitHub repositories. Every, as ever, has produced a review which is worth a read. As is Simon Willison‚Äôs.\nClaude Code also got two new tools (available in the terminal): \n\nFirst one to display a new interactive question UI with multiple questions and certain choices to select for each (and blank space to answer subjectively).\n\nSandbox to define what Claude can access (locally and remotely) to make working with it more secure. Run /sandbox to configure it, and the tool is open-source.\n\nOn side quests, Anthopic is launching a program called Claude for Life Sciences and adding new integrations for it. It‚Äôs also cosying up with Microsoft, connecting Claude to all of the Office 365 tools while trying to eat Glean‚Äôs lunch by offering Enterprise Search to the Claude Team and Enterprise plans.\nOpenAI is planning a ‚ÄúSign in with ChatGPT‚Äù option and pitching it to other companies. Companies that agree can let users use their ChatGPT quota to access AI features on their tools.\nMocha is an all-in-one tool for building real apps, no duct tape required. It packs in a backend with auth, payments, hosting and database‚Äîno need to juggle Supabase, or even have a Github account. Launch in minutes, scale without glue. üëâ  Join 100,000+ founders to start building your ideas today.*\n\n\n üåê What I‚Äôm consuming\n\nIt pays to be a middleman - how SF compute corners to offtake market.\n\nUsing AI to generate 100% of my code over the last few months.\n\n3 ways Manus engineers context for its agent.\n\nHow GPT-5 thinks, with OpenAI‚Äôs VP of Research.\n\nLocal models are (not) cope.\n\nEvaluating long context reasoning ability and introducing a new benchmark.\n\nA tale of two Agent Builders - Two competing solutions to the same design problem in AI interfaces.\n\nLLM psychosis isn‚Äôt, generally, psychosis.\n\nAndrej Karpathy on Dwarkesh‚Äôs podcast‚ÄîI‚Äôm 30% into it, and I have just one recommendation: don‚Äôt listen to commentaries on the podcast; instead, listen to it. Everyone has their own take that benefits what they want to sell you.\n\n\n\n\n\n‚öôÔ∏è  Tools and demos\n\nTired of fixing your CRM instead of closing deals? Clarify is the self-updating CRM that records calls, enriches, and updates in real time.*\n\nEveryone wants to be an app builder. Manus, the general web agent, is also focusing heavily on app creation in its upgrade to Manus 1.5.\n\nCline also has a CLI tool now, and Cline in your IDE can orchestrate Cline CLI subagents.\n\nDocsAlot - Automatically generate and update documentation, tutorials, and blog posts as your code evolves.\n\nTLDW -  Learn from long YouTube videos better & faster. (repo and examples)\n\nEpilogue - Record your natural thoughts, capture quotes, and explore questions while you‚Äôre reading.\n\nE2B Build System 2.0 - A faster and simpler way to create custom sandboxes.\n\nCode Review in Conductor - Comment on diffs generated by Claude Code, and send them back to get fixed.\n\nAlloy.app - Prototype with your real product (vs. vibe coding from scratch).\n\nDunbar - Replace cold emails with warm intros by searching through your existing network. One of my recent investments\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nüîå MCP Matters\n\nDefault Context by Context7 now auto-generates library documentation using Claude models, even if its repo has zero docs.\n\nParallel Task MCP Server - The first async MCP server for complex research tasks that can work in the background.\n\n\n\n ü•£ Dev dish\n\nI‚Äôm hearing LLMs are better at writing Swift than React ‚Äî so if you‚Äôre vibe-coding a desktop app, you might want to try making a native MacOS app  instead of an Electron app. (exhibit - Ivan built a working clone of Apple Notes in 30 mins)\n\nGemini CLI added a new feature to let you use the same terminal window (where it‚Äôs running) to run other commands, keeping them in Gemini‚Äôs context. Gemini API now offers support for Grounding with Google Maps. It‚Äôs one of the unique AI features I‚Äôve seen (demo app).\n\nRepoPrompt 1.5 - Build context that fits a certain token budget, connect to your agent of choice and use your existing subscription.\n\nMoondream Cloud - Make cutting-edge vision applications without worrying about hosting a model.\n\nGPT-OSS is now 20-40% cheaper on Groq with an additional 50% reduction from prompt caching.\n\nStarter kit to ship a ChatGPT app on Vercel with Next.js and MCP. Or maybe you wanna roll out your own web app to run Claude Code, Codex or any CLI tool.\n\nllmchat - Feature-rich chat app with local storage for your chats.\n\nOpen Agent Builder - open source n8n-style workflow builder.\n\nHow to build a Lovable clone with Kimi K2. \n\n\n\n üìä Charts you should see\n\nCognition has trained two new models, SWE-grep and SWE-grep-mini, to search a codebase for relevant context to answer a question. These models are way faster than LLMs and have better performance. These are available in Windsurf as a ‚ÄúFast Context‚Äù subagent that triggers automatically.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nSWE-grep and SWE-grep-mini outperform both LLMs and embeddings.\n\nShortcut, an agent for Excel, just surpassed Microsoft‚Äôs own Copilot Agent Mode (which is different from Copilot in Excel, you know how that goes) on SpreadsheetBench. There‚Äôs still quite a gap between the best score and humans.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\ntryshortcut.ai scores #1 (59.3%) on SpreadsheetBench\n\nAlpha Arena is a new experiment where 6 models get $10000 to trade cryptocurrencies. It started a little over 90 hours ago, and Deepseek and Claude are up, while Gemini and GPT-5 are in the gutters. They call it a benchmark, but I doubt it‚Äôs a good one.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nPerformance of 6 models on Alpha Arena trading cryptocurrencies\n\nGemini‚Äôs share of the web traffic going to AI is increasing steadily, but still a tiny portion of what ChatGPT gets.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nSimilarWeb‚Äôs data on AI web traffic share in the past 12 months\n\n\n üí∞ Who got that bag?\n\nOsmosis raised $7M to fine-tune models for other companies.\n\nClove raised $14M (founded by ex-CEO of Paddle) to make AI your financial guide.\n\nReducto raised $75M Series B for production-ready document parsing.\n\nGeneral Intuition spins out of Medal with their $133M seed raise to build foundational models.\n\n\n\nüç¶ Afters\n\nLeann and Autumn are hiring founding engineers + operators.\n\nWorld Labs has trained another interactive model where you can walk through a generated environment. Updates, tool reviews, and lay of the land from an exited founder turned investor and forever tinkerer.</em></p><p class=\"button-wrapper\" data-attrs=\"{&quot;url&quot;:&quot;https://www.bensbites.com/subscribe?&quot;,&quot;text&quot;:&quot;Subscribe now&quot;,&quot;action&quot;:null,&quot;class&quot;:null}\" data-component-name=\"ButtonCreateButton\"><a class=\"button primary\" href=\"https://www.bensbites.com/subscribe?\"><span>Subscribe now</span></a></p><div><hr></div><p>Hey folks,</p><p><strong><a href=\"https://www.anthropic.com/news/claude-haiku-4-5\">Anthropic just released Haiku 4.5</a></strong> - a smaller model that performs the same as Sonnet 4 (a 5-month-old model) while being 3x cheaper than Sonnet. For context, until 2 weeks ago, the $20 plan in Claude Code only gave you access to Sonnet 4, and if you were happy using it but kept hitting rate limits, you can now work 3x more (and faster). It now powers the <a href=\"https://x.com/0xblacklight/status/1978669859564069151\">&#8220;Explore tool&#8221;</a> in Claude Code by default.</p><p>This model is also great for agents like web searches, sifting through some data, or <a href=\"https://x.com/kylejeong21/status/1978551064442912838\">browser automations</a>. Basically, when you need some level of intelligence but not the smartest bloke out there.</p><p>Google upgraded its video generation models to <strong><a href=\"https://developers.googleblog.com/en/introducing-veo-3-1-and-new-creative-capabilities-in-the-gemini-api/\">Veo 3.1 and Veo 3.1 Fast</a></strong>. It&#8217;s still 50% pricier than Sora 2, but the new controllable features make up for it.</p><ul><li><p>&#8220;Ingredients to video&#8221; feature lets you upload up to three images and use them to guide the style of the video or add elements to it.</p></li><li><p>Scene extension takes in the final second of your generation and continues your video for even longer than a minute.</p></li><li><p>First to last frame lets you upload the starting and ending image and fill in the gap with a video.</p></li></ul><p>ChatGPT can now automatically <strong><a href=\"https://help.openai.com/en/articles/8590148-memory-faq#:~:text=it%20was%20shared.-,How%20do%20I%20manage%20my%20saved%20memory%20storage%3F,-Please%20note%20that\">manage your saved memories</a></strong>, prioritising recent and frequent ones. Searching and deleting your memories in the app is also a bit smoother now.</p><p>My latest investment was in <strong><a href=\"https://x.com/alxai_/status/1978491513953722472\">Good Start Labs</a> - </strong>they make <strong>games to test models&#8217;</strong> capabilities. They ran a Diplomacy contest with AIs working against one another that was streamed on Twitch and watched by 10s of thousands of people. Here&#8217;s a <a href=\"https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=u6J0zKP1_8c\">podcast</a> with Alex, one of the co-founders. He used to work at our friends, Every, which incubated the company and spun it out (I&#8217;ve invested in 2 out of 2 Every spinouts thinking about it now&#8230; <a href=\"https://lex.page/\">lex</a> - the ai writing tool - being the other).  I met Alex at Dev Day last week after I invested and it was great meeting irl! </p><blockquote><p>Reminder; if you&#8217;re building dev tools or anything in infra I invest out of Ben&#8217;s Bites Fund. DM me on X - I can also include some early experiments here to get early users and test your positioning.</p><p>And if you&#8217;re interesting in investing in the fund - first close will be end of Oct - you can <a href=\"https://tally.so/r/w8gNYl\">enter your details here and I&#8217;ll reach out</a> (I&#8217;m having to prioritise $100k+ checks first)</p></blockquote><p><strong><a href=\"https://ampcode.com/news/amp-free\">AmpCode added a free plan</a></strong> to their CLI coding tool, supported by ads. My first reaction was omg cringe BUT the more i sat with it, the more i thought&#8230;wait it could actually work - I mean, it&#8217;s very targeted and if i&#8217;m coding up something that needs a database and a Supabase ad came on, that could work&#8230;Or it&#8217;s a way to try and grow. <a href=\"https://cto.new/blog/why-we-raised-5-7m-to-launch-cto-new-completely-for-free\">cto.new</a>, another coding agent is giving unlimited access to all models (ty VCs!).</p><p>Build smarter Voice AI Agents with the <strong>best ears in AI.</strong> Speechmatics captures who said what - even in noisy, heavily accented, multi-speaker conversations. 25% higher accuracy than competitors. Sub-second latency. 55+ languages. Start building with <strong><a href=\"https://www.speechmatics.com/best-ears-in-ai?utm_source=bens-bites&amp;utm_medium=paid-media&amp;utm_campaign=voice-ai-agents-2025&amp;utm_content=newsletter\">$200 free credits</a></strong>*</p><div><hr></div><h3><strong> </strong>&#127760;<strong> </strong>What I&#8217;m consuming</h3><ul><li><p><a href=\"https://every.to/vibe-check/vibe-check-claude-haiku-4-5-anthropic-cooked\">Haiku 4.5 vibe check</a> by Every.</p></li><li><p><a href=\"https://arize.com/blog/optimizing-coding-agent-rules-claude-md-agents-md-clinerules-cursor-rules-for-improved-accuracy/\">Optimising coding agent rules</a> for improved accuracy. They improved Cline&#8217;s performance with GPT-4.1 from 18% to 34% on SWE-Bench lite.</p></li><li><p><a href=\"https://thoughtsbyjane.substack.com/p/the-case-for-vibe-coding\">The case for vibe coding</a> - personal software.</p></li><li><p>How <a href=\"https://inference.net/case-study/cal-ai\">fine-tuning a model</a> reduced latency by 3x while improving reliability for Cal AI.</p></li><li><p><a href=\"https://www.philschmid.de/benchmark-compedium\">AI agent benchmark compendium</a> - high-level overview to over 50 of modern benchmarks, grouped into four key href=\"https://retool.com/?utm_source=bensbites&amp;utm_medium=newsletter&amp;utm_campaign=copilot&amp;utm_content=tool_ad&amp;rcid=701Qo000014OOJQIA4\">Retool</a></strong> - AI app gen that meets your production requirements. Prompt to start, edit in context, and deploy on a platform your team trusts.*</p></li><li><p><strong><a href=\"https://www.tryflint.com/\">Flint</a></strong> - Launch and optimise on-brand landing pages instantly. (raised $5M)</p></li><li><p><strong><a href=\"https://x.com/runwayml/status/1978094115142225968\">Apps by Runway</a></strong> - Use case specific workflows for creative editing (like upscaling an image, reshooting products, adding dialogue, etc.), ready for instant use.</p></li><li><p><strong><a href=\"https://www.dedaluslabs.ai/\">Deadulus Labs</a></strong> - Connect any model to any MCP server with a single API. (raised $11M)</p></li><li><p><strong><a href=\"https://decode.dev/\">Decode.dev</a></strong> - Review your app with a browser and a whiteboard and send that feedback to Claude Code.</p></li><li><p><strong><a href=\"https://flask.do/\">Flask</a></strong> - A video editor that feels like a mix of Notion and Loom. It&#8217;s got some AI features but not an AI product primarily.</p></li><li><p><strong><a href=\"https://www.tryfundable.ai\">Fundable</a></strong> - Real-time funding signals from 10k+ sources.</p></li><li><p><strong><a href=\"https://strawberrybrowser.com/\">Strawberry</a></strong> - A self-driving browser, create &#8220;companions&#8221; for tasks you do on the browser and let them work.</p></li></ul><div class=\"captioned-image-container\"><figure><a class=\"image-link image2 is-viewable-img\" target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://strawberrybrowser.com/\" Alana keeps building these fun, cool and open-source projects (while investing). Check out the <a href=\"https://github.com/alanagoyal/lexiconic\">repo for this one</a>.</p></li><li><p><a href=\"https://sandbox.cloudflare.com/\">Sandbox SDK by Cloudflare</a> - Let your agents run code, execute commands, manage files, run services and more securely.</p></li><li><p><a href=\"https://github.com/Selfdb-io/SelfDB\">SelfDB</a> - Self-hosted, open-source alternative to Supabase and Firebase.</p></li><li><p><a href=\"https://github.com/github/spec-kit\">Spec Kit by GitHub</a> - Get started with spec-driven development for your codebase.</p></li><li><p><a href=\"https://github.com/virattt/dexter\">Dexter</a> - An open source financial agent in ~200 lines of code. Claude Code like experience, but for finance.</p></li><li><p><a href=\"https://github.com/punitarani/flights-tracker\">GrayPane</a> - the simplest way to search for the best time and flight to fly.</p></li></ul><div><hr></div><h3> &#127846; Afters</h3><ul><li><p>DeepMind and Yale built a new model on top of Gemma to <a href=\"https://blog.google/technology/ai/google-gemma-ai-cancer-therapy-discovery/\">identify new drugs that affect cancer cells.</a> Classic Google stuff.</p></li><li><p>Sara is hiring a <a href=\"https://x.com/sarahookr/status/1978521940244492699\">data adaptation research engineer</a> for her new AI lab.</p></li><li><p>Sneha is hiring a <a href=\"https://x.com/sneha8sivakumar/status/1963669335773467130\">founding designer</a> in NYC to build agentic QA for e-commerce brands.</p></li><li><p>Karina Nguyen (ex-OpenAI &amp; Anthropic, worked on Artifacts) is <a href=\"https://maisonagi.com/\">opening a fashion house</a> with Ilya Sutskever as her first collab.</p></li><li><p>Nathan is turning his AI consultancy into an <a href=\"https://x.com/NathanLands/status/1978434458522182120\">AI infra and compute</a> company.</p></li></ul><div><hr></div><div class=\"captioned-button-wrap\" data-attrs=\"{&quot;url&quot;:&quot;https://www.bensbites.com/p/3x-cheaper-in-5-months?utm_source=substack&utm_medium=email&utm_content=share&action=share&quot;,&quot;text&quot;:&quot;Share&quot;}\" data-component-name=\"CaptionedButtonToDOM\"><div class=\"preamble\"><p class=\"cta-caption\">Enjoy this newsletter? For context, until 2 weeks ago, the $20 plan in Claude Code only gave you access to Sonnet 4, and if you were happy using it but kept hitting rate limits, you can now work 3x more (and faster). It now powers the ‚ÄúExplore tool‚Äù in Claude Code by default.\nThis model is also great for agents like web searches, sifting through some data, or browser automations. Basically, when you need some level of intelligence but not the smartest bloke out there.\nGoogle upgraded its video generation models to Veo 3.1 and Veo 3.1 Fast. It‚Äôs still 50% pricier than Sora 2, but the new controllable features make up for it.\n\n‚ÄúIngredients to video‚Äù feature lets you upload up to three images and use them to guide the style of the video or add elements to it.\n\nScene extension takes in the final second of your generation and continues your video for even longer than a minute.\n\nFirst to last frame lets you upload the starting and ending image and fill in the gap with a video.\n\nChatGPT can now automatically manage your saved memories, prioritising recent and frequent ones. Searching and deleting your memories in the app is also a bit smoother now.\nMy latest investment was in Good Start Labs - they make games to test models‚Äô capabilities. They ran a Diplomacy contest with AIs working against one another that was streamed on Twitch and watched by 10s of thousands of people. Here‚Äôs a podcast with Alex, one of the co-founders. He used to work at our friends, Every, which incubated the company and spun it out (I‚Äôve invested in 2 out of 2 Every spinouts thinking about it now‚Ä¶ lex - the ai writing tool - being the other).  I met Alex at Dev Day last week after I invested and it was great meeting irl! \n\nReminder; if you‚Äôre building dev tools or anything in infra I invest out of Ben‚Äôs Bites Fund. DM me on X - I can also include some early experiments here to get early users and test your positioning.\nAnd if you‚Äôre interesting in investing in the fund - first close will be end of Oct - you can enter your details here and I‚Äôll reach out (I‚Äôm having to prioritise $100k+ checks first)\n\nAmpCode added a free plan to their CLI coding tool, supported by ads. My first reaction was omg cringe BUT the more i sat with it, the more i thought‚Ä¶wait it could actually work - I mean, it‚Äôs very targeted and if i‚Äôm coding up something that needs a database and a Supabase ad came on, that could work‚Ä¶Or it‚Äôs a way to try and grow. cto.new, another coding agent is giving unlimited access to all models (ty VCs!).\nBuild smarter Voice AI Agents with the best ears in AI. Speechmatics captures who said what - even in noisy, heavily accented, multi-speaker conversations. 25% higher accuracy than competitors. Sub-second latency. 55+ languages. Start building with $200 free credits*\n\n\n üåê What I‚Äôm consuming\n\nHaiku 4.5 vibe check by Every.\n\nOptimising coding agent rules for improved accuracy. They improved Cline‚Äôs performance with GPT-4.1 from 18% to 34% on SWE-Bench lite.\n\nThe case for vibe coding - personal software.\n\nHow fine-tuning a model reduced latency by 3x while improving reliability for Cal AI.\n\nAI agent benchmark compendium - high-level overview to over 50 of modern benchmarks, grouped into four key categories.\n\nJust talk to it - the no-bs way of agentic engineering.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n‚öôÔ∏è  Tools and demos\n\nRetool - AI app gen that meets your production requirements. (raised $11M)\n\nDecode.dev - Review your app with a browser and a whiteboard and send that feedback to Claude Code.\n\nFlask - A video editor that feels like a mix of Notion and Loom. It‚Äôs got some AI features but not an AI product primarily.\n\nFundable - Real-time funding signals from 10k+ sources.\n\nStrawberry - A self-driving browser, create ‚Äúcompanions‚Äù for tasks you do on the browser and let them work.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n ü•£ Dev dish\n\nLexiconic - Words that don‚Äôt translate. Last few slots left for the rest of the year.","enclosure":{"url":"https://substack-post-media.s3.amazonaws.com/public/images/fd0e638c-f309-4182-a515-0014e98ff129_1024x660.png","length":"0","type":"image/jpeg"},"content":"are ads the inevitable path ahead?","contentSnippet":"are ads the inevitable path ahead?","guid":"https://www.bensbites.com/p/3x-cheaper-in-5-months","isoDate":"2025-10-16T13:15:38.000Z","itunes":{}},"pairedItem":[{"item":0}]},{"json":{"title":"Recipes for Claude-maxxing","link":"https://www.bensbites.com/p/recipes-for-claude-maxxing","pubDate":"Tue, 14 Oct 2025 13:03:35 GMT","content:encoded":"<p><em>The newsletter for the technically curious. Updates, tool reviews, and lay of the land from an exited founder turned investor and forever tinkerer.</em></p><p class=\"button-wrapper\" data-attrs=\"{&quot;url&quot;:&quot;https://www.bensbites.com/subscribe?&quot;,&quot;text&quot;:&quot;Subscribe now&quot;,&quot;action&quot;:null,&quot;class&quot;:null}\" data-component-name=\"ButtonCreateButton\"><a class=\"button primary\" href=\"https://www.bensbites.com/subscribe?\"><span>Subscribe now</span></a></p><div><hr></div><p>Hey folks,</p><p>You can now share your Claude Code setup with others using &#8220;<strong><a href=\"https://www.anthropic.com/news/claude-code-plugins\">Claude Code Plugins</a></strong>&#8221;. Plugins combine slash commands, subagents, MCP servers, and hooks that you have set up into a single JSON. You can publish a set of plugins as a marketplace and let your team members or anyone install them.</p><p>I think this is <em>supposed</em> to be cool but I don&#8217;t think it is - for a while people have been sharing their own commands/agents/etc in GitHub repos for others to copy in their workflows. This just feels like a slightly easier way to bulk download them. (It also feels like the days of people selling Notion templates).</p><p>And because so many CLI tools are built similarly, these can just be ported across to any CLI you use. It didn&#8217;t take long for Ian Nuttall to create <a href=\"https://github.com/iannuttall/droid-factory\">this</a>, which lets you easily install as bundles or individually from marketplaces into any CLI.</p><p>What I do think is cool is reading the <a href=\"https://blog.fsck.com/2025/10/09/superpowers/\">different docs</a> people create to enhance their coding workflows. If you&#8217;re <a href=\"https://simonwillison.net/2025/Oct/10/superpowers/\">paying attention</a>, the files are often just really clear instructions for an agentic tool to follow. I&#8217;m again finding myself trying to code a tool only to end up with a simple markdown file that gives explicit instructions to an agent to follow instead. Apps are specs. </p><p>Gemini CLI also launched <a href=\"https://geminicli.com/extensions/\">Gemini Extensions</a>, which package custom commands, MCP servers and specific files into a single JSON config. (again, see <a href=\"https://github.com/iannuttall/droid-factory\">Ian&#8217;s tool</a> to easily port into any CLI)</p><p>OpenAI is aggressively ramping up where it gets compute from&#8212;including deals with Google Cloud, Nvidia, AMD and now, <a href=\"https://openai.com/index/openai-and-broadcom-announce-strategic-collaboration/\">chips designed by OpenAI itself in partnership with Broadcom</a>. They&#8217;ve been working together for <a href=\"https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=qqAbVTFnfk8\">18 months already</a>, and will start deploying 10 GW of compute late next year.</p><p><a href=\"https://slack.com/intl/en-gb/blog/news/powering-agentic-collaboration\">Slack&#8217;s new platform</a> gives AI agents secure, real-time access to team conversations via RTS (real-time search API) and MCP, enabling context-aware workflows. Launch partners like OpenAI, Anthropic, Google, Perplexity, Dropbox, and Notion have built new Slack-native apps.</p><p><strong><a href=\"https://www.clarify.ai/?utm_source=newsletter&amp;utm_medium=main&amp;utm_campaign=bens_bites\">Clarify</a></strong> is the autonomous CRM that runs itself. It logs calls, enriches contacts, and updates deals&#8212;so you can focus on selling, not systems. Built for fast-moving GTM teams who hate admin work. <a href=\"https://www.clarify.ai/?utm_source=newsletter&amp;utm_medium=main&amp;utm_campaign=bens_bites\">&#9889; Start for free</a>.*</p><blockquote><p>Ever wonder how this newsletter gets made? Shanice shared what goes on in <a href=\"https://www.linkedin.com/pulse/day-life-bens-bites-shanice-stewart-jones-8um8c/\">a day in the life of Ben&#8217;s Bites</a>.</p></blockquote><div><hr></div><h3><strong> </strong>&#127760;<strong> </strong>What I&#8217;m consuming</h3><ul><li><p>AI memory explained: <a href=\"https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=mKXzPVIMFYE\">SuperMemory MCP</a> for Cursor, Claude &amp; Windsurf.</p></li><li><p>Why everyone will be talking about <a href=\"https://www.vtrivedy.com/posts/claude-code-sdk-haas-harness-as-a-service/\">Harness Engineering</a> in six months.</p></li><li><p><a href=\"https://importai.substack.com/p/import-ai-431-technological-optimism\">Technological Optimism and Appropriate Fear</a> - What do we do if AI progress keeps happening?</p></li><li><p>The case for Supermemory is the <a href=\"https://solofounders.com/blog/the-case-for-supermemory-is-the-case-for-solo-founders/\">case for solo founders</a>.</p></li><li><p>How <a href=\"https://developers.openai.com/blog/codex-at-devday\">Codex ran OpenAI DevDay</a> 2025.</p></li><li><p><a href=\"https://dx.tips/devrel-is-back\">DevRel is unbelievably back</a>. I saved this then surprisingly saw my name mentioned in the post (ty swyx!) - I think dev rel is the best job, especially in today&#8217;s world. A lot of the functions are really similar to being a founder; you speak to your customers every day, listen to &amp; implement feedback, understand your product inside and out, know whats on the roadmap, why certain technical decisions are made and you&#8217;ve got to be in charge of growth. I&#8217;m going to start talking about little tools I&#8217;m making to help me in my day to day at <a href=\"https://factory.ai\">Factory</a>, like;</p><ul><li><p>ask-factory - i have the full codebase and our docs on my computer (they get auto-updated from github every hour). So when a user asks a technical question or &#8216;is this workflow possible&#8217; I can query this tool and it&#8217;ll look up the code and docs plus linear issues on whether something is already down as a bug or new feature on the roadmap.</p></li><li><p>linear-cli - this is just a simple cli tool that uses my linear api key and searches linear. </p></li><li><p>release-notes - this is a way to generate release notes from our latest releases for our changelog (still in progress!)</p></li></ul><p>These tools aren&#8217;t really tools at all&#8230; they are instruction documents. e.g. ask-factory has instructions to say, look at the factory codebase repo and docs (linking them), then run search queries in parallel across both to get an understanding of which areas the query relates to, then check linear to see if anything relevant in there, then put together in an answer format like '[example]&#8217;. Because when you use an agentic tool like Droid, Claude Code, Codex etc, they can follow instructions really well and have their own tools at their disposal. Fwiw I get way better results currently using gpt-5-codex. </p></li></ul><div class=\"captioned-image-container\"><figure><a class=\"image-link image2 is-viewable-img\" target=\"_blank\" automating your business.</p></li><li><p><a href=\"https://exa.ai/blog/exa-api-2-0\">Exa Fast and Deep</a> - Two new search API for your AI products.</p></li><li><p><a href=\"https://docs.n8n.io/release-notes/#ai-workflow-builder-beta\">AI workflow builder by n8n</a> - Build workflows, nodes and structure from your prompts in English.</p></li><li><p><a href=\"https://x.com/0interestrates/status/1977788884298903773\">Julius AI</a> now connects to your SQL Server and writes SQL for you to analyse performance, adoption and other KPIs.</p></li><li><p><a href=\"https://blog.google/technology/google-labs/video-overviews-nano-banana\">NotebookLM&#8217;s</a> video overviews can now use images generated by Nano-Banana and a shorter format called Brief.</p></li><li><p><a href=\"https://yc-unicorn-predictor.vercel.app/\">YC unicorn predictor</a> - Are you making something people want? (I think the biggest change to YC&#8217;s tagline in the future will be &#8216;Make something agents want&#8217;)</p></li></ul><div><hr></div><h3> &#129379; Dev dish</h3><ul><li><p><a href=\"https://github.com/karpathy/nanochat\">nanochat</a> - A minimal repo from Karpathy to train an LLM from scratch, and then take it through post-training with SFT, RL and run it in a ChatGPT like interface. (<a href=\"https://x.com/karpathy/status/1977755427569111362\">discussions on X</a>)</p></li><li><p><a href=\"https://github.com/midday-ai/ai-sdk-tools\">ai-sdk-tools</a> - Essential utilities for building production-ready AI applications.</p></li><li><p><a href=\"https://github.com/steveyegge/beads\">Beads</a> - A drop-in cognitive upgrade for your coding agent of choice. (<a href=\"https://steve-yegge.medium.com/introducing-beads-a-coding-agent-memory-system-637d7d92514a\">read more</a>)</p></li></ul><div><hr></div><h3> &#127846; Afters</h3><ul><li><p>Dwarkesh Patel and Stripe Press have a new book, <a href=\"https://x.com/dwarkesh_sp/status/1975958555313504324\">The Scaling Era: An Oral History of AI 2019-2025</a>.</p></li><li><p><a href=\"https://huggingface.co/LiquidAI/LFM2-350M-PII-Extract-JP\">This 350M params model from Liquid AI</a> performs similarly to GPT-5 when extracting PII from Japanese texts.</p></li><li><p>new research: you can just ask an LLM if a certain demographic would <a href=\"https://arxiv.org/abs/2510.08338\">purchase your product</a> and get reliable answers.</p></li></ul><div><hr></div><div class=\"captioned-button-wrap\" data-attrs=\"{&quot;url&quot;:&quot;https://www.bensbites.com/p/recipes-for-claude-maxxing?utm_source=substack&utm_medium=email&utm_content=share&action=share&quot;,&quot;text&quot;:&quot;Share&quot;}\" data-component-name=\"CaptionedButtonToDOM\"><div class=\"preamble\"><p class=\"cta-caption\">Enjoy this newsletter? Feel free to comment and share your thoughts. &#128075;</p><ul><li><p>Find me on <a href=\"https://x.com/bentossell/\">X</a>, <a href=\"https://www.linkedin.com/in/ben-tossell-70453537/\">Linkedin</a>, or <a href=\"https://instagram.com/bentossell\">Instagram</a></p></li><li><p>Read <a href=\"https://bensbites.substack.com/about\">about me</a> and ben&#8217;s bites</p></li><li><p>&#128247; thumbnail creds: <a href=\"https://x.com/Keshavatearth\">@keshavatearth</a>,</p></li></ul><h6><em>* marks sponsors that make this newsletter possible :)</em></h6><h6><em>Wanna <a href=\"https://sponsor.bensbites.co/\">partner with us</a>? Updates, tool reviews, and lay of the land from an exited founder turned investor and forever tinkerer.\nSubscribe now\n\n\nHey folks,\nYou can now share your Claude Code setup with others using ‚ÄúClaude Code Plugins‚Äù. Plugins combine slash commands, subagents, MCP servers, and hooks that you have set up into a single JSON. You can publish a set of plugins as a marketplace and let your team members or anyone install them.\nI think this is supposed to be cool but I don‚Äôt think it is - for a while people have been sharing their own commands/agents/etc in GitHub repos for others to copy in their workflows. This just feels like a slightly easier way to bulk download them. (It also feels like the days of people selling Notion templates).\nAnd because so many CLI tools are built similarly, these can just be ported across to any CLI you use. It didn‚Äôt take long for Ian Nuttall to create this, which lets you easily install as bundles or individually from marketplaces into any CLI.\nWhat I do think is cool is reading the different docs people create to enhance their coding workflows. If you‚Äôre paying attention, the files are often just really clear instructions for an agentic tool to follow. I‚Äôm again finding myself trying to code a tool only to end up with a simple markdown file that gives explicit instructions to an agent to follow instead. Apps are specs. \nGemini CLI also launched Gemini Extensions, which package custom commands, MCP servers and specific files into a single JSON config. (again, see Ian‚Äôs tool to easily port into any CLI)\nOpenAI is aggressively ramping up where it gets compute from‚Äîincluding deals with Google Cloud, Nvidia, AMD and now, chips designed by OpenAI itself in partnership with Broadcom. They‚Äôve been working together for 18 months already, and will start deploying 10 GW of compute late next year.\nSlack‚Äôs new platform gives AI agents secure, real-time access to team conversations via RTS (real-time search API) and MCP, enabling context-aware workflows. Launch partners like OpenAI, Anthropic, Google, Perplexity, Dropbox, and Notion have built new Slack-native apps.\nClarify is the autonomous CRM that runs itself. I saved this then surprisingly saw my name mentioned in the post (ty swyx!) - I think dev rel is the best job, especially in today‚Äôs world. A lot of the functions are really similar to being a founder; you speak to your customers every day, listen to & implement feedback, understand your product inside and out, know whats on the roadmap, why certain technical decisions are made and you‚Äôve got to be in charge of growth. I‚Äôm going to start talking about little tools I‚Äôm making to help me in my day to day at Factory, like;\n\nask-factory - i have the full codebase and our docs on my computer (they get auto-updated from github every hour). So when a user asks a technical question or ‚Äòis this workflow possible‚Äô I can query this tool and it‚Äôll look up the code and docs plus linear issues on whether something is already down as a bug or new feature on the roadmap.\n\nlinear-cli - this is just a simple cli tool that uses my linear api key and searches linear. \n\nrelease-notes - this is a way to generate release notes from our latest releases for our changelog (still in progress!)\n\nThese tools aren‚Äôt really tools at all‚Ä¶ they are instruction documents. e.g. ask-factory has instructions to say, look at the factory codebase repo and docs (linking them), then run search queries in parallel across both to get an understanding of which areas the query relates to, then check linear to see if anything relevant in there, then put together in an answer format like '[example]‚Äô. Because when you use an agentic tool like Droid, Claude Code, Codex etc, they can follow instructions really well and have their own tools at their disposal. Fwiw I get way better results currently using gpt-5-codex. \n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n‚öôÔ∏è  Tools and demos\n\nTasklet - An AI agent for automating your business.\n\nExa Fast and Deep - Two new search API for your AI products.\n\nAI workflow builder by n8n - Build workflows, nodes and structure from your prompts in English.\n\nJulius AI now connects to your SQL Server and writes SQL for you to analyse performance, adoption and other KPIs.\n\nNotebookLM‚Äôs video overviews can now use images generated by Nano-Banana and a shorter format called Brief.\n\nYC unicorn predictor - Are you making something people want? (I think the biggest change to YC‚Äôs tagline in the future will be ‚ÄòMake something agents want‚Äô)\n\n\n\n ü•£ Dev dish\n\nnanochat - A minimal repo from Karpathy to train an LLM from scratch, and then take it through post-training with SFT, RL and run it in a ChatGPT like interface.
