Last few slots left for the rest of the year.","enclosure":{"url":"https://substack-post-media.s3.amazonaws.com/public/images/9c63e770-f6de-4f3e-8f95-6f34276dadf5_1184x864.png","length":"0","type":"image/jpeg"},"content":"the best job in this timeline","contentSnippet":"the best job in this timeline","guid":"https://www.bensbites.com/p/recipes-for-claude-maxxing","isoDate":"2025-10-14T13:03:35.000Z","itunes":{}},"pairedItem":[{"item":0}]},{"json":{"title":"How to see through AI marketing","link":"https://www.bensbites.com/p/how-to-see-through-ai-marketing","pubDate":"Thu, 09 Oct 2025 13:02:54 GMT","content:encoded":"<p><em>The newsletter for the technically curious. Updates, tool reviews, and lay of the land from an exited founder turned investor and forever tinkerer.</em></p><p class=\"button-wrapper\" data-attrs=\"{&quot;url&quot;:&quot;https://www.bensbites.com/subscribe?&quot;,&quot;text&quot;:&quot;Subscribe now&quot;,&quot;action&quot;:null,&quot;class&quot;:null}\" data-component-name=\"ButtonCreateButton\"><a class=\"button primary\" href=\"https://www.bensbites.com/subscribe?\"><span>Subscribe now</span></a></p><div><hr></div><p>Hey folks,</p><p>I was up late last night in SF at the meet-up I hosted, and it was so awesome to meet and speak to a bunch of you. I&#8217;m saving my full SF thoughts for a post next week.</p><p>In the meantime, Google released a preview of its first <strong><a href=\"https://blog.google/technology/google-deepmind/gemini-computer-use-model/\">computer-use model</a></strong> based on Gemini 2.5, in partnership with <strong><a href=\"https://gemini.browserbase.com/\">Browserbase</a></strong>. It&#8217;s a good model&#8212;it scores decently better than Sonnet 4.5 and much better than OpenAI&#8217;s computer use model on <a href=\"https://www.browserbase.com/blog/evaluating-browser-agents\">benchmarks</a>.</p><p>But benchmarks and evaluations can be misleading, especially if you only go by the official announcement posts. This one is a good example to dig into:</p><ul><li><p>This is a model optimised for browser usage, so it&#8217;s not surprising that it does better than the base version of Sonnet 4.5</p></li><li><p>OpenAI&#8217;s computer use model used in this comparison is 7 months old&#8212;a version based on 4o. (side note: I had high expectations for a new computer use model at Dev Day)</p></li><li><p>The product experience of the model matters. ChatGPT Agent, even with a worse model, feels better because it&#8217;s a good product combining a computer-using model, a browser and a terminal.</p></li></ul><p>I don&#8217;t mean to say that companies do it out of malice. Finding the latest scores and implementation of a benchmark is hard, and you don&#8217;t want to be too nuanced in a marketing post about your launch. But we, as users, need to understand the model cycle and the taste of the dessert being sold to us.</p><p>Even with all these factors, the new Gemini model definitely passes the smoke test.  </p><p>The smoke test is just one way we decide what makes it into every newsletter post and what doesn&#8217;t. Shanice wrote about it in detail in this post, <a href=\"https://www.linkedin.com/pulse/day-life-bens-bites-shanice-stewart-jones-8um8c/\">A day in the life of Ben&#8217;s Bites</a>.</p><p>With <strong><a href=\"https://retool.com/?utm_source=bensbites&amp;utm_medium=newsletter&amp;utm_campaign=copilot&amp;utm_content=main_ad&amp;rcid=701Qo000014OTm9IAG\">Retool</a></strong>, you can turn prompts into full-stack internal tools&#8212;connected to your data, hosted in your cloud, and secured by your rules. Build easier, deploy safely, and move from idea to production in minutes.*</p><div><hr></div><h3><strong> </strong>&#127760;<strong> </strong>What I&#8217;m consuming</h3><ul><li><p><a href=\"https://www.latent.space/p/figma\">Taste is your moat</a> with Dylan Field, Figma.</p></li><li><p><a href=\"https://open.spotify.com/show/4O7eFPtxPBSrdsO2KwY6Ko\">Agents of Scale</a> - new podcast by my old boss at Zapier.</p></li><li><p><a href=\"https://theoatmeal.com/comics/ai_art\">A cartoonist&#8217;s review of AI art</a> by The Oatmeal. </p></li><li><p><a href=\"https://simonwillison.net/2025/Oct/7/vibe-engineering/\">Vibe engineering</a> and embracing the <a href=\"https://simonwillison.net/2025/Oct/5/parallel-coding-agents/\">parallel coding agent lifestyle</a>.</p></li><li><p><a href=\"https://stratechery.com/2025/sora-ai-bicycles-and-meta-disruption/\">Sora, AI Bicycles, and Meta Disruption</a>.</p></li><li><p><a href=\"https://kix.dev/two-things-llm-coding-agents-are-still-bad-at/\">Two things LLM coding agents are still bad at</a>: copy-pasting code and asking questions. This is actually a good critique&#8212;especially the first one. I wonder if you could create an app/service for refactoring codebases by teaching an open-source model (like Kimi K2 or GLM 4.6) to use &#8220;cut/copy/paste&#8221; as tools.</p></li><li><p><strong><a href=\"https://www.stateof.ai/\">The State of AI report 2025</a></strong> &#8212; this one will take me a few days to go through.</p></li></ul><div class=\"captioned-image-container\"><figure><a href=\"https://www.scoutapm.com/mcp?utm_source=bensbites&amp;utm_medium=newsletter&amp;utm_campaign=gtm_launch&amp;utm_content=c\">Scout Monitoring&#8217;s MCP</a></strong><a href=\"https://www.scoutapm.com/mcp?utm_source=bensbites&amp;utm_medium=newsletter&amp;utm_campaign=gtm_launch&amp;utm_content=c\"> </a>- AI-native monitoring. It feeds performance issues and slow endpoints directly into your AI coding assistant.*</p></li><li><p><strong><a href=\"https://aistudio.google.com/apps\">Google AI Studio</a></strong> now lets you use your voice as an input for vibe coding.</p></li><li><p><strong><a href=\"https://x.com/elevenlabsio/status/1975191207149269214\">ElevenLabs</a></strong> launched Agent Workflows and an <a href=\"https://x.com/elevenlabsio/status/1975622003550802141\">open source UI library</a> for building voice agents.</p></li><li><p><strong><a href=\"https://x.com/xai/status/1975607901571199086\">Grok Imagine</a></strong> now uses xAI&#8217;s Imagine 0.9 model with audio generation.</p></li><li><p><strong><a href=\"https://opal.withgoogle.com/\">Opal</a></strong>, Google&#8217;s experimental product for chaining AI steps together with a visual builder, is now open globally (with MCP support coming soon).</p></li></ul><div class=\"captioned-image-container\"><figure><a class=\"image-link image2 is-viewable-img\" target=\"_blank\" &#129379; Dev dish</h3><ul><li><p><a href=\"https://playwright.dev/docs/test-agents\">Playwright</a>, the browser automation library, has agents now. One to plan tests, another to generate them and a healer to debug and fix failing tests.</p></li><li><p><a href=\"https://github.com/joseairosa/recall\">Recall</a> - Redis-powered persistent memory for Claude (usable as an MCP server).</p></li><li><p><a href=\"https://github.com/Doriandarko/sora-mcp\">sora-mcp</a> - An MCP server to use Sora video generation APIs.</p></li><li><p>You can use any open-source model in <a href=\"https://x.com/FactoryAI/status/1975643644326793619\">Factory AI&#8217;s Droid</a>. </p></li><li><p><a href=\"https://repoprompt.com/bench\">Repobench</a> - Ranking models for large context reasoning, file editing precision, and instruction adherence for coding tasks. I met Eric yesterday and chatted about <a href=\"https://repoprompt.com/blog/building-repo-bench\">how he built this</a>.</p></li></ul><div class=\"captioned-image-container\"><figure><a Engineering Hackathon, Oct. 11</a> &#8212; Push the boundaries of what you can build with MongoDB&#8217;s Atlas Vector Search and Voyage AI.*</p></li><li><p>Both <a href=\"https://techcrunch.com/2025/10/09/openais-affordable-chatgpt-go-plan-expands-to-16-new-countries-in-asia/\">OpenAI</a> and <a href=\"https://blog.google/products/google-one/google-ai-plus-36-countries/\">Google</a> have expanded their $5/mo AI plan to multiple countries.</p></li><li><p><a href=\"https://www.theinformation.com/articles/cursor-maker-anysphere-considers-investment-offers-30-billion-valuation?rc=bdorru\">Cursor is planning</a> another round at $30B valuation.</p></li></ul><div><hr></div><div class=\"captioned-button-wrap\" Last few slots left for the rest of the year.</em></h6><div><hr></div>","content:encodedSnippet":"The newsletter for the technically curious. Updates, tool reviews, and lay of the land from an exited founder turned investor and forever tinkerer.\nSubscribe now\n\n\nHey folks,\nI was up late last night in SF at the meet-up I hosted, and it was so awesome to meet and speak to a bunch of you. I‚Äôm saving my full SF thoughts for a post next week.\nIn the meantime, Google released a preview of its first computer-use model based on Gemini 2.5, in partnership with Browserbase. It‚Äôs a good model‚Äîit scores decently better than Sonnet 4.5 and much better than OpenAI‚Äôs computer use model on benchmarks.\nBut benchmarks and evaluations can be misleading, especially if you only go by the official announcement posts. This one is a good example to dig into:\n\nThis is a model optimised for browser usage, so it‚Äôs not surprising that it does better than the base version of Sonnet 4.5\n\nOpenAI‚Äôs computer use model used in this comparison is 7 months old‚Äîa version based on 4o. (side note: I had high expectations for a new computer use model at Dev Day)\n\nThe product experience of the model matters. ChatGPT Agent, even with a worse model, feels better because it‚Äôs a good product combining a computer-using model, a browser and a terminal.\n\nI don‚Äôt mean to say that companies do it out of malice. Finding the latest scores and implementation of a benchmark is hard, and you don‚Äôt want to be too nuanced in a marketing post about your launch. But we, as users, need to understand the model cycle and the taste of the dessert being sold to us.\nEven with all these factors, the new Gemini model definitely passes the smoke test.  \nThe smoke test is just one way we decide what makes it into every newsletter post and what doesn‚Äôt. Shanice wrote about it in detail in this post, A day in the life of Ben‚Äôs Bites.\nWith Retool, you can turn prompts into full-stack internal tools‚Äîconnected to your data, hosted in your cloud, and secured by your rules. Build easier, deploy safely, and move from idea to production in minutes.*\n\n\n üåê What I‚Äôm consuming\n\nTaste is your moat with Dylan Field, Figma.\n\nAgents of Scale - new podcast by my old boss at Zapier.\n\nA cartoonist‚Äôs review of AI art by The Oatmeal. \n\nVibe engineering and embracing the parallel coding agent lifestyle.\n\nSora, AI Bicycles, and Meta Disruption.\n\nTwo things LLM coding agents are still bad at: copy-pasting code and asking questions. This is actually a good critique‚Äîespecially the first one. I wonder if you could create an app/service for refactoring codebases by teaching an open-source model (like Kimi K2 or GLM 4.6) to use ‚Äúcut/copy/paste‚Äù as tools.\n\nThe State of AI report 2025 ‚Äî this one will take me a few days to go through.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n‚öôÔ∏è  Tools and demos\n\nScout Monitoring‚Äôs MCP - AI-native monitoring. It feeds performance issues and slow endpoints directly into your AI coding assistant.*\n\nGoogle AI Studio now lets you use your voice as an input for vibe coding.\n\nElevenLabs launched Agent Workflows and an open source UI library for building voice agents.\n\nGrok Imagine now uses xAI‚Äôs Imagine 0.9 model with audio generation.\n\nOpal, Google‚Äôs experimental product for chaining AI steps together with a visual builder, is now open globally (with MCP support coming soon).\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n ü•£ Dev dish\n\nPlaywright, the browser automation library, has agents now. One to plan tests, another to generate them and a healer to debug and fix failing tests.\n\nRecall - Redis-powered persistent memory for Claude (usable as an MCP server).\n\nsora-mcp - An MCP server to use Sora video generation APIs.\n\nYou can use any open-source model in Factory AI‚Äôs Droid. \n\nRepobench - Ranking models for large context reasoning, file editing precision, and instruction adherence for coding tasks. I met Eric yesterday and chatted about how he built this.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n üç¶ Afters\n\nAgentic Memory & Context Engineering Hackathon, Oct. 11 ‚Äî Push the boundaries of what you can build with MongoDB‚Äôs Atlas Vector Search and Voyage AI.*\n\nBoth OpenAI and Google have expanded their $5/mo AI plan to multiple countries.\n\nn8n has raised $180M at a $2.5B valuation, and Cursor is planning another round at $30B valuation.\n\n\n\n\nEnjoy this newsletter? Forward it to a friend.\n\nShare\n\nThat‚Äôs it for today. Feel free to comment and share your thoughts. üëã\n\nFind me on X, Linkedin, or Instagram\n\nRead about me and ben‚Äôs bites\n\nüì∑ thumbnail creds: @keshavatearth,\n\n* marks sponsors that make this newsletter possible :)\nWanna partner with us? Last few slots left for the rest of the year.","enclosure":{"url":"https://substack-post-media.s3.amazonaws.com/public/images/d1dce3a7-83c0-485c-96d8-7e22c99896a9_460x276.png","length":"0","type":"image/jpeg"},"content":"by zooming out a little bit","contentSnippet":"by zooming out a little bit","guid":"https://www.bensbites.com/p/how-to-see-through-ai-marketing","isoDate":"2025-10-09T13:02:54.000Z","itunes":{}},"pairedItem":[{"item":0}]},{"json":{"title":"Thoughts from OpenAI DevDay","link":"https://www.bensbites.com/p/thoughts-from-openai-devday","pubDate":"Tue, 07 Oct 2025 13:31:01 GMT","content:encoded":"<p><em>The newsletter for the technically curious. Updates, tool reviews, and lay of the land from an exited founder turned investor and forever tinkerer.</em></p><p class=\"button-wrapper\" data-attrs=\"{&quot;url&quot;:&quot;https://www.bensbites.com/subscribe?&quot;,&quot;text&quot;:&quot;Subscribe now&quot;,&quot;action&quot;:null,&quot;class&quot;:null}\" data-component-name=\"ButtonCreateButton\"><a class=\"button primary\" href=\"https://www.bensbites.com/subscribe?\"><span>Subscribe now</span></a></p><div><hr></div><p>Hey folks, I&#8217;ve just been at OpenAI Dev Day.</p><p>The event itself was phenomenal, great organisation. In terms of releases, there were two big themes:</p><ol><li><p>Add your apps to ChatGPT</p></li><li><p>Add ChatGPT to your apps </p></li></ol><p><strong><a href=\"https://openai.com/index/introducing-apps-in-chatgpt/\">Apps in ChatGPT</a></strong>, I think we all saw that coming. It renders a familiar UI based on the application you&#8217;re using (say, Figma) and syncs with your data using MCP. It feels native to ChatGPT vs. OpenAI&#8217;s previous attempts to make an app store (hello, Plugins &amp; GPT Store).</p><p>OpenAI promises discovery and monetisation for building on top of ChatGPT. But there&#8217;s a question about the future, will devs focus more on bundling components with MCP, so that AI can stitch together into an interface inside chat tools like ChatGPT or Claude, or building a website/app to be consumed by a human, which is very different? To me, it mimics how mobile apps became something you <em>need</em> to build now, but the web didn&#8217;t go away.</p><p>Then we have <strong><a href=\"https://openai.com/index/introducing-agentkit/\">AgentKit</a></strong> - A suite of tools to add a chat UI to your apps. There&#8217;s a visual workflow builder (like n8n or Zapier) called <strong><a href=\"https://platform.openai.com/agent-builder\">Agent Builder</a></strong>. And a <strong><a href=\"https://chatkit.studio/\">Widget Builder</a></strong> with ready-to-use components tailor-made for chat UIs. It&#8217;s for developer-adjacent roles, like a PM who can build a chatbot in a no-code UI and just hand the workflow_id to a dev or AI-generated code.</p><p>It&#8217;s not quite automating away repeated tasks (like Zapier); instead, it&#8217;s focusing on creating a chat-based experience on top of your product. But OpenAI can easily turn it into the former; they&#8217;re swallowing up the actual space in between any startups right now building anything with AI.</p><p>The OpenAI team typically say the same thing: &#8220;Well, the models are taking us wherever we&#8217;re going&#8221; and &#8220;models will keep getting better.&#8221; But that doesn&#8217;t mean ChatGPT needs a workflow builder. Fees like they&#8217;re capitalising on every opportunity enabled by the models improving. Also, they&#8217;re training the models to get better at certain things, like writing code, so it&#8217;s not uninformed.</p><p>Of course, there were the <a href=\"https://openai.com/devday/\">other updates</a> we expected:</p><ul><li><p>Sora 2 is now in the API. It&#8217;s cheaper than Veo 3&#8217;s API with better quality/controls.</p></li><li><p>Codex is generally available with a new SDK and Slack integration.</p></li><li><p>GPT-5 Pro is available in the API.</p></li><li><p>Cheaper, smaller models for voice-to-voice chat (<code>gpt-realtime-mini</code>) and image generation (<code>gpt-image-1-mini</code>).</p></li></ul><p>I saw some familiar faces: Swyx, Alessio from Latent Space, Alex from Thursday AI, Rowan from The Rundown, Greg from ARC-AGI, Dan Shipper. And Simon Willison sat next to me in a workshop, just coding away. He was like, <em>&#8220;Oh, they, they&#8217;ve launched this GPT Image Mini. It&#8217;s very cheap, they didn&#8217;t even mention it in the keynote,&#8221;</em> but he just discovered it and then did his <a href=\"https://simonwillison.net/2025/Oct/6/gpt-5-pro/\">pelican test for GPT-5-Pro</a> straight away. That was really cool, actually.</p><p>I also spoke to Greg Brockman, asking him, &#8220;Why is there no new thinking around GitHub and the whole development stack? I&#8217;m new to development, but writing code is no longer the hard part,&#8221; and he agreed with me. If you&#8217;re building in that space, reach out&#8212;I want to invest.</p><p>Also, <a href=\"https://luma.com/26lnt0gy\">come meet me IRL on 8th October in SF</a> and talk about Droids, ask the team questions, plus more free tokens :)</p><p><strong><a href=\"https://developers.googleblog.com/en/gemini-2-5-flash-image-now-ready-for-production-with-new-aspect-ratios/\">Nano-banana is generally available</a></strong> in the Gemini API. The stable version comes with support for 10 different aspect ratios and image-only output. Google DeepMind also shared the results of their new agent, <strong><a href=\"https://deepmind.google/discover/blog/introducing-codemender-an-ai-agent-for-code-security\">CodeMender</a></strong> (nice name). It&#8217;s built on top of Gemini Deep Think and can automatically patch critical software vulnerabilities.</p><p><strong>OpenAI built GPT for the masses. Brightwave built AI for professionals:</strong> full editability, traceability down to the sentence level, and 20x the compute. Their custom subagents can ingest 2000+ documents with zero loss of fidelity - try doing that with a consumer LLM. &#8594; <a href=\"https://lp.brightwave.io/research-platform/?utm_source=bensbites&amp;utm_medium=newsletter&amp;utm_campaign=107\">Your 7-day trial is waiting.</a>*</p><div><hr></div><h3><strong> </strong>&#127760;<strong> </strong>What I&#8217;m consuming</h3><ul><li><p><a href=\"https://a16zenterprise.substack.com/p/the-ai-application-spending-report\">Which apps are startups spending their AI budget</a> on (beyond GPUs)? The top 50 contains 4 vibe-coding and 10 creative AI tools, hinting they are here to stay.</p></li><li><p>Three paths for how AI changes <a href=\"https://jake.vision/blog/ai-for-science\">scientific discovery</a>.</p></li><li><p><a href=\"https://every.to/vibe-check/vibe-check-openai-devday-2025\">Vibe Check by Every</a> - OpenAI DevDay 2025.</p></li></ul><blockquote><p>If you&#8217;re looking for a tactical playbook on startup investing (did you know you can write $1k checks?), my friends at Angel Squad run a weekly newsletter called <strong>Small Bets</strong>. It&#8217;s one of the top investor newsletters in the space with 30k+ subscribers. If you&#8217;re interested in AI, you&#8217;ll enjoy it. Check it out &#8211; <a href=\"https://www.hustlefund.vc/small-bets\">subscribe here</a>.*</p></blockquote><div><hr></div><h3>&#9881;&#65039;  Tools and demos</h3><ul><li><p><strong><a href=\"https://www.assemblyai.com/?utm_source=bensbites&amp;utm_medium=newsletter_sponsor&amp;utm_campaign=toptools&amp;utm_content=voice_ai_100725\">AssemblyAI</a></strong> &#8211; Fast, accurate, scalable speech-to-text for the next generation of Voice AI apps.*</p></li><li><p><strong><a href=\"https://instant.bot/\">Instant.bot</a></strong> - Group chat with your own AI in Discord or a browser.</p></li><li><p><strong><a href=\"https://www.lindy.ai/blog/gaia-announcement\">Gaia by Lindy</a></strong> - Low-latency phone agent with memory that you can integrate with other tools, like a CRM.</p></li><li><p><strong><a href=\"https://www.perplexity.ai/comet\">Perplexity&#8217;s AI browser Comet</a></strong> is now available to everyone in the world</p></li><li><p><strong><a href=\"https://blog.reve.art/posts/reve-editing-model/\">Reve</a></strong> is a new startup training image models from scratch and making a product around them. Their latest image editing model is #4 on the image edit arena, but using it within their product experience feels like what Photoshop with AI should be.</p></li><li><p><strong><a href=\"https://conare.ai/\">Conare</a></strong> - Visual UI to manage context for Claude Code.</p></li></ul><div class=\"captioned-image-container\"><figure><a class=\"image-link image2 href=\"https://github.com/MaximeRivest/maivi\">Maivi</a> - Get a local voice-to-text model running on your device.</p></li><li><p><a href=\"https://github.com/safety-research/petri\">Petri</a> - Agent to audit model behaviours like sycophancy and deception. (<a href=\"https://www.anthropic.com/research/petri-open-source-auditing\">Anthropic&#8217;s blog</a>)</p></li><li><p><a href=\"https://developers.googleblog.com/en/meet-jules-tools-a-command-line-companion-for-googles-async-coding-agent/\">Jules Tools</a> - Lightweight CLI to manage your tasks/trigger new tasks with Google Jules.</p></li><li><p><a href=\"https://github.com/goodfire-ai/scribe\">Scribe by GoodFire AI</a> - Give Claude Code, Codex, and Gemini CLI agents access to Jupyter servers + notebooks. (Their goal here is enabling experimentation for AI safety research&#8212;<a href=\"https://www.goodfire.ai/blog/you-and-your-research-agent\">more in their blog</a>)</p></li></ul><div><hr></div><h3> &#128202; Charts I came across this week</h3><ul><li><p>Mercor AI, a hiring company that outsources data labelling for AI labs, released a new benchmark: <a href=\"https://mercor.com/apex\">AI Productivity Index (APEX)</a>. All the top models have roughly similar scores, except Opus 4.1, which scores way low here (vs. topping OpenAI&#8217;s similar <a href=\"https://openai.com/index/gdpval/\">GDPval</a>). </p></li></ul><div class=\"captioned-image-container\"><figure><a class=\"image-link image2 is-viewable-img\" target=\"_blank\" for their data. Last few slots left for the rest of the year.</em></h6><div><hr></div>","content:encodedSnippet":"The newsletter for the technically curious. Updates, tool reviews, and lay of the land from an exited founder turned investor and forever tinkerer.\nSubscribe now\n\n\nHey folks, I‚Äôve just been at OpenAI Dev Day.\nThe event itself was phenomenal, great organisation. In terms of releases, there were two big themes:\n\nAdd your apps to ChatGPT\n\nAdd ChatGPT to your apps \n\nApps in ChatGPT, I think we all saw that coming. It renders a familiar UI based on the application you‚Äôre using (say, Figma) and syncs with your data using MCP. It feels native to ChatGPT vs. OpenAI‚Äôs previous attempts to make an app store (hello, Plugins & GPT Store).\nOpenAI promises discovery and monetisation for building on top of ChatGPT. But there‚Äôs a question about the future, will devs focus more on bundling components with MCP, so that AI can stitch together into an interface inside chat tools like ChatGPT or Claude, or building a website/app to be consumed by a human, which is very different? To me, it mimics how mobile apps became something you need to build now, but the web didn‚Äôt go away.\nThen we have AgentKit - A suite of tools to add a chat UI to your apps. There‚Äôs a visual workflow builder (like n8n or Zapier) called Agent Builder. And a Widget Builder with ready-to-use components tailor-made for chat UIs. It‚Äôs for developer-adjacent roles, like a PM who can build a chatbot in a no-code UI and just hand the workflow_id to a dev or AI-generated code.\nIt‚Äôs not quite automating away repeated tasks (like Zapier); instead, it‚Äôs focusing on creating a chat-based experience on top of your product. But OpenAI can easily turn it into the former; they‚Äôre swallowing up the actual space in between any startups right now building anything with AI.\nThe OpenAI team typically say the same thing: ‚ÄúWell, the models are taking us wherever we‚Äôre going‚Äù and ‚Äúmodels will keep getting better.‚Äù But that doesn‚Äôt mean ChatGPT needs a workflow builder. Fees like they‚Äôre capitalising on every opportunity enabled by the models improving. Also, they‚Äôre training the models to get better at certain things, like writing code, so it‚Äôs not uninformed.\nOf course, there were the other updates we expected:\n\nSora 2 is now in the API. It‚Äôs cheaper than Veo 3‚Äôs API with better quality/controls.\n\nCodex is generally available with a new SDK and Slack integration.\n\nGPT-5 Pro is available in the API.\n\nCheaper, smaller models for voice-to-voice chat (gpt-realtime-mini) and image generation (gpt-image-1-mini).\n\nI saw some familiar faces: Swyx, Alessio from Latent Space, Alex from Thursday AI, Rowan from The Rundown, Greg from ARC-AGI, Dan Shipper. And Simon Willison sat next to me in a workshop, just coding away. He was like, ‚ÄúOh, they, they‚Äôve launched this GPT Image Mini. It‚Äôs very cheap, they didn‚Äôt even mention it in the keynote,‚Äù but he just discovered it and then did his pelican test for GPT-5-Pro straight away. That was really cool, actually.\nI also spoke to Greg Brockman, asking him, ‚ÄúWhy is there no new thinking around GitHub and the whole development stack? I‚Äôm new to development, but writing code is no longer the hard part,‚Äù and he agreed with me. If you‚Äôre building in that space, reach out‚ÄîI want to invest.\nAlso, come meet me IRL on 8th October in SF and talk about Droids, ask the team questions, plus more free tokens :)\nNano-banana is generally available in the Gemini API. The stable version comes with support for 10 different aspect ratios and image-only output. Google DeepMind also shared the results of their new agent, CodeMender (nice name). It‚Äôs built on top of Gemini Deep Think and can automatically patch critical software vulnerabilities.\nOpenAI built GPT for the masses. Brightwave built AI for professionals: full editability, traceability down to the sentence level, and 20x the compute. Their custom subagents can ingest 2000+ documents with zero loss of fidelity - try doing that with a consumer LLM. ‚Üí Your 7-day trial is waiting.*\n\n\n üåê What I‚Äôm consuming\n\nWhich apps are startups spending their AI budget on (beyond GPUs)? The top 50 contains 4 vibe-coding and 10 creative AI tools, hinting they are here to stay.\n\nThree paths for how AI changes scientific discovery.\n\nVibe Check by Every - OpenAI DevDay 2025.\n\n\nIf you‚Äôre looking for a tactical playbook on startup investing (did you know you can write $1k checks?), my friends at Angel Squad run a weekly newsletter called Small Bets. It‚Äôs one of the top investor newsletters in the space with 30k+ subscribers. If you‚Äôre interested in AI, you‚Äôll enjoy it. Check it out ‚Äì subscribe here.*\n\n\n‚öôÔ∏è  Tools and demos\n\nAssemblyAI ‚Äì Fast, accurate, scalable speech-to-text for the next generation of Voice AI apps.*\n\nInstant.bot - Group chat with your own AI in Discord or a browser.\n\nGaia by Lindy - Low-latency phone agent with memory that you can integrate with other tools, like a CRM.\n\nPerplexity‚Äôs AI browser Comet is now available to everyone in the world\n\nReve is a new startup training image models from scratch and making a product around them. Their latest image editing model is #4 on the image edit arena, but using it within their product experience feels like what Photoshop with AI should be.\n\nConare - Visual UI to manage context for Claude Code.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n ü•£ Dev dish\n\nMaivi - Get a local voice-to-text model running on your device.\n\nPetri - Agent to audit model behaviours like sycophancy and deception. (Anthropic‚Äôs blog)\n\nJules Tools - Lightweight CLI to manage your tasks/trigger new tasks with Google Jules.\n\nScribe by GoodFire AI - Give Claude Code, Codex, and Gemini CLI agents access to Jupyter servers + notebooks. (Their goal here is enabling experimentation for AI safety research‚Äîmore in their blog)\n\n\n\n üìä Charts I came across this week\n\nMercor AI, a hiring company that outsources data labelling for AI labs, released a new benchmark: AI Productivity Index (APEX). All the top models have roughly similar scores, except Opus 4.1, which scores way low here (vs. topping OpenAI‚Äôs similar GDPval). \n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nTop performing models across 4 professions covered by APEX\n\n\n üç¶ Afters\n\nAgentic Memory & Context Engineering Hackathon, Oct. 11 ‚Äî Push the boundaries of what you can build with MongoDB‚Äôs Atlas Vector Search and Voyage AI.*\n\nVercel is hosting a one-day AI conference on 23rd Oct in SF.\n\nMedal, a company that allows you to capture and share video game clips, was getting $500M from OpenAI for their data. The deal fell through, and Medal is now building a research lab of its own.\n\nSupermemory raised $3M to build the best memory for LLMs and agents. (I‚Äôm an investor)\n\nOpenAI is partnering with AMD to deploy 6 GW of AMD GPUs over the next few years (and buy up to 10% of AMD stock).\n\n\n\n\nEnjoy this newsletter? Forward it to a friend.\n\nShare\n\nThat‚Äôs it for today. news!</p><p>People are just realizing that &#8220;<strong><a href=\"https://x.com/shl/status/1997492199328485400\">Harness is the new app</a></strong>&#8221; but this was very clear early this year when we saw Claude and Gemini play pokemon. <a href=\"https://www.bensbites.com/p/thoughts-on-a-week-in-sf?open=false#%C2%A7what-im-consuming\">We&#8217;ve been talking about</a> it since May but it&#8217;s gaining even more momentum now. Cursor is talking about improving their <a href=\"https://cursor.com/blog/codex-model-harness\">harness for Codex models</a> and Poetic used a custom harness Gemini 3 Pro to get the <a href=\"https://poetiq.ai/posts/arcagi_verified/\">best score on ARC-AGI 2</a>.</p><p>Google upgraded <strong><a href=\"https://x.com/GoogleAI/status/1996657213390155927\">Deep Think with Gemini 3</a></strong> for Ultra plan users ($250/mo). Shopify&#8217;s CTO and prev. Head of AI at Microsoft, <a href=\"https://x.com/MParakhin/status/1997392115777638545\">Mikhail Parakhin</a>, thinks the new version is better for coding something from scratch and notices more corner cases (and it&#8217;s faster), but still has some rough edges. </p><p>You can now <strong><a href=\"https://x.com/claudeai/status/1998109170449719647\">delegate tasks to Claude Code</a></strong> directly from Slack. I played around with Claude Code on the desktop app and it&#8217;s a nice interface for Claude as an Agent. I won&#8217;t be surprised if Claude app starts to look like that by default in 2026.</p><p>Folks at HuggingFace got Claude Code and other CLIs to <a href=\"https://huggingface.co/blog/hf-skills-training\">fine-tune an open model</a>. It&#8217;s available as a skill. Here&#8217;s an idea for you to steal: make a local email processing app with a 3-7B model.</p><p><strong>Eliminate AI anxiety. Build with confidence.</strong> AI agents are the future&#8212;but centralized systems create costly risks. With Airia, prototype and orchestrate AI agents securely while creating a resilient, decentralized AI ecosystem for your organization. Get started today at <strong><a href=\"https://airia.com/\">airia.com</a></strong>*</p><p>ps: <a href=\"https://www.theverge.com/report/838857/openai-gpt-5-2-release-date-code-red-google-response\">GPT-5.2</a> is likely coming this week, and Google will launch its first <a href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2025/12/08/google-ai-glasses-launch-2026.html\">AI glasses in 2026</a>.</p><div><hr></div><h3><strong> </strong>&#127760;<strong> </strong>What I&#8217;m consuming</h3><ul><li><p><a href=\"https://www.99ravens.agency/resources/blogs/your-experts-wont-train-your-ai-you-have-to-interview-them/\">Your experts won&#8217;t train your AI</a>. You have to interview them.</p></li><li><p>How I keep up with <a href=\"https://www.raf.xyz/blog/03-how-i-keep-up-with-ai-generated-prs\">AI-generated PRs</a>.</p></li><li><p><a href=\"https://www.abilshr.com/writing/droid-maxxing\">Droid-maxxing</a> - Pushing AI-assisted development to its limits.</p></li><li><p><a href=\"https://www.androidpolice.com/google-illuminate-best-research-tool-didnt-know-i-needed/\">Google Illuminate</a> is quietly becoming the best research tool I didn&#8217;t know I needed.</p></li><li><p>Better ways to build <a href=\"https://yoheinakajima.com/better-ways-to-build-self-improving-ai-agents/\">self-improving agents</a> - A recap of 2025 NeurIPS research papers.</p></li><li><p>A profile of <a href=\"https://www.theinformation.com/articles/chatgpt-product-chief-responding-code-red?rc=bdorru\">ChatGPT&#8217;s product chief</a>, Nick Turley.</p></li><li><p>Antropic&#8217;s resident philosopher, <a href=\"https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=I9aGC6Ui3eE\">Amanda Askell</a>, answers questions about AI.</p></li><li><p>Stop juggling 5 APIs. &amp; content.*</p></li><li><p><strong><a href=\"https://x.com/paraga/status/1997038270308643098\">Integrations by Parallel AI</a></strong> - Get fast and cheap search data right in Google Sheets, restocks, news, etc).</p></li><li><p><strong><a href=\"https://apps.apple.com/us/app/private-notes-ai-note-taker/id6752633041\">Private Notes</a></strong> - 100% offline AI note-taking iOS app (built with Droid).</p></li><li><p><strong><a href=\"https://x.com/stitchbygoogle/status/1998151360446181626\">Stitch</a></strong> by Google Labs can now convert a design image generated by Nano Banana Pro Dev Dish</h3><ul><li><p><a href=\"https://github.com/adewale/claude-history-explorer\">Claude history explorer</a> - Python CLI tool to explore, search and visualise your Claude Code conversation history.</p></li><li><p><a href=\"https://github.com/tobi/qmd\">QMD by Tobi Lutke</a> - On-device search engine for everything. A combination of BM25 full-text search, vector semantic search, and LLM re-ranking.</p></li></ul><div><hr></div><h3>&#128203; State of AI reports</h3><ul><li><p><a href=\"https://openrouter.ai/state-of-ai\">OpenRouter released a &#8220;state of AI&#8221; report</a> based on 100 trillion tokens used on their platform. Mostly focuses on how OSS models are used.</p></li><li><p><a href=\"https://www.anthropic.com/research/anthropic-interviewer\">Anthropic Interviewer</a> - Anthropic interviewed 1,250 professionals about working with AI to map their emptions and expectaations. They are now opening it Claude users too (you should see a popup if you visit Claude on Web).</p></li><li><p><a href=\"https://openai.com/index/the-state-of-enterprise-ai-2025-report/\">The State of Enterprise AI by OpenAI</a> - Haven&#8217;t got the chance to dig into this one but saw this chart. Top AI users use it much more than median users.</p></li></ul><div class=\"captioned-image-container\"><figure><a class=\"image-link image2 is-viewable-img\" target=\"_blank\" We‚Äôve been talking about it since May but it‚Äôs gaining even more momentum now. Cursor is talking about improving their harness for Codex models and Poetic used a custom harness Gemini 3 Pro to get the best score on ARC-AGI 2.\nGoogle upgraded Deep Think with Gemini 3 for Ultra plan users ($250/mo). Shopify‚Äôs CTO and prev. Head of AI at Microsoft, Mikhail Parakhin, thinks the new version is better for coding something from scratch and notices more corner cases (and it‚Äôs faster), but still has some rough edges. \nYou can now delegate tasks to Claude Code directly from Slack. I won‚Äôt be surprised if Claude app starts to look like that by default in 2026.\nFolks at HuggingFace got Claude Code and other CLIs to fine-tune an open model. It‚Äôs available as a skill. Another Google Labs product, Mixboard, also got some upgrades.\n\nYou can now connect Replit Agent to remote MCP servers.\n\nNormal - Your team‚Äôs branding partner.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nü•£ Dev Dish\n\nClaude history explorer - Python CLI tool to explore, search and visualise your Claude Code conversation history.\n\nQMD by Tobi Lutke - On-device search engine for everything. A combination of BM25 full-text search, vector semantic search, and LLM re-ranking.\n\n\n\nüìã State of AI reports\n\nOpenRouter released a ‚Äústate of AI‚Äù report based on 100 trillion tokens used on their platform. Updates, tool reviews, and lay of the land from an exited founder turned investor and forever tinkerer.</em></p><p class=\"button-wrapper\" data-attrs=\"{&quot;url&quot;:&quot;https://www.bensbites.com/subscribe?&quot;,&quot;text&quot;:&quot;Subscribe now&quot;,&quot;action&quot;:null,&quot;class&quot;:null}\" data-component-name=\"ButtonCreateButton\"><a class=\"button primary\" href=\"https://www.bensbites.com/subscribe?\"><span>Subscribe now</span></a></p><div><hr></div><p>Hey folks, </p><p>I&#8217;m launching a fun little thing: <strong><a href=\"https://droidmas.com/\">droidmas.com</a></strong> - jokes and games around concepts in ai dev. Day 1 is about benchmarks, live now.</p><p><strong><a href=\"https://www.anthropic.com/news/anthropic-acquires-bun-as-claude-code-reaches-usd1b-milestone\">Anthropic has acquired Bun</a></strong>. Bun makes JS code run faster, and the company is filled with the best JS devs. The story of <a href=\"https://bun.com/blog/bun-joins-anthropic\">how this came to be</a> is crazy. <a href=\"https://openai.com/index/openai-to-acquire-neptune/\">OpenAI also bought a company, Neptune AI</a> (tools for AI researchers).</p><p>Opus 4.5 is finally available on Claude Code with Pro plans ($20/mo). The limits are not as generous, but at least you can use it :) Claude Code has crossed $1B in run-rate revenue just 6 months after launch, and the rumours are that Anthropic is planning an IPO.</p><p><strong><a href=\"https://workspace.google.com/studio\">Google Workspace Studio</a></strong> is now GA. It&#8217;s an automation builder, but it looks like it can handle much more complex use cases (connect multiple apps beyond Google&#8217;s ecosystem, add different AI steps in between), all with just prompts.</p><p>Mistral released a few models: <strong><a href=\"https://mistral.ai/news/mistral-3\">Mistral Large 3 and Ministral 3</a></strong>. Mistral Large 3 is in the same leagues as DeepSeek 3.2 and Kimi K2. I&#8217;m more excited by Ministral models. They come in three sizes: 14B, 8B, and 3B with base, instruct and reasoning variants for all three.</p><p><strong>Eliminate AI anxiety. Build with confidence.</strong> AI agents are the future&#8212;but centralized systems create costly risks. With Airia, prototype and orchestrate AI agents securely while creating a resilient, decentralized AI ecosystem for your organization. <strong>Get started today at <a href=\"https://airia.com/\">airia.com</a></strong>*</p><div><hr></div><h3><strong> </strong>&#127760;<strong> </strong>What I&#8217;m consuming</h3><ul><li><p><a The limits are not as generous, but at least you can use it :) Claude Code has crossed $1B in run-rate revenue just 6 months after launch, and the rumours are that Anthropic is planning an IPO.\nGoogle Workspace Studio is now GA. It‚Äôs an automation builder, but it looks like it can handle much more complex use cases (connect multiple apps beyond Google‚Äôs ecosystem, add different AI steps in between), all with just prompts.\nMistral released a few models: Mistral Large 3 and Ministral 3. Mistral Large 3 is in the same leagues as DeepSeek 3.2 and Kimi K2. I‚Äôm more excited by Ministral models. They come in three sizes: 14B, 8B, and 3B with base, instruct and reasoning variants for all three.\nEliminate AI anxiety. Build with confidence. Updates, tool reviews, and lay of the land from an exited founder turned investor and forever tinkerer.</em></p><p class=\"button-wrapper\" data-attrs=\"{&quot;url&quot;:&quot;https://www.bensbites.com/subscribe?&quot;,&quot;text&quot;:&quot;Subscribe now&quot;,&quot;action&quot;:null,&quot;class&quot;:null}\" data-component-name=\"ButtonCreateButton\"><a class=\"button primary\" href=\"https://www.bensbites.com/subscribe?\"><span>Subscribe now</span></a></p><div><hr></div><p>Hey folks, </p><p>The Information reports <strong><a href=\"https://www.theinformation.com/articles/openai-ceo-declares-code-red-combat-threats-chatgpt-delays-ads-effort\">Sam Altman declared &#8220;Code Red&#8221;</a></strong> inside OpenAI after Gemini 3&#8217;s success. Ads in ChatGPT will be delayed, with the same fate for products like Agents and Pulse. Personalisation, image generation and model behaviour will be the main focus. The report also claims that OpenAI will release a new reasoning model better than Gemini 3 next week.</p><p>DeepSeek&#8217;s new models, <strong><a href=\"https://x.com/deepseek_ai/status/1995452641430651132\">DeepSeek V3.2 base and Speciale</a>,</strong> are impressive (and open) BUT not better than any of the other top models (GPT-5.1/Codex, Opus/Sonnet 4.5, Gemini 3). The Speciale version can get a gold medal in math olympiads, but it&#8217;s only good for proving theorems, it seems, and you can think of the base version as almost the same level as GPT-5 though you&#8217;ll see subpar results in both use cases: chat and coding.</p><p>FLUX models by Black Forest Labs were the original stable diffusion killer. With <strong><a href=\"https://bfl.ai/blog/flux-2\">FLUX.2 family of image generation models</a></strong>, their next goal is Nano Banana and dozens of open models from China. FLUX.2 [dev] is the 32B open weights variant, better and 3x cheaper than the original Nano Banana (10x cheaper than Nano Banana Pro). BFL also raised a <a href=\"https://bfl.ai/blog/our-300m-series-b\">$300M Series B.</a></p><p>The leading video generation model swapped hands by a significant margin. Runway is the new leader with its latest <strong><a href=\"https://runwayml.com/research/introducing-runway-gen-4.5\">Runway Gen 4.5 model</a></strong>, beating Google&#8217;s Veo 3. Kling, a close competitor, also released a new model, <strong><a href=\"https://x.com/fal/status/1995508595954225232\">Kling O1</a>,</strong> exclusively on Fal, so it&#8217;s not on the leaderboards yet.</p><p><strong><a href=\"https://attio.com/?utm_source=bens_bites&amp;utm_medium=newsletter_sponsorship&amp;utm_campaign=bens_bites-Q3Y25\">Attio</a></strong> is the AI-native CRM for the next generation of teams. Sync your email and calendar, and Attio instantly builds your CRM&#8212;enriching every company, contact, and interaction with actionable insights in seconds. Join fast growing teams like Granola, Flatfile, Modal, and more. <strong><a href=\"https://attio.com/?utm_source=bens_bites&amp;utm_medium=newsletter_sponsorship&amp;utm_campaign=bens_bites-Q3Y25\">Start for free today.</a></strong>*</p><div><hr></div><h3><strong> </strong>&#127760;<strong> </strong>What I&#8217;m consuming</h3><ul><li><p>The new <a href=\"https://alignment.openai.com/\">alignment research blog</a> from OpenAI, live with its <a href=\"https://alignment.openai.com/sae-latent-attribution/\">first</a> <a href=\"https://alignment.openai.com/scaling-code-verification/\">two</a> posts.</p></li><li><p>On the <a href=\"https://www.sh-reya.com/blog/consumption-ai-scale/\">consumption of AI-generated content</a> at scale.</p></li><li><p>Thoughts from building and shutting down a <a href=\"https://hypersoren.xyz/posts/dark-matter/\">portable context layer</a> company.</p></li><li><p><a href=\"https://www.ft.com/content/8881062d-ff4f-4454-8e9d-d992e8e2c4e3\">OpenAI&#8217;s lead under pressure</a> as rivals start to close the gap - FT</p></li><li><p><a href=\"https://supermemory.ai/research\">Supermemory is state-of-the-art on LongMemEval</a> - a measure for reasoning, recollection and more across 100K+ tokens. (I&#8217;m an investor)</p></li></ul><div class=\"captioned-image-container\"><figure><a class=\"image-link image2 is-viewable-img\" target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://supermemory.ai/research\" y2=\"14\"></line></svg></button></div></div></div></a></figure></div><div><hr></div><h3>&#9881;&#65039; Tools and demos</h3><ul><li><p><strong><a href=\"http://concierge.ai/\">Concierge.ai</a></strong> - Engage &amp; convert inbound website visitors into qualified leads with a custom AI answer engine trained on your brand &amp; content.*</p></li><li><p><strong>Gemini Dynamic View</strong> - Paid users on Gemini can select this tool to get a visual one-pager website-like output on a certain topic. Here&#8217;s a <a href=\"https://x.com/Keshavatearth/status/1995548166591250773\">sample</a> of using it to catch up for Stranger Things S5.</p></li><li><p><strong><a href=\"https://duet.so/\">Duet</a></strong> - Group ChatGPT for work (with MCP and a shared knowledge base).</p></li><li><p><strong><a href=\"https://www.rephrase.space/\">Rephrase</a></strong> - Fix grammar and format text instantly on Mac.</p></li><li><p><strong><a href=\"https://www.komposo.ai/\">Komposo</a></strong> - Generate and edit designs, and export directly to code.</p></li><li><p><strong><a href=\"https://www.plok.sh/\">Plok.sh</a></strong> -  Turn a GitHub repo into a blog. Not an AI tool, but this looks useful.</p></li><li><p><strong><a href=\"https://tldw.us/\">TLDW</a></strong> - Paste the link of an hour-long video and get the gist in 5-minute highlight reels.</p></li></ul><div class=\"captioned-image-container\"><figure><a class=\"image-link image2 is-viewable-img\" target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://tldw.us/\" data-component-name=\"Image2ToDOM\"><div Dev dish</h3><ul><li><p><a href=\"https://github.com/Ryandonofrio3/osgrep\">osgrep</a> - open source, local semantic code search for Claude Code that works.</p></li><li><p><a href=\"https://x.com/morphllm/status/1994484969050444103\">WarpGrep by Morph</a> runs parallel tool calls as a context subagent to improve coding agent performance.</p></li><li><p><a href=\"https://agiopen.org/blog\">Lux by OpenAGI</a> - Fast, cheap and better computer-use model in an SDK.</p></li><li><p><a href=\"https://github.com/automazeio/vibeproxy\">vibeproxy</a> - Native macOS menu bar app to use your Claude/ChatGPT/Gemini subscriptions with AI coding tools.</p></li></ul><div><hr></div><h3>&#127846; Afters</h3><ul><li><p><strong><a href=\"https://fandf.co/3M4yodI\">Valon is hiring Forward Deployed Engineers</a>.</strong> $130K&#8211;$230K &amp; equity, turning enterprise clients needs into code onsite. NYC/SF/Seattle + travel*</p></li><li><p><a href=\"https://www.raindrop.ai/blog/seed-round\">Raindrop AI</a> (monitoring and A/B testing for AI apps) raised $15M seed.</p></li><li><p>Telegram is operating a <a href=\"https://x.com/durov/status/1995208789600182391\">decentralised compute network</a> for its AI features and making it open for others, too.</p></li><li><p>OpenAI takes an <a href=\"https://openai.com/index/thrive-holdings/\">ownership stake</a> in Thrive Holdings.</p></li></ul><blockquote><p>Thrive Holdings (initial round of $1B) acquires and holds legacy businesses like accounting &amp; IT services and transforms them with AI/tech. OpenAI now has equity and will train models for tasks with company-specific data.</p><p><em>- from Sheel Mohnot&#8217;s tweet (<a href=\"https://x.com/pitdesi/status/1995489623389433951\">@pitdesi</a>)</em></p></blockquote><div><hr></div><div class=\"captioned-button-wrap\" data-attrs=\"{&quot;url&quot;:&quot;https://www.bensbites.com/p/is-openai-really-in-trouble?utm_source=substack&utm_medium=email&utm_content=share&action=share&quot;,&quot;text&quot;:&quot;Share&quot;}\" data-component-name=\"CaptionedButtonToDOM\"><div class=\"preamble\"><p class=\"cta-caption\">Enjoy this newsletter? Ads in ChatGPT will be delayed, with the same fate for products like Agents and Pulse. Personalisation, image generation and model behaviour will be the main focus. The report also claims that OpenAI will release a new reasoning model better than Gemini 3 next week.\nDeepSeek‚Äôs new models, DeepSeek V3.2 base and Speciale, are impressive (and open) BUT not better than any of the other top models (GPT-5.1/Codex, Opus/Sonnet 4.5, Gemini 3). The Speciale version can get a gold medal in math olympiads, but it‚Äôs only good for proving theorems, it seems, and you can think of the base version as almost the same level as GPT-5 though you‚Äôll see subpar results in both use cases: chat and coding.\nFLUX models by Black Forest Labs were the original stable diffusion killer. With FLUX.2 family of image generation models, their next goal is Nano Banana and dozens of open models from China. FLUX.2 [dev] is the 32B open weights variant, better and 3x cheaper than the original Nano Banana (10x cheaper than Nano Banana Pro). BFL also raised a $300M Series B.\nThe leading video generation model swapped hands by a significant margin. Runway is the new leader with its latest Runway Gen 4.5 model, beating Google‚Äôs Veo 3. Kling, a close competitor, also released a new model, Kling O1, exclusively on Fal, so it‚Äôs not on the leaderboards yet.\nAttio is the AI-native CRM for the next generation of teams. Sync your email and calendar, and Attio instantly builds your CRM‚Äîenriching every company, contact, and interaction with actionable insights in seconds. Join fast growing teams like Granola, Flatfile, Modal, and more. (I‚Äôm an investor)\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n‚öôÔ∏è Tools and demos\n\nConcierge.ai - Engage & convert inbound website visitors into qualified leads with a custom AI answer engine trained on your brand & content.*\n\nGemini Dynamic View - Paid users on Gemini can select this tool to get a visual one-pager website-like output on a certain topic. Updates, tool reviews, and lay of the land from an exited founder turned investor and forever tinkerer.</em></p><p class=\"button-wrapper\" data-attrs=\"{&quot;url&quot;:&quot;https://www.bensbites.com/subscribe?&quot;,&quot;text&quot;:&quot;Subscribe now&quot;,&quot;action&quot;:null,&quot;class&quot;:null}\" data-component-name=\"ButtonCreateButton\"><a class=\"button primary\" href=\"https://www.bensbites.com/subscribe?\"><span>Subscribe now</span></a></p><div><hr></div><p>Hey folks, Happy Thanksgiving to those celebrating! Light edition today&#8230;</p><p>Classic move from OpenAI - dropping a data breach disclosure at 10pm the night before Turkey day. Brilliant PR timing.</p><p><strong>OpenAI disclosed a <a href=\"https://openai.com/index/mixpanel-incident\">Mixpanel security incident</a> that exposed API user data</strong> - names, emails, user IDs, and location info. No ChatGPT data or API keys were compromised. OpenAI has terminated its Mixpanel use entirely (no shit!).</p><p>Meanwhile, <a href=\"https://www.ft.com/content/23e54a28-6f63-4533-ab96-3756d9c88bad\">OpenAI needs to raise at least $207 billion by 2030</a> [paywalled] to keep the lights on, according to HSBC. This is <em>after</em> their commitments to Oracle ($300B), Microsoft ($250B), and AWS ($38B) for cloud services. The FT called OpenAI &#8220;a money pit with a website on top.&#8221; &#129760;</p><p><strong>Anthropic dropped two bangers this week</strong>. First, <a href=\"https://www.anthropic.com/engineering/effective-harnesses-for-long-running-agents\">Effective harnesses for long-running agents</a> - a deep dive into how they get Claude to work across multiple context windows without losing the plot. The key insight: use an initializer agent to set up the environment, then a coding agent that makes incremental progress and leaves clean artifacts for the next session. They built a Claude.ai clone this way. </p><p>[But <a href=\"https://www.factory.ai/\">Factory&#8217;s</a> harness is better]</p><p>Second, <a href=\"https://www.anthropic.com/research/estimating-productivity-gains\">Estimating AI productivity gains</a> - they analyzed 100K real Claude conversations and found AI reduces task completion time by ~80%. Extrapolating this, they estimate current AI could increase US labor productivity by 1.8% annually over the next decade - roughly doubling recent growth rates. The caveat: this doesn&#8217;t account for time humans spend validating outputs outside the chat window.</p><p>A little update from my portfolio:</p><p><a href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/sf-compute-40m)\">San Francisco Compute</a> - raised $40M at a $300M valuation - marketplace for AI computing capacity. (I&#8217;m an early investor) + <a href=\"https://x.com/evanjconrad/status/1993796642299105717?s=12\">they&#8217;re hiring</a></p><p>Plus some other investments have been on a tear recently;</p><ul><li><p>Gamma @ $2.5bn valuation - I invested as an a16z scout, they led the latest round. </p></li><li><p>Supabase @ $5bn </p></li><li><p>Scribe @ $1.3bn </p></li></ul><p>My 2020/2021 fund is now over 4x / 36% IRR</p><p>Ben&#8217;s Bites Fund I is 2x / 39% IRR (2023-2025)</p><p>Ben&#8217;s Bites Fund II did its first close, and is still open to new LPs. Get in touch if you&#8217;re interested. </p><p>Here&#8217;s a few YC companies I&#8217;m looking at:</p><ul><li><p><a href=\"https://www.sourcebot.dev/\">Sourcebot</a> - Self-hosted code search and AI Q&amp;A for your entire codebase. </p></li><li><p><a href=\"https://metorial.com/\">Metorial</a> - Serverless MCP hosting with 600+ integrations. Deploy MCP servers in 3 clicks, instant observability.</p></li><li><p><a href=\"https://sf-tensor.com/\">SF-Tensor</a> - Cross-cloud GPU orchestration that finds the cheapest hardware and auto-optimizes your training kernels.</p></li><li><p><a href=\"https://s2.dev/\">S2.dev</a> - Serverless durable streams API. Like if Kafka and S3 had a baby - unlimited, real-time, bottomless storage.</p></li><li><p><a href=\"https://www.hyperspell.com/\">Hyperspell</a> - Context and memory layer for AI agents. </p></li><li><p><a href=\"https://www.usecrunched.com/\">Crunched</a> - AI analyst that works natively inside Excel. </p></li></ul><div><hr></div><h3><strong> </strong>&#127760;<strong> </strong>What I&#8217;m consuming</h3><ul><li><p>Ilya Sutskever &#8211; We&#8217;re moving from <a href=\"https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=aR20FWCCjAs\">the age of scaling to the age of research</a></p></li><li><p><a href=\"https://x.com/elder_plinius/status/1993089311995314564?s=20\">Jailbreaking Opus 4.5</a> </p></li><li><p><a href=\"https://fokus.cool/2025/11/25/i-dont-care-how-well-your-ai-works.html\">I don&#8217;t care how well your &#8220;AI&#8221; works</a> - a rant about AI product fatigue.</p></li><li><p><a href=\"https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=vq5WhoPCWQ8\">High School Dropout to OpenAI Researcher</a></p></li></ul><div><hr></div><h3>&#9881;&#65039; Tools and demos</h3><ul><li><p><strong><a href=\"https://askcodi.com/\">AskCodi</a></strong> - Custom LLMs without training, accessible via OpenAI-compatible API</p></li><li><p><strong><a href=\"https://bfl.ai/blog/flux-2\">Flux 2</a></strong> - image generation &amp; editing model. Multi-reference. 4MP. Production-ready. Open weights.</p></li><li><p><strong><a href=\"https://github.com/addyosmani/gemini-cli-tips\">Gemini CLI Tips &amp; Tricks </a></strong></p></li><li><p><strong><a href=\"https://penpot.app/\">Penpot</a></strong> - The open-source design tool for design and code collaboration (open-source Figma)</p></li></ul><div><hr></div><h3>&#129379; Dev dish</h3><ul><li><p><a href=\"https://github.com/BinSquare/ERA\">Era</a> - Open-source local sandbox for AI agents. Run agents safely without cloud dependencies.</p></li><li><p><a href=\"https://tryrubberduck.com/\">Rubberduck</a> - Catch App Store rejection issues before Apple does </p></li><li><p>Prime Intellect <a href=\"https://x.com/PrimeIntellect/status/1993895068290388134\">launched INTELLECT-3</a>: Scaling RL to a 100B+ MoE model on our end-to-end stack</p></li></ul><div><hr></div><h3>&#127846; Afters</h3><ul><li><p><a href=\"https://www.wired.com/story/jeff-bezos-new-ai-company-acquired-agentic-computing-startup/\">Jeff Bezos&#8217; Project Prometheus quietly acquired General Agents</a>, an agentic AI startup founded by ex-DeepMind and OpenAI researchers. Their agent &#8220;Ace&#8221; can autonomously control computers and perform complex tasks. Project Prometheus has raised $6.2B and now has 100+ employees, all focused on AI for manufacturing - computers, cars, spacecraft. Bezos is back in operator mode.</p></li></ul><div><hr></div><div class=\"captioned-button-wrap\" data-attrs=\"{&quot;url&quot;:&quot;https://www.bensbites.com/p/always-post-bad-news-on-a-holiday?utm_source=substack&utm_medium=email&utm_content=share&action=share&quot;,&quot;text&quot;:&quot;Share&quot;}\" data-component-name=\"CaptionedButtonToDOM\"><div class=\"preamble\"><p class=\"cta-caption\">Enjoy this newsletter? Updates, tool reviews, and lay of the land from an exited founder turned investor and forever tinkerer.\nSubscribe now\n\n\nHey folks, Happy Thanksgiving to those celebrating! Light edition today‚Ä¶\nClassic move from OpenAI - dropping a data breach disclosure at 10pm the night before Turkey day. Brilliant PR timing.\nOpenAI disclosed a Mixpanel security incident that exposed API user data - names, emails, user IDs, and location info. No ChatGPT data or API keys were compromised. OpenAI has terminated its Mixpanel use entirely (no shit!).\nMeanwhile, OpenAI needs to raise at least $207 billion by 2030 [paywalled] to keep the lights on, according to HSBC. This is after their commitments to Oracle ($300B), Microsoft ($250B), and AWS ($38B) for cloud services. The FT called OpenAI ‚Äúa money pit with a website on top.‚Äù ü´†\nAnthropic dropped two bangers this week. First, Effective harnesses for long-running agents - a deep dive into how they get Claude to work across multiple context windows without losing the plot. The key insight: use an initializer agent to set up the environment, then a coding agent that makes incremental progress and leaves clean artifacts for the next session. They built a Claude.ai clone this way. \n[But Factory‚Äôs harness is better]\nSecond, Estimating AI productivity gains - they analyzed 100K real Claude conversations and found AI reduces task completion time by ~80%. Extrapolating this, they estimate current AI could increase US labor productivity by 1.8% annually over the next decade - roughly doubling recent growth rates. The caveat: this doesn‚Äôt account for time humans spend validating outputs outside the chat window.\nA little update from my portfolio:\nSan Francisco Compute - raised $40M at a $300M valuation - marketplace for AI computing capacity. (I‚Äôm an early investor) + they‚Äôre hiring\nPlus some other investments have been on a tear recently;\n\nGamma @ $2.5bn valuation - I invested as an a16z scout, they led the latest round. \n\nSupabase @ $5bn \n\nScribe @ $1.3bn \n\nMy 2020/2021 fund is now over 4x / 36% IRR\nBen‚Äôs Bites Fund I is 2x / 39% IRR (2023-2025)\nBen‚Äôs Bites Fund II did its first close, and is still open to new LPs. Get in touch if you‚Äôre interested. \nHere‚Äôs a few YC companies I‚Äôm looking at:\n\nSourcebot - Self-hosted code search and AI Q&A for your entire codebase. \n\nMetorial - Serverless MCP hosting with 600+ integrations. Deploy MCP servers in 3 clicks, instant observability.\n\nSF-Tensor - Cross-cloud GPU orchestration that finds the cheapest hardware and auto-optimizes your training kernels.\n\nS2.dev - Serverless durable streams API. Like if Kafka and S3 had a baby - unlimited, real-time, bottomless storage.\n\nHyperspell - Context and memory layer for AI agents. \n\nCrunched - AI analyst that works natively inside Excel. \n\n\n\n üåê What I‚Äôm consuming\n\nIlya Sutskever ‚Äì We‚Äôre moving from the age of scaling to the age of research\n\nJailbreaking Opus 4.5 \n\nI don‚Äôt care how well your ‚ÄúAI‚Äù works - a rant about AI product fatigue.\n\nHigh School Dropout to OpenAI Researcher\n\n\n\n‚öôÔ∏è Tools and demos\n\nAskCodi - Custom LLMs without training, accessible via OpenAI-compatible API\n\nFlux 2 - image generation & editing model. Multi-reference. 4MP. Production-ready. Open weights.\n\nGemini CLI Tips & Tricks \n\nPenpot - The open-source design tool for design and code collaboration (open-source Figma)\n\n\n\nü•£ Dev dish\n\nEra - Open-source local sandbox for AI agents. Run agents safely without cloud dependencies.\n\nRubberduck - Catch App Store rejection issues before Apple does \n\nPrime Intellect launched INTELLECT-3: Scaling RL to a 100B+ MoE model on our end-to-end stack\n\n\n\nüç¶ Afters\n\nJeff Bezos‚Äô Project Prometheus quietly acquired General Agents, an agentic AI startup founded by ex-DeepMind and OpenAI researchers. Their agent ‚ÄúAce‚Äù can autonomously control computers and perform complex tasks. Project Prometheus has raised $6.2B and now has 100+ employees, all focused on AI for manufacturing - computers, cars, spacecraft. Bezos is back in operator mode.\n\n\n\n\nEnjoy this newsletter? Updates, tool reviews, and lay of the land from an exited founder turned investor and forever tinkerer.</em></p><p class=\"button-wrapper\" data-attrs=\"{&quot;url&quot;:&quot;https://www.bensbites.com/subscribe?&quot;,&quot;text&quot;:&quot;Subscribe now&quot;,&quot;action&quot;:null,&quot;class&quot;:null}\" data-component-name=\"ButtonCreateButton\"><a class=\"button primary\" href=\"https://www.bensbites.com/subscribe?\"><span>Subscribe now</span></a></p><div><hr></div><p>Hey folks, today&#8217;s post is packed. </p><p>Everyone&#8217;s rushing to launch their thing before American Turkey day.</p><p>I built a social tracker over the weekend, design inspired by Linear so i can rip through all social mentions from X/Github/Reddits/any other feed you like. It&#8217;s open-source so you can copy it and use it for yourself. <a href=\"https://x.com/bentossell/status/1992910274823905533/video/1\">Here&#8217;s a lil video </a>I recorded of it in action. Built with Factory&#8217;s Droid, Gemini did the initial design pass (which was ok-ish), but trusty Sonnet polished the F out of it. <a href=\"https://blog.google/technology/ai/nano-banana-pro/\">Nano Banana Pro</a>,</strong> i.e. image generation powered by Gemini 3 Pro. Massive upgrade over already amazing Nano Banana (on top of Gemini 2.5 Flash). It&#8217;s great at text rendering, uses reasoning to think about styles, visual layout and content inside an image.</p><p>Gemini 3 Pro had its charm for a week, but <strong><a href=\"https://www.anthropic.com/news/claude-opus-4-5\">Claude took it back with Opus 4.5</a></strong>. It&#8217;s the best coding model in the world (crossing 80% on SWE-Bench Verified) and 3x cheaper than previous Opus models. Opus 4.5&#8217;s medium reasoning performs the same as Sonnet 4.5&#8217;s best results while using 76% fewer tokens. So, in real use, sometimes using Opus 4.5 might end up being cheaper. </p><blockquote><p>I&#8217;m working on a web app for a board game. I tested both Gemini 3 Pro and Opus 4.5 on adding multiplayer room creation to it. First, both of these models gave an almost working solution, whereas older models just didn&#8217;t work. Opus was definitely better (and faster) than Gemini, but it still has a few familiar issues. It creates too much duplicate code and very easily falls into the &#8220;you&#8217;re absolutely right&#8221; trap when fixing bugs.</p><p>&#8211; Keshav</p></blockquote><p>Anthropic also released many product updates with this: &#8220;no cutoff&#8221; in long conversations on the Claude app, Claude Code on Desktop, Claude in Chrome and Excel, new tools for <a href=\"https://www.anthropic.com/engineering/advanced-tool-use\">avoiding the pitfalls of MCP</a> and more.</p><p>OpenAI also released <strong>two major features in ChatGPT: <a href=\"https://x.com/nickaturley/status/1991560210326974649\">Group Chats</a> and <a href=\"https://x.com/OpenAI/status/1993018357432586391\">Shopping Research</a>.</strong> Group Chats have a limit of 20 people and still have that beta feel. They were earlier launched in a few countries but are now available globally. Shopping Research is a new mode like Deep Research, powered by a special version of GPT-5 Mini. It promises to find the product on the web for your query, but since it&#8217;s a small model, be wary of inaccuracies in details like pricing, sizes, etc. Both these features are available to free and paid users (except teams/enterprises).</p><p><strong>Hardcoded permissions slowing you down?</strong> As systems grow, hardcoded authorization creates security gaps and dev bottlenecks. This 80-page ebook walks through the <strong>move to externalized authorization</strong> - with frameworks, code samples, and lessons from teams who&#8217;ve made the transition. <a href=\"https://solutions.cerbos.dev/how-to-adopt-externalized-authorization?utm_campaign=bens_bites_nov_2025&amp;utm_source=newsletter&amp;utm_medium=email&amp;utm_content=&amp;utm_term=\">Download free ebook.</a>*</p><p><a href=\"https://x.com/bentossell/status/1991960096864338000?s=20\">Factory skills</a> are now live (links to my video)! Skills are essentially instructions + tools to run workflows super easily. I built this browser tool that opens sites, takes actions (clicks, fills in forms etc) and pulls all that back into my chat. I also recently added a DOM picker so i can select elements on a webpage and that code gets sent to the chat so i can identify specific elements to change (instead of saying no not that button, the other blue button)</p><div><hr></div><h3><strong> </strong>&#127760;<strong> </strong>What I&#8217;m consuming</h3><ul><li><p>Why your Voice AI <a href=\"https://www.speechmatics.com/company/articles-and-news/voice-ai-doesnt-need-to-be-faster-it-needs-to-read-the-room?utm_source=bens-bites&amp;utm_medium=paid-social&amp;utm_campaign=voice-ai-agents-speaker&amp;utm_content=newsletter\">keeps interrupting users</a> (hint: it&#8217;s too fast).*</p></li><li><p>I tested <a href=\"https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=t2n1QRjdPMM\">Gemini 3.0 Pro inside Droid</a> and Google Antigravity.</p></li><li><p>How a global company lets its employees <a href=\"https://www.bensbites.com/p/global-company-lets-employees-build-with-30-llms\">build with 30+ LLMs.</a></p></li><li><p>Benedict Evans&#8217; Nov 2025 edition of <a href=\"https://www.ben-evans.com/presentations\">AI eats the world.</a></p></li><li><p>Why we <a href=\"https://www.browserbase.com/blog/chromium-fork-for-ai-automation\">forked Chromium</a> for AI automation.</p></li><li><p>How to prompt with Gemini 3 to <a href=\"https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=b-kTkak2FKs&amp;t=1s\">get the best UIs</a></p></li><li><p>Building an <a href=\"https://cdn.openai.com/business-guides-and-resources/building-an-ai-native-engineering-team.pdf\">AI native engineering team</a>.</p></li><li><p>A first principles deep dive into <a href=\"https://leehanchung.github.io/blogs/2025/10/26/claude-skills-deep-dive/\">Claude Agent Skills.</a></p></li><li><p>My read for the weekend is this 35k+ words monster from <span class=\"mention-wrap\" data-attrs=\"{&quot;name&quot;:&quot;Contrary&quot;,&quot;id&quot;:151170839,&quot;type&quot;:&quot;user&quot;,&quot;url&quot;:null,&quot;photo_url&quot;:&quot;https://substack-post-media.s3.amazonaws.com/public/images/1133cb61-6139-4fa2-9990-bdc6f4497319_96x96.jpeg&quot;,&quot;uuid&quot;:&quot;349bc1fa-fff5-484b-991d-dacd7b84a5ab&quot;}\" data-component-name=\"MentionToDOM\"></span> Research covering <a href=\"https://research.contrary.com/company/openai\">all things OpenAI</a>.</p></li></ul><div><hr></div><h3>&#9881;&#65039; Tools and demos</h3><ul><li><p><strong><a href=\"https://yutori.com/blog/introducing-navigator\">Navigator</a></strong> by Yutori - SOTA web-navigating agent with its own cloud browser.</p></li><li><p><strong><a href=\"https://tubedummies.com/\">TubeDummies</a></strong> - Turn any YouTube tutorial into step-by-step interactive learning.</p></li><li><p><strong><a href=\"https://paperreview.ai/\">paperreview</a></strong> - Get detailed AI feedback on your research paper.</p></li><li><p><strong><a href=\"https://parallel.ai/blog/introducing-parallel-extract\">Parallel Extract</a></strong> - Get all content from a URL in markdown, either in full detail or in a compressed form for better token efficiency.</p></li><li><p><strong><a href=\"https://x.com/Replit/status/1991951303757709664\">Replit</a></strong> Agent now integrates with Stripe to help you add payments easily.</p></li><li><p><strong><a href=\"https://www.cfosilvia.com/?utm_source=bensbites&amp;utm_medium=newsletter&amp;utm_campaign=sponsorship_oct2025_v1\">Silvia</a></strong> &#8211; Your personal AI CFO that tracks every account, models &#8220;what if&#8221; scenarios, and surfaces insights automatically. 1456w\" sizes=\"100vw\" loading=\"lazy\"></picture><div></div></div></a></figure></div><div><hr></div><h3>&#129379; Dev dish</h3><ul><li><p><a href=\"https://github.com/dzhng/claude-agent-server\">claude-agent-server</a> - Run Claude Agent (the harness behind Claude Code) in a cloud sandbox and control it via WebSocket.</p></li><li><p><a href=\"https://github.com/Kylejeong2/synapse\">synapse</a> - Fork chats and go down rabbitholes on things without clogging context (<a href=\"https://x.com/kylejeong/status/1992373423310602271\">demo</a>).</p></li><li><p><a href=\"https://github.com/karpathy/llm-council\">llm-council</a> - Send your response to multiple models and let the council choose the best for you.</p></li><li><p>MCP servers might soon power interactive user interfaces for hosts with the new proposal of <a href=\"https://blog.modelcontextprotocol.io/posts/2025-11-21-mcp-apps/\">MCP Apps</a>.</p></li></ul><div><hr></div><h3>&#127846; Afters</h3><ul><li><p><strong><a href=\"https://fandf.co/48hlBfG\">Valon is hiring Forward Deployed Engineers</a>.</strong> $130K&#8211;$230K &amp; equity, turning enterprise clients needs into code onsite. NYC/SF/Seattle + travel*</p></li><li><p><a href=\"https://openai.com/index/accelerating-science-gpt-5/\">OpenAI for Science</a> released their first paper - 13 examples of GPT-5 accelerating scientific research.</p></li><li><p><a href=\"https://www.anthropic.com/research/emergent-misalignment-reward-hacking\">New Anthropic research</a>: if you teach a model to cheat on coding tasks, it learns other bad behaviours too. But if you frame reward hacking as finding loopholes to patch (vs cheating), this generalisation does not happen.</p></li><li><p>Cline is building <a href=\"https://cline.bot/blog/cline-bench-initiative\">cline-bench</a> - A real-world open source benchmark for agentic coding. Plus, there&#8217;s a new hard physics benchmark in the market - <a href=\"https://critpt.com/\">CritPt</a>.</p></li><li><p><a href=\"https://grokipedia.com/\">Grokipedia</a> accepts proposed edits now, Elon&#8217;s replacing <a href=\"https://www.theinformation.com/articles/twins-pushing-elon-musks-plans-replace-x-staff-grok\">X&#8217;s content moderation with Grok</a>, Replit and Campus Edu have a new <a href=\"https://campus.edu/vibe-coding\">8-week vibe-coding course</a>, and a <a href=\"https://www.browserbase.com/blog/training-computer-use-models-in-the-real-world-with-microsoft\">small model from Microsoft</a> tops computer use charts.</p></li></ul><div><hr></div><div class=\"captioned-button-wrap\" data-attrs=\"{&quot;url&quot;:&quot;https://www.bensbites.com/p/new-opus-is-bananas?utm_source=substack&utm_medium=email&utm_content=share&action=share&quot;,&quot;text&quot;:&quot;Share&quot;}\" data-component-name=\"CaptionedButtonToDOM\"><div class=\"preamble\"><p class=\"cta-caption\">Enjoy this newsletter? Last few slots left for the rest of the year.</em></h6></blockquote><div><hr></div>","content:encodedSnippet":"The newsletter for the technically curious. Updates, tool reviews, and lay of the land from an exited founder turned investor and forever tinkerer.\nSubscribe now\n\n\nHey folks, today‚Äôs post is packed. \nEveryone‚Äôs rushing to launch their thing before American Turkey day.\nI built a social tracker over the weekend, design inspired by Linear so i can rip through all social mentions from X/Github/Reddits/any other feed you like. It‚Äôs open-source so you can copy it and use it for yourself. Here‚Äôs a lil video I recorded of it in action. Built with Factory‚Äôs Droid, Gemini did the initial design pass (which was ok-ish), but trusty Sonnet polished the F out of it. (My first time open-sourcing something I‚Äôm proud of!)\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nGoogle released Nano Banana Pro, i.e. image generation powered by Gemini 3 Pro. Massive upgrade over already amazing Nano Banana (on top of Gemini 2.5 Flash). It‚Äôs great at text rendering, uses reasoning to think about styles, visual layout and content inside an image.\nGemini 3 Pro had its charm for a week, but Claude took it back with Opus 4.5. It‚Äôs the best coding model in the world (crossing 80% on SWE-Bench Verified) and 3x cheaper than previous Opus models. Opus 4.5‚Äôs medium reasoning performs the same as Sonnet 4.5‚Äôs best results while using 76% fewer tokens. So, in real use, sometimes using Opus 4.5 might end up being cheaper. \n\nI‚Äôm working on a web app for a board game. I tested both Gemini 3 Pro and Opus 4.5 on adding multiplayer room creation to it. First, both of these models gave an almost working solution, whereas older models just didn‚Äôt work. Opus was definitely better (and faster) than Gemini, but it still has a few familiar issues. It creates too much duplicate code and very easily falls into the ‚Äúyou‚Äôre absolutely right‚Äù trap when fixing bugs.\n‚Äì Keshav\n\nAnthropic also released many product updates with this: ‚Äúno cutoff‚Äù in long conversations on the Claude app, Claude Code on Desktop, Claude in Chrome and Excel, new tools for avoiding the pitfalls of MCP and more.\nOpenAI also released two major features in ChatGPT: Group Chats and Shopping Research. Group Chats have a limit of 20 people and still have that beta feel. They were earlier launched in a few countries but are now available globally. Shopping Research is a new mode like Deep Research, powered by a special version of GPT-5 Mini. It promises to find the product on the web for your query, but since it‚Äôs a small model, be wary of inaccuracies in details like pricing, sizes, etc. Both these features are available to free and paid users (except teams/enterprises).\nHardcoded permissions slowing you down? As systems grow, hardcoded authorization creates security gaps and dev bottlenecks. This 80-page ebook walks through the move to externalized authorization - with frameworks, code samples, and lessons from teams who‚Äôve made the transition. Download free ebook.*\nFactory skills are now live (links to my video)! Skills are essentially instructions + tools to run workflows super easily. I built this browser tool that opens sites, takes actions (clicks, fills in forms etc) and pulls all that back into my chat. I also recently added a DOM picker so i can select elements on a webpage and that code gets sent to the chat so i can identify specific elements to change (instead of saying no not that button, the other blue button)\n\n\n üåê What I‚Äôm consuming\n\nWhy your Voice AI keeps interrupting users (hint: it‚Äôs too fast).*\n\nI tested Gemini 3.0 Pro inside Droid and Google Antigravity.\n\nHow a global company lets its employees build with 30+ LLMs.\n\nBenedict Evans‚Äô Nov 2025 edition of AI eats the world.\n\nWhy we forked Chromium for AI automation.\n\nHow to prompt with Gemini 3 to get the best UIs\n\nBuilding an AI native engineering team.\n\nA first principles deep dive into Claude Agent Skills.\n\nMy read for the weekend is this 35k+ words monster from  Research covering all things OpenAI.\n\n\n\n‚öôÔ∏è Tools and demos\n\nNavigator by Yutori - SOTA web-navigating agent with its own cloud browser.\n\nTubeDummies - Turn any YouTube tutorial into step-by-step interactive learning.\n\npaperreview - Get detailed AI feedback on your research paper.\n\nParallel Extract - Get all content from a URL in markdown, either in full detail or in a compressed form for better token efficiency.\n\nReplit Agent now integrates with Stripe to help you add payments easily.\n\nSilvia ‚Äì Your personal AI CFO that tracks every account, models ‚Äúwhat if‚Äù scenarios, and surfaces insights automatically. One place to see and grow your entire net worth.*\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nü•£ Dev dish\n\nclaude-agent-server - Run Claude Agent (the harness behind Claude Code) in a cloud sandbox and control it via WebSocket.\n\nsynapse - Fork chats and go down rabbitholes on things without clogging context (demo).\n\nllm-council - Send your response to multiple models and let the council choose the best for you.\n\nMCP servers might soon power interactive user interfaces for hosts with the new proposal of MCP Apps.\n\n\n\nüç¶ Afters\n\nValon is hiring Forward Deployed Engineers. $130K‚Äì$230K & equity, turning enterprise clients needs into code onsite. NYC/SF/Seattle + travel*\n\nOpenAI for Science released their first paper - 13 examples of GPT-5 accelerating scientific research.\n\nNew Anthropic research: if you teach a model to cheat on coding tasks, it learns other bad behaviours too. But if you frame reward hacking as finding loopholes to patch (vs cheating), this generalisation does not happen.\n\nCline is building cline-bench - A real-world open source benchmark for agentic coding. Plus, there‚Äôs a new hard physics benchmark in the market - CritPt.\n\nGrokipedia accepts proposed edits now, Elon‚Äôs replacing X‚Äôs content moderation with Grok, Replit and Campus Edu have a new 8-week vibe-coding course, and a small model from Microsoft tops computer use charts.\n\n\n\n\nEnjoy this newsletter?
